Summary: From Oahu, Hawaii. Came to visit family living here in Cali. Booked room for 2 night stay, mainly to have a place to sleep. Checked in 6pm Monday after 5 1/2 hour drive, checked out 10am Wednesday. The room was perfect for it's purpose, relax, shower, sleep, and TV & Chill 😁 That's all my family and I needed it to be. Yes, I told my family we would stay here again. Our room was clean when we returned from 12 hours at Disneyland because I only had a one day, and we thought it was so thoughtful, housekeeping folded my 15mos old son's blankey and left it on the bed with our bag I left on the floor (I'm sure so they could vacuum) the breakfast was decent enough for my family, but if you're looking for some grand buffet, just walk to Denny's. Besides that, I've experienced worse

Will definitely stay again when in the area

Summary: Hotel was very clean, pool was great, staff was very nice, breakfast was well stocked and the beds! The beds were SO comfortable. They have a Beauty Rest Rejuvenation pillow top on them with duvets that make you feel like you are on a cloud. I also liked the location to the attractions and the size of the hotel meaning you can get to your room fast if you forget something or it's been a long day. There was also plenty of parking available. They price is what made 7s decide to stay there but we'll stay there again because of our experience.

We had enough towels for every one of us daily as well as toiletries replenished as needed, soaps, lotions, shampoos and conditioner. Room had 2 TV's and a door to separate. I was very impressed with the wonderful housekeeping. Basic breakfast, nothing to write home about. 3 cereal choices and plain oatmeal. Toast, English muffins and toaster waffles. At least 2 hot items offered: biscuits and gravy with cold hard boiled eggs; egg patties, sausage and pancakes another day. Mini muffins and fresh fruit,

Enrique who works at the breakfast area was really nice and very accommodating.  He always offer guests to see if they need anything else.   I would have given it 5 stars if parking was a bit better.  It was really hard to find parking after 10:00pm.

The kids enjoyed the pool and the breakfasts were yummy and filling before our busy days. The comfort, and price were awesome and couldn’t be beat. Thank you to all the kind and professional staff members for making us feel at ease and welcome.

Summary Heading: Okay place, but there are likely better places if u have time to research.
Summary: My daughter and I stayed here due to our Airbnb turning out terribly. We booked a room with this hotel quickly and weren't aware it was an outdoor entrance to the rooms. We were not super thrilled with that but tried to make do with it. Due to the open exposure to outside you end up hearing everything, traffic, people coming and going. Babies crying. Everything. The pool was small and full of people the 2 days we stayed. They offer a shuttle to Disneyland but it costs $ and isn't a straight trip to the park. The only positive was a free toy story shuttle u can walk to a few blocks away to get to the park. We will not be staying here again & will stay at a hotel that is all contained within the building. So we can sleep better at night.

Summary Heading: 3rd Vacation in 6 years and 3rd stay at Cortona Inn
Summary: It has been 6 years (we took 2 trips in 2013) since we have visited Anaheim. All 3 visits we have chosen Cortona Inn and Suites. It is clean (which is WAY IMPORTANT), the staff is friendly, our housekeeper on day 2, Blanca, did a wonderful job. We were extremely content and satisfied with our stay. The price was within our budget and I can guarantee the next time we visit Anaheim (we're from Phoenix), we will definitely be staying here again. Thank you for being such an awesome place to lay our head down at night!

Summary: we really enjoyed this hotel. the rooms are spacious, with fridges and microwaves. 15-20 min walk to disney or walk across the street to the toy story parking lot and get a free ride on the disney bus. breakfast was good and filling, cereals, pastries, eggs, sausages, potatoes, juice. our room was always clean with fresh towels and they set up our beds with the kids stuffed animals which they thought was great. the only negative is that sounds outside are magnified because the hotel is in a u-shape. stayed here with small kids for a 3 day trip and we weren’t disappointed. would stay here again.

We love our Breakfast and we appreciate all the positive feedback and look forward to assisting you again when your travels return you to the Anaheim area.  Yours in hospitality

Summary: Stayed here for 4 days for our Disneyland trip. Beds were comfortable and the room was clean. It's away from the streets so it was quite. It has a continental breakfast with typical foods, yogurt, cereal, danishes, eggos. This hotel would be way too far to walk. I believe their is a bus you can take though. I had family members that stayed at a closer hotel so we were able to use their hotel for parking and walk to the parks. Overall good hotel if you are on a budget and that just needs a good place to sleep.
Manager Response: Dear Katie R, Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback with regards to our hotel.  Cortona Inn & Suites always located in the convenience place near the Anaheim Convention Center, approximately 1 mile away from Disneyland Parks. We hope our customers can feel more relaxed no matter they are on work or in travel.  We look forward to your next trip!  Sincerely

Summary: Staff was friendly and helpful. Located within walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center, which was helpful since we were there for a National Cheer Competition with a team. Disney was also within walking distance, though a bit further than the Convention Center. There was a continental  breakfast which was great for a bunch of hungry Cheerleaders. Parking is free which really helped! The beds were comfortable, the furnishings were outdated but not a problem for me. The only snafu we had was a small light in the room didn't work. It was such a non issue that I didn't tell staff about it until our second day. We were able to extend our stay a third night with ease. Definitely would stay there again when I'm in town.
Manager Response: Dear Kliggy64  Thank you for taking the time to provide such  wonderful feedback  I am happy to hear that we met and exceeded expectations. We love our Breakfast and we appreciate all the positive feedback and look forward to assisting you again when your travels return you to the area.  Yours in hospitality,

Summary: Great value and location. Usually stay here when visiting Disneyland. Free breakfast and parking is a huge value. Beds very comfortable. Definitely recommend. Lots of restaurants close by. Disneyland is a 10 minute walk to front gate.
Manager Response: Dear VGKFan29,  Thank you so much for choosing Cortona Inn & Suites, Anaheim Resort, for your recent visit to Anaheim. I am happy to hear that we met and exceeded expectations. We love our Breakfast and we appreciate all the positive feedback and look forward to assisting you again when your travels return you to the area.  Thank you for 5 Star Review.  Yours in hospitality,

Summary: Good location, property is airy and spacious but the room and furnishing is dated. They should consider renovating. Bed is too soft for my liking. And the sofa-bed in our room was broken so we were offered 2 rollaways instead. That took up a lot of space in the living area. Breakfast is OK but a very basic affair. Just don't expect a buffet spread. There is no in-house restaurant available. It would be nice if there was one, for the convenience of the guests.  A overall pleasant experience but will definitely try other properties on my next trip there.
Manager Response: Dear shaunwk512  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. We strive to accommodate all of our guests and their needs and I’m disappointed that we did not meet your expectations with regards to the sofa bed. We are sorry for the unusual condition of the room you received. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously, and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.  While we understand that your stay was not 100% satisfactory, we would hope that you would give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.

Summary Heading: Very basic and not very quiet
Summary: While the place overall was clean and ok, it was not a place I will likely return to. The walls must not have sound-proofing or baffling in them. I could hear people walking by outside the room, could hear every car door open and shut and start up, and could even hear the people in the adjacent rooms talking at normal levels. The accommodations were very basic and I guess what you would expect for a 3 star hotel but this place had a rating over 4 stars on Trip Advisor. I have stayed in many hotels in this area so I was hoping to have a better experience. Not horrible but not great either.
Manager Response: Dear Wander20176814519,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Guest comfort and satisfaction are of the utmost concern to us and our hotel is committed to making every possible effort to provide comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. it sounds like you were let down by the hotel noise . Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas. We welcome any opportunity to improve.  We value you as our guest and hope you will continue to choose Cortona Inn & Suites  for your future travel needs.

Summary: Good location to convention center. Room was fine. Breakfast....no. Maybe add oatmeal and hard boiled eggs.Property is clean.Staff is friendly, beds are comfy.Definitely not fancy, but good no frills value.
Manager Response: Dear lisaforthworth,  Hello from Cortona Inn & Suites. Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed review with the Trip Advisor community and of course with us. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Good value hotel with a decent continental breakfast.  Nothing fancy, but the rooms were clean and in good repair, the beds were comfortable, and the staff were friendly and helpful.  The pool and hot tub were clean, but could have been warmer.  Overall the hotel is solid and the price and its location near Disneyland made it a perfect fit for us.
Manager Response: Dear DavidA32587,  I appreciate you taking the time to comment about your recent stay at our hotel. We are glad you found our rooms comfortable and clean and found our staff efficient and friendly. We are truly touched and grateful for your very kind review. We look forward to welcoming you back to our establishment.  Sincerely,

Summary: Front desk does not give a lot of info. 1. There are two shuttle busses that you can take. #3 going to Disneyland and #1 or 2 coming back to hotel gets your drop off point closer to the hotel. That info was provided by bus driver when question came up about  how far we were being dropped off from hotel.  2. They have a parking issue, also front desk didn’t issue us a parking pass which made it difficult to leave the premises until issue was resolved by a visit to front desk.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Guest comfort and satisfaction are of the utmost concern to us and our hotel is committed to making every possible effort to provide comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. it sounds like you were let down by the staff services. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas. We welcome any opportunity to improve.  We value you as our guest and hope you will continue to choose Cortona Inn & Suites  for your future travel needs.  Yours in Hospitality,

Summary: The price was right, the rooms were clean, the breakfast was decent and the staff was very helpful when we had some unfortunate events through the night. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a good value!
Manager Response: Dear Chase C, I appreciate you taking the time to comment about your recent stay at our hotel. We are glad you found our rooms comfortable and clean and found our staff efficient and friendly. We are truly touched and grateful for your very kind review. We look forward to welcoming you back to our establishment. Once again thank you for the wonderful comments and kind words of praise for our staff.  Sincerely,

Summary: It's clean, quiet, and beds are super comfy. Staff is friendly and helpful. Pool and hot tub are nice. Location is great for walking to Disney or surrounding eating & shopping areas. 15 minute drive to Knott's Berry farm. Parking can be a bit tricky, spaces are small and usually don't get near your room. Breakfast is a zero, but that never stops us from staying here!
Manager Response: Your business is very important to us and we value your feedback. By telling us what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, you are helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. We hope you will come back and see us again soon.  Sincerely, Front Office Manager

Summary: Room was pretty big. Nice 1 bedroom suite. Nothing to complain about that I noticed was wrong. I wish I could live in there. Nice TV's in both rooms. The only thing I found kinda annoying with the TV was you had to aim the remote directly at the TV to work
Manager Response: Dear reggie2xtreme,  Thank you for choosing Cortona Inn & Suites. We are happy to see you enjoyed your stay! We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, Yours in hospitality

Summary: Stayed in Toscana suite with 3 kids(11, 8, 6) and 2 adults. Perfect for our family’s needs!  5 min walk to the free Disney shuttles.  Breakfast was good: nice variety of hot and cold, all of us found something we liked.  Disney gift shop was a bit expensive but not nearly as pricey as Disneyland.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Room was clean and well stocked with towels etc.  Only complaints are minor - AC was noisy and the room was humid, so it was hard to dry out clothes and footwear after the rain.   Beds were comfortable, king was a little too soft for our taste but not bad.  Pillows were thankfully not too thick.  Kids loved bunk bed and their own TV.  Would highly recommend this hotel for any families, especially ones visiting Disney.
Manager Response: Dear 838jen,  Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed review with the Trip Advisor community and of course with us. Thank you for your kind words. We will certainly share your compliments with our staff. We truly value your continued patronage and hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: The Beds are very comfortable if you like soft mattress
Summary: I have stayed at the Cortona two times. I find the location convenient and fairly inexpensive. The beds are very comfortable so long as you like a softer mattress. It is not a very big Motel so no matter your room location it is not allot of extra walking. This is very important at the end of the day when you've been on your feet for 8-16hrs at the park. They offer a free continental breakfast that has a decent amount of variety ranging from staples like cereal and toast to a new hot entree each morning that features faire such as eggs, pancakes or biscuits and gravy. The reason this Motel is only getting 4 stars is due to the two rooms I have stayed in both having a slight chlorine smell as well as when you take a shower the curtain does not go completely side to side more
Manager Response: Dear kellyg111251,  Thank you so much for choosing Cortona Inn & Suites, Anaheim Resort, for your recent visit to Anaheim. I am happy to hear that we met your expectations. We love our Breakfast and we appreciate all the positive feedback and look forward to assisting you again when your travels return you to the area.  Yours in hospitality,

Summary: Great place to stay. It’s a decent walk to Disneyland. Clean rooms. Tight on parking, if you find a space, don’t move your car!  Everything was great except the maid service trying to clean and rush us out before checkout. 10:28am is not 11am.  Over all it was good experience.
Manager Response: Dear Markanthonyf44,  Thank you for choosing Cortona Inn. We are happy to see you enjoyed your stay! We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Nice bunkbed room, great kid / baby room
Summary: Great location for the convention center, but also Disney. Good fast breakfast included. Nice bunkbed room, for kids / baby room. Nice employees and easy in/out Parking. WIFI easy to use. There is a CVS which you can walk to at Harbor and Katella.
Manager Response: Dear Adventure273546,  Thank you so much for choosing Cortona Inn & Suites, Anaheim Resort, for your recent visit to Anaheim. I am happy to hear that we met and exceeded expectations. We love our Breakfast and we appreciate all the positive feedback and look forward to assisting you again when your travels return you to the area.  Yours in hospitality, Front Desk Manager

Summary: Had a great stay rooms were clean beds comfortable take shower gel if you prefer to soap staff very friendly and helpful walking distance to Disney so didn’t  need shuttle passes good choice of breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Dawn1631,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and for your positive review. We are pleased to read that you found the beds comfortable and our staff friendly.  Thank you for staying with us, and look forward in welcoming you in the near future!  Yours in hospitality, Front Office Manager

Summary: What a wonderful hotel and a wonderful value.  Very clean, great continental breakfast with a variety of food and drinks.    Easy access to the parks either walking, taking the ART bus or driving.   Food and shopping within walking distance too, CVS, Rite Aid, IHop, Denny's, Morton's Steak House and numerous little shops.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and for your 5 star review.  We are pleased to read that you found the rooms and breakfast up to your par and location very convenient.   We are truly touched and grateful for your very kind review. We look forward to welcoming you back to our establishment.

Summary: Room is very clean and confortable, close to Disneyland resort, many stores around, close to main roads. Not so quiet early in the morning as many people likes to get early to the parks. You can ask for extra beds if needed (Extra charges apply). Parkin is a problem on weekends at least.
Manager Response: Dear ChuySalgado,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience regarding your stay at our hotel. We are pleased to read that you found the rooms clean and comfortable.    Thank you for choosing Cortona Inn. We are happy to see you enjoyed your stay! We look forward to your next visit!  Yours in hospitality,  Front Office Manager

Summary: I booked this hotel for a 4-night stay with my daughter for an event she had at the Convention Center.  The photos online made this place look WAY nicer than it is.  The room was musty and outdated, the bathroom smelled horribly like smoke and was full of mold, the sink drain was nearly clogged and the Wifi did not work in the room 99% of the time I tried it.  The whole exterior of the building could use some work - paint chipping all over, etc.  The breakfast was just ok, nothing fancy but I do appreciate any breakfast that is included in the stay.  My daughter liked the pool and hot tub.  Parking lot is VERY small - I was lucky to find a place to park my rental car but just barely most times.  Luckily we weren't at the hotel very often during this trip - just to sleep.  The
Manager Response: Dear Cedarwood02, Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I am very disappointed to hear about your experience at the hotel. We are committed to providing our guests with the highest quality services and facilities. It seems that we were not able to execute an exemplary hotel stay experience with regard to the Wifi  and the unpleasant smell in the rooms. Please accept our sincere apologies for any discomfort it may have caused you. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas. We welcome any opportunity to improve.  We know you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we hope you will continue to choose Cortona Inn & Suites for your travel needs.  Sincerely,

Summary: We chose this hotel for location, room size (enough beds to sleep 5), free breakfast and price. The hotel staff was Amazing as was housekeeping. The breakfast selection changed daily but I wish there were a few more options, can't complain about a free meal though. I was disappointed to learn the theme park shuttle was extra, it would have been a small fortune for us to use it so we chose to Uber instead. A couple of minor complaints. The walls are thin However, it was the running up and down the corridors of small children early in the morning that was the bigger issue. Definitely not the hotels fault but parents should be mindful of others staying on the property. The sofa bed was in dire need of a new mattress. Housekeeping was quick to respond to our requests though for

The hotel was average, the room was musty and stuffy.  The beds were fine, comfortable and clean.  The breakfast was mediocre, and consisted mostly of greasy sausage patties, egg patties, or biscuits and gravy.  There was bread and english muffins for toasting, some cereal, and an assortment of danishes.  Some fruit (apples/bananas).  PROS: free parking, free breakfast, free wifi, close distance to Disney.  CONS: smelly/musty room, average breakfast choices.

The room is a very good size, BUT extremely dirty, restroom is full of mold, sofa is very nasty! Carpets need to be replaced, curtains are also moldy, price of room is very decent compared to what you get!

This hotel is so close to the Disneyland parking lot Woody and friends. You can walk across the street and take the bus for free into Disney theme parks.  The hotel was plesantly clean and beds were really soft.  I was really surprised by the breakfast as having more then your normally coffee/juice/toast/fruit.  I was not expecting hot breakfast but it was a nice surprise 1st day eggs and sausage along with pancakes.  2nd day sausage buscuits and gravy and toaster waffles.  I would definitely come again and recommend to friends

People at the reception were really nice and helpful with directions to Disney parking and they offer transportation for a small fee.  The room was nice and clean and the beds were warm.  Parking was waived and was pleased to find the handicapped parking right next to the room we were assigned.

Excellent, friendly staff, hotel is within walking distance of everything and free breakfast.  Room was spacious, water took a little while to get hot, parking was a little challenging (there is additional underground parking), jacuzzi is kind of small.  Otherwise it was great.

Summary Heading: A Disneyland motel that is a great place to stay
Summary: The Cortana was family friendly,  good family rooms at reasonable prices.  Near Disney, restaurants and everything else you might need.   The breakfast each day was just what we needed to start the day before hopping a $5 Uber to Disney five minutes away.  Highly recommended.

The hotel was convenient, it had a nice breakfast included with a lot of seating. Free parking was convenient. We walked with5 small kids, two in a stroller and it was about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. It was a bit far but doable. The walk back late at night is a lot longer than getting there in the morning. The rooms were clean and the bunk suites were awesome. Overall I’d stay there again.   Tip: I think we cane during busy season being that it was a holiday weekend but I wouldn’t expect an early check in or a late checkout. But it’s understandable for the amount of beds in the room that need to be turned over, we had 4.

We decided on a family vacation to Disney during the Holidays.  With this being 2 weeks before Christmas there were not many hotel options that would fit our size or budget.  We found a decent deal, as you know everything in the general Disney area is expensive.  This was a quote "Suite", so it did technically have a door to divide the living room and the bedroom but far from a suite.  The room was decently sized but for the amount of people it was to fit the restroom was far from desirable.  The beds were soft, carpet needed help as well as the sofa sleeper.  The restroom was small and slightly dingy.  For the amount of time we spent in the room it was fine, the breakfast was decent to good but for the overall cost not being cheap in any means it could have been better.

Nice. People were friendly. Food was good.only problem the parking lot. Too small and you're only entitled to one space even if you have a big group. Other wise you're charged for extra cars. Accommodations were nice and clean. Close to disneyland Park

I like the place it wast near to Disneyland. People on the front Desk very kind and I like my room, irt was comfortable. The only thing that I would like to improve the sofa. The breakfast was fine but I would like to include more options.

Facilities of the hotel fit the price and expectations. Overall my family had a nice stay. Regular breakfast is served and because the hotel is always full we had some troubles to find table in the morning. The room was clean and always very well maintained. WiFi worked well without problems. Point positive is the proximity form Disneyland and other points of interest. One of the negative points is the parking, always difficult to find a spot and most of time you are oriented to park in prohibited places until the next day. Laundry it is another problem, there are just two washers and two dryers, for the whole hotel...

It was good we got a nice room and comfortable, the crew was nice and friendly, the only problem was our bathroom door didnt closed it would opem by itself, other than that we enjoyed stating here....

Recently, it was my second time staying here. I actually forgot that I had stayed here before and accidentally booked it again.  Stayed for 2 nights just for a quick trip to Disneyland. I had booked the suite with a king bed, a twin bunk bed, and a double sofa for 4 adults and 1 child. When I arrived, they confirmed the suite, only to tell me 5 minutes later that there had apparently been some damage to that room and they can no longer accommodate the booking. Instead, they gave me two rooms with two double beds, convincing me that it's a much better deal and that I didn't have to pay any extra... In reality, I got gypped. Being that it was already late and we were all tired, I just went with it.  Terrible sleep because the walls are paper thin and you can hear EVERYTHING. Loud

Summary Heading: I guess ok for a quick stay
Summary: The 2 room “suite” was small, you could not have more than one person in the bathroom at a time, which was very hard with 2 teenagers and 2 adults. The room really has very few amenities, not even a spoon. The bed was not very comfortable and we all hardly slept, lucky we only stayed 2 nights. The positives were the friendly staff and the good location (a good 15 min walk to Disneyland), but remember your legs will be very sore on the way home and that 15 mins will feel like 60 mins.

Good value for families. The facility is clean, comfortable, walking distance to Disneyland or Toy Story Shuttle.  Room comes with complimentary hot/cold breakfast. Easy check in at reception.   Staff are welcoming to guests.
Manager Response: Dear riverboatfinder,  Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed review with the Trip Advisor community and of course with us. Thank you for your kind words. We will certainly share your compliments with our staff. We truly value your continued patronage and hope to see you again in the future.   Yours in Hospitality

Summary: I have stayed at this motel previously and while it was average accommodations the location to Disney Parking lot was worth it. But be careful after dark if walking to lot as neighborhood has some homeless residents that we have seen harass walkers. This time stay was not very pleasant. I asked about quietness of room location upon check in and was reassured it was. Room 102 next to stairwell was anything but quiet. And while the stairwell traffic calmed down about 10pm, when the people above me came in about 11pm it sounded like they would come crashing through the ceiling. Add the luke warm shower temp and it was a disappointment this time around. Maybe it was just this particular room?Since prices at other hotels were competitive I will probably try different location next

This was our first visit to Disneyland for our kids.  Our visit began with extremely bad customer service.   We arrived early and simply requested if we could get in earlier but were rude about their response.  The rooms were outdated and and not clean.  Our TV remote did not work and had to request for a working hair blower. The nights were very noisy.  Breakfast was OK. After the 1st day, we chose to eat at IHOP down the street. Upon checkout out, we requested an extension because I was speaking at a conference and it was cold outside. They would not allow for the extension and had to find a onsite daycare.  When we came back to get our suitcases, we overheard them give an extension to another young lady. Wow!  For being a good neighbor for Disney, this is bad.

We took a last minute trip to Disneyland over one of the biggest American shopping weekends in the year. We not only found this hotel for a great deal, but it's within walking distance to the park. Their morning breakfast menu isn't anything fancy, but the fact that it was complimentary and was always warm was appreciated. Our room was clean, and much bigger than we had anticipated, and we loved the jacuzzi bathtub!   The only thing we would have appreciated more would have been to be given more detailed information about the public transporation options given for guests staying and trying to get to the main enterance of Disneyland. We were told the three alternate routes, the times each one would approximately take, and the price for the ART round trip bus faire. The only thing

Summary Heading: So close to Toy Story Parking
Summary: Not a fancy place, but so convenient to park!  Staff seemed very nice. Free breakfast was ok, but they did have hot selections every morning. My 10 year old was dissapointed that they didn't have cocoa ☺. All in all a good experience.

We have stayed here several times with just my kids to with my whole family. I have seen the breakfast menu change often but never disappointing. This past time we went they had waffles, pastries, eggs, pancakes, sausage, toast, juice and cereal. It was perfect for our 2 year old all the way to my grama. The room was clean and perfect.

Summary Heading: Nothing fancy... but you can't beat the price / closeness to Disneyland.
Summary: We went to Disneyland for part of our honeymoon and booked into the Cortona Inn and Suite solely for the price. Through Disney's packages, we got a really cheap rate for the Kids Suite of all things. So our room had a king bed in the main room, a bathroom, and then a whole other room with bunkbeds for those kids we don't have. That was fine.  Be prepared for some noise - you'll have lots of kid neighbors and families everywhere. If I'd known how thin the walls were, I'd have opted for a top floor if it was possible - but no elevator, so... maybe you don't want to lug all your stuff up a bunch of stairs. This is definitely motel-style, so your door opens right to the outside. If you aren't cool with that, don't stay here.  The room was nothing fancy at all but we didn't mind,

Summary Heading: Clean, affordable hotel not far from major attractions
Summary: Hotel was mostly clean, although the safe didn't have a key. Service could have been better as follows. I was at first assigned a key card that didn't work, and it turned out the room which we were initially assigned was still being cleaned. After going back to the concierge, we were given a different key for a different room, which worked.

Summary Heading: Mosquitoes Galore and room was outdated (OVERPRICED)!!!
Summary: We took our chances to try the Cartona Inn last weekend for two nights (luckily only 2 nights) since it's close to Disney but from our arrival and checking-in the staff was not very welcoming.  Upon entering the room, my wife already killed 10 mosquitoes. We left the room and when we came back killed 6 more mosquitoes again.  My wife was worried for our two lil'girls to get bitten by mosquitoes but luckily got all of them.  The room was very outdated and the parking was horrible.  Breakfast is very basic and could be better.  The day we checkout, didn't even heard from the staff (a guy didn't get his name) at least asking "how was your stay?" nothing zero eye contact.  I mentioned about the mosquitoes and he only shrugged his shoulder and responded sorry about that and handed my

Summary Heading: staff all over the hotel was friendly and always smiling.  Judy was so sweet & friendly.  Great selection for breakfast
Summary: Nice hotel with you being able to purchase Disney tickets at the hotel and not have to stand in line at Disney.  You can purchase ART transportation tickets also at the front desk.  People that worked at the hotel were all friendly.

Summary Heading: Location is the only thing in its favour
Summary: We chose to stay here due to the family suite and allowing the kids to have their own space. Whilst the kids loved this, that was the only positive. The room was outdated, the bathrooms were terrible, and the hotel is incredibly noisy. We were on the ground floor and it felt like the family above us were about to come crashing through the floor at any time.  The breakfast on offer was worse than terrible and after our first two experiences, we decided to skip it.  The hotel is a short drive from Disneyland, but we walked across the road and caught the shuttle from the Toy Story car park.  The location and the price was the reason why we stayed here, but the place needs a lot of work to bring it up to the standard of other hotels in the area.

The beds were great! Just what is needed after walking all day at Disneyland.  The AC works great!  The breakfast could be better, though.  Pretty basic.  If you don't mind walking and don't want to wait for the bus to Disneyland, it is about a mile, not a bad walk. The hotel is dated but clean. No problems. Friendly helpful people at the front desk. I would stay there again.

Good value for a 5 night 6 day stay. Rooms are adequately clean, some dirty spots can be seen, the air conditioning unit needs to be cleaned out there was a funky smell coming from it. Bed was good, soft and clean. Not a bad hotel, would stay again if needed.

We checked in last minute since everything in the area was booked, the staff was very courteous and friendly. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Cant beat the free breakfast and parking. Will definitely book again since we visit a few times per year.

Very close to Disney.  It had the feel of a resort in the lobby.  The rooms were typical of an upgraded motel (exterior door), clean and the beds were fantastic.  We were near the stairs, so anticipated noise that never materialized. The black-out curtains and adjustable AC were just what we needed for a great night's sleep.  Customer service was exceptional (extra towels and blankets delivered without being asked) and friendly, efficient staff in all areas.  The only reason I didn't give it a five is that the breakfast was disappointing - all pretty processed with no special touches (e.g.toaster waffles with only syrup).  We stay at Hampton Inn on occasion and the extra touches like dried fruit, nuts, yogurt, fresh fruit, oatmeal, etc. provide special touches and choices that

It was wonderful to have a separate room for the kids and especially to have bunk beds! We loved the room layout and we all slept very comfortably. We didnt like how the AC unit in the kids room was falling apart and was obnoxiously loud, the room was pretty humid,there was rust/mold all over the bathroom, there was hair everywhere from the housekeeper, and breakfast was rather disappointing in terms of choices available.

My husband and I along with my daughter, son-in-law and 2 grand daughters stayed at Cortona Inn.  It was a perfect stay,  My daughter had a room with a separate room with bunk beds for the girls, which was super for them.  Our room had 2 queen beds which were super comfortable.  There was also a continental breakfast.    I would recommend and stay at this hotel again.  There was a shuttle to Disneyland which was more than super.  Great time and great stay.

My friend and I decided to make a little quick weekend trip to Disneyland and chose Cortona Inn and Suites as our hotel. I am so glad we did!! They offered a great rate, free parking, free wifi and a complimentary breakfast. I was expecting a continental breakfast, but it was so much more. Waffles, biscuits and gravy, sausage patties, fruit, cereal, hard boiled eggs, and muffins. Another fantastic feature of this hotel is it's proximity to the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot. A 4 minute walk and we boarded the free shuttle to Disneyland. No ART system that goes around to several hotels! And last, but definitely not least was their amazing employees. Everyone was so incredibly friendly and helpful. We were greeted with a "good morning" by everyone from the front desk, to the

Summary Heading: Great place for a family on a budget!
Summary: We stayed several nights here, we loved the Kids suite. Plenty of space, plenty of room for all our luggage. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. I wouldn’t mind staying here again! The pool area was nice, the location to hop on the shuttle to Disney was great!  It was a fight for the washing machines and dryers, I think they should add another laundry room. It was a joke, people throwing others laundry out and jumping ahead. For the size of hotel, and a location where a lot of families stay, more laundry would be nice.  The breakfast was meh. More fresh options would have been nice. The breakfast room was a good size, and clean. The staff worked very hard to keep everything in stock, which was nice!

Summary Heading: Quick business stay for a conference.
Summary: Room was clean. Breakfast was great and breakfast area is kept clean and well stocked.  There was some construction going on at the hotel at the time but it was 9 to 5pm and i wasnt in my room at that time.

Summary Heading: Decent accommodations and on a budget!
Summary: Let's face it. If you're going to Disney and not staying in their resorts, then you know you're on a budget! The room is what you need my recent Disney trip. Bathe, sleep, repeat! I can offer zero complaints.

On our road trip my kids became very ill.  In order to not get the rest of the family sick we decided to get a hotel room.  We stayed in our room (bunkbed suite) for 3 days.  The staff at the Cortona inn and suites was amazing.  They answered any questions I had over the phone and even brought our food to us so we didn't expose others.  They went above and beyond.  We are grateful for their hard work and appreciate being able to stay there

It is very nice, we stayed at a Kids suite, they loved the bunk beds, breakfast was nice, closing distance to disney, the rooms Could be cleaner, I deffinetly recomend this hotel specially for families

The service was good, comfortable beds but not comfortable pillows at all, even my 2 years old niece said she had back pain.  Anyway the location was convenient.  I was concern about the walking time to Disneyland but it wasnt bad at all even on our returning to the hotel at night.  Bathrooms in the rooms are a little outdated and in some of them hot water didnt work well.  Good things the rooms have are the microwave and fridge.  The hotel is good however it could be better for the price.

I read some less than thrilling reviews and was nervous, but this place far exceeded my expectations. The front desk was friendly and extremely accommodating. They assisted us in booking our Lux Bus to Universal Studios, taking that off our plate. The room was nice and clean. The pool area was quiet when we went. We would absolutely return.

The room is very spacious.  The only problem is the thin walls and the noisy neighbors upstairs.  Also the food can do some work.  Otherwise I was satisfied with my stay.  The proximity to Disneyland was a major plus in why I chose to stay here.

It was good. The people that work there are very nice, they let me keep my car in the parking lot while we were in Disneyland even though we had checked out. Saved us from paying for parking & dealing with the park traffic! Thank you!

Rooms are very clean, beds are comfy, the staff is nice and it's only half a mile away from Disneyland. Also close to CVS and a couple good, hole in the wall restaurants. I'd definitely stay here again and use the money saved on other things for a Disney vacation.

As other have said - walk across street to Toy Story parking lot and shuttle to and from front gate of Disneyland and CA Adventure parks. Parking at Cortona Inn is included in rate so just keep the car there while at the park without paying $20 more elsewhere. Front desk Staff was very friendly and courteous and we purchased 2 additional tickets right there. Mini suite suited our party of 4 adults and 2 kids perfectly. Will definitely stay there again.

I've stayed here multiple times within the past 3 year and I will keep coming back. There is great access to Disneyland by just walking to the toy story parking lot and hopping on a free shuttle to the park. They hold your luggage so you can enjoy the park before or after your stay with them. The breakfast is good. The options they've served has changed over the years but it's still worth checking out(and it's free so can't complain too much). Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and up to date. Always enjoy my stay here!

Nice rooms, very comfortable beds, no excessive noise, great breakfast selection, easy walk to arena and restaurants .  Close to Disney  House keeping quick to respond, customer service at the desk polite, very helpful

This was our 4th trip to the Disneyland area. Finally found a hotel I will return to on our next trip to the area. As a family on a budget paying with Canadian money we look for great value and this is it.  The breakfast had good variety not just carbs. Meat, French toast , eggs changed every morning.  The rooms are nice and clean with very comfortable beds. We never did use the pool spent all our time in the parks. Was a short walk to the Toy Story parking lot across the street where we caught the shuttle. Also a convenient little store with snacks and gifts etc. One night we decided to walk back from the park was a pretty nice 10 minute walk at an average pace.  Very friendly staff especially the woman who checked us in. I forgot her name but she was very helpful and extremely

We got the Kids Suite for our daughter and grandbabies and they loved it. Easy walk to the park. Lots of food choices. Eduardo and Renzo, the front desk staff during the day, were wonderful! They were full of suggestions and very accommodating. We'd recommend this facility highly!

I had reserved 2 rooms next to each other.  I was told on check in this was not possible.  Asked for early check in, one room was ready ( at 1:30 very appreciative) 2nd room was not available until 3:30 pm

Summary Heading: It suited our needs but thought the room was bigger by looking at picture.
Summary: Location was good. A bit of a walk to Disneyland or you could pay for a shuttle. Convenience stores & restaurants nearby. The pool & hot tub were nice to relax in. The people at the front desk were very helpful when arranging transportation to L.A. tours etc.

I would not recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. The room smelled like mold. Some guy was sleeping in his car all night right in front of our room. Weird nasty stains on the couch, curtains and towels and this was a upgrade to a suite. Next time I will spend a little more money and stay at a cleaner hotel. Wall paper was falling off.

Summary Heading: Spacious, clean basic room, maintenance below average, elevator crayon smell
Summary: We stayed at Cortona for 4 days.  Room is basic but spacious.  Staff does a good job of keeping the interiors of the room clean.  However, outside hallway and elevator areas are not as clean.  Elevator has a distinct smell of crayon.  Door to our bath does not lock and A/C is a bit loud.  Maintenance can be improved.  Free breakfast is good, and food area is pretty clean and organized.  The staff is friendly and the hotel is centrally located.  Food and shopping and, of course, Disney is within walking distance.  Their parking lot is small so you may need to park underground.  However, the elevator takes you to the hotel next door so you have to walk out to get to Cortona.

Summary Heading: GREAT PLACE TO STAY CLOSE TO CONVENTION CENTER AND DISNYLAND
Summary: We were in a two day car show in the convention center and I found Cortona Inn when looking for rooms, This was a great choice.  It is in easy walking distance of the convention center.  The staff was excellant to work with, the facility was very clean, the pool area was great, the rooms were clean and comfortable.  The free breakfast was good with muffins, toaster waffles, eggs, sausage, potatoes and cerials to choose from.  Some packets of jelly would be nice is my only suggestion.  The staff worked with us as our group was not all together when we checked in so they were great getting our car passes and rooms taken care of on the fly, Really Impressed with the check in staff.  They were great at check out also as we were not able to get back from the convention center to

Summary Heading: Great Hotel- Recommend for all travellers
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last week and were thoroughly impressed by the friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness of the room and the overall feel of the property. We stayed in the spa suite, which was spacious with a king bed and pull out couch. The spa tub itself was separate from the other bathroom which was nice. We were asked daily by the cleaning staff if we wanted service and/or if we needed supplies. The front office staff was super friendly as well. The only downside was the breakfast was not that great, and it was PACKED every time we went in there. Understandable, but thought I would add that.  This hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the main entrance of Disneyland, give or take a few minutes depending on foot traffic. On the way to and from Disney on

My wife and I stayed here for a weekend, and we had a fantastic stay.  The employees were all very friendly and greeted us each time we walked through the lobby.  Our room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable!  This hotel is close to Disneyland and the Convention Center.  Great location! Great room! Great time!

We have a time share at a Condo but room wasn't available so I went online and started looking at other options. So glad I chose Cortona! Husband and I celebrated our 1 yr anniversary at Disneyland and wanted to stay somewhere nice. Very impressed with resort grounds, room and staff!

Excellent client service especially from Esmeralda Cruz. The welcome gifts were great!!, they made our first visit to Anaheim very pleasant. The Hotel is near to Disneyland. Only as a recommendation, breakfast could be a little more varied.

Loved the location relative to Disneyland, the customer service and staff was awesome.  The pool was nice to dip in after a long hot day, and the breakfast was a nice add.  Parking seemed to be an issue (lack of), but the staff was super accommodating and allowed us to park in other places.

have stayed here several times. Clean, very reasonable, great location, free parking. Disney shuttle is cross the street, numerous places to eat within walking distance. Staff courteous, offers free breakfast every morning.

Summary Heading: It's kind of close to Disney but...
Summary: I booked our family vacation at Cortona Inn through a military voucher system because the hotel I love to stay near the Parks was already booked.  The parking lot is small so plan to either double park in the red zone or walk from the shared underground lot with the hotel next door.  The AC unit outside the room door leaked creating a water puddle we had to avoid.  The room was clean but had the bare minimum.  The breakfast was boring and practically the same everyday.  The elevator to the room had an odor we all decided was the smell of the paper from a crayon.  We bought the ART shuttle pass which I would recommend since it would have been too long of a walk for little feet after a day at the parks.  The batteries in the remote were corroded so we manually turned the tv on and

Staff was very kind and welcoming.  Rooms could use some updating and a deep cleaning, but for a place to come crash after a long day at Disney it did the trick.  Beds were comfortable.  Breakfast was SUPER busy, the staff had a hard time keeping food available and juices were constantly needing refilled, food was pretty bland.  Location can't really be helped, but it wasn't near any restaurants to speak of (Uber was helpful for this!)  Perfectly located near the Disney Toy Story Lot with free shuttles was a plus!

Perfect for a place to crash in between days at the park. Has a microwave in the room which is nice! And a large fridge. They also offer a free breakfast, which is good to grab before heading to the parks. I didn't notice much noise from other hotel guests, but that might be because we were so tired. Mostly clean, but noticed some spots on the air conditioner. Not sure if it was dirt or something else.

Stayed here for a couple of nights and was positively surprised by cleanliness and comfort of my room. Asked for a third floor and quiet room since the hotel is an older building with thin walls. Reservations was very accommodating.

Staff is Amazing Eduardo was quick at check in even though it was busy he managed to keep a smile and he was very welcoming.  He gave us lots of info on the park and even bought tickets at the counter, totally skipped the line the next day.   After driving all day we just wanted to get to the room and hit the bed...OMG sooooo comfortable I wish I can take it home with me!   Breakfast was great lots to choose from we thought it was going to to be just coffee and donuts or cereal and this place goes beyond that!!  Will definitely be back next time

It was about a mile from Disneyland and the walk wasn't bad. Overall, the staff was helpful and the hotel and our room were clean and comfortable. I did expect a little more from a Disney neighborhood hotel. The pool was very small and the breakfast was lacking variety and the "hot" foods were cold or lacked flavor . We skipped the breakfast the 2nd day and went to Starbucks instead. We spent most of our time at Disneyland so the it worked fine, but for the price I'd upgrade next time.

Cortona inn and suites was really a great hotel for the price. The beds were comfortable, staff was helpful and kept the rooms cleaned. Free breakfast was convenient  considering every where in anahiem, CA was expensive . I would definitely stay here again next I'm in town.

The breakfast was a disappointment.  It was highly rated on a travel website.  It was very lacking.  The front desk men weren't very friendly.  There was garbage in the parking lot.  The housekeeping people were very helpful and pleasant.  The kids enjoyed the pool which was clean.  Location is good.  I think it is a bare bones facility which appears much nicer online.

The hotel is very nice and affordable. The rooms are very clean and spacious with comfortable beds. Very close to the parks, approximately 5 minute drive. My family and I got to use the hot tub after long days of walking at Disneyland.

Hotel was very nice and affordable, room was very clean and spacious. The hotel is very close to Disneyland about 5 min drive. My family got to use the hot tub after a long day of walking in Disneyland which was nice. We bought our tickets in the lobby front desk which was convenient. Overall good experience.

An older motel type with separate entry which we liked. Room was clean. Breakfast was in the main building and did not have enough seating when we went at 8am. The children didnt find it appetizing (it's a decent continental where you can toast premade waffles etc, cereals, muffins and fruit) because my children are fussy.  It is a 20-30 min walk to and from the park but at least you don't have to worry about the traffic (vehicle and pedestrian) directly around the park.

I booked this hotel for 5 days and 4 nights for a family vacation to DISNEYLAND. We had to walk few blocks to Disneyland. It is very convenient to the shops and restaurants. . We booked this hotel with a king size and a pull-out sofa bed. We also had a jacuzzi in the room. The kids were happy with the room. But the bad thing is, I couldn’t sleep good at night because I can hear people talking and hear upstairs footsteps. Other than that, everything is going great. We had a great time.

My family enjoyed our stay at Cortona staff was friendly. We recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable place to stay at.They serve hot breakfast.My sister had an issue with her room but they resolved it asap and apologized.Thank you.Este hotel es comodo y el servicio al cliente es espectacular rente un cuarto por dos dias y puedo decir que es un buen hotel y esta cerca de disneyland.

Older, remodeled hotel with friendly staff.  Conveniently located to convention center.  Decent, hot breakfast.  Older doors and windows made for a noisy stay on the first floor.  Only 2 washers/dryers for entire hotel.

I stayed at this hotel with my daughter for 3 nights for a volleyball tournament. The only positive thing I will give this hotel is location. Room was not clean. The second day we were there they never bothered to provide housekeeping at all. Wallpaper coming off bathroom walls. Mold around bathtub,This hotel badly needs refurbishment. It was not cheap. Parking is difficult. There are many choices around this area so do not waste your money here.

Rooms were clean but very basic. Musty smell, but you get used to it.  The kids suite was nicely set-up.  Bunk beds were comfortable. Continental breakfast was meek.  Close proximity to the convention center.

Summary Heading: Dated but clean with friendly staff
Summary: Old fashioned with bathrooms that must be 20 years old but it's clean, with spacious rooms (I booked a room for one on a business trip and got two double beds). Staff very helpful.   It's about a 25min walk to the convention centre, a little further for Disneyland

Summary Heading: Great Room and Fantastic Disneyland Trip
Summary: The Toscana family suite was perfect for our group of 5.  Each of ou 3 kids, ages 9, 12, and 15, absolutely loved that they each got their own bed and we (parents) really appreciated our own separate space.  This place is also perfect if you’re planning on visiting Disneyland as the FREE shuttle from the Toy Story parking lot is only a 5 min walk from the hotel.  The staff was always friendly and the free breakfast was a nice perk.  Overall, this place is a great value.

Nice, clean place and the kids loved the bunk bed! Very friendly staff and in a great location. Took us 15-20 minutes to walk to Disneyland. Underground parking was a great alternative. Thanks for everything!

The walk is a little long. We have 2 kids and a double stroller and for us to take the kids out the stroller and fold the stroller up and hold on to everything is quite a hassle if you chose to take the bus. The rooms were clean and breakfast wasn't bad. I would probably stay again when the kids are older and can just hop on and off the bus.

I have a lovely stay at this hotel. The staff was super friendly. The room was clean and most importantly there was no smell of any kind. The only kind of dirt I saw was in the bathroom corner, but it was tiny. The beds were so comfortable, I slept like a rock after a very long day at Disneyland. Noise level was pretty low, the only sufficient noise I heard were from other people there who were very close to the door. I was surprised by the amount of food provided during breakfast time, especially considering it was all free. Good food variety.

Summary Heading: The front desk was such a pleasure to work with!
Summary: Thank you Judy for such an amazing experience while staying in Anaheim this past weekend. We stayed in the spa suite and it was such a pleasure to be able to take a spa bath in our room! Will definitely be booking again while in the area!

My family and I were here June 14th-18th to visit Disney, when we arrived it was to early to check in 3pm and Erica from front desk was great in allowing us to check in 130pm, Cortona offers free  breakfast and the cleanliness is awesome!!! Thanks Erica for all your help even with the car rental!!!

Summary Heading: Eduardo the receptionist great customer service
Summary: Terrific customer service from Eduardo,would like to see more variety of your continental breakfast,including some Flavor milk for the coffee.Some bacon would be a good idea. Would recommend the hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice little hotel/motel close to Disneyland
Summary: Our room was comfortable, updated. There was a little microwave and fridge, more like a Motor Inn as all access to your room is from the outside. There was only one ice machine that we could find in the far northwest corner of the property on the main level outside. The staff was very friendly. The property was clean, the continental breakfast was good, there were hot items such as biscuits and gravy and sausage patties. The pool only goes up to four and a half feet so it's good for kids, but we couldn't go into the hot tub because when we turned it on the chemicals were incredibly strong and it started overflowing with bubbles of soap. Parking was free. There is no shuttle to Disneyland from the hotel. But you can catch the Disney shuttle at Pluto parking which is only two

I would have probably rated a 2+, but rounded up because it was inexpensive comparative to other Disneyland Hotels.  Pros: Free parking, within (20 minute) walk to Disneyland, free breakfast (more than the advertised continental. It included eggs and sausage). Rooms included a microwave and refrigerator. The air conditioning worked well.  Cons: Rooms were not extremely clean. They cleaned everyday, but the bare minimum...changing the towels and making the beds. They never replaced the ice bucket liner or cleaned bathroom floors or even replaced soap. The rooms were older and our particular rooms smelled extremely musty.  The breakfast room was packed everyday. Some days we had to wait for 10 minutes to have a table.  We were on the bottom floor. It was very noisy, not only from

We stayed here for our Disneyland trip. It wasn’t a bad walk maybe 20-25 minutes. The gentleman that helped me wasn’t too friendly at all. Our room keys weren’t working so I had to go into the office and the gentleman said I would recommended not putting it by your cell phone or in your wallet by cards. It doesn’t sound rude on here but it was rude how he said it to me! But other than that it wasn’t a bad stay!

We had a good stay.  Nothing fancy, but clean and staff was friendly. Microwave and fridge in room was nice.   Food selection for breakfast was average selection but was good.   Good value for you money, walking distance to park (about 20-25 min walk).

Very comfortable beds. Clean room. Quiet. Was upgraded to a larger room at no charge; a pleasant surprise. Free parking and breakfast make this a great value for convention attendees and families visiting Disneyland

Great place for big families! Decent breakfast. Close to great restaurants!  Down side was people upstairs constantly noisy and limited parking. Room was very comfortable though! Big and spacious rooms.

Room small but nice and clean, free parking is a plus , and a pool , breakfast good for free some hot food ,about 15-20 min walk to Disneyland, gift shop was convenient,had a good stay would recommend ,

My only complaint is the noise level at this hotel.  Kids are running down the halls and yelling until midnight or later.  We were on the ground floor and the family above us was SO LOUD!  Besides that, the rooms were clean, the breakfast was good and check-in was a breeze.  We love the suite so that the kids get their own room.  We have stayed here before and will stay here again.

Only negative I have is the walls are paper thin - cant really rest here. Rooms are nice, staff was great, everything was clean and organized. I would stay here again if it were the only option but if I had a choice, I would stay elsewhere just based on the thin walls and needing the rest when I'm at the room.

The staff seemed very swift in the service. Usually I don’t like it but for the reason of my stay it was very convenient. I don’t know if I would recommend this hotel since I like when the customer service is attentive but I would use your establishment again for business purposes.

I had to go into emergency surgery two days before staying at this hotel and they wouldn't let me cancel the reservation. I was in the hospital for 4 days then recovery for two months. They wouldn't refund me. So I have no idea how the hotel was.

Property was overall pretty basic, nothing too fancy. The breakfast wasn’t that great, but I was glad to get something before we started the day. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. It was nice that they had free parking.

The room was great and clean overall. It had a microwave and good size mini fridge. The tv and AC worked properly and the bathroom was nice and clean; they also had big mirrors. The beds were nice and comfy. It’s not too far from Disneyland and it’s across the street from the Disneyland parking lot. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Breakfast was not good. There was a soda bottle in our room when we first arrived, near bed. Room could have been cleaner. Best part is location. Near Disneyland was a huge plus, and near a lot of shops and restaurants.

Everything was perfect till it was breakfast time. On the hotel pictures shows more variety of food to chose. No egg, no potatoes like the pictures. That was the main reason why i chose the hotel. Most of the hotels don't offer free breakfast.

Room: Subpar, misty, filthy carpet, have killed 5 spiders in Just 24 hours and the living space air conditioner is useless as it sounds like a freight train! Refrigerator does not work, main overhead light does not work, crumbs found in the fold or couch. The noise coming from the rooms around us is ridiculous and THE WORST we have every experienced. Theres no sleeping through the walking and moving about from guests above you and thank goodness our small children were so exhausted they slept through most of it. The vent from the air conditioner fell right off and to our horror it had a ton of dirt and debris inside. I don’t expect luxury but I expect clean and a half way decent night sleep.  It feels like party central at all hours of the night. I guess that’s not the hotels

Nice place for the price. Parking was a bit tough despite being included but overall was good. Didn’t have the breakfast but looked to be satisfactory to other guests. Front Desk clerk was sweet and helpful.

My room was neat and cleaned each day.  The daily, complimentary continental breakfast was delicious!  The customer service Representatives were very courteous and professional.  I would certainly refer Cortona Inn to others, and I would book it again if I should visit again in the future.

Summary Heading: 1.1 miles from the park and a block from Toy Story parking.
Summary: We took a trip to California and for 2 days we stayed at a 4.5 star resort in Pasadena and then stayed here at Cortona for 4 days to go to Disney. The moral of the story: this hotel has better amenities, friendlier staff, an awesome continental breakfast, and cleaner rooms than that resort did. The parking is free if you're staying at the hotel and so is the WiFi. I was even able to take my Roku and use it on the TV without hassel so we could watch Disney movies in the room at night. The only reason I'm giving this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because the walls are SUPER thin. We could hear the conversations of both side neighbors and we could hear the upstairs neighbors walking around. We could also hear the people out in the pool. This hotel is not fancy but it's well kept. I

Very nice double room, bunkers and a couch and a queen bed. clean rooms and facility. Courteous employees. Nice breakfast. Really enjoyed our stay. We use the shuttle for 5:50 a person Anna was able to easily get to Disneyland

Excellent staff, clean comfortable room, affordable rate & near Disneyland as well as other major attractions. My kids enjoyed the pool while we relaxed in the hot tub, both of which were clean & kept up. The breakfast was above average for a contiental breakfast & got us fueled for the day.

Breakfast was the best thing about it. It offered all needed items like fruit, eggs cereal, coffee, breas, waffles. The rooms are good and clean but dont have enough power outlets, only one by the window and another in the bathroom. Parking is included but they do charge an additional 16 dollar a night resort fee. 20 min walk from disneyland

Cortona Inn is a very nice hotel. Staff is always very nice and always available to help. Parking lot is small, but we always find a place to park. Hotel is set a little further back from the street so it is quiet from traffic, however, early morning you can very easily hear anyone walking past your room. Breakfast is nothing special - could use more options for sure, but if you want a little something in your belly, its perfect. We stay here for short trips and is just a few steps away from the shuttle bus.

Summary Heading: Great stay for a great price
Summary: Everything was great brekfast was amazing quick and simple and the bunk beds are a great thing to have in the room I will come back on my next trip only down side is the parking needs to be more but other then that amazing

We had a lovely stay here. The staff was very friendly and helpful with all questions. I especially appreciated that they had a stamp vending machine in the lobby, as I had forgotten stamps for my post cards! Breakfast was also very nice, and hot items changed day to day. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. Fairly easy walk to Disneyland park, which was the purpose of our trip!

we go to Anaheim 3 times a year just for Cheerleading competitions and have stayed her multiple times.  This is a great place to stay.  Prices reasonable, staff very friendly, and rooms clean.  The only thing I think they could do better on is the breakfast.  The gravy was like water, very limited fruit - only apples and oranges.

Beds were great, breakfast was decent and offered different variety of items each day. When I booked the pictures on the web site did not match the room we got, so our room was smaller than what I was expecting, but it was ok and the kids enjoyed the bunk beds.  Pool was nicely heated and a good size.  And the ART bus stop was close by. Only con was a silly thing, but we only got 1 - 2 wash clothes each day for the 5 of us.

Hotel is clean. Located just a couple blocks from Disneyland entrance. Breakfast is good. Staff is friendly. Our only issue was the casing around our air conditioner was cracked and broken and would rattle for a minute when it kicked on. I'm sure they will get it fixed though.

Our visit was good, centrally  located to ART bus stop and within walking of restaurants and drug stores. The hot tub could have been cleaner and at times the pool area lacked towels, which I might say were awfully small, about the size of a hand towel. I was disappointed yesterday as I had to be at  the airport at 5:30 AM only to discover the maid service did not leave me a coffee packet, and the lobby did not have any coffee made.

Property was clean and very friendly staff but is old and a bit run down for the money. We stayed in the King bed with bunk bed. The pull out couch was rather beat up and old, also not very big. Overall decent stay but would look for something a bit nicer next time. Parking is an issue if you get in late, they have everyone parking in fire zones. Breakfast is decent, the kids liked it. Not bad if it was $120 or under a night for the stay. For almost $200 a night I think we could find something better.

We enjoyed a short visit. The hotel met our sleeping needs, was fairly clean and kids enjoyed the pool. Walking distance to Toy Story bus was great! Easy to find and good room rate for our family. Kids enjoyed the bunkbeds.  Couch bed mattress was ok, but thin. Master bed was very comfortable! Enough Hot water for 6 showers was a plus!

The staff was very friendly and informative. Breakfast was delicious, rooms were clean, beds super comfy. Bathrooms nicely clean. Overall amazing. I was a little worried because of ratings not being all that good. Within a mile walking distance from Disney district which we did with a 11 year old and a 4yr old. Close enough to the magic without that extra pricey price tag!

The Cortona Inn is cool, clean and comfortable.  The service is excellent from the front desk to the housekeeping.   Any feedback is the breakfast is very crowded and simple: eggs, potatoes, sausage patties, cereal, whole fruit and breads.

We always come to Anaheim around this time of year for congress. We bring the family along and the family suite is our go-to. This year we got tickets for Disney and the kids loved it! We prefer this hotel for its openness. Thank you for a great stay!

Great place to stay close to Disneyland.  Breakfast was good and great price. Staff was very hospitable and helpful. No high deposit required.  The rooms are cleaned everyday.  Cleaning service is very respectful.

Summary Heading: I had a great experience at Cortona Inn
Summary: The only reason a gave it 4 stars it's because parking lot was full by the time of our arrival (8:15pm). Also, there was a little bit of mold in the restroom ceiling. Other than that everything was ok.Room was clean and the personal was very polite. Food was ok. Perhaps some veggies for the people who cannot eat greasy food.

Yummy breakfast and comfy beds. There is a smoking section on property and that was nice to have.stafff went out of their way to help us when my credit card went on the fritz and took a day to get straighten out.but like I said they were understanding and very helpful.i will always stay here.

Everything was great, we checked in and got our room key but our room wasn’t even ready.  Our beds were half way done. Had to go back to the lobby and tell them.  They gave us a new room but it was very far from our friends.  We decided it’d be better to just stay in the room and wait till it was ready.  We waited about 20 minutes.   Overall it was a hotel I would recommend.  It’s close to Disney and you can walk to the park.  They also sell tickets in the lobby.  They gave you breakfast in the morning.  They have a souvenir shop in the lobby.

The continental breakfast is fine, but I think some yogurt and peanut butter would give another plus to this great service at the beginning of the day. Also a microwave would help to warm milk for children.

Summary Heading: Nice overall stay located close to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for one night while we went to Disneyland. This place definetly had pros and cons, but overall we had a decent stay.  Some of the pros. This place is very close to Disneyland, so it's just a short drive to and from the park. Our room easily accommodated six people, which included two queen beds and a bunk bed for the kids. The beds were very comfortable, which for me meant that it wasn't too soft.  There was a fridge and microwave for our convenience. The room was clean, and the shower and toilet worked as well as expected. Check in was easy and the people working the front were friendly enough.  The cons. Limited parking but there is an underground parking lot that is shared with another hotel. The elevator out of the lot actually takes you to the other hotel, so

We spent 6 nights here and my wife and I were impressed with just about everything. Clean room, great rate, free breakfast and parking and close to Disneyland. You have the option of walking or taking Toy story shuttle (across street) to Disneyland each day. Maybe a 15 min walk each way.  We walked it a couple times with 3 kids when shuttle lines were too long. Kids loved the pool and hot tub. We would definitely stay here again.

I attended the NAMM show and wanted a close hotel. This served the purpose well. It is old but was clean and a very easy walk. I will stay here again IF they don't raise the prices. This is a $99 hotel charging $249 a night during the convention.

Great staff was very courteous and accommodating.  Room was clean.  I'm not big on street side hallways especially first floor rooms and people walking by large front windows.  Great location easy in and out.  Good breakfast Buffett.

I debated between the 4 and 5 star rating, but since the hotel met and exceeded my expectations - I went full out. First - the pros: excellent check in and all employees friendly and helpful. Parking included in daily fees (affordable). Excellent pricing (we paid $84 a night with Disney passholder). They offer discounted multi-day tickets if you preorder at booking online. They give 3 extra discount surprises - I chose shopping, dining, and uber discounts. Extremely comfortable beds. 10 - 15 minute walk to Disney! Delicious orange juice - continental breakfast included. Cons - I did not expect much from the breakfast after reading other reviews online. The egg and sausage patties went straight to the garbage. I did have a bowl of raisin bran. 3 cereal choices plus oatmeal.

Summary Heading: Decent but will stay elsewhere next time
Summary: This hotel is near the Disneyland resort. You can walk from it to the park. Probably a 15 min walk.  The beds are very comfortable. The room is a basic motel room size but does include a fridge and microwave. Bathroom was clean but old looking. Did like that the toilet and shower were a separate room from sink and vanity.  The hotel charges a resort fee of $17 and some change per day. I would have been okay with this had their breakfast been good. When I say the best part of breakfast was toast with jam and the unpeeled oranges, that’s no exaggeration. But for $17/day my breakfast better be great. So this was a real let down. Not sure where that resort fee is being used in this hotel.  Eggs were these yellow defrosted discs, sausage patties tasted like a spice and not meat,

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for the Namm Show
Summary: I couldn't believe how nice my room was.  A flat screen tv that worked and it had HD for the channels.  The staff was nice and every day someone from the front desk would call me and ask if I needed any towels etc.  I never had that at the other hotel I used to stay at when I came to Anaheim for the Namm Show.

The Cortona is pretty nice, but not elegant. It is clean and offers a more than minimal breakfast. It is close to the convention center. This is the fourth time I have stayed. I would like to next year, but the room rate got jacked up $150, from $250 to $399. Even $250 was more than I paid the year before. It is not worth $400 a night for me or my employees to stay at the Cortona. I would rather not go to NAMM when that is the price. I will look to airbnb for next year. Even with a taxi, it will be far less that paying $400 a night.

Showed up at 130pm and they let us check in early! Tv in the bedroom didn't work, but we didn't mind, we only needed a room for 1 night, so it was no big deal. As our room had 2 tv's. Beds where AMAZING, very comfy, staff was nice! Breakfast was great. Daniel who was there the day we got there was very nice to a 1st timer to the area and helped us find our way to Disney!

Summary Heading: overly priced, but safe and nice
Summary: This place advertises as a resort, but it is really a motel with a pool and jacuzzi, and a breakfast.  The breakfast was adequate, but made up of prefrozen items warmed up.   The beds were very nice.  The rooms were fine.  We selected the two room suites which was very convenient for our family size.   The bathrooms are extremely small.  The internet did not work consistently.  Close to Disneyland...a Short drive (about 10 minutes) to disneyland.  Staff were nice.  Some staff spoke no English and most likely did not understand as the yes they gave was wrong.

Pros: The most comfortable beds I've ever slept in at a hotel!! Nice and clean!! We plan on staying here everytime we visit Disney and we are Annual Pass holders.  Cons: AC/ heater filter needs cleaning. And our lock on door kept jamming. Had trouble opening it until shown otherwise by house cleaning

We enjoyed our stay at the Cortona.  There is a nice pool and hot tub outside the main building which is easily accessed from all parts of hotel.  Lots of free in and out self parking and additional underground parking.  Need to grab a ticket from machine on arrival and they reimburse that on check in - was confusing at first.  Daily breakfast hot and cold items and changed up daily with good hours. Friendly and helpful staff.  Clean and large rooms with fridge and microwave.

Great hotel for what we wanted very clean and tidy with very friendly staff. Only one small problem with the shower sorted within the hour first class service . Small pool and hot tub always clean with towels. Great hotel if you just want  a comfortable bed and a good breakfast 👍

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: This hotel was booked via our NZ travel agent so I'm not sure what actual price was - looking at costs online I think you could get better value for money as a couple elsewhere. As a family of 5 this place was great with 2 rooms giving parents a bit of space - unfortunately wifi only reached front room (ours) so we had kids on top of us until they went to sleep.  It was clean roomy and beds good.  My only issue was noise - external balcony access to rooms means all people coming and going can be heard - hotel has no noise after 10pm but we were woken 3 of our 4 nights with really noisy people coming in.  Would probably stay a bit further away and trade Location for quiet next time - we had a car and drove to Disneyland so we had that option

Good continental breakfast, great housekeeping, ten min bus ride to Disney Land. Good little gift shop to get Disney souvenirs much cheaper than Disney. Nice to have the family suite with a seperate bedroom and bunkbeds for the kids.
