Good place to stay, clean rooms and common areas, nice pool and hot tub, good breakfast, nice staff that's always willing to help. fairly close to Disney land able to walk, although its a long walk on the way back after a day at the park. all in all I would recommend.

Cortona Inn & Suites is well situated in Anaheim and close to key places like the Anaheim Convention Center. The room is ok and equipped with the necessary items like coffee machine, fridge and microwave. staff also very responsive.

A fine place to stay for Disneyland. Room was clean and comfortable. I liked having a fridge and microwave in the room. Staff was friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was your typical assortment of eggs, fruit, cereal, etc. Parked underground and felt safe keeping my car there. What I didn't like was the underground parking did not have access to Cortona so you have to go through the neighboring Hyatt to get in/out of the underground.

Room was standard, I was able to request a first floor when we arrived at 8am to pickup our park tickets but couldn’t check in until rooms were ready. Room was standard, but comforters were very nice! Thick to keep us warm, beds were medium to firm. Breakfast was lame. Eggos, toast, danish, cereal, apple, banana, apple or orange juice, reheated frozen scrambled eggs patty, reheated frozen sausage patty and small yogurts. Parking was extremely packed!! They share the parking lot and single underground parking floor with another hotel. People were parking in fire lanes and loading zones and still not enough spaces!

Adriana and Ricardo were the two employees working the front desk while I resided here at the Cortona inn and suites, they were very kind and helpful. Rooms are well maintained and they provide everything!

Close to Disneyland, room was clean; it need it some pillow cases, but within minutes it was taken care off. Breakfast can improve by adding yogurt, more fruits or other type of meats and different eggs.

This is a quaint hotel.  The rooms were of adequate size but needed refurbishing.  The front desk was very helpful.  With the high volume of customers it seemed that housekeeping was understaffed.  The property also hosts the Hyatt Place.  There is not enough parking for both hotels on the same property.  It is conveniently located within walking distance of Disneyland.  The free breakfast was alright.

The accommodations were clean and adequate for our travel purpose which was Disneyland with family.  We rented two rooms including the Kids Suite to accommodate my two grandsons and daughter and son-in-law.  The boys enjoyed the bunk beds and the pool.  We had a wonderful time.

Nice place to stay. Was clean. The beds were very comfortable. Loved the shower pressure. Had a free breakfast with eggs, sausage, toast, cereals and beverages. I would stay again. Was able to access shuttle service to Disneyland

Place was great. I got there between 9 or 10am check was not till 3 the guy out front was great and found a room for us right away. Breakfast was great would be nice if they had oatmeal but the sausage and eggs was great

Good hotel and comfortable beds. Room was clean and spacious. Staff was very friendly. I called for extra bedding and towels and they brought it within 5 minutes. Groupon nds were clean and well kept. We walked to Disneyland and it took about 15 minutes and was an easy walk. We had a car to park and had no problem finding a spot. They did not charge for parking but did have a resort fee. Breakfast was disappointing but ok, have had better at other hotels nearby. They did have plenty of breakfast seating and we could always find a table for the 5 adults in our party. Overall I would stay here again.

Our stay was very nice. The cleanliness of the room was amazing. We stayed there for 4 days. The beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was really good too. The front office clerks were professional and courteous. I would definitely recommend Cortona Inn &Suites to my friends and family. And we will for sure go back there as well.Thank you for the great service to my family and I!

I was happy with the stay with the exception of a call from the front desk at 9 pm saying that someone had complained that my kids walked loudly.....quiet time doesn't start til 10 pm. I was frustrated that they would call me about something so dumb when it wasn't even quiet hrs.

The room was great. It was clean, comfortable, and the location was prefect for being close to the conference center. The room amenities were great with a fridge and microwave, and I appreciated that breakfast was included. The only thing that borders on a complaint is that I wish the plug-ins were more accessible.  (I moved a table out to get at one.)

Stayed here with family of 5.  Location is great, 15 minute walk to Disney and brief walk to GardenWalk and dining options.  Check in and reception help was excellent.  Couple of things to be aware of.  Beware of the rooms near the stairwells as they are very noisy.  Also, there is a breakfast included, but IMO its a poor quality, cereals full of sugar and hot selection unappealing. I ended up having toast each day.

Pretty clean room, great breakfast (which was included in price). We stayed here two nights while visiting Disneyland and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Free parking, free breakfast, clean room, super comfy bed and friendly staff. There really isn’t much more to ask for especially at such a great price

This is the second time we stayed at this hotel and it was another great experience. The rooms are clean and the front desk staff is very helpful. Thank You to Elizabeth who was very helpful and nice.

Summary Heading: Good cheap place to stay with downsides
Summary: If you are looking for a cheap place to stay within walking distance to Disneyland, this is a good option.  The rooms however have a helicopter of an air conditioner in them and they get far too hot to not have it on. Advice would be to make the room freezing while you are out to avoid having to put it on while you are sleeping because you won't be sleeping with that thing on.  The noise from the people in the room above us was insane, not sure if they were having a gathering of the loudest foot stompers in the world or if the rooms are generally just crap.  We didn't sleep much here.   The only plus is the location and it's cheap. Don't bother with the breakfast (we grabbed the bananas) the coffee was not too bad either.  The staff are super friendly and the parking is free. We

Summary Heading: Motel, not hotel- better for families on a budget
Summary: First of all, the website photos, like many hotel websites, make this motel look nicer than it is. Although close to Disneyland and the convention center, the Clarion next door charged the other half of our group the same room rate and is a much nicer hotel. The front looks as pictured, but the rest looks like a motel (not hotel) you’d find anywhere. Also has a pretty small pool.   The outside doors make it easier to hear noise and there is quite a bit of it. Despite hotel policy being quiet hours after 10 pm, there was a lot of noise outside my room until 11 all three nights I was there.   I remember bringing my kids to hotels when we came to Disneyland and looking for the best deal and I also remember how hard it is to keep them entertained if you aren’t actually at the theme

We stayed here at the end of our trip. After having experienced such amazing hotels in NYC, Baltimore and DC - this place was a real disappointment. I booked it for my family because it is one of the partnered hotels on the Disney website so I didn’t really look into it very well. The room we were given smelt old and musty - the air con sounded like a freight train train was going through the place so we couldn’t even use it. My kids and my husband only slept because they were exhausted, I didn’t sleep a wink because of the noise and the smell.  I will say that the hotel staff were friendly and courteous - we didn’t have an issue with any of the staff there.   We were meant to stay for 6 nights but we only lasted the 1. We ended up cancelling the remainder of our stay there and

The accommodations were great, the only downside was the continental breakfast it was less than expected. The eggs felt like I was eating cardboard. Need better protein. My daughter left some meds in the room, I called, haven't heard from you yet.

The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and had comfortable beds. The breakfast was ok, nothing fancy but good. We will definitely stay here when we return to the southern California area.

My room was nice, the decore was updated and attractive.  People were friendly and courteous.  It was nice to have a breakfast that was more than a continental breakfast.  I was able to have  waffles and sausage.

Room was decent however did not like the amount of people smoking in the parking lot and talking at 1 am in the morning-we were on the 1st floor. We did go the front desk and I guess they told them to break it up.  Breakfast was not all that great-they need to improve their coffee and food

Summary Heading: Stayed too long. Better for a short stay
Summary: We stayed here 5 nights on our family trip to Southern California. It was too long of a stay. We stayed here previously for 1 night in 2015 and loved the place. However I think our memory was skewed because the hotel we were at beforehand in 2015 was terrible. In 2015 Cortona upgraded us to a family room with bunk beds which was a huge room. We loved that room and it was the main reason we said we’d stay here the next trip. This time we had a standard 2 Queen room. The room wasn’t bad but not extravagant by any means when you’re spending 5 nights in one spot. The area is quite crowded and there is a battle for parking spaces close to your hotel room, but they do have an overflow underground lot that helps, but is just more of a walk when your arms are full. The pool area is not

Great price for a very clean room with FREE parking, wi-fi & breakfast all within walking distance to Disney.   Walk: 2 blocks to Disney & 1 block to Katella which has lots of places to eat. My 3 year old did the walk to Disney the entire way so it was doable for all. It's a block down from the Disney parking lot itself.  Room: I was surprised how clean it was. I've been in many 5 star rooms not that clean. Yes, at times it had an old room smell (after showering if the AC was on) but not smelly overall. I let my kid use the bath cuz it was so clean & I usually only use the shower. Had fridge & microwave which is helpful for family trips.   Breakfast: Yes, free breakfast. Same most days but at least some hot options: eggs, sausage & pancakes. Rest are continental breakfast

This hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to the Anaheim Convention center and Disney!  Bed was very comfortable!   Continental breakfast was included in the room rate and it wasn’t bad! I would totally stay here again!

The room was spacious and for the price comfortable enough, the beds made us relax to a point that sleep was easily the best featureof the room, the bathroom while smaller had a large enough tub for even myself to relax in, and I am 5'10". the bathroom however had a rather musty/moldy smell to it, but could have been due to the humidityat the time. Their breakfast Buffet was good, and there was plenty of variety

Summary Heading: Budget sensitive property, but cheap is not worth it ...
Summary: The room was below average. The beds were old and worn. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was outside of what I would consider walking distance from the Disneyland Resort.  8 minutes is an extreme underestimation of the walking time.  We averaged 20 minutes (about 1 mile) and we we walk fast, passing most other pedestrians along the way.   Overall the stay was uneventful except for some middle of the night drama right outside of our door on the first night. However, on our last night, after spending all day at the park until closing, our alarm clock went off at 5:30am, wrecking a chance to catch a bit of make-up sleep before checking out. We never used the alarm clock either night before and it never went off either morning. The only explanation I can think of is

Stayed here for the first time for one of our Disneyland trips. Room was nice and the people working the front desk were friendly. Only issue I had was other guest not taking into consideration that others may still be sleeping and were constantly loud during the hotels quite time.

Some rooms are nicer than others, but the staff is ☆☆☆☆☆ five stars for sure. We have stayed several times. It's about an 8 minute walk to Disneyland  ir a 6$ uber can be there as fast as you walk yo the driveway from your room. Convenient location, great rates, and very good customer service-plus free breakfast. Couldn't really ask for anything more. So we recommend this place to people who ask where they should stay.

Antonio Mejio greeted us when we arrived at Cortona and he was more than great!! He was patient and very helpful! Our room was simple yet nice and so worth the price! Everything was clean and the front desk was always helpful! We will definitely stay again. Antonio was the icing on the cake, he deserves a raise!

The only thing that prevented five stars was the fact that our room was close to the stairwell and elevator and we could hear people returning to their rooms at all hours of the night. Otherwise it was a great stay. Clean room, comfy bed, and decent breakfast selection. Also, there's no Disney shuttle, but the hotel is just down the street from the entrance to the park, so no need!

The hotel was wonderful. The staff was helpful and my stay was definitely great. My A/C wasn't working when we arrived i called the office and it was replaced within 30 minutes. I also got engaged at Disneyland this weekend so the trip was perfect all around

This is my first stay here at Cortona Inn & Suites and it was the best choice I could have made.  From the start the staff was fabulous, very helpful and accommodating.  I told them I needed a Roll-away bed and within minutes they were there.  The room was excellent, very clean and neat.  The front desk staff was excellent very helpful, check out was a wiz.  We went to breakfast and we were going to load the car after, but not thinking I went to check out and when I realized it Antonio Mejia, the desk clerk had already demagnetized the card and he said no problem he re did it and told me not to worry to just leave the card in the room no need to return to the office.  I was there from Sunday, Oct. 15 to Tuesday, October 16th, we went to Disneyland and I will be returning to this

Summary Heading: Very helpful staff, especially Esmeralda and Erica.
Summary: The hotel is in a good location for going to Disneyland. There is a Disney Toy Story parking lot a block away and across the street. We took the free Disney parking shuttle from there to the park every day. The breakfast at the hotel was ok. There were a couple of different items  each morning. The beds in the rooms were comfortable. The room is pretty typical of what you get for this price. Where the hotel really shined, and set itself apart from others in this price range, was the staff. Specifically Esmeralda and Erica. They both went out of their way before our trip to ensure everything would go smooth once we arrived. During our stay Esmeralda continued to ensure everything went great, and it did. They are the reason we will use this hotel again, when we return in a couple

This is a very nice, family friendly hotel. We just returned after spending 5 days there. It has a good location within walking distance of Disney Land/California Adventure as well as many of the local restaurants. It is about a straight 10-15 minute walk to the Disney security gates including waiting for traffic signals. It is also about a 10-15 minute drive to Knott’s Berry Farm. We had a single room with 2 queen beds. There was plenty of room (there were 3 of us) and the beds were very comfortable. It was a standard issue room: TV, mini fridge, coffee pot. The rooms are accessed from the outside. It is a 3 floor hotel shaped like a horseshoe. The pool and jacuzzi are located between the legs of the horseshoe just behind the main office. The actual hotel itself sits fairly

Summary Heading: Room was good, but WiFi was poor
Summary: We stayed in the Toscana Kids Suite (king bed in main room, bunk bed and foldout in back bedroom). We enjoyed our stay and the price was OK.  However, we only had WiFi in part of the main room by the door/window.  It also kept disconnecting if you move around.  The kids' room couldn't get any signal at all!  We asked about it at the front-desk and they had their tech do something (I think he rebooted something), but that barely helped and only for one day.  They said that most of the bedroom suites have that problem because they are too far from the wireless router.  Seriously?  They can't spend a few hundred bucks on another router to cover an entire wing (1/3 of the total rooms)?

This hotel is a great value for the quality of rooms they have.  They're clean, updated and very comfortable.  The beds were super comfy as well and compared to other hotels we've stayed at in the area, this takes top notch.I would absolutely recommend anyone to stay here. We will definitely be staying here again!!

The room was clean and the service was excellent. We didn't try the breakfast so cannot say what that was like.  It was a convenient location to Disneyland which is where we visited. It's only about a ten minute walk and leave you car at the hotel. Will definitely refer it to others.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay for DisneyLand trip
Summary: I wasn't overly impressed with the room or place. There was no parking when we got there luckily they let us park in a fire lane. There were several cars that had to park in the fire lane due to the fact there was no parking left. Very few outlets in our room. We had to unplug the alarm clock and use the bathroom outlets just to charge our phones. Our room smelled weird and we think it was the air conditioner. It was very loud at night with other guests coming in and out of their room around us. The room was spacious and was very close to the shuttle stop that takes you to and from Disneyland. You can also purchase tickets for the shuttle at the front desk.

We stayed there about two weeks ago, customer service was helpful and very nice! Room was spacious and close to Disneyland. We came back a second time this week and kids just loved it. Only downfall I can think of, is breakfast. Not that great but overall I definitely will come back in our next stay and tell friends and family

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland trip!
Summary: Room was perfect for our Disneyland trip. More places to plug in devices by nightstands would be helpful. Could use fresh paint and possibly carpet update, but overall a great experience. Bunk beds were fun for the kids. Beds were super comfortable and the bedding was top notch!

Just got back yesterday from a 3 day trip to Disneyland. Needed a larger room with more beds to fit my kids and niece who was joining us and the room we had was two queens plus a bunk bed which fit us perfectly. It was all one room but I would have preferred separate rooms. The breakfast in the morning was convenient and fine, nothing too exciting. The hotel staff were all very nice. It is about a mile from the park so fine in the morning but a little long when leaving after all day in Disneyland. My only complaint would be the lack of outlets in the room. With 4 teenagers and phones and computers it was hard to all get plugged in. I chose this hotel for its affordability, free parking and free breakfast.

Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was ok, very basic. No yogurt. Parking is terrible, if you find a spot, don't move your car. We stayed on the first floor and the floors are super thin, so you hear your neighbors stomping on top of you at 1am! On the positive, we took a short walk to Toy Story lot and rode the Disney shuttle to the parks. I'd stay again, but would probably request a third floor room.

Summary Heading: Great option for budget-minded Disneyland families!
Summary: This was our first time staying at Cortona for our annual disneyland trip. Hotel is a 10-15 min walk from the Disneyland entrance - not bad at all. Way easier to walk then to try to catch a shuttle with a packed stroller. Breakfast and parking was included in our package which was nice. Breakfast was okay - hot items and continental type items. Was nice to be able to fill up and save our $ for other meals. Staff was awesome. We arrived much earlier than expected since our kids slept the whole trip. We arrived around 10:30 am and while inquiring about bag check and completing pre-check in paperwork, a room became available! Was so much easier to get ready for our first day in the park than I expected! Definitely didn't expect to be able to get a room that early. Housekeeping was

the rooms were nice and  better then anticipated.  The breakfast was not great tho. friendly service the whole time. its close enough to walk  but definitely not the most convenient walk. prefer to uber.

This was a decent hotel.  No complaints. I would stay here again.  It is even closer to the convention center it would be a good option for someone attending a convention function on a budget.  It was within walking distance of The Garden Walk also.

My 11-year-old daughter, my 2 sisters and I just stayed here for two nights to attend Mickey's Halloween Party.  We all enjoyed our stay very much.  All hotel staff we encountered were kind and helpful.  We were allowed to use the lobby bathrooms to change into our beach gear, validate our parking pass and leave our baggage there before we were even able to check-in.  When we returned our room was ready and we found it to be clean and the beds very comfortable pillow-tops.  The room was a decent size. There were plenty of mirrors for us all to do our hair and makeup in-front of.  The refrigerator was a good size, not too small.  Staff was quick to respond and bring towels when we requested them.  The front desk allowed us to use a pair of scissors to make quick adjustments to

Overall hotel was good. It is set up Motel style. We had some issues with our room type. The front desk fixed it promptly. Nothing fancy pretty basic. The bathroom fans was noisy. They offered a hot breakfast. Nothing fancy here, but they did rotate items so you were not eating the same thing every day.

This is going to be so fun were are going to the cortona inn today and there is no waffle maker😢😜😜😜💩💩💩💩🐛🐝🐥🐠and you see there is silly emojis yagsy it is going to be fun seeing this AA hotel and we are aslos going to Hollywood

The rooms were great! Wonderful family room and clean, with very comfy beds.  The front desk staff was also very friendly and very helpful.  The only feedback I could give is they needed bigger towels always available and the pool.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and affordable and really close to everything there
Summary: Great place to stay very friendly place and very quiet place it’s close to everything and at walking distance there’s a pool you can also, buy you’r  Disneyland tick there in said of waiting a long there at Disneyland.

The staff was amazingly friendly & helpful. Our rooms were clean & comfy. We even received a call while in Disneyland notifying us that our car trunk was left open, asked what actions we would like them to take. The breakfasts each morning had different options & overall our stay was great!

Very nice  place close to Disneyland ,close to. Shopping places to eat.  The swimming pool with hot tub was great. We will make sure that we stay here again the next time we visit family in the area.  The front desk day staff were very friendly & helpful hats off to them.

I love that this location is so close to the Toy Story Parking lot! We walked from the hotel to the lot often to take the buses to Disneyland. The service was good for us. The front desk employee that checked us in and check us out was very patient with us. She answered all of our questions and made the effort to ask for information from coworkers if she didn't know an answer. Rooms were cleaned everyday. They have cereals, donuts, waffles, muffins, etc for breakfast every morning which we loved. The rooms had the home vibe to them. A nice place to stay on a budget when you're in the Anaheim area.

Reasonable price. Good friendly service. Breakfast was good with many selections. About 15 minute walk to Disneyland. Room was clean with microwave and  Refrigerator. Kids enjoyed the swimming pool a lot.

We didn't have any issues, the breakfast was perfect since it saved us eating out every morning, the rooms were decent, and the staff was friendly. About a 15 minute walk to Disneyland which isn't to bad.

Great service and Staff.... not a AA hotel but mid grade.... family was all comfortable and rooms are affordable. Love the Spa King Suite, will rent again! AC might need servicing not as cold as expected but was cool enough.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel For Your Disney Vacation
Summary: We stayed here for our Disney Vacation. We walked to and from the park.  There was a nice complimentary breakfast.  The room was clean and roomy.  The staff was friendly.  We Ubered once from the park and it was five dollars.  We Ubered to the airport and it was 50.00.  The price was good and the location awesome.  We took a bus to Universal and we only had to walk a block to catch it.

Just down the street from Disneyland and close to restaurants and shopping. The bed was super comfy. Free hot breakfast every morning. Only negative was parking- filled up quickly and kind of tricky to get into parking lot. But I would stay here again.

At first we had some issues nothing the manager by the name Erica did not fix and their employees.Very satisfied and happy with the outcome. We all enjoyed the stay good food the pool and the great access to different restaurants.

We were looking for a nice place to stay that was reasonable and walking distance to Disneyland. We found it by checking out the Good Neighbor web sight. Our room was clean, the two queen beds were comfortable and the four days we had free breakfast was very good.

The stay was amazing great customer service but one thing is that wifi wasn't that great it can be better, other than that service was great very clean room and breakfeast was amazing would definetly recommend.

Reminded me of a renovated Motel 6. Elevator kind of smelly and shakey. Beds harder and not that comfortable. But it was clean and the maid service was great, they even made our beds up with the throw blankets our kids brought. Breakfast was alright. Better than basic coffee and muffins but no waffle maker.  We wanted something close to Disneyland and the price was right. You get what you pay for.

We stayed just the one night after arriving at 2am following a 7 hour drive. Didn't get up for breakfast and ended up parking the car by accident outside the front in a please don't park area but given the time , two very tired kids and lack of spaces we had little choice. Room was fine, just very noisy with people banging on doors from 7am and shouting at people to wake them up. Maybe people could be a little bit more considerate!! Also had to run shower about 5 mins before got hot water. Thought was going to have to have a cold one.

The staff was wonderful.  The breakfast staff was always on their toes and kept the food refilled and the area clean... and the ladies were very sweet.  Even though the hotel is a bit older, the pool area and everything else was neat and clean.  The housekeeping staff was very attentive also.  It was a very pleasant stay.

This hotel is simple and dated with outdoor access to rooms. However, the rooms are clean, internet and parking are free and it is walking distance to both the convention center and Disney (though quite a walk). Breakfast is modest but free, and equal to most 3-star name brands. The price is considerably less than convention hotels.

Simple clean hotel.  They say it's a couple blocks to the park.  A couple really long blocks.. It took me a  good 25 minutes  to reach the Disney property and I walk every day!!  Breakfast was nothing to brag about.  Danish, bananas and cereal.  Eggs looked like round hockey pucks.  Overall,  not bad for your money.

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff and a nice clean hotel!
Summary: We had a great time at this hotel. We were attending an event at the Anaheim Convention Center and it was nice that you could walk back and forth in a few minutes. The breakfast that was served in the morning was very good and the staff made sure everything was very clean and nice during the entire breakfast time.

Decent rooms, free breakfast and the worst parking I have seen at any hotel ever. In the Cortona lot, there are never enough spaces.  There were cars double and triple parked everywhere, cars parked in fire zones and blocking the driveway.  An emergency vehicle could not get in if they tried.   I had to park in the garage of the neighboring Hyatt hotel and was DOUBLE PARKED IN so I could not back out of my space.  I finally had to alert the front desk at BOTH hotels so they could locate the guests to move their cars.  If they charged for parking, there would not be this type of issue.  I no longer feel safe at this property.

We stayed at the Cortona Inn this week while on a business/vacation trip.  The rooms were clean, however the couch in the suite was "well" worn, but clean.  The king size bed was very comfortable after a long day.  The AC vent filters were musty smelling, but I just used some essential oils on the filters and it made a huge difference.  I'd stay here again, knowing that it is not the Marriott or the Hilton, but an affordable nice place to stay.  All of the staff were welcoming and helpful.

Not a fancy place, housekeeping keeps it stay able. Suite area is simple; pullout sleeper ok for kids. Microwave, frige and sm. coffeemaker. Gift shop has lots of trnket. Breakfast is ok in a pinch. Denny's is walking distance and a latte can be bought next door @ Hyatt Place. This is a thrifty family motel.

We loved it! Loved the room! The breakfast was good. (Biscuit and gravy a little watery.) See you next year! Pool water was warm and didnt hurt our eyes! STAFF WAS AMAZING  See you next year. See you next year.

We have now stayed here many times and it is quickly becoming a favorite for a getaway to Disneyland. We are annual pass holders so we come down a lot and we've stayed here now 5 times and have not had a bad experience. The bed is so comfortable, the breakfast is good and the rooms are clean. This time when we got back from the park for the night, there was no water to take a shower. We found out there was an issue that the staff was already on top of and it was solved quickly and efficiently. I was very impressed with how they handled it. This was the first stay we had where there was a lack of parking so it required looking for a spot in the garage below that's shared with the other hote on property but no issues with that either. With great rates available, including AP

We stayed here for 3 days to discover Disneyland, California world and LA city.  I can't say it was a great place to stay, perhaps you get what you pay for.   Our stay was Ok but not great.  The family suite we booked was clean but very dark and the bathroom had hairs in it when we showed up, the hairs were in the bath and on the towels so that was not ideal. Could be cleaner.   The breakfast is ok but definitely nothing flash.  We also though we had booked tickets to the parks in our accommodation price but this was not the case we just had the option to buy discounted tickets when we arrived.  I definitely think the website needs to be worded/written better to make this clearer for anyone coming to stay. I had thought a good neighbor hotel would me a it was fine.. but in

This place needs major updating and maintenance.  Cannot believe Costco has this hotel as part of their Disneyland package.  Although advertised as within walking distance to Disneyland, please note that it is a LONG walk - which is fine when you're refreshed in the morning, but crazy tough when you are returning after the park closes. In addition, the room was run down.  The bathroom door has expanded from humidity and it was difficult to get out.  Twice I thought I was locked in, but with help from the outside, we were able to open it.  The sheets had some staining and towels were a mixture of fairly new to thread bare. The breakfast was minimal - cereal, hard boiled eggs, sausage patties, and packaged donuts.  I think I saw someone making frozen waffles in a toaster.  The

The hotel was clean and the staff was nice. If you have kids this is a good place to stay because there are lots of other loud kids here too. Kids running outside at 10pm and then other families getting up at 6:30 for an early start to Disney. You can hear them all outside your room. The location is very nice across the street from the Toy Story parking where you can just hop on a Disney bus.

My family and I stayed at the Cortona inn for a 3 day vacation trip to Disney Land for my sons birthday. The room was nice, front desk staff and housekeeping were all really friendly. The only issue we had was the gift shop attendant. She acted like she didn't want to be there and gave my elderly mom attitude when my 10 year old son tried purchasing a toy car he saw in the store using his allowance. Needless to say my son ended up getting something other then he really wanted. Overall the stay was great

Rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable!  Breakfast could have been a little better, but it was worth it to save a few dollars to not stay on a Disney property, but get free breakfast every morning.

The room was clean, staff was pleasant and made our stay enjoyable. Breakfast was good, lots of choices. The pool was a very clean area and quite relaxing as well. The towels weren't always stoked but that wasn't a problem fir us at all.   We would stay here again!

A 20 minutes walk to Disney. After a long day, it's a long walk.  The hotel room is good enough for a family of three.  It's not old, but clean.  Breakfast included. Some days they change up the menu. We take some with us to Disney. 😆Enjoyed our stay.

I had booked this sight unseen and was a bit worried considering the price.  Every other hotel in the area had jacked their prices up ridiculously high for the convention i was attending. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and courteous and the room to be comfortable.  We will definitely be booking for future conventions

Summary Heading: Stayed for D23 Expo. Great hotel for the price!
Summary: I wanted to stay on-site for D23 Expo and booked the room a couple weeks ahead of time. We got a great deal, and for the price, the Cortona Inn is a great choice! It is in close proximity to the convention center and to the Toy Story parking lot, so you just need to do a short quarter mile walk to the parking lot shuttles.   The room was very clean and spacious, and the breakfast was not five-star restaurant quality, but they had a good selection of sausage, eggs, cereal, and a number of pastries.   The staff was very kind and took very good care of us throughout the check-in and check-out process.   The only issue I had was the air conditioner was a little noisy and very cold, but the inconvenience was negligible and didn't bother me much at all.  I would definitely stay here

We were able to get a two room suite which was very comfortable for our family. It was clean and the staff was friendly. We stayed here one night. The breakfast was good also. Close to Disneyland. They told us that we could park here the whole next day while we were at Disneyland for free, but we chose to drive over. I'm not sure what the distance of the walk would be.

My wife, daughter, and I stayed at Cortona Inn for four nights during the 4th of July. The check in process was somewhat fast, people were training. I would recommend that your hostess explains more of the amenities. For example, breakfast times, pool, shuttle service to the park, and how parking works.   Our first room was on the first floor tucked into a corner and it smelled of mold and mildew. We called the front desk and asked for a room change and they did without issues. The housekeepers should report this to the front desk to handle.   The next room felt somewhat clean, I'm a germ freak and pulled off the top bed blanket. The television remote didn't turn the television on, we had to manually turn it on/off. The shower was decent pressure, the water somewhat smelled

Summary Heading: For the price and location great service.
Summary: For the price and location great service We really enjoyed the place. Very convenient for the Disneyland. Morning breakfast was pretty good too. Pool and the hot tub definitely a nice touch. I highly recommend.

Had to switch room due to power outage but overall great stay. Our boys loved that they had their own room with bunk beds and we liked the privacy. Only blocks away from Disneyland. Would recommend it 100%.

Easiest check in process I've ever had for a group. The previous guest had smoked in our room. Before ever even giving us the suite room, the front desk gave us two individual rooms instead. Technically a downgrade, but actually worked better for our needs. They never even tried to give us the smoke smelling room. Housekeeping was great and worked around when we were in the room. Everyone was very helpful and kind. We will definitely be staying here again if we ever return to Anaheim.  It was so nice to be able to open your door and get fresh air rather than staying in a hotel and never seeing the sun.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Anaheim Convention Center.
Summary: This affordable hotel has very polite bilingual people at the service desk.  Very helpful.  We were so fortunate to find this little hide away which was recommended by a friend.  Breakfast was included and was fresh everyday  Wallking distance to Disneyland and wonderful restaurants.  Can purchase a bus pass at the service desk that says ART and it will take you to Disneyland very inexpensive.  Uber was there within minutes also.

This hotel worked well for our family of 6. We usually try and find somewhere with a kitchen & washing machine. But this was very hard to find in the Anaheim area. So we had breakfast included and still had a small fridge in the room to keep cold drinks etc in. There were 2 rooms. Front room had comfortable king size bed, 2nd back room had a pull out sofa bed and bunk beds. Only complaint would be that the mattress was very thick and reached the top of the top bunk safely rail. So we decided to take the mattress off the top bunk to make it safer.  Both rooms had a tv.  There was also a microwave in front room aswell. Also laundry facilities available for a few dollars. The kids enjoyed the swimming pool too. We were able to walk to Disneyland, probably about 20 min walk once you

Reservations at Cortona were made months prior to my and my grandson's June 23 arrival. Researched this VidCon Convention recommended property online, and based on comments and ratings booked for 3 nights. What a horror! The assigned room was on the first floor in direct line with  a ramp used to roll suitcases to access rooms/staircase. After complaining we were moved to the adjoining room; the door was directly in front of said staircase and granted us full access to enjoy screeching children continually stomping up and down the stairs.  The door and window were so thin and  offered no insulation to the noise or weather. The condition of the room was subpar. Furniture was worn, - couch especially un-inviting, the bathroom was dirty and in dire need of a coat of paint.

Upon check in the staff member was great, explained everything we needed to know and couldn't have been more helpful. Room was clean and beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was limited but covered the basics. Always busy, some day it was hard to get a seat. Fruit available so there was one snack for the day. Staff member in the breakfast room was always busy cleaning and re stocking food. Parking was a problem. If you arrived after dark very limited spaces however under ground car park is shared with another Hotel so we always got a park. Maids were friendly and very courteous. Room was alway service well. Having fridge and microwave was very convenient. Well located easy walk to Disneyland.

We were pleased with our recent stay at Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim Resort.  It is close to Disneyland and the ART bus was fantastic.  Rooms were clean, breakfast was nice, beds were very comfortable.  Would consider staying again if in the area.  Thanks for the great stay.

Took my daughter for a quick overnight stay while we visited Disneyland to ride the new GOTG attraction. Budget friendly and across the street from Disney parking. Staff was professional. Not overly friendly but efficient. Room was nice for near Disney hotel that's probably used a lot. Clean with mini fridge. Not many toiletries (soap, shampoo, etc) so bring enough. Did not try breakfast. Wifi ok. For price and location would definitely return.

we had a king bed with bunk beds.  Our room was spacious and the beds were super comfortable, but the bathroom was small and the sink was in the bathroom.  Check in was easy and the staff was very nice and helpful.  Breakfast was good and the same from day to day. Parking was limited in the evening.

The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was very clean, the free breakfast was very good and there was always plenty of food for everyone. The bed was very comfortable. Nice pool and hot tub. Not a bad walk to Disney. Would definitely stay again.

Great stay. My family and I enjoyed staying here. We also loved that it was within walking distance for the shuttle buses to Disneyland. We will definitely stay her again when we come back. Only suggestion is to maybe have turkey sausage or bacon for breakfast. Thank you.

This was our 3rd time staying at the Cortona in the last year and we've had a great experience every time. It's a few blocks from Disneyland which makes it a easy walk to the park. A lot of families stay here so it can get a little noisy at times, but everything else is totally worth it.

Summary Heading: Our Favorite Place To Stay In Anaheim
Summary: We visit Anaheim on a monthly calender and sometimes weekly. We al2ays try booking at Cortona Inn because the rooms are very clean and the staff is excellent! My husband loves their breakfast and free coffee all day!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland
Summary: Rooms were rather nice. Housekeeping were wonderful! They always did little special things for us and our children while we were out. Management were so nice amd helpful. There is a delicious continental breakfast every morning. They even have a convenient gift shop right in the lobby. We will definitely be returning!

The room was clean and nice compared to other high end rooms I have stayed in before. Customer service was excellent. Very easy check in considering we were a hour early. Close to dining and shopping!

The room was clean and confortable. The beds where excellent and the pillows prompted compliments from both of us in the morning. Nice and helpful staff. The breakfast is as simple as it can be, but didn't advertise otherwise. The only con is that 2 nights I had to park in the subterranean parking below the Best western next door.

Bed was comfortable, but it has that moldy smell a lot of hotels have. The hotel room bathroom smelled as if it was not cleaned before we got there. The breakfast bar was pretty good though. Needs more parking spaces.

Friendly staff, very clean and quiet hotel. Read other reviews but never believe what others say. We will be staying here for any Disneyland or LA trip in the future. Perfect breakfast for a quick meal.

Summary Heading: Average hotel, fine for a short stay
Summary: This hotel is absolutely fine for a short stay. The room was large and clean, but quite tired-looking. Pool and hot tub are nice. Wifi very temperamental in the room - fine by the window.The breakfast food in my opinion was pretty poor. I do have one big complaint though - all of the breakfast plates/cups/cutlery were disposable! Why are washable items not being used or at the very least recyclable plates/cups rather than styrofoam! Please, please do something about this!

We enjoyed our stay at this location. It was quite and roomy with a couple with 2 kids. The breakfast was a great addition which completed the stay. It is also a 15 min walk to disneyland or you can hop on the tram across street . There is plenty of good restaurants located around the area so you don't have to drive like Cheesecake factory Bubba Gumps. So lots to choose from. The staff is very friendly and efficient as well.

Stayed here from May 12-17  Pros: Kids rooms were nice option with bunkbed Pool was nice  Breakfast was probably one of the best hotel breakfasts I've had, nice assortment of fruit, yogurt, eggs, toast and sausage. Cons: We were staying in one of the older kids suites (toscana suite?) It definitely needs updating. Ceiling looked worn, shower head looked like it was about to fall in,  We had 5 people in the room- 3 teenage boys and 2 adults. Kid suite is set up the opposite how i expected. The kids area is in the back "bedroom" while the Queen bed is up front- I guess I just expected the parents would have the private bedroom but that was ok. Back bedroom was good size, bunkbeds fit our 2 16 year olds just fine The bathroom was an ongoing nightmare- first off the water has a

Nice room for our trip.  Only issue was that we needed to request more towels and shampoo/conditioner since it seemed they only prep'd for 2 people.  The pool was nice and they even have special handicapped lifts for the pool and jacuzzi.

We spent 9 nights at the Cortona Inn on a family vacation consisting of grandpa, grandma,  son, daughterinlaw and 2 grandkids 6 & 9.  The price was reasonable, the rooms comfortable and the walk to Disneyland about 15 minutes.  We spent a few hours at the pool and hot tub which the g'kids thought was great.  Lots of restaurants nearby serving all types of food. The staff were extremely helpful when we needed assistance.  Highly recommend for a family  vacation.

Stayed here with my Family from 5th-8th May in a one bedroom family suite with 3 adults and 2children!  Suite was a great size for us, beds very comfortable and my 15yo son was happy with the foldout couch! A little on the older side but it was very clean and comfortable. Kids loved the pool and husband loved the spa. Breakfast was ok! Basic breakfast and enough to get you started on your Disneyland adventure. Staff were friendly and very helpful! It was great to have laundry facilities! There is an onsite gift shop so you can purchase a few amenities!  There is onsite restaurant. My only gripe is that it was a bit of a walk to Disneyland, at least 20mins! Especially after a full day of walking its a lot for the kids to work an extra 1.5km. If you don't mind then it is fine! I

Great value, clean rooms, nice staff, breakfast staff were very clean and efficient. Families of young children that wake easily might note that the pool area can be loud (we used a blower that helped) and that the bathroom sink/mirror are out in the main room (not behind a separate closed door).

You can hear what's going on in the next room so if you have loud children yourself you may have to constantly quote them down. The set up is more like a motel rather than a hotel but it was a great price and convenient walking distance from the Disneyland bus pick up

We chose Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim for proximity to Disney Resort & affordability. We knew it wasn't a luxury resort, but it met all our needs & requirements. The rooms & grounds were clean, the beds were comfortable, & the self-serve, hot continental breakfast was adequate. All the staff were helpful, pleasant, & courteous. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to Disney and is close to many restaurants, ranging from fast food to upper-end steak houses, as well as a couple of chain pharmacies such as Walgreens. We would stay there again.

We had stayed here in 2012 and thought that it was a great value back then.  That's why when we returned with the grandchildren to Disneyland we decided to stay again.  Although the proximity to the park is great, this is tired property, in dire need of updating.  The entire bathroom needs to be gutted and redone.  Just bad !  Every time we took a shower the counter top of the sink on the other side of the wall got wet.  Not sure where the water was coming from.  The fan in the bathroom was soooo loud.  Not on a separate switch either, so if the light was on the fan was on.  There were very bright lights right outside the door, and the curtains were very difficult to close completely so at night the light shone right into the room. I ended up using a hair clip to keep it closed.

Comfortable beds. Clean. OK breakfast. Free parking. Good value. Pool and hot tub over run with young children; do not expect a quiet soak in the hot tub at the end of the day . The romm, however, was surprisingly quiet.

It was an affordable hotel compared to other ones and was very nice. No complaints! Had a really good breakfast, not your regular continental. We were upgraded to a suite as well so we had a great stay!

I would have given this property 5 stars, yetmajor updates to rooms are needed. Bad ventilation in rooms due to outdated ac units. Constant dripping in bathroom from fan condensation. Other than that, great property for family trips larger than 4.

Beds were comfortable and clean. Great bmorning breakfast. The stag were extremely helpful, pleasant and I appreciated them letting me into my room twice when my key would not work or reset. Otherwise I had a great visit.

Summary Heading: My friend and I were attending a medical conference at the Convention Center
Summary: We experienced the utmost positive customer service from staff members. The Front Desk representative, Esmeralda, was gracious, kind and most helpful in demeanor and presentation. We can't say thank you enough to her.

Family vacation. Thought I booked a suite but ended up being one big room. Kind of crowded with a family of 6 but we survived.  Not enough electrical outlets for the room. Staff was very friendly and not having to pay to park was a plus

We have been staying here for the past nine years. Always a great stay. The room was great with the kids.  Breakfast was good as usual.  Looking forward to our next trip. Nice that there is more parking available now.

I really enjoyed my stay ,very kid friendly and everyone there is super nice. The breakfast is also very good and they have a variety. Would definitely recommend  it and it's not to far from Disneyland we walked there it took like 8 min if that.

When you book this place, first you must know that it is a motor lodge layout (door to the street).  There are three floors surrounding a parking lot in a U shape.  I did not know this.  The beds are fine.  However, the bathroom definitely needs updating.  The shower head is completely calcified.  Do not count on the breakfast - in this respect, I was fooled because somewhere on their site they made it seem more than it really is.  The breakfast is substandard.  It is hard for me to pass up a free breakfast, but in this case we ended up eating at the park.  For example, the waffles are eggos you put in a toaster (not your typical waffle maker).  The selection is limited.  Finally, I would not book this hotel on a Friday night.  Go somewhere else.  Their rates on Friday are

This hotel is a wonderful place to stay near the Anaheim Convention Center at a very reasonable price. The rooms are spacious and clean and the beds comfortable. And it is near Disneyland, if that is your thing. Nearby restaurants provide a wide array of choices from basic fare to expensive dining. But do not plan to use the internet if you bring your personal device. The WiFi is soooo bad as to be useless. I mean it, really useless! I had to repeatedly rely on my friends smart phone for internet access. It was so bad I have only given it 3 points on the rating instead of the 4 it deserves for other reasons. Additionally, the breakfasts are adequate but nothing to really write home about. The outdoor pool is attractive to the kids. I am not sure this will upload but I can try!

We selected Cortona Inn & Suites based on location to Disneyland. They have the most COMFORTABLE bed - it was like sleeping on a cloud. I had such a good nights sleep I was almost at home. Great location with a few blocks walk to Disneyland. We chose a ground level room for ease of access with suitcases and pram etc. Only downfall was being positioned outside the ice machine and elevator, but it was not so much noisy by the time you went to bed. We skipped breakfast the second morning as it wasn't very tasty and they had run out of english muffins that were not refilled. Still value for money and recommended.

This is the 3rd time that we have come to this hotel in the last couple of months. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is fine. The kids love the breakfast, but I usually bring some yogurt for me and keep it in the room fridge. Easy enough walk to Disneyland. Takes us about 15 minutes.

Summary Heading: Good property to stay in Anaheim.
Summary: The front desk personnel are fine especially the two girls when i arrived last april 24. Breakfast are good and buffet. Will definitely return here. Good accomodation and also the gift shop. Thanks...

We stayed here for a week and found the stay to be fine. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms are a little dated however we dont go away to stay in a room so it did not matter as its only for sleeping. The location to Disneyland is walkable, probably around 15 minutes at a normal pace. The toy story carpark is across the road so we found it easy to jump on a Disneyland shuttle to save time. The free breakfast is good with plenty of hot and cold choices from yoghurt to toast to eggs and sausage, there is also fuit juice, tea + coffee. The pool and spa are nice after a long day at Disneyland. All in all a nice place to stay, nothing flash but it is comfortable and suits the purpose, i would stay again.

We stayed at the Cortona for 2 nights so we could visit Disneyland.  We had booked a Kids Suite but got upgraded to two rooms which was fantastic for our teenage girls (and for us!).  The hotel was clean with comfortable beds.  Our only negative comments would be the air-conditioning unit in our room needed an upgrade as was very loud and old (compared to our kids' room) and the breakfast was terrible - very unhealthy!  Some granola, yoghurt and fresh fruit would be an improvement.

We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland. The staff was very friendly and even got us rooms next to our parents. The rooms were nice and perfect for testing after Disneyland. The breakfast was good. Had a good combo of hot and cold food. Would definitely stay there again.

The room was ok. Needs some updating. We had 2 queens and the comforter on one of the beds appeared dirty and stained. The other bed was fine. I didn't call to complain but they might have corrected it since we were only using 1 bed.  Bathroom needs updating. They did have a refrigerator and microwave which is a plus and if I stayed longer would have been great. New flat screen  tv and free wifi . Very close to Disneyland and across the street from the Toy Story parking lot. Free parking at hotel too!  Breakfast was ok, lots of continental choices. Overall clean and comfy just not a 5 star hotel.

Room was updated and clean! Property was clean.. within walking distance of Disneyland's main entrance. Kid friendly which was great! And free breakfast! Staff was friendly and quick to respond to requests!

Great deal for how close we were to the disney parks, having breakfast included and free parking was a nice plus ontop of the all ready afordable rooms.  Pipes in walls were pretty loud but it was fine it was way better than having noise from the street all night.  Definatly would stay here agian.

I highly recommend the Cortona Inn and Suites!!!  It has the nicest staff that you will find anywhere!!!  They were so helpful!!!  The hotel was very clean, and the beds were the most comfortable of any hotel beds that I have ever slept on!!!

Excellent hotel.  The beds are really comfortable i sleep very well on them. Pillows are great and clean. Everything is  clean and nice, in my next visit to anaheim i will definitely stay in cortona inn Anaheim resort🤗🤗

This property looked tidy and neat outside.  The room was pretty well worn, but functional.  The casing for the heat and air unit was cracked up -- it looked like someone had kicked it.  It worked, though.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Cortonna.  The staff was incredible,  and incredibly accomadating of anything we needed.  They were very helpful with shuttles, knowledge of the parks, and very personable.  Thw breakfast was amazing with an incredible array of foods to choose from. The rooms were nice and very clean.  They even allowed us to park there the day we checked out so we could enjoy our last day in California Adventure.  Highly recommended hotel.  Affordable, dependable and clean!

I have nothing but positive things to say about Cortona!! Rooms were clean and spacious. We enjoyed our breakfast before we started our day. We really appreciated the secured parking. Felt very comfortable here. The huge housekeeping staff were always available during the day and easy to find when in need of anything for our room.  Will be back next year! Thank you Cortona!

The room was clean, comfortable and the staff went out of their way to help as I a severe injury occur just before I arrived for the conference.  Helped with information as to where we could go to be seen by a doctor as well as get medical supplies.   Good breakfast.  All in all, I would stay again.

Esmeralda the front desk manager was great! She couldn't help us enough. Close to Disneyland, with free Wi-Fi, pool and great beds. Complimentary breakfast each morning was a plus too. We had a fantastic time at Cortona and can't rate it highly enough.

I reserved two rooms with two queen size beds in each room, therefore, I feel that we should have gotten two free parking passes for each room thru out our stay. And the continental breakfast should be available til 11 am. Other that those issues, the conveniance of the resort was very good for our needs. Thank you all.

Excellent customer service, clean and quiet. Good breakfast 😀😀😀😀😀😀And comfort good area for visitors of all around the globe... Will do it again.  My family and I had a great time,the pool and spa were super clean very good atmosphere.

Very good service the room very clean and the beds very comfortable, the breakfast is fine but could improve it i also understand why the room rate is very accessible and this close to disneyland i would surely recommend it and if i go back to disney i would To host with you 👍🏻

Really enjoyed our stay at La Cortana Inn & Suites. Our reason for the stay was our daughter's cheer competition at the Anaheim Convention Center. The Cortana was within walking distance. We decided on staying at this hotel because of the reasonable price as well as the continental breakfast. The hotel has a nice pool and the room are very clean. I would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Anaheim.

I appreciated the clean room and comfortable beds. The towels were changes regularly the only downside was the placement of the "kitchen". I felt there should have been more to the kitchen. I did like the room overall though

This was a trip for my family to go to Disneyland and a few other LA tourist spots. The room was exactly what we needed. The only thing that we saw for improvement were the pillows. They were incredibly uncomfortable. The beds were actually ok, esp. for the value of the room. Thanks Cortana

Great place to stay if visiting Disneyland. The pool is not big at all but the staff was very helpful and the rooms were clean. Stayed in a kids suite and was worth the price we payed for it. Also very close to the garden walk area.

Summary Heading: The sound proofing of the room is not very well
Summary: The sound proofing of the room is not very well. The room smells a little sometimes. The breakfast is ok. The bed is comfortable and good. The microwave oven should be marked with the power for user. My whole impression is fine.

Great loacation easy walking distance to Disney or the convention center. Room was much larger than I expected.  Breakfast was great with a wide variety. Older hotel but kept up great. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable

Don't find it fair to charge visitors of guests to park for a couple hours during the day. Other than that I had no issues with the stay. Clean rooms, we'll maintained property. We would stay again in the future.

This hotel was great for what we needed. The bunk beds actually worked perfect for two guys 6ft tall. Breakfast for pretty good and it was a quick walk to Disneyland or any restaurants around.  Best part was the free parking. Would stay here in a heart beat again

We went the place for conference. The suit was just 5 minutes away from convention center. We reached at the suit around 12:45pm & i got to go to conference immediately. I requested the manger to early for my daughter as she was very tired. They allowed that. Moreover they helped to checked in room. Also we enjoyed the breakfast.

Reserved a king suite but was given a two queen toom. Went to front desk to complain and immediately was given my king suite. Room was clean, but there were nats flying around on our first day. Parking not so good. Staff was professional and friendly. Suite was a good size. Will definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends.

We loved it the room was clean and really nice also. My girlfriend was we need to come back here I agree. Everything was great we will be seeing you guys again real soon thank again see you next time!

Great price for a king suite. Hot breakfast was good. The concierge was very helpful and great attitude staff. Downtown Disney is about 10 mins driving, walking is about 15-20 mins. Parking is free, and there is in and outs with your stay.

We really enjoyed our stay with you. We forgot our pillows and the staff worked with us to have them returned home. We'll definitely return to your hotel on our next visit. Thanks so much! Room was very clean and reasonably priced.

My family and I stayed at Cortona for the weekend. The hotel is not far from Disney which was super convenient! The beds were sooooo comfy, the staff was awesome and it was very quiet. I will definitely book here again for my next Disney trip!

Super great priced hotel! Got a military discount which made it even cheaper..SCORE! Rooms were nicely renovated, not luxurious but very clean and comfortable for my family of 6. We stayed in one of the bunk bed suites it was nice that there was an actual door to separate the two rooms and both rooms had flat screens with family friendly channels. The batbroom was very small and the tub didn't drain well but it was clean and got the job done. Noise was not a problem and the hotel seemed to be pretty full with vacancy. The kids enjoyed the pool and spa both days and nights there. Staff was very friendly and professional. They have a gift shop with much cheaper items than at Disneyland but noticed the clothing seemed to run very small. Breakfast was ok. It was nice to be free and

We stayed here for a week recently on our Disney vacation and I am a bit conflicted with this hotel. Overall our stay was pleasant and there are some positive features but some of the negatives really outweigh them in my mind.   On the positive side our room was quite good. We had a junior suite which had lots of space which was really great for a week long stay. Our daughter loved the bunk bed and the other beds were very comfortable. There is lots of storage but the closet door was almost falling off. The facility has lots of parking and there was always a spot. The location is great for Disney and you can take the ART bus from the hotel next door right to the front gate. There is daily breakfast which is nice but it was pretty underwhelming but the pool area was great.  There

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for WonderCon!
Summary: I stayed here for WonderCon 2017 and I enjoyed it!  Nice rooms, walking distance to the Convention Center and two pools!  This is part of what seems to be a two block radius that is just hotels.  I stayed on my own in a room that, I assume due to so many people visiting Disneyland, had a bedroom and a bathroom, but also a second bedroom that had bunk beds and a hide-a-bed, plus lots and lots of floor space, so if someone brought a sleeping bag, as many as ten people could have stayed in one room (I didn't test this theory, just guessing).  Free hot breakfast in the morning and the staff was incredibly friendly, even allowing a friend of mine to park at the hotel under my name for free even though they were charging other people for "Event parking".  That was pretty cool of them.

The most comfortable hotel beds ever! Very nice staff,  clean rooms and good mirning breakfast buffet with hot and cold basics!  onsite gift shop fir last minute Disney stuff and cheap califirnia themed t shirts!

Average room. Comfy bed. Quiet. Good water pressure. Close to the park, Uber trips cost roughly 6 bucks. Discounted resort tickets was a plus. Breakfast was disappointing and coffee was terribly weak, but hey they had cereal and toast.

This is our second time staying at Cortona. Very pleased with the hotel. Clean, spacious rooms, great customer service. Good hot breakfast, nothing fancy, but enough to give you a good start to the day. Walking distance to the park, but it can be too much, especially after an entire day in the park. We used Uber every day. Would definitely stay here again.

The room was always neat and clean, so housekeeping was well done. Room facilities were good. There was a drawer though that never closed and that was a little annoying. It is a quite place, perfect to just sleep. Parking was not a problem. Wifi, working well.

This is a hidden gem as far as Hotels near Disney! The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were clean, it was very quiet considering there were so many kids! The hot tub was warm, breakfast was edible! I would definitely stay here again. The only negative feedback I would give is that parking is somewhat limited and I did see several people parking on red curbs and in the handicapped stalls.

Wonderful family trip. The hotel was better than I expected. Nice and clean with everything we needed. We stayed at the suite and having that additional room with the bunk beds for the kids was great! Kudos to the housekeeper who always did a super job. The breakfast is good, nothing fancy but enjoyed putting breakfast sandwiches together and the kids really liked the waffles. There was always apples and oranges washed and ready to eat and tasty. I compared many hotels and for the price it was wonderful. Mostly families going to Disneyland. We would cross the street and take a free shuttle which was very convenient. Overall excellent for our price range.

The staff and rooms at Cortona were great. I enjoyed the "inn" style rather than a hotel and for my family it was very convenient walk to Disneyland. Also enjoyed the ability to park onsite and not pay.  Rooms were clean but average. Did have access to a fridge and the continental breakfast was great for the family.   Would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay close to the Convention Center, and Disneyland Resort
Summary: Previously, I have stayed at this hotel, before. The first time I stayed, the hotel had just opened. The second time I stayed, it was a few years later.  The rooms have been renovated since the last time I stayed. However, the rooms seem smaller than they used to be. Perhaps it was simply the room I was in this time, I don't know. I swear they used to be bigger than they are now. Perhaps I've been spoiled by staying at suites in one of the other hotels in the area that offer apartment sized sleeping areas, I don't know. It was comfortable, however.  In the morning, I went down to the continental breakfast area, and came across the hotel cat. I love cats. Cats are good n fun. This one was no different. He stood his ground, and took the attention I gave him: pets, scratches on the

The rooms were average. It was nice that the facility had a laundry mat for guest use, but it's kind of silly to have it limited to such narrow windows of time. It was closed when we checked in and it doesn't open until 9. We wanted to be at Disneyland at 10 when the opened, but we couldn't finish our one load of laundry until close to checkout time - 11. The breakfast was a hot breakfast with biscuits and gravy, scrambled and hard boiled eggs, and sausage. All were very yummy and helped bring up the overall experience. It is about a half mile from Disneyland on the same road, so it makes it simple if you're walking.

We stay here frequently when we visit Disneyland. The rooms are clean, service is good, and the breakfast is satisfactory.  It's not a 5-Star hotel, but it's worth the $.  If you have more than 4 in your family consider doing the Disney parking lot. It's $18 with in and out privileges. I think the trolley is like $4 per person and there are so many stops.

The room was comfy. The noise upstairs was ridiculous. The fan and the light in the bathroom were noisy and so bright - it made middle of the night bathroom trips difficult!! The air conditioning was also very loud. Beds were soft, TV, desk, fridge, all great!! Shower was good too.

Room was average hotel room.  They were clean.  Excellent location for convention center or Disney. Breakfast was average. I would recommend but do not expect too much.    Staff was friendly and answered any questions.

Room layout was nice.  Wifi was not consistent; had to go to the main office for some help.  Extra pillows in the drawers that were meant for the sofa bed smelled stale...like maybe they weren't washed regularly(?), but the beds were comfortable.  The only real problem I had was that I could hear EVERY FOOTSTEP, both upstairs and downstairs (I was on the second floor out of three).  My husband actually went upstairs to tell the tenant to walk softly.  Would I stay there again???  Probably.  The price and location was a big seller.  Plus, the fact that there was breakfast AND a gift shop was a nice treat.

This hotel was conveniently located within walking distance of the convention center and Disney. It was very easy walk any where I wanted to go. The room was clean and well appointed and the staff was friendly and attentive.

The hotel was fine, and  the staff at the desk is  friendly and courteous hotel and go out of their way to  help you book tours,  get a cab or carry a package upstairs.  The was a microwave, a fridge and cofeemaker  in the room. In the morning  they offered a good hot  breakfast, that included eggs and meat.  The location is  great because of the  proximity to Disneyland attractions/bus stops/drugstore/restaurants/ Convention Center, etc.    They could be more careful about cleanliness. My room was not  cleaned the first day.  It was nice the rest of my stay.  There  is stuff lying around the bottom of stairs that should not be there.  Some areas could use a little paint.

Stayed for one night. Room was clean and comfy. Parking lot was full but they let us park in the Hyatt lot which was nice. We did Disney Monday and Tuesday and they let us stay in the parking both days, even though we were already checked out Tuesday morning which was great. Walked across the street and took the free shuttle from the Toy Story lot. Free breakfast was fine, nothing gourmet but fine to fill us up for the morning. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Only problem was no conditioner supplied for the shower and only decaf for the in-room coffee maker. Would still definitely stay again.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at your excellent facility. Breakfast was good and customer service was fantastic. Surroundings were well kept and the location was very convenient. I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Free Disney parking, wonderful breakfast, comfortable beds and walking distance (15 minutes) to Disneyland...what more could you ask for! Thank you to the sweet staff for making our vacation so comfortable.

Summary Heading: Comfortable room but breakfast not to my liking
Summary: First let me compliment front desk staff for their helpfulness especially the manager who went out and purchased a toaster so I could eat the gluten free bread I had brought from home and not have it cross contaminated in the regular toaster. Had he not done that my options were an apple or orange, or something that vaguely resembled egg (made from powder?). As I didn't know what additives were in the sausage (hamburger), it was out. However other guests, mostly Americans didn't seem to object to these, the doughnuts..and disposable cutlery, plates.  The Queen beds were comfortable; the TV a good size and the complimentary wifi appreciated. There was a microwave and small coffee maker. As a tea drinker, I bought a mug and microwaved the water. The shower was over a low bath in

The hotel was great! Super close to Disneyland and really nice staff. The breakfast was good - both hot and cold options. The room was clean and comfortable. The Anaheim Resort Transit stops right out front! The price of the room was very reasonable. I found other hotels that were not near as nice or as close for more money. This was a great choice!

It was a very good experience in this hotel, all people was very friendly and helpful. the room service was excellent , room very clean everyday, decent breakfast, parking available. the hotel is close to Disneyland , it took just 10 minutes to go there. nice!

We really enjoy staying at the Cortona Inn. The room was clean and seemed more spacious than other rooms we have stayed in. The breakfast includes eggs, sausage and either biscuits/gravy or potatoes as well as cereals, donuts, juices and coffee. It's a great way to begin the day.  The walk to Disney is two long blocks or you can cross the street to take the Disneyland bus to the entrance for free. We did both ways and they take about the same amount of time.  I checked into the Cortona in the morning, left my car and returned later that afternoon to enjoy the pool.  I would recommend this hotel because of the clean rooms with comfortable beds, parking, morning breakfast, proximity to Disneyland, and the kind and helpful staff. We have stayed here a few times and have always had

Summary Heading: Great spot for our Disneyland vacation!
Summary: I got a great rate for this hotel through my work.  Luckily it was available for my vacation dates in March.  It's also conveniently located to the Toy Story parking lot so we could use the shuttle to and from Disneyland.  We chose to walk the first day of our 3-Day visit and it's not too bad of a walk (about a mile) from the hotel but I would recommend using the shuttle if you want to save some energy for walking around the amusement park.  Plus, there's no charge to use it!  The hotel itself is not the greatest but the location and the rate was what was important to me.  There are closer hotels nearby Disneyland but they charge outrageous prices for run-of-the-mill hotels. Our room was fairly clean but obviously outdated.  It wasn't where we were going to spend most of our

This is a great place with great prices. I was in town with my family for a couple of days.  The room was spacious and welcoming. Nice pools and spas. The even serve a nice breakfast. I am definitely coming back. This was a stay to remember.

First time staying here and will definitely stay here again. We originally reserved a kid's suite but the room was unavailable upon arrival. Moses was very accommodating and gave us 2 adjoining rooms at no extra cost. The rooms were clean. The beds were very comfy! Breakfast was good too. They have a variety of things to to eat; from sausage and eggs to pancakes, waffles, cereal, and fruit. Staff was nice and friendly. The pool was clean. The gift shop is not expensive and fits even the tightest budget.

Summary Heading: disney trip for our grand kids
Summary: Every thing was very good. needs to add bacon and hass brown too the breafast. This hotel is very good walking distance from disney land. The personnel is very friendly and helpful.to meet all your needs

Resort is Walking distance from Disneyland and great contential breakfast in the morning also has a swimming pool our staff was very friendly and helpful. Resort is very close to variety of food locations.

Staff was very pleasant. Excellent CS. The only down side was the wet smell in my room every time I got back from a outing. I had to leave my door open to air it out. Room was clean. Didn't care much for breakfast.

The hotel was amazing the staff was amazing the only issue I had was the parking situation is horrible I don't think I would stay again there due to parking we had to park illegally because the top was full and the garage was full so we were unable to rest thinking we would get towed

Great location for Disneyland.  15 min walk to entrance.  Knotts Berry farm 20 min car drive.  Lots of restaurants around. Kids enjoyed pool.  Breakfast was simple, but included if your budgeting. Front desk was extremely polite. Shout out to Esmerelda who helped book tickets for us! Beds were comfortable, fridge and microwave in room was great.  Would definitely stay again.

Definitely would recommend it to a friend we enjoyed our stay especially the room it was nice and clean and the beds were so comfy and we had no complaints about the free breakfast. Definitely would recommend this to anyone

Service was great! Amenities were great! Location is great! Would definately stay again. The continental breakfast could use a bit more variety. Especially for those guests who can't have certain products like dairy, eggs. But overall, wonderful!

Good location for disneyland, breakfast with 3 hot items each day, parking included, but ac not very cold.  Small fridge and microwave, adequate for our stay. This time we had a studio room.  Last visit we had a 1 bedroom, which had more privacy and more room overall. Would stay there again.

The room was very clean as well as the rest of the hotel. The staff was very nice and friendly. They answered all of our questions and got us anything we needed. The cleaning staff was amazing and when we came back to the rooms they had our blankets and stuffed animals set up in the room! It was cute! One problem we did have was finding parking spots. There were not enough spots for all the rooms so we actually were told to park in a fire lane because that was the only option.
