We only had this problem on Saturday night but if you are going for a weekend trip it might be more of a problem during peak season. Other than the parking, our stay was amazing and we would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel so close to the convention center
Summary: Had a very pleasant stay. I didn't have the full breakfast but it is included . Free parking is huge!!!!!!!  You will have fun here. You can walk to the convention center in 5 minutes flat and the hotel is well priced

We stayed here with our three grandchildren for our Disneyland visit. We honestly can not find fault with the Cortona. Friendly, helpful staff, clean rooms and nice pool for the children to play in after a long day at Disneyland. Thank you for helping to make our trip memorable.

Stayed here for one night..all in all the hotel was pretty alright. Our room was fairly nice and clean, the hotel is only a short 10 minutes from Disney and the lady at the front desk was super helpful. But there was one complaint. The location of our room. It was first floor right by the steps for everyone to walk up to next levels. You could hear every voice and foot step. Also the walls of this hotel must be paper thin because we could also hear the doors slam, voices, and every step of the people above us and beside us. Needless to say we couldn't sleep then were woken up very early in the morning.

My family and I had a nice time stating here. The rooms were clean and spacious, it was within walking distance from disneyland. The only one issue was how to catch the shuttle to and from the park so our little ones didn't have to worry about walking far.

Summary Heading: Good but could of been better for us disney visiters
Summary: It was OK but my room had a mildew smell to it had to buy air freshener and the laundry room was open from 9-9pm knowing that the park hours can't allow us to even make it to wash our clothes,then we wanted to go swimming but like I said before they close before we can even make it to take a late swim they should leave it open 24 hours the laundry room and pool area but other then that loved the breakfast and loved the price and the distance from Disney

Front desk was pleasant. Breakfast was fair, but plenty. Rates were competitive, and rooms were clean. My greatest complaint was the lack of parking. After a long day at Disneyland, it was frustrating to get back to our room and not have a place to leave my vehicle. Twice I went to the front desk, they asked me to finally park in a no parking/fire red zone for the night.

Great hotel to stay in close to Disneyland.  The front desk and all the employees are very nice and helpful.  Enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi.  I Would recommend anyone coming to Disneyland to check it out.

This isn't a four-star hotel. But it's a great place to crash with your family when you're going to Disneyland. The breakfast was great. The suite with the extra room was worth the price to give us a little extra space. It's a bit of a walk, but close enough that it's worth saving he day parking prices.

Bed was comfortable and room clean. Internet service was very poor and breakfast should be more tasty eggs and sausage was plain and cooked in bulk.  The internet service is a show stopper for returning.  Frank

I enjoyed my  stay. It was comfortable and the front desk was very helpful in helping us get tickets to disneyland. They don't provide shuttle service to disneyland but there is a bus stop in the front of their parking lot that takes you to disneyland. They sell disneyland tickets and bus shuttle tickets. It's a short ride - about 5 minutes to disneyland. It wasn't swanky and there were no frills, but it was clean and relatively inexpensive. I would recommend this place to someone looking to book to go to disney  that  doesn't want to spend all their money booking a hotel.  Pros: a simple breakfast is included, inexpensive, front desk is friendly and helpful, clean, close to disneyland + food places cons: no frills (subjective), has a motel kind of feel with the rooms being

The staffs are very friendly and helpful, they show a positive attitude at all time.  We love our stay in this hotel, the room is clean and our kids love the bunk bed!  We would definitely come back to this hotel next time.

Every single staff member went above and beyond to make our stay the best we could experience. The beds are very comfortable. The rooms are nice and clean. Complimentary breakfast had hot and cold selections. We will definitely stay here again for our next trip to Disney.

This is a motel style accommodations. They charge a resort fee and parking fee. There's an outdoor pool & spa and they serve hot breakfast. The rooms are dated and there's not an easy access to underground parking garage. Staff are all friendly.

This hotel is in walking distance of Disneyland, the breakfast was good but they need to have cream cheese for the bagels. The hotel was quiet and beds were very comfortable with a microwave and large frig so we didn't have to eat out all the time. Will definitely stay there again.

Definitely worth staying here. Room was nice and clean, beds were very comfy, staff was friendly. The breakfast was decent though the area to eat was small and got crowded fast. Overall a great hotel!

Nice property! Super comfortable beds! Our room was clean and spacious. Rooms have hair dryers and ironing boards. Check in was a little busy but Elizabeth was hospitable and very accommodating, 5 stars for,she's amazing!!! Breakfast is just ok,never seen eggs like they have, preformed "disc's", avoid them and stick with the pancakes and sausage. When the hotel is full they run out of parking and you have to go underground to a shared parking garage with the hotel next door. When you use the elevator to come up from the garage you come up in the other hotel. The one complaint we had was the noisy housekeepers. They start early in the morning and our room was next to their storage. They're very gossipy and loud. They woke us up both mornings with their talking and laughing. When

We stayed here for two nights while visiting family. It is close to Disneyland, only about a 5 minute drive if you are going there. You can buy Disney tickets at the office at the hotel.   I had my husband, my 7 yr. old and 11 yr. old for this stay. The parking situation sucked, it was free but we could not find a place close to our room. We have a handicap pass for our daughter and even those spots were taken. My husband ended up parking in the parking garage under the hotel.   The rooms were clean, the beds were comfy and there were 4 pillows (though they were about half the size of a normal pillow). I liked that the sink area was separate from the bath/toilet. The shower was fine, water pressure was decent. The television had a good amount of channels.   The grounds were nice

This is the second time we've stayed here for a Disney trip and it has quickly become one of our favorites! The staff is always friendly and courteous. The breakfast is great! Actually has a hot breakfast-one morning was pancakes, one was biscuits and gravy. Not super food, but great for a free breakfast and awesome that it's not just pastries, ugh. The rooms are fantastic. They are updated, fresh carpet, and clean. The mattress was incredibly soft as well, and I'm saying that when we have an expensive memory foam mattress at home. My only complaints would be a couple of the walls could use a magic eraser taken to them. We actually got upgraded, so our room also had a jacuzzi tub in it. So nice to come back to the room after a long day and the park and be able to soak. It was so

Room was basic, clean, reasonably comfortable.  Free breakfast was standard: Fresh fruit, pastries, doughnuts, cereal, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, french toast, bagels, muffins, coffee,  milk, juice etc. Staff was very friendly and fulfilled our needs quickly and efficiently.  There is about an 8 min walk to the main gate to Disneyland or a 2 minute walk to the Disney parking lot....you can get on the #20 shuttle bus to and from the park.  This hotel is great for a family on a budget and is located close to 7eleven,CVS pharmacy, and several fastfood/take out restruants.

The service was great! The room was clean. The beds were very comfortable. The fridge was a good size to store snacks and bottles of water. The breakfast was just OK. Wish to have more options. I didn't mind the walk to Disney in the morning, but it is a bit hard to walk back in the evening after being in the Park all day. My youngest is 8 and she struggled with the walk back. But, we would stay again at the Cortona because of the price and the room.

I enjoyed staying this resort. Room condition is good and price is also good. And resort is located near Disney resort. Reasonable resort in Anaheim. If we have a chance to stay in Anaheim , I will stay here again. Thank.

We stayed in one of the suites. Check in was fast and easy, staff was nice. Free breakfast and super close to Disneyland and Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles. This hotel suited our needs perfectly. Only annoying thing is the gift shop staff. You can tell they don't like kids in their shop.

The front desk were professional and awesome... this is our 3rd time staying here and we'll continue to stay here because we love the proximity between Disneyland and the hotel not to mention it's affordable...

Rooms where clean and beds were comfortable. We arrived 2 hours prior to check in and the staff was very helpful and found us a room to get settled in. Breakfast was included with the price and it was very helpful if you are going to Disney with a tight budget. Spa was open till 10, we enjoyed relaxing for a few minutes after long day walking at the parks. We had a fridge to keep snacks and drinks cold. I recommend the pizza place the have in the room card, you get 15% off and it's good pizza. The only bad  things I encountered was parking. If you drive out is hard to find a parking spot near your room. Also the last night we got some upstairs neighbors with little kids running around at 4:30 am.

Helpful friendly staff! Older style hotel with rooms that open to the outside but clean and updated. At check in the staff booked us Park Tickets and Shuttle Service. So the car never left the FREE parking lot!

Summary Heading: Close to Toy Story parking lot!
Summary: We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland for the weekend. Overall, this location is quite nice. Personally, I love the hotels with the wall/floor unit air conditioner instead of the central heat and air a/c unit like in most homes. I like to sleep in very cold conditions, and this one didn’t disappoint.   The quality of the room was good and the beds were super comfortable. I had some of the best sleep I have had in a while from these beds. The TV remote was crazy long and huge, something I found quite funny, and the staff was very pleasant.  The breakfast in the morning was also good. On day one they had all the usual bread choices along with sausage, eggs, and potatoes. On day two they had sausage, eggs, and pancakes. The kids enjoyed all of the options. The only thing I

Great customer service! Thank you again Elizabeth, your great customer service is why we will be staying here again! Clean rooms and free parking. Is also in a great location. Rates are very reasonable.

We had this hotel thrown in as a package deal with our flight.  We did not go to Disneyland at all but this was a great base for dividing our time between Los Angeles and Orange County.  The hotel is very convenient to Disneyland and is easily walkable (we walked to Downtown Disney) but I believe there is also a bus for those who do not want to walk.  The staff were very professional and they let us check in very early which was a lifesaver after being on a 24 hour trip from New Zealand.  The day we arrived was pouring down so was good to catch up on some sleep.  There is plenty of parking for guests.  I would say it is predominantly a family hotel and probably on the budget side of facilities/price but the rooms were spacious, very clean and the beds were comfortable.  The

We really enjoyed our stay here, Within 15 minutes walking distance of Disneyland.  We had kids suite. Our 7 year old really enjoyed the bunk beds. Our rooms were kept nice and clean by housekeeping staff. It has a heated pool and spa pool.  The swimming pool was  a little cold although it was the middle of winter. Breakfast was okay.  We would stay here again.

This is our favorite oasis.  The rooms are clean and the people are great.  It's close to everything.  We love the moderate rates and the free parking.  We hope the new ownership doesn't change these great perks.

Found this hidden jewel online.  Nice free breakfast.  Very accommodating.  Parked right in front of our room.  Quiet.  Comfortable beds. Clean.  Next door to Hyatt Place. Had dinner at Hyatt as we arrived in evening and just walked over and had a reasonable dinner.

Summary Heading: Volleyball tournament at Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: Our club volleyball team has stayed at the Cortona Inn and Suites three times when participating in tournaments at the Anaheim Convention Center. You won't find a better choice for the price if you need access to the ACC. Contact Reina to book a group. She will take great care of you. The rooms are clean and have two queen sized beds. There are also suites if you need to put more than four people in a room. Hot breakfast is included and is very good. The hotel is a five minute walk to the Anaheim Convention Center!

Cortona Inn and Suites was a perfect fit for our trip.  My son was participating in a boys volleyball tournament at the Anaheim Convention Center and the location of this hotel was within comfortable walking distance.  The room was clean and well appointed.  The staff was courteous, helpful and attentive even the evening staff.  Although the Cortona Inn and Suites was not a high-end hotel, it was a very nice and enjoyable place to stay.  I would recommend it to anyone.

We stayed at this resort for our sorry family vacation to the Disney parks. The resort employees were great, nice and helpful. They do offer a shuttle bus for a small fee, it's about 1/4 away from the Disney parks. The lobby was clean and had a small gift shop located inside. The room was a king bed with a hide-a-bed in another room. 2 air conditioners and 2 televisions. Shared bathroom and separate sink that's shared as well; both were located inside the king bed room. Thru also have a microwave and fridge in one room as well as a coffee pot. The sink area had a blow dryer and a safe in the closet (keys available at the front desk). Would have liked anothwr light that was so blinding, a small vanity would have been great to do my make up inside of using the sink mirror. The

This is our 4th times in this hotel in always is excellent rooms are clean is quiet walking distance from disneyland and California adventure, customers service are very nice and helpful really enjoy highly recommended this hotel

The room was a great size for our family of 6. We had more than enough room. The walk to Disney was about 15 but the shuttle was across the road and a 5 min walk so it was perfect to either walk or shuttle. The shuttle was also free. There was a good choice of hot or cold items for the continental breakfast. The fridges were the full size bar fridge and not the tiny ones that dont fit anything in them. The staff was EXTREMELY helpful. Being our first time they helped us with purchasing tickets right there in the lobby and explained the details of every pass.  There were great food  within 5 mins walking distance. We would definetely stay here again.

Really enjoyed our stay here. The room was great very neat and big. Disneyland is about a 15 minute walk or you can use  the ART System.  Would have given 5 but we were on the first floor and it sounded like a soccer team was above us. Even with the noise I would stay here and reccomend thus hotel.

We wanted a hotel within walking distance of Disneyland.  It was a long walk to the park, but it was not difficult.  The room was clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly.  The continental breakfast was great for starting the day.  We would stay again.

We enjoyed our stay at the Cortona Inn.  It was very inexpensive and the amenities were great.  The staff was friendly, outgoing, and very helpful  Daily shuttle passes to and from Disneyland were purchased in the main lobby of the hotel and allowed for daily unlimited round trip transportation to and from the park.  Price was something like $2 per child and $5 per adult.    The continental breakfast was great.  It included a variety of cereals, eggs, sausage patties, potatoes, English muffins, toast, coffee, milk, waffles...I could go on and on.  Breakfast ran from 6:30 to 9:30.  The dining area is not the largest, so if you want to sit down and eat you may want to get there early.  Or you can always bring the food to your room.   The rooms were well kept and free of funny

This was our 3rd time staying at the Red Lion and again everything was awesome!!! They have a bar in the lobby, breakfast is really good and plenty of restaurants, stores and other bars within walking distance.

The Cortona Inn and Suites is a great value with its free parking, breakfast and prime location near the Toy Story Parking lot.   Staff was incredibly helpful at checkin and gave us all the info we needed. We were able to park onsite for free and leave our car there the next day while inside the Disneyland park, even though we were checking out. We then just walked across the street to the Toy Story parking lot and took the shuttle to the main entrance. Right there an $18 savings!   The hotel also provided a great breakfast with hot and cold options. We went very early so we weren't fighting any crowds. This breakfast probably saved us another $30 at least.   Two points that I think could be improved upon at this hotel. 1) Soundproofing. Our room was right by a staircase and I

Everything worked out great! The location is right next to the Toy Story and Friends parking lot so you don't even have to pay for parking to get to Disneyland. It's also 3 blocks away from Disneyland, so you could also walk if you wanted to. The breakfast was also good, nothing to brag about.

Summary Heading: Great value and perfect for a family vacation :)
Summary: This is our second stay at the Cortona, and once again, the employees were super nice and helpful.  They helped make our Disney Vacation very fun and the price was right!! The regular rooms are nice, and the kids suite is super fun for the kiddos.  The breakfast that is included is also great...saved us some money.

Quite affordable, stayed with family as we were visiting Disneyland. Staff were very helpful whenever I needed something. Breakfast was pretty good enjoyed that there were more options than I thought - eggs, sausage patties, selection of cereals, bread, coffee, donuts, waffles, fruit plus another dish that seemed to change daily (perhaps invest in another toaster/grill though can get busy sometimes) Also there is a gift shop in the lobby which you can find some Disney themed items cheaper than Disneyland so I would definitely recommend having a look in the store first before going to Disneyland so you know what is cheaper. Beds were VERY comfortable, though the bathrooms and decor is a little dated I would really recommend this place as staff are helpful and stay was affordable

Love the location to Disneyland parks, an easy 15 min walk to the entry up Harbor.  We asked for the 3rd floor and it was one of the most peaceful properties we have ever stayed in.  Great room size, we had 2 queens, fantastic mini frig.  The included breakfast the next morning was outstanding.  This must vary by how occupied they are as some had not been very complimentary in their reviews but I think they were full when we were there, super great staff at reception and breakfast,.  They refilled food as quick as it went, everything was terrific- our stay they had eggs, sausage patties, potatoes, apples, oranges, cereals, toast and pastries.  We were happy with just a little something and could not believe the spread.  Also appreciated the Disney cartoons they had on while we

Staff were very helpful and friendly, family room was great for family needing lots of space, beds were very comfortable (pillows are awful) distance from Disney didn't bother us (2 teens happy to explore shops to and from) but quite a walk with littlies after a big day at Disney.

Prime location and under $100 a night in Anaheim? I wasn't expecting much but Cortona was a pleasant surprise. A very short walk to the convention center where I was working and about 3 miles from Disneyland. VERY family friendly (families with lots of kids) so the squeals start early in the day.  The rooms were basic but clean and well laid out. A breakfast is included and the cafeteria can get crowded fast. It's the bare minimum of eggs and potatoes and the kids all went for the donut selection. Staff was friendly and seemed eager to help with Disney tickets and transportation. I give them high marks for affordability and service.

The Hotel is in a great location and the outside looks fine.  But once you open the door all the positives leave.  The room itself is not very clean and everything is old and run down.  On the bright side the pricing is not too bad for the area so I guess you get what you pay for.     The pictures on the wed DO NOT reflect the rooms at all

Summary Heading: It was a nice stay at your hotel, and will try to book another stay next year.
Summary: Location was a good walk from Disney resort, and me and the wife did enjoy the short walk to the resort and back. I do want to say that your staff are so very good taking care of us. I do want to say that your hotel serving breakfast for three hours every morning was so very nice. Also I want to thank your maid for cleaning the room every day. i will recommend your hotel & suites to all my friend. Again i do want to thank your staff for doing a great job making my stay so very comfortable.

Always super friendly when we go, rooms are always clean, they look a little dated, but the comfort and the amenities make up for that, the free continental breakfast is definitely a plus, and it's delicious!

We stayed in one of the suites and it was very roomy.  The beds were very comfy although the hide-a-bed could use a makeover.  The breakfast was quite good with three hot items every day.  Very close to Disneyland although we chose to take the ART which picked us up at the end of the driveway.  The check-in staff was very friendly.  We've stayed there before and will stay there again!

Hotel is decent. Free breakfast was good and the hosts worked hard to keep it full. Don't book room 203. It's at the top of the stairs. Extremely noisy. Rooms were good and kept very clean. We required extra towels late on last night and front desk was quick to get us some. Parking lot is always full but we managed a spot. Walkable to Disneyland. Didn't use pool or hot tub.

Service was good but the room was quite dated. We went when it was still quite hot and the air conditioning was loud, as it was old, and due to this the room was either hot or cold. Beds were comfortable.

Stayed here for two nights while visiting DL. Great location- withi walking distance to many restaurants and DIsney. Room was spacious and clean. Breakfast was chaotic and mediocre variety. We ended up at IHOP I would stay here again though.

The Cortona was a good place to stay for our three night trip to Disneyland. It is within walking distance to the park, although a long walk. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The breakfast was pretty good. We would stay here again.

We had a very nice stay.  The room was ready when we got there.  The beds were very comfortable.  It was nice having an elevator too.  The breakfast was delicious too.  The staff was friendly and the room was quiet and comfortable.

I was planning a DL trip for the family. 1 week before my visit 12/16 double checked to see if they had a Suite available for my family. In looking online on "their" website found rooms at $114  for 2 queen beds DLX Room and Suites at $127. I called to see if they would give me their price online from their website. Well I was put on hold off and on for over 20 minutes, then the person who does the reservations said  "they  could not honor their price online. That I should cancel my previous reservation, and book online for the lower price." So while I asked him to hold this time. I tried to do the order online, and I went to click the reserve the rooms; the price changed to the rate I had originally booked for. I am now questioning why he put me on hold for so long? I was so

We were very pleased with our room. I requested a king size bed and we got an awesome room along with the king size bed. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the room and the bed was great not hard.

Summary Heading: Perfect for our visit to Disneyland
Summary: I'm pretty sure we've stayed in most of the hotels by Disneyland in the last 15 years. It's hard to find a place that's within walking distance, clean enough to spend a little time in ( as most of the time we are at the park), provides breakfast and free parking! The Cortona is that hotel! The room was more than adequate enough to rest our heads, the breakfast was your typical continental ( enough to get you ready to enjoy your day) and the parking was free! For the money we saved on parking and breakfast the room was basically 50 bucks a night! That's amazing! Will definitely stay here again! Thanks Cortona!

The hotel was nice, clean, friendly staff and the breakfast was great. I loved our room it was great. Will stay here again when we come to Disneyland. Also you can see the fireworks from the third floor.

The rooms were a little outdated. The W walls are paper thin you can hear everything outside and upstairs clear as day. We had a bottom floor room next to the pool and it was impossible to go to sleep at a decent hour... It sounded like a giant was jumping upstairs when they were simply walking... The lock on the door was broken and the sink was slightly clogged when we arrived and during our stay. If the hotel was priced closer to 100/night I wouldn't not have been bothered but when it costs near 200/night I would expect more.  Not worth the price.

Walking distance to Disneyland even though we took the shuttle. Rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely recommend this place to all my friends and family.

Staff was terrific .Breakfast was okay for a quick breakfast. Bed Room was small.   With 2 beds in the room there was approx. 12" between the bed and the closet and the same for the other bed and the wall. Living room had a small couch.  Still nor sure if the sheets were changed.  I pull out the sheet and blanket and the end of the bed when I sleep and when we returned to the hotel the beds were made and the sheet/blanket were still loose at the end of the bed. Elevators were a blessing even though not close to room.  All in all it was a good hotel for a short vacation.  Booked through Getawaytoday and did not call them with any complaints.

The hotel was okay. We didn't have any major issues but our room smelled weird, the wifi was terrible and the free breakfast was pretty bad. We booked online and what we were quoted online vs what we paid was completely different and much higher. We were charged a "bed tax"??? Each day that was as high as $24 a night! Like I said, our stay wasn't terrible but I feel like there was nothing that stood out that would make me stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great beds, Air Con, Eateries just around the corner and walking distance to Disneyland!
Summary: Absolutely loved our stay, breakfast is great and complimentary. Staff were lovely, I couldn't say any more great things, loved it:) Microwave and fridge in the room, beds were amazing! Even better than our suite at the Paris in Las Vegas! Also has coin operated laundromat.

Great hotel with excellent service. Amazing  breakfast with good service. Rooms were very clean and maids did a great job going above and beyond. Would definitely stay again and recommend! Just a short walk from Disneyland, but also close to busses that can pick you up and take you.

Our room had a very odd smell that would not go away. We believed this has to do with the humidity combined with a dirty A/C unit. If the unit was kept extremely cold it would dry the room out and the smell would get better but anytime the temp raised even a little bit the odor would come back. This seemed like an issue in many rooms as the odor was present when walking by other rooms.

Summary Heading: Best sleep in a long time.
Summary: If you are staying in the area, you are probably doing a lot of something. Having a comfy place to rest vital. They have the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. I hope I can find out what they are so I can buy one. Plenty of pillows and blankets. The room is good sized and seems very clean and up to date. It could use more outlets, but that is a minor thing. The staff were friendly and helpful. The gift shop had some excellent items I purchased. I will be staying here anytime I am in the area for sure.

Summary Heading: Mother and Daughter Disneyland Birthday Surprise!
Summary: My daughter and son surprised thier little sister and myself with a trip to Disneyland for our Birthday, we also invited my husband who's never been to Disneyland before! So after many hours of walking we were all tired our first night coming back to a super comfortable bed was awesome and the Hotel was well lit! And no noise it was nice.

Summary Heading: A Ray of Sunshine in California
Summary: Tucked away next to a really nice hotel the Cortona is a nice basic hotel. The rooms are clean and quit large.  All rooms open to the outside.  Pool in parking lot.  Hot water not great at times but the staff is super nice.  Transport to the shopping and Disney close by.  Joes  crab shack andbubba gumps and roscoe waffle house and joes Italian ice within walking distance. Free breakfast is good too

Efficient check-in for starters. The free breakfast was your average "continental" style breakfast, but with more family seating than most. Parking was an issue if you arrived late in the evening as at least a half-dozen vehicles were parked in fire lanes overnight. Rooms were fair. A couple of lights did not work properly and one was never plugged in -- hopefully because the vacuum was the last thing plugged into that outlet! We paid for four adults, so we asked housekeeping for four full sets of towels each day. Fail! The air conditioning unit was noisier than most. Conveniently located across the street from the Disney Toy Story parking lot. Decent value earned the two-star rating.

Stayed the night Sun/Mon at Cortona.  Rate was very inexpensive and well worth it.  Room was clean and updated.  Check in was extremely fast and the employees were friendly.  The breakfast was pretty good and included in the stay, as well as parking.  This is the 3rd time staying at Cortona and would anticipate a 4th

Summary Heading: Good enough for what you pay for this close to Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed here a couple times while visiting Disneyland. The hotel staff is very friendly and the rooms for their part are clean though a bit dated. The room rates are quite fair for the area, but don't expect too many amenities. In fact, some of our bathroom washcloths were starting to fall apart, and for a room with 4 people, 1 or 2 cloths are not enough. We had to ask for more each day. The free breakfast is very adequate for a quick meal to start the day, though it gets rather crowded in the dining room. Parking is limited but you can use the lot for the hotel next door as well. The hotel gets points for proximity to the theme parks, within walking distance and not having to pay the prices of the Disney hotels. We'd certainly stay there again... assuming the

Summary Heading: Decent hotel for a short stay
Summary: We stayed here for three nights in late September. The breakfast was decent, not the best, but at least it was a hot meal.  The kids liked the bunk beds. Bathroom was a little small but not a big deal. Staff was very nice and friendly. Not a short walk to Disney as it may appear on a map. decent pool for the kids and the hot tub was nice. Would I stay there again? Maybe, maybe not. If you're on a budget and heading to Disney and don't plan on being in the room too much, I'd say go for it!

While not the Marriott, Hyatt, etc., it is nice enough!  Good central location.  Decent rooms but NO GYM was a bummer.  Having a refrigerator that worked well and microwave was a definite plus.  Easy access to anything I needed from Harbor Blvd.  Oh, and nice Jacuzzi, but small.  For a business traveler too many families but, hey, it's Disneyland!

We enjoyed our one night visit at Cortona. Wish we had stayed there for our whole weekend. Price was very reasonable!  Breakfast wasn't great but better than nothing!  We requested a king bed and got 2 queens and thru didn't tell us when we checked in.

Nothing like the advertising on their website. The room is plain and there were no decorations in the kids room. It was pain white bedding, no pictures, no characters, no color, no kids table...just a regular bunk bed with white sheets. The room smelled like mildew from the air conditioner.

Very friendly and helpful staff, nice breakfast, excellent value for money.  We stayed here for 6 nights and really cant fault the place.  We wanted a place close to disneyland without costing a fortune and were very happy with Cortona Inn and Suites.

For being within walking distance of Disneyland, it was great for the price. Friendly staff, hot breakfast, and pretty clean. The floors could use a good detail clean. Nothing fancy, but it had all the essentials.

We booked online and took advantage of their discounted Disneyland tickets, which we were able to pick up early in the day, even though we couldn't check in until after 3 pm. We were also offered to eat at the continental breakfast even though we weren't checked in. This was great since we drove overnight and got to the hotel around 7:15am.   When we did check in, the staff was extremely helpful in letting us know where everything was. Our room and bathroom were clean. We had a 2 queen bed room for 2 adults and 2 children. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. We didn't use the microwave or tv, but the mini fridge worked well. The air conditioner worked really well, but was a little loud. There was ample parking, and 1 car is free for your entire stay, with in and out

Pictures can be deceiving. The pictures on their website are beautiful but that was not the case in our room. It smelled like there was mold in our room, very musty smelling. The carpet was so dirty that my children's feet were black at the end of the night (it didn't look dirty but it was). Pillows were very lumpy and pretty flat. Location was nice and so were the staff but I wouldn't stay there again. We stayed 4 nights and if we hadn't pre paid, I probably would have gone elsewhere after night 1.

We stayed here two nights while visiting Disneyland, it was within walking distance of the park (about 10 minutes depending on pace) and would highly recommend!  The room was very clean and had all amenities you would expect with a VERY comfy bed!  Breakfast was buffet style with plenty of choice and all staff were friendly and efficient.  Great stay and would go back if in the area!

Nice hotel located close to Disney.  Our room was clean & comfy, with a separate bedroom with bunk beds for the our daughter which she thought was "pretty cool".  We only stayed one night, breakfast was ok but there are IHOP's & Denny's nearby if you want more than toast, cereal & coffee.  The hot buffet option is pretty limited in choice, but it wasn't a big deal & we didn't go hungry.    The pool was welcoming after a day walking round Disney, and great to cool off in.  Plenty of car parking spaces were available during our stay, and the hotel staff were friendly.  The room safe is not electronic, you get the key from reception.

Our family had a great time at the Cortona Inn. Walking distance to Disney even with  7 year old in tow. Clean rooms and helpful staff. Rooms are a bit noisy but after a busy day who would notice. We enjoyed our stay.

Rooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable. Microwave and refrigerator in the rooms. Convenient location to Disneyland and to resort parking. Breakfast was included which was a plus! Would stay again!

Place was nice. Comfy beds and rooms were clean. Free breakfast was convenient for on the go, however I really wish they would switch to paper plates and cups. Styrofoam is so old school and not environmental friendly. I understand it's less expensive but would be nice to see that small switch.

Family's first trip to Disneyland, had a great time and no issues with the stay. I have been places where my wife is constantly bugging me to call for something we did not get or have. Not here, room was clean every night we got back and enough towels for the 4 of us.

Summary Heading: Free parking, free breakfast and close to Disneyland....  What!
Summary: I enjoy Cortona.  This place beats others because they have free wifi, refrigerator and microwave in room,gated parking, breakfast  and great service.   free I love the front desk lady Ericka she was fast check in, professional and genuinely nice.  Disney hotel doesn't even have a iron or a microwave in there room and they charge about 375 a night.

We're Disney Annual Passholders, and we've stayed at five different good neighbor hotels.  Cortona has excellent value for being so close to Disneyland.  Nice 3-story hotel next to the Clarion and Hyatt with ample gated parking.  Rooms were nice; we had two queens.  Clean bathroom, mini-fridge, TV, and free WIFI... and free breakfast which included sausage, eggs, waffles, muffins, juices and coffee - nice!  You can walk (4/10 mile) to Disneyland (but we walked over to the Disney Toy Story parking lot and caught free shuttle in).  Regular Anaheim ART shuttle (pay) stops right in front of hotel too.  We'll be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Good value for the money to get to Conventoin Center
Summary: Booked a king suite room for the week during a trade show at the nearby Anaheim Convention Center. Price was about half or 2/3 of what the nearby chain hotels were offering, many without breakfast included. My room was clean and reasonably spacious, with a king size bed and a pullout sofa sleeper in the adjoining living area. Had a mini fridge and microwave in the room, and bathroom was adequate but not spectacular. The lavatory sink was in the bedroom with the king bed, so guests sleeping on the sleeper sofa would not be able to use the sink without going into the private bedroom, but the toilet and shower were separate. If you're looking for a good business hotel, this isn't it, with limited business amenities and no on-site dining other than breakfast. Speaking of which, the

This place exceeded my expectations. I booked a double room solely due and proximity to Disneyland. What we discovered was a moderate sized hotels will all the amenities of a larger more expensive chain.  The room was very clean, pool was well-maintained and the breakfast was great. I considered the walk to the Disneyland entrance short, with the main Disneyland entrance on the same road (Harbor) as the Cortona. With all that said, the front desk was extremely nice. Maybe because we're a short walk to the Happiest Place on Earth... but the folks working there were all smiles.

I stayed in Cortona Inn for two nights because of business, I received the best attention, the breakfast was very good and they can save your belongings for the last and the first day, before and after the check in. They have bus and Disneyland park tickets available.  The location is very good and you can go walking to so many places. They have all the information available to know the area. I really liked this place, widely recommended.

We went for a quick weekend. We had an event at the convention center and wanted to be close to it (no car).  It was under 10 minutes to walk to the convention center which was great. The hotel staff were very personable and helpful. The hot breakfast was fine and the serving and eating area were very clean and neat.  The rooms were clean and there was very little outside noise.  I would recommend this hotel if you wanted to be near either the convention center or Disneyland.  It was very safe to be walking in that area after dark.

The hotel is located around safe areas. It is great place for family, and near to walk to Disneyland Parks. The rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable and breakfast is free. It is enjoyable place to rest. It is quiet and safe.

I loved it. It was comfortable and the breakfast was the basic but it made my morning.. only thing was it has a smell like if the rooms are always closed.. But other then that our family loved the stay.

Beds were comfortable.  Room was good sized. Appeared clean. Somewhat musty smell but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room.  Breakfast was okay and I ate there 3 of the 4 mornings before conferences.  It was economical.  Would have liked longer pool hours.  Never got to the pool/hot tub because it was closed by the time my day/evening was over.  It was in easy walking distance of the Convention Center. Would stay again if necessary.

Had a blast at Cortona, just down the road from Disney land and close to reastraunts, Walmart target outlets on orange etc. lovely staff, good room servicing and choice as pool and spa! Free parking also a great bonus!! The breakfast was very nice too good range to choose from.  Thanks heaps

We stayed there for a trip to Disneyland. We stay there for 6 nights. Originally, I only had 5 nights booked. They were great to work with me to stay the extra night. The breakfast was good all the mornings and they had a variety of foods. When we first got to our room they had a "thank you" card in the room. Which I thought was a nice touch. We had 4 kids, and 2 adults, the room I stayed in was nice an large with 2 tvs. I'd stay again and would recommend this place to friends.

Stayed here for the first time Sept 21/23 2016. The room was clean , the hotel was convenient to Disneyland and the price was  well within our budget. Add free parking and a decent breakfast it was a win- win all around . Will be back for sure.

This was my 3rd stay at the hotel. I've tried different hotels in the area & my family & I prefer this one. The price is right & the hotel is clean. Since we're AP holders we'll  be staying here again.

This was our second time staying here and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Disney and wants the best of everything for an excellent price. The staff was very friendly. We arrive at 730am, parked, left our car/luggage and spent the day at Disney. Our clean, cozy  room was ready on the first floor as I had requested. We enjoyed a few hours at the pool that night and slept comfortably. We enjoyed a nice breakfast of eggs, sausage, potatoes, pancakes, breads/cereals, juices, fruit and coffee before we checked out and spent another day at Disney. It's about two large blocks to Disney but we enjoyed the walk. You can also get a bus pass to shuttle to the park.

We booked in for 4 nights,3 adults and 2 children  we couldnt check out fast enough, the smell as soon as we walked in,the window in the bedroom was loose, no security screens or locks on the windows, the whole unit is old out dated smelly carpet and just not inviting.

We stay at this Hotel often because of the price, location, free Breakfast, comfy Beds and sink area outside the bathroom has enough room for 4 woman to get ready!! :) Location is nice because you can walk across the street to the Toy Story parking lot and catch their bus!! They have tons so it's not like your taking someones spot, and they never say anything to you about walking in we've done it a lot.   Only thing I don't like about the hotel is the doors for entry on the outside. Sometimes I don't feel to safe if it's just with the girls. One time they gave us the room by the stairs and the air conditioning unit was coming off the wall and somebody was smoking weed outside and you could smell it in the room, so don't get the room by the stairs!!     One time my car broke down

Staff was so unprofessional ! Lady at the front desk told us one story next night we get locked out our hotel when the lady had an arrangement for us, so we then talk to another guy at the front desk and told us we had to pay, when telling him we couldn't he insisted that we had to give him something, we obviously didn't have nothing if all of our stuff was locked in, so we decided to just leave we then told him well we want our stuff from the room he first asked how long I said an hour then he told me NO I'll give you 30 minutes ! Do not recommend it here

First floor room had bugs on the comforters in the evening, probably from the shrubs that lined the sidewalk directly in front of the doors. Got moved to a suite upstairs, was very clean but not enough mirrors around the rooms for multiple people to get ready in the morning & don't plan on using the sofa sleeper because the mattress is very thin & lumpy. Kids were also running up & down the hallway screaming and playing late at night and early in the morning. I love kids but if your looking for a good nights sleep you might not find it here. On the upside staff was extremely friendly & very helpful.

Our stay was "okay". We really only slept there and had a few breakfasts. Our room smelled musty and like chlorine. It was like they had just used chemicals to clean mold. The bathroom hinges squeaked badly. It woke everyone up every time they used the restroom. 2 sets of bunk beds would have been nice since there was plenty of room for it. The pull out couch was old and the mattress was very thin. If we were spending more time in our room or were there longer, we would have switched hotels.

Summary Heading: Stay was good, but it was smelly
Summary: Location is nice location and easy accessible to Disney land, We liked the stay, but as soon as we enter room was stinking due to no proper ventilation. AC's power was very less, but i liked breakfast, I suggest management to make it pleasant with good smell.

My friend and I were running in the Disneyland marathon and stayed 1 night. When we first opened the door, the room smelt very much like mildew and was musty... We left the fan/ac on thinking it would get better but it didn't. And there was a blood stain on the sheet on the bed. Kinda gross... Other than that it was ok. I liked the mini fridge and the mini microwave. The location was walking distance to Disneyland and the shuttle stop was right out on the street. The parking was free and that was nice. Would stay here again but will double check the sheets next time 😟

I liked the fact that it was close to the Convention Center where we had the SCRC Convention, we will choose you again next year for this yearly Catholic Convention of Charismatic Renewal.  We were happy with the room itself, the service, parking fee and breakfast includes was great!

Was in the top floor standard room for 5 nights for a conference in the convention centre. location for me was fantastic with a very short hop across the parking lots to reach my venue. the room was good in size, not so much in amenities - microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator were available. The refrigerator was not working - i did not need it so I did not raise the matter. However I needed a water kettle instead of the coffee maker and was provided with one. Everything is based on use and throw - included the pasticware cups and glasses provided in the room and the breakfast (which was self-service) and included in the room rent. The breakfast spread was okay, with some options for vegetarians. All in all I liked the place - the staff was courteous and responsive - I had

The staff were very nice...very. But, when we first checked into our room, the room looked nothing like the picture and the floors were soaking wet.  We immediately went back to the front desk where they gave us adjoining rooms.  These rooms were cleaner but they still had an odor.   The bathrooms are in need of repair, peeling paint and mold in the shower.  The breakfast was free which I shouldn't complain about, but honestly, it was gross. We had to use the elevator to the 2nd floor because we had someone with us that couldn't use the stairs, and even the elevator was gross...filthy dirty and smelly. The location was convenient to Disney which was all we really needed.  Most of the hotels looked old and run down in the area and ours was no exception.  If we head cross country

First of all the staff are really friendly.  The room we were given had no hot water in the sink.  Maintenance showed up and said they should be able to fix it the next day.  As we were out all day the next day it seemed ok.  As we returned, we found that we still had no hot water.  Shortly after talking with the front desk, we were told that we would have to change rooms in order to repair the problem.  They did upgrade us to a room with a kids room, however the extra room was not a big deal to us.

This is a motel, which was convenient for us, since we were on a road trip and appreciated the easy access to our car. The room was comfortable for 2 adults and 2 kids, but AC was noisy. Walkable 15-20 min. distance to Disneyland, no problem in the morning but tiring at the end of the day. Hot breakfast was fine, if a bit basic. We would have appreciated bagels and yogurt or cheese. We didn't use the pool, but it looked small.

Everything was great except for the ac not cooling enough so the room was kind of hot. The breakfast was wonderful. A lot of options to choose from. The parking was close to the room and secure. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a comfortable stay at an affordable price.

we stayed for 5 nights. very close to the Toy Story parking lot for a free shuttle to Disneyland. which was great. breakfast was good would be nice not to eat on Styrofoam plates..such alot of garbage.. food was fine but would like maybe more fruit selection and yogurt. but great to have it available. The staff are very friendly and helpful help to get a shuttle to Universal Studios for myself or my daughter. would stay again next time we visit Disneyland. thanks mom and daughter from  surrey bc canada

Excellent staff at the front desk, good breakfasts in the morning although more variety and belgian waffles would be great! I didn't like the door opening to the outside though especially when traveling with my family.

Good location and area lots of space in the rooms. Had a pool but we did not use it. Breakfast was served every morning. Parking was tight and didn't have enough of it. Not too far of a walk to the theme parks

The hotel was "ok" for what you pay. Likes having enough room for whole family but seemed old and run down. Location was not bad for being close to Disney 😊 Would stay again if out of options but not first choice. Hotel is same parking lot as another hotel with a nicer pool. Was discouraged when we found out that the nice pool wasn't for us to use 😏

Summary Heading: Great Hotel just a short walk to the Park!
Summary: We normally stay here when we visit Disneyland. Its a short walk to the park and the ART stop is right in front of the hotel. The staff is very courteous and attentive. The Family rooms are very convenient with a king bed, pull out sofa and bunk beds.  Love the Hot breakfast and good coffee.

Very nice hotel! I have stayed at a few other hotels around here and Cortona Inn & Suites became my favorite. The room was clean and appeared to be kept up with compared to the other hotels I have stayed in  the past. The price was also on the lower side of the spectrum which is obviously a plus! Liz among the other staff that I have encountered have all gone way above and beyond their jobs to ensure I enjoyed my stay. Thank you for making me and my family feel welcomed! We will definitely be back!

Water was very smelly, but service and friendliness of staff was top notch!  The hotel needs a gym.  Continental breakfast should be improved for selections and quality.  Front Desk staff were very accommodating.  Especially Bruno!!

Went here for a vacation in June and intended to stay for a full week. Booked online but made several calls to ask questions before booking in to a room. Was lied to on practically every account. I feel like they told me what I wanted to hear to get me to book. The room was not big enough despite assurances that it would have plenty of sleeping space. When I arrived they overcharged me by almost $300 which I had to fight tooth and nail to get refunded. The room was dirty and in need of updating and had a faint smell of cigarette smoke. The mini fridge did not work, but they did fix it. The iron didn't work. There was 3 outlets in the entire room, but evidence there used to be more. The water pressure in the jetted tub was so low it took an hour to fill. Not nearly enough parking

The hotel rooms can use updating. More parking needs to be available and the breakfast needs more options. The pictures look better that reality. Not worth the $ spent. The good thing was that it was close to the entrance of Disneyland.

Stayed in room 140 a kids suite with 3 adults & 2 kids. All beds comfy & good amount of space but we were only in room to sleep & shower. There was an obvious smell of mold and upon closer inspection there was mold underneath the wallpaper in the bathroom. The bathroom was also tiny compared to the size of the room. Breakfast was good staff was pleasant. I would stay again but ask for a different room & hope it is mold free otherwise it seemed pretty basic but clean.

Stayed in the family room. Positives: roomy enough for everyone, nice and clean, front desk staff very nice, breakfast was good. Negatives: no shuttle to Disneyland, housecleaners doing the room were VERY unfriendly, pretty rude, in fact. Overall very good experience.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay as a family with the Jr Suite
Summary: Location was great. Breakfast was good and had plenty. Different every day. Close to Disneyland, restaurants and shopping.  Stayed in the Jr suite and it was great size bigger than the main room.  We had 5 adults and twin girls that will be 2. 2 mini cribs in the main room and 3 adults slept on the bunk beds and sofa bed.

Summary Heading: Reasonable rooms but very poor Wi-Fi, poor service
Summary: I had some difficulty verifying that my order was correct on their reservation website before submitting it. And, despite being careful, it resulted in duplicate reservations (except part of it was under one name and part of it was under the name of another person in our party---who never reserved a room). Thankfully, they fixed the problem and didn't charge us for the incorrect reservation.  We arrived at around 1pm, we asked if we could check-in early. The desk told us to return at 3pm for our room (the official check-in time). We had the hotel hold our bags while we explored the area. We returned at 2:40 to try to check-in again---but the room wasn't ready until exactly 3pm. While I understand that they have the official check-in time for a reason, Cortona was the first hotel

Summary Heading: This is an excellent place to stay on a family vacation
Summary: We selected this hotel after extensive research. It had all the amenities we wanted with the exception of a gym. The kids suite was great - two rooms and one bathroom. This hotel is a good location near the convention center and Disney.

The hotel was near Disneyland which was a plus. The hotel room was separated with a door to the other room which had a pull out sofa bed and a bunk bed which was nice. The front room had a king size bed but the only think was that you could everything going on outside the room (suit cases rolling, people talking, etc.). The bed was comfy. The parking was horrible. I came back to the hotel at 11:00 p.m. and all of the parking was filled. I had to ask the valet at the Hyatt Place next door if I could park in their parking, which they were happy to let me do. Overall, it was okay.

This is the second time at the Cortona. Friendly helpful staff. Location was great as it is a short bus ride on the ART to Disneyland.  Room was clean and had everything we needed. The pool was nice and clean. King bed was super comfortable. There is a Target close by if you need to by snacks and drinks at a reasonable price.

Room was clean. Given an upgraded spa suite at check in at no extra charge b/c it was ready before the room I booked. Front desk reception - professional, cheerful. My 15-year old son and I (age 47, relatively good health) had no problem walking to and from Disneyland (.8mi one way) twice in one day. That's about a 5k :) Breakfast is above average and filling.

Summary Heading: Don't pick this hotel if you want an easy walk to Disneyland
Summary: Do pick this hotel if you want a clean affordable room for a big family! We had two families in the kids family suite w bunks. The sofa bed was awesome and they gave us a rollaway bed (extra charge). Invest in the ART pass though (you can find a kids ride free coupon on visitanaheim.org). It's a long long walk after all the park walking. Also one free car per room. Others are $14.99 per night.

I wholeheartedly understand that any review good or bad about any of the resort hotels/motels around the Disneyland parks area is almost counter productive. Based solely on the location of these places, they are able to take advantage of booking every if not nearly every room and nearly every night of the year.   I do take issue with this however as it allows the establishment owners and their representatives and employees to slack on everything from service to cleanliness and everything in between.   As the guest on the other end of this equation, when I shell out a large chunk of my yearly income to book a resort hotel that is only 2 blocks from the gates to Disneyland, I have a few expectations of the place before I ever arrive. When those expectations are not only not met

0.9 mile walk to Disney- forget public transportation- not needed. We bought ART passes to ride to Disney, but can walk there faster most of the time so wont do that again. This is our third stay here for Disney and the staff is excellent. Our room was not available at check-in and got upgraded for free! No questions asked. Excellent breakfast. Recommended.

We came to the Cortona for a volleyball tournament for a week.  The room was very clean, staff extremely helpful.  Only thing that needs to change is the parking lot, no room to park if you come back to your room after 8:00pm.  Overall great stay!

This is great location for a quick stay at Disneyland. It's close enough to walk to the park to avoid the additional parking fees. Overall the rooms were exactly as represented the website and definitely comfortable and clean.  The lobby staff were very polite and efficient at both arrival and departure and the continental breakfast was pretty substantial with a number of different options.   The downside is that we were assigned a room on the second floor in a corner between 2 halls and the stairs were right outside of our door, so we could clearly hear everything that was being said in both hallways and hears every step as people went up and down the stairs. That being the case we didn't really get restful sleep as the noise kept waking us up.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel for quick weekend getaway to Disney!
Summary: The room was really clean, so no complaints on that! The one aspect of this hotel that kind of annoyed my bf and I was the fact that we barely could find a parking spot..there needs to be something done about how many cars per room are to be allowed..since the parking area is very tiny for this hotel. Overall, we did enjoy our stay and how convenient it was, to be close to Disney and other attractions!

We came to the Cortona and stayed for a week while visiting Disneyland. While staying our kids enjoyed having their own private area to themselves for a little rest and relaxation. We also took advantage of the pool and the breakfast that was offered. We would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends. Thanks and see you next time!

If you are planning a Disney Vacation on a dime, this place is perfect. It covers everything I look for when planning a Disney trip on a tight budget. Reasonably priced, Close to Disney, clean rooms, comfortable beds, free parking, free breakfast. The location is very close to Disney. You can walk there, or cross the street and hop on a free Disney shuttle at the Toy Story parking lot. We walked to Disney in the morning and took the shuttle back. The hotel is tucked in between other hotels and a little bit away from the busy road. That was nice because you couldn't hear any traffic. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The front lobby was clean and looked recently remodeled. It had a cute little gift shop inside. Our room was clean and looked recently remodeled. The

We stayed here for two nights while visiting Disneyland. The rooms look nice and it is very economical but know that ALL of the rooms in the hotel smell musty. So much so that after we left and went to the next hotel on our vacation my luggage and all of the clothing and it smelled musty and needed to be aired out. When I walked in the first room it definitely had a smell. The person at the front desk told me all of the rooms were like that. They offered Febreeze which should tell you something right there So if this sort of thing bothers you with allergies or asthma I recommend choosing a different hotel. I wish I would have known

It's just the right place to go for any convention. Located very near the convention center, it's practical at any time, and your friends will love you if they need to drop some of their belongings somewhere for the day!

Room was clean, staff was friendly, service was great, breakfast was good.  Towels not too soft, but overall, I have no complaints.  We stayed here for Vidcon at the Anaheim Convention Center and it was very convenient and easy to walk there.  Thanks for a nice stay!

2 room kids suite, Room worked well for kids with bunkbed and pullout bed. Bath room door painted did not close.  Room overall was okay. Across the street from Disney iverflow parking. Breakfast, not so good. Cherrios Cereal had no taste. Bland eggs, waffles. So hoohum. Day 2, when too dennys. Then cocos. Overall, it was okay. Private parking. But if you have kids, this room should be considered.

I have commend the staff of Cortona Suite, after a bad experience with Hotwire. Daniel at the front desk, as well as the Manager made very effort to resolve an issue that obviously not their fault, by reducing my cost, even though Hotwire made a reservation mistake. Manager explained to staff to accommodate us in every way. Rooms were very comfortable, the continental breakfast was excellent, and the hospitality staff worked effortlessly to please all their guest. 2 thumbs up, to all of them.

Our stay was fine. It was clean, but definitely well used. and The staff was very friendly and helpful. I thought my bed was uncomfortable, some of the lights didn't work and the wifi was horrible. We avoided the hot breakfast since it didn't look very inviting. But they did have quick grab options that we opted for (fruit, yogurt, donuts).  We used ART to get to Disneyland and caught it at the Clarion right next door. They stop every 15-20 min and it takes you right to the gate. This eliminated waiting for hotel shuttles. Not sure if I'd stay again since it needs some work, but it served its purpose.

Summary Heading: SMELLY dirty hotel CORTONA INN and Suites
Summary: The worst dump ever, this hotel should be comdemed, The room smelled moldy , smelled like something died , carpet furniture a disgrace, completely avoid this hell hole, maybe the hotel will be knocked down

Noise was loud and started early on the sidewalks just outside the doors. Breakfast was poor and often the food was out. Beds were ok and the room was for a good size. They did not tell us we could walk across the street to a free shuttle service, they only told us of paid services.

Summary Heading: Good for what we needed it for
Summary: The staff was friendly. The continental breakfast was more than what we anticipated; food wise. The room we had was a king suite and it did the job for what we needed to do. Check in was at 3 PM which in my opinion is horrible for a hotel close to an amusement park. But check in time was the only fault.

Very friendly staff! Free breakfast was okay, nothing fancy but helped with the food budget. Bed was comfy. Free wi-fi for unlimited devices. Free parking (but must be validated). Military discount. Tuscana room offered a bit of privacy from kids. Room was equipped with a small fridge and microwave, again helping with food budget.  A bit far from DIsneyland but you can purchase bus tickets to and from, just ask front desk. Motel 6 feeling.   During our stay, we did notice a couple vehicles just parked in red zones, one of which actually blocked us in. We called the front desk and it was immediately moved, however the very next day the same vehicle was parked in another red zone. Another vehicle was parked in a red zone for days. If it does not matter, why paint the curb red?

Our room was clean and comfortable.  We were within easy walking distance to Disneyland and the convention center, as well as plenty of restaurants.  Breakfast was decent and staff was friendly.  Would definitely stay again.

It was great for what our family needed! We really liked their continental breakfast too! We got a cab to Disneyland that was around $10, but it was totally worth it when you and your family are tired.

Fantastic value for the room.  Have stayed over the years in many hotels along harbor for our annual Disney vaca hotel and this one far exceeded my expectations. Staff were very courteous and responsive to any concerns. Housekeeping were very helpful as well.  At one point our room a/c was emitting a mildew type oder and I asked for the filter to be changed and came back that evening to a brand new unit! That's what I call customer service.  Very much appreciated and unexpected. Underground parking is a plus and a nice perk. Hard to find a hotel now close to Disney without insane parking charges added to the total cost and that also will allow parking past noon on day of checkout in order to take advantage of one more afternoon at the parks. Our first time staying here and it

Nice property. Clean, great staff, good breakfast. About mile walk to Disneyland, but also have option of the ART shuttle stop at hotel next door. Only issue we had was the location of our room. We were next to the guest laundry, elevator and ice machine. Was quite noisy. We would have asked to switch, but were with family and needed to remain close to them. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to Family and Friends.

My daughter and I stayed at the Cortona for our last Disneyland trip. It was clean, quiet, beds very comfortable and we loved the heated pool and hot tub. The breakfast had good options. We loved that it was walking distance to Disneyland or we could take the ART bus that stopped near the hotel. We will definitely stay again!

Staff are Wonderful! They take care of your every wish right away! Room was Wonderful. The beds were beyond our expectations for comfort. The Breakfast Buffet is busy but good. The Staff keep it filled up with pancakes, eggs, sausages, bread for toast, yogurt, fruit, juices etc. Wonderful kick start to your Disney Morning.  Distance from Disneyland is half an hour walking.

This hotel is a good stay for the price. Beds were comfortable. Had hot water when needed.  Breakfast could include cold water. If they offered it I couldn't find it. Overall. Was a nice stay   Recommend this hotel for families.

Summary Heading: don't stay unless you have to
Summary: This room was disgusting.  They put me in a back corner on the ground floor, the window didn't even lock all the way.  There was hair in the bathtub, the outlets didn't work, the toilet didn't flush and it smelled horrible.

Summary Heading: A clean affordable and very friendly place to stay by Disneyland.
Summary: My girlfriend and I spent a week in Southern California seeing the sites. Manly interested in Disneyland and California Adventure so the Cortona Inn and Suites is in a great location. It is only a couple of blocks from both those locations.  The location is great but it's the friendly and always ready to help service that makes this small Inn a wonderful place to stay. The staff are all pleasant and eager to meet any request to make your stay enjoyable. I ended up be unexpectedly in the middle of selling a property of mine and the staff went above and beyond to help me complete that transaction. They received emails, printed documents I needed to sign and then fax those documents out for me. All with a pleased to help demeanour and at no extra cost to me for these services. I

Summary Heading: Great Place for a good price
Summary: The room was super clean and has everything we needed. Everything was in good condition and certainly would recommend the place for anyone. We picked the place by looking at the commute to Disneyland, We never took our car and for all the three days we stayed we just walked to Disneyland which was like a 15 minutes walk.

Summary Heading: Great service, family suite was perfect for a family of 5.
Summary: The room and staff were great! Beak fast was good and saved us time and money in the morning so we could head to disneyland. It wasn't really two blocks  from the park so we took ART still. The bathroom is small but not a big deal overall.

Summary Heading: Very happy with our stay at Cortona.
Summary: This was a great value.  The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean, the grounds and the pool were very nice, the cleaning staff were respectful and quiet as they worked, the continental breakfast was perfect for a quick meal before heading off to Disneyland.  It is a bit of a walk to Disneyland, especially when you are tired at the end of the day, but absolutely worth it for the great price.

Summary Heading: very nice hotel staff ,Service is excellent
Summary: Room was definitely above our expectation, Service is great , I would recommend this hotel for all my friends who visiting Disneyland in the future ,a lot of parking spaces as well and the area around the hotel had everything we needed

Esmerelda checked us in and was extremely helpful and friendly.  She set the tone for the rest of our stay. The breakfast was fine,  a little crowded. Room was comfortable and convenient to local attractions.

Our stay at Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim Resort was first greeted by the most friendly staff. Each and every time we entered the reception lobby we were always greeted with a friendly smile. Room service was exceptional and prompt. Along with our stay was a free breakfast, that was filled with a variety of choices to pick from. We appreciate housekeeping for they kept our room sparkling clean.

The bed was hard and the pillows were HORRIBLE! We ended up driving to Walmart in the middle of the night to buy new ones. Parking was an issue, no spaces even near our room.  Bring your own shampoo/conditioner (forgot mine and the hotels was super gross). Also don't stay on the bottom floor, it's loud and walls are paper thin. Room was clean, breakfast was decent and distance to Disneyland was good.

Summary Heading: Older motel but clean and great location and price
Summary: Staff was awesome and helped whenever you needed something.  The location was great you could get onto the Disney Resort Bus and for just a few $$ & get to Disneyland and the shuttles are handicapped accessible. They pick up every 20-30 minutes and go until the park closes.  The free breakfast is nice and offers more than just a continental breakfast. The free parking was a great! Buying Disneyland Tickets and Shuttle tickets was easy at the hotel.

We got in on Thursday and stayed thru Sunday for memorial weekend. Check in was fast and the rooms were really nice and clean. It is such a good distance to Disney that we were able to walk to and from the park with no issues. The beds were super comfy which was needed after a long couple days at the park.

We arrived at the hotel at 7:30am on Sunday morning of Memorial Day. We were able to do "pre check-in" to get our parking permit and leave our car there for the rest of the day while we went to Disneyland.   Free parking.  yay!   They offered the continental breakfast to us that morning which was a nice bonus but we had already eaten.   The walk to Disneyland is a little further than some other hotels but definitely still walking distance.   You will not be alone on your walk to the park!   When we got back at 10:30 at night it was a very quick check-in process.   I didn't realize that it would be a motel set up with exterior entrances but it was okay.   Rooms were very large and comfortable.  Included everything we needed.  Very clean too.   Only thing about the Cortona Inn

I had a good stay at the hotel.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  Loved the free hot breakfasts.  The free parking even after I checked out I could still leave my car for no additional charge.  Hotel was close to Disneyland.

Since this property is very close to Disneyland there is a lot of children.  On the week that we were there 70 children and chaperones were booked there.  The free breakfast form 6:30 to 9:00 was so over crowed with children that the food continued to run out.

Summary Heading: great hotel and staff, parking limited!
Summary: great hotel for the money. Rooms clean, staff were great and breakfast was definitely adequate with lots of choice for our family. Parking was a nightmare, we almost ended up on an episode of parking wars the night we arrived!!! the result was us having to park in a fire zone which I was not comfortable with even though the security guard told us to do so. If there was a fire I would hate to think of the liability should the fire truck not be able to access the building due to our vehicle blocking the way.

Drove down to DL for a quick trip....was looking for a room for a reasonable price. Cortona's rooms were very clean and the beds were super comfortable. Staff was friendly. The walk to Disneyland wasn't bad at all. I would come back and stay here again without a doubt.

I really enjoyed our stay at the Cortona. Its about a 15- 20 minute walk to Disneyland so for our family it was managable.Its also about a five minute walk to the toy story parking lot that offers a bus to Disneyland. The room was clean and comfortable. We got the king size bed with a door leading to a room with a bunk bed and a sleeper sofa. So it slept six of us comfortably and my husband an I had our privacy which was great because the kids wanted to stay up and watch tv.The only downside was the breakfast. We stayed for three days and the breakfast was about the same everyday. I wish they had offered more variety. But with the value I got I really cant complain. Overall it was a great stay for us. It was nice to come back to a clean room after a long day at Disneyland.

We booked 2 rooms, one family suite and one double queen.  Both rooms were very nice but the sofa bed in the suite was horrible.  The mattress was old and lumpy, sheets were dirty upon opening and you could feel the metal bars.  The mattresses on the bunk beds were very hard, as were the pillows.

Summary Heading: This is where we always stay
Summary: Eveything about the Cortona Inn and Suites is great!! We already have our next trip booked for October. I definitely would recommend the Cortona. Give them a try and you will not be disappointed. Free breakfast too

Summary Heading: Good hotel at a decent price, in a good location.
Summary: Overall, a nice hotel. Really great location, not too far from the Disney parks, easy access to transportation, right in the convention district. The kids' suites are really nice in that they have the bunk beds as well as a pull out sleeper sofa and a king in a separate room. Breakfast buffet is included, which is really nice and was pretty darn tasty. The hotel amenities could use a little updating, and it might be worth trying to figure out if you can get a second bathroom (at least quarter bath, toilet and sink) into those suites.

Stayed at the Cortona Inn and suites for 4 nights. The Hotel is a Disney Good neighbour hotel. Beds were really comfy, and the room was clean and quiet. Staff was friendly, and the free breakfast was very good. Pool was nice and  clean and towels were provided at the pool. Would stay here again.

We spent 9 nights at the Cortona Inn and Suites and loved every moment of it! My husband and I traveled from New Zealand for our honeymoon, making Disneyland one of the main attractions. We booked this hotel with our travel agent and began our planning of the trip. We arrived after midnight and was greeted by a lovely man who made me feel at ease after our big day of flying in and out of states. We were given our card and went up to the top floor to our room. The next day we took stock of where we were and was very happy with the room. The bed was super comfy and the pillows were great too. The shower was powerful, the whole place looked good in our books. The breakfast was well laid out, and I loved the fact that Mickey Mouse cartoons were playing on the TV. There was certainly

We arrived early and left our car. Although we had already eaten the friendly staff said we were welcome to eat breakfast! We left our bags in the storage and walked to Disneyland. It wasn't a far walk, just two long blocks.  We took the Disney shuttle on the way back and just had to cross the street to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel at 10 we were again welcomed, got our key and enjoyed a very peaceful sleep. The room was very clean and comfortable.  The breakfast in the morning was perfect. It had sausage, hard boiled eggs and eggs in a round shape. I made an egg sandwich with two waffles. There was also nice pieces of fruit, cereals, donuts, yogurts, and juices. We checked out and left our car until we returned that night. I would recommend this hotel to anymore who

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for your Disney vacation
Summary: We selected this hotel for our daughter's first trip to Disney.  We were impressed with the friendliness of front desk staff and hotel maintenance workers.  Our room was clean and well-kept. The breakfast provided each morning from 6:30 am to 9:30 am was delicious and had a nice variety of items.  There was both hot and cold items on the menu and a fresh fruit available.  We were about three blocks from the Disneyland entrance and were able to walk it without any trouble.  The pool was adequate size but could have been cleaner.
