My friend pulled out two dirty bandaids and a hair elastic while we were swimming.  There is a small hot tub which is often crowded with adults and small children.  Overall we were pleased with our experience at this hotel and would rebook if we were to

We were quite satisfied with Cortona on our trip in May 2016. We had 2 adults and 3 kids in our room so it was a little tight but room enough for our youngest to sleep on an air mattress on the floor. The beds were super comfortable and we all slept very well after long days at Disney. I also was impressed with the shower. It had good pressure which was a welcome surprise. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. And the free breakfast was terrific for being free. Each morning offered eggs, sausage, potatoes, cereal, danishes and donuts, toast, juice, and fresh whole fruit. The Cortona is a bit far from the park to walk with kids (1 mile to the gate) however, the Disneyland owned Toy Story parking lot is right across the street (Harbor) and we just went there and hopped on

This was a decent hotel with a pool, and hot tub and free breakfast.  Short walk to Disneyland.  Free parking for hotel guests.  Our room had two queen beds and a full pull out sofa bed.  Great for our family of 5.

We stayed two nights while on a quick trip to Disneyland. We were impressed with the Clean rooms and courtesy of the staff. They have free parking for guest and an in room safe to store all your valuables. And it was a short walk to Disneyland which was a huge plus. We will definitely be staying there again.

We booked this hotel before we checked into one of the Dismey properties, should have just booked another night with Disney. Check in was easy, everyone was friendly. Got into our room, 144, and it was a different story. The pictures that you see on the website are totally staged. First thing the door between the two rooms was open. I could not get them to line up to lock, had to call for help.  The plug behind the desk did not work. I took apart the couch for the kids to sleep and noticed a ink stain, no big deal. Our bed was comfy. Checked out, I was checking my bank account and noticed a $50 charge from cortana inn. I then checked emails and there was a email telling me they were charging for ink on the couch! After getting very upset with the staff I was refunded the $50,

Summary Heading: Good price and fairly close to Disneyland
Summary: The rooms were clean,comfortable, and more quiet than other motels I've stayed at. The breakfast was average, nothing spectacular but it fed us. The staff was really nice and helpful. It is walking distance to disneyland and some restaurants, but it does seem far on the way back after a day of walking through disneyland. Overall, a good hotel if you don't mind the walking.

My boyfriend, our best friend, and I selected the Cortona Inn & Suites for our Disneyland trip.  The room was comfortable and just what we needed. PLENTY of great spots to eat within walking/short driving distance. (And a lot of those places deliver!)  Front desk clerks Elizabeth and Ruth were really friendly and helpful during our stay.   Parking situation kind of sucks, but overall a good stay!

The breakfast has been upgraded since last year.  Hot eggs, potatoes or pancakes and sausage; cereal, toaster waffles as before.  The apples and oranges were really excellent.    Our mini-suite was right near an adjoining hotel but we couldn't even hear the kids playing in the pool on the other side of the wall.  Wish the bathroom had been a bit bigger though.

Always a pleasure and never had a problem with this place. Always have modern things unlike other places that might have a few things. I stay multiple times a year here. I am a Disneyland pass holder and love how close to the park it is.

The hotel was mostly convenient to Disney park but further than I expected. The room we had was behind the staircase and offered no view at all! Terrible room location and musty smell upon entry. Ok after spraying room with Lysol and turning on air for circulation. We arrived very late (after 10pm) and if I had been staying more than a single night I would have requested another room.  The main lobby area and breakfast room were good. The frontdesk staff was very pleasant and more than accommodating.  The breakfast was wonderful: many choices and well supplied. Staff returned constantly to keep up with demand. Room was filled with guests (almost every table taken) and food never ran out.

I was disappointed there was no door between the living area and bedroom. The room was dark and dated and overpriced. We were next to the elevator that sounded like a leaf blower while trying to put the kids to bed. The pictures did not match the room.

Very friendly staff and great location to the Anaheim Convention Center.  It was a wonderful discovery with the expensive Hilton and Marriott nearby. I would happily stay there next year.  They even upgraded me to a larger room for free.

Very close to Disney, we chose to drive still though so we had our car ready to go instead of waiting for a bus to pick us up/drop us off there or walking after being tired. Breakfast was expected, nothing special. Best to wake up early so that you don't have to deal with the crowds in the breakfast room. We were amazingly upgraded rooms, fantastic service on their part. We booked a regular king room and were upgraded to a spa suite for the 6 nights we were staying. Parking was difficult in the evenings. There was not enough space for all the cars, so people ended up parking in the fire lanes because there simply was no where else to go. One con we had with our room is that housekeeping could have been better. There were dusty cobwebs in the corners of the room that weren't

We were upgraded for free when our original choice was not available. Parking was free, unlike Red Lion. Breakfast was ok--nothing special, honestly you have to beat the crowd it seems. Clean, good location. I liked that it had a lot of kids and a swimming pool--very family friendly for our toddler. Some hotels can be shady, but this one was full of children and made it all the more pleasant for a Disneyland vacation. Except the jumping and running that woke us up--but, that's life.

Good value for price - room (suite) layout is fantastic - separate bedroom to allow for early risers to get up and enjoy the morning without disturbing the rest of your party. Breakfast is good - better than adequate, not fantastic - would be great to see more fruit options - good hot options (pancakes/hashbrowns/sausage/biscuits/gravy) OK location - would not classify this property as ideal walking distance to Parks.  At least 20 min and in hot weather not appropriate for little ones, tired guests.  Used ART - fabulous options with transportation to many Anaheim area attractions. Would recommend the Cortona - Staff were fantastic and very eager to make our stay the best possible!

Check in around 7pm, was staying here to go to Disneyland with my boyfriend . The staff help us right away and was very nice . Even though they shared a parking lot with a different hotel , my boyfriend Found parking right away . The room was clean and the bathroom. It was very quite at night. The breakfast was okay , could of been better but other then that I will stay here again.

I would  rate higher but  the cockroaches really killed it for us.  We were not happy about that at all. The staff was nice  and helped us get a new room. And apologized  to us for that. The new room we got was clean and smelled clean.

Summary Heading: My kids loved that you played classic mickey cartoons with breakfast in the morning!
Summary: The beds were very comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed the hot breakfast in the mornings. I also liked that there were no additional fees for parking. Thank you for helping our vacation be comfortable and relaxing.

The staff was excellent.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Bed was nice and comfortable. Spa and pool are nice. I will definitely stay again.  Room was ready when we got there. Continental breakfast was more than I expected   They had eggs, sausage and biscuits and gravy.  Fruit,  juice, coffee and milk  There was refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave in our room.

Went for our honeymoon Hotel right off the I-5 really good location they have shuttles that pick you up every 20 mins which was really convenient, the breakfast was OK we tried it the 1st morning but decided the next days we would go somewhere else. They gave away our room so they upgraded our us to a suite that was really comfortable. We would definitely go again.

Customer service was great, although there were a few issues that was not mentioned when reserving a room from a third party website. It was due to the additional fee , which was not much but something that could have been stated.  The breakfast in the morning was good, but certain things as far as presentation of hot foods needed to be better, for one ( the breakfast sausage patties we submerged in grease ) . My solution to this issue, was to have a rack so the grease could be at the bottom away from the meat. Second thing was the biscuit, the temperature that they had it on to keep warm, should have been lower in order not to make it hard.  The bathroom in the rooms they have had wall paper in them , making mildew/mold an issue, I ask to check another room , but it had the

We really enjoyed our stay!  The hotel was super convenient, staff was very pleasant and helpful (we had one minor issue that they took care of immediately for us).  My son loved having the pool right there the day we arrived, the day we left & in the evenings after the day at Disneyland. Convenient Breakfast at the hotel, or down the block there were several options if you'd prefer.  We took advantage of the free breakfast to start our day.  The Kids suite was a perfect fit for us.

Summary Heading: Had to cancel reservation, still charged a nights stay because we got an event special prie.
Summary: I made reservations in January to stay for a few nights in April for a business convention. Because it was offered for a group special pricing rate, I was unaware that in fine print it stated that there would be no refunds because of the price. I canceled months in advance because we were unable to attend, and was still charged over $200. I was unhappy and disappointed because they would not let us cancel. So we were charged for a night, while they still could give the room to another person and charge them for a night. I do not recommend staying here and if we go to CA we will not be supporting their business.

Was with 3 blocks of Disney so only a ten minute walk.  CVS close by for food and drinks.  Room was clean and comfortable.  It was a little loud some nights with people walking by and hanging out outside.  Pool was really warm and clean.  Breakfast was good but wished the hot food selection changed a bit.  It was exactly the same for 7 days.  Sausage, Eggs and lukewarm hashbrowns.  Pool towels the size of handtowels but they are generous with room towels so we used those.  Front desk staff are EXCELLENT!

My family and I stayed here for 2 days. We usually stay at a different hotel but we found a really good deal on Expedia that we could not pass. This hotel is actually quite nice. Rooms are clean and beds are really comfortable. A huge plus was the free parking and complementary breakfast. I would definitely recommend.

This was our first time staying at Cortona, but we really enjoyed our stay! The breakfast buffet was really good, had more choices than most other hotels we have stayed at. We had pancakes one day, biscuits and gravy the next, along with sausage, eggs, waffles, and many other choices.  The room had a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. Parking was free, as well as wifi, which was nice. We would definitely stay here again!

Second time staying at cortona inn .the rooms are clean with fridge and microwave and very comfortable beds..breakfast in the morning and a pool that my son enjoyed. Front desk staff were very friendly throughout our stay and made us feel comfortable.

Excellent floorplan and great arrangement. Perfect for large families with possibly extra adults/kids. We needed every extra ounce of space and their sofa bed, bunk beds, and Master suite were wonderful. Can't underscore how great the central bathroom was also! The location was ideal for Disneyland. The price was very affordable. Quality was very good for the money!

We rented the king suite for one night to visit Disneyland. It was slightly less expensive than the surrounding hotels. On the plus side it was extremely close to the Disney parking lot and to the park. However, the room we rented was listed as a king suite with separating door. Well that term is correct but not what you think it is. The door is only the door to the bathroom left wide open and they have the sink not in the bathroom rather it is in the hallway where the door opens. This wasn't what we were expecting. We were expecting a door that fully closes the bedroom off from the living room because our young son needed to go to sleep earlier than us and we wanted to take showers and use the restroom after he was asleep without waking him. The room was also directly in front

Very dirty with bulging old  wallpaper. Carpets old and stained. Very stripped down quality of furniture and drapes.. Breakfast is the worst. No scrambled eggs. Pancake watered down batter no taste. Very limited choices. Would never recommend this hotel. Bed linens tattered and worn.

The pictures were very deceiving. A lot older than it looked. We had a kids suite and there was plenty of room and the little ones loved the bunk beds. The rooms were ok, a little old. The free buffet breakfast and free parking were definitely a plus.

The Cortona is a decent hotel. The free breakfast is good and restocked right on time. The rooms were clean a lot of space for a family of five. The kids loved the bunk beds. We didn't isethepool or the hot tub so I can't comment on that. It seemed as though there was enough parking as we always got a spot just not by our room every time. But we did go during spring break. The hotel was very clean and the frontless staff was awesome to is.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay, nice staff, close to Disneyland, hot breakfast
Summary: Our trip was to visit family members in southern California; however, we took advantage of the hotel location.  The streets were full of travelers in custom for Disneyland's events and nice weather; so, we enjoyed to walk to Disneyland and surrounding areas many times in hours.  Staff were so nice: from the front counter to maintenance, house keepers, etc.  There was always one to watch out during breakfast (good hostess, shinning your new day) and one to fill up food and drinks.  Breakfasts were OK: included normal stuff you could have for breakfast_of course, plus some hot ground beef and/or eggs and/or potatoes.  Our room had flat screen TV with cable channels, microwave, refrigerator, etc. as listed on hotel website.  We got clean room everyday unless we requested not to.

Friendly and helpful staff.  Clean rooms.  Easy family breakfast.  Easy walk with kids to and from Disneyland, no need for shuttle.  King Suite was very nice and kept kids in their own living room space.  Free parking and free Wifi are a bonus.

Nothing special. Continental breakfast was blah. The only thing good was they don't charge to park your car daily. Otherwise, everything was just ok. They said the beds are pillow top but ours was definitely not. The fridge didn't really keep stuff that cold and the room smelt like musty old shoes. The windows are not dual pane so you can hear anything and everything that is going on outside. The wi-fi is beyond slow. I will not be back

Summary Heading: Nice comfortable room with excellent service.
Summary: The room was very comfortable for our family. The maid service was excellent and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We only wish it had been a bit closer to Disneyland. It was a healthy walk back and forth.

We love this hotel it's always clean,the staff is amicable and the breakfast is way better then others.The pool is also well keep. Only problem with this visit was that they didn't have enough Disney tickets.

The room was small, but clean. I liked that the pool was warm, the breakfast was blah, I wish there was more options. I had to leave early, and they were nice about it, which was nice. But overall it was OK.

Summary Heading: A very comfortable environment with good beds!
Summary: The hotel has a short distance from the Disney Park and the environment of it is so good! There is a small swimming pool and it is clean. I love the bed best because it is so soft and there was still a comfortable blanket to sleep on. It is a good place to live in.

We came up for a trip to Disneyland. We got the room just for a night. Price was decent for being Spring Break and having other hotels sold out. Staff at front desk were friendly and accommodating,  room was spacious and comfy. Even had a fudge/freezer which was great. Breakfast was pretty good, too!

I chose this place based on the TripAdvisor reviews.  This is the first time I have been disappointed in a place I chose based on reviews.    Pros: Front desk staff are nice.  Room is clean but super super old and smells old.  The price we paid for a 2 room suite was very reasonable. We chose this room so the kids could have their own beds and my husband and I could have our own space.   It's very close to lots of restaurants and there's a Target nearby.   CONS: The lobby smells like stale urine.   The pool was a total wreck when we got here today at 3:30. Pool towels scattered everywhere, even in the bottom of the pool. Trash, partially drank water bottles,  and sunflower seeds scattered around on the concrete. The pool is not heated. My kids did swim for a bit, and then we

In reception Judy and Liz give is an excellent attention. They are two very nice girls, and most of all we got a first-class service. Simply excellent care from Judy and Liz.  The hotel is very beautiful and very close to Disney. The rooms are nice and very comfortable.  Simply is a very very good hotel;)

Summary Heading: Excellent value and very close to Disneyland
Summary: We had stayed at Cortona for 5 nights while we were going to Disneyland.  The hotel is more like a motel style that is on 3 floors and has laundry, free internet, free parking, good and free breakfast.    Breakfast includes patties, sausages, form eggs, breads, juice and coffee.   The manager Erika is super sweet and have worn many different hats while we were staying there.  Erika had come out to help with the front desk check in when it was getting busy as well as helped wiped and clean tables during the busy breakfast time.  We also saw Erika mingling with the other guests and she was very helpful in  sharing her experiences when she had taken her little ones to Disneyland.  Erika also provided us with plates and utensils on our first night there when we went to buy dinner.

We didn't end up staying at Cortona itself due to a issue they had with their pipes, but they made accommodations for me at a neighboring hotel and took care of the extra expenses (for parking and for extra cost of hotel room).  So as for Cortona, the customer service was amazing. The lady at the front (sorry I don't remember names!) was incredibly helpful and made sure we were well taken care of before we went to the neighboring hotel. I would happily recommend Cortona though based off of customer service! I hope next time I get to stay at their facility to see what the rooms are like!

Room was very damp and mouldy smell coming from the AC unit which did not work very well. Bathroom not very clean. Stains on couch. Badly needs updating. Thin walls, noisy. Overpriced, pictures on website must be from when they first opened.

Booked the hotel thru hotwire, when we got there we where informed that the rooms I booked where sold out. They gave us a free upgrade without having to contact hotwire. Which made it extremely hassle free. Should I return in the future I will book directly with the hotel.

Summary Heading: Price, parking and free wifi, breakfast and proximity to Disneyland make this a winner!
Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland, included parking and free breakfast made this a good choice for our family.     Breakfast included hot foods.     Room quality was average, not fancy, but clean and large (we had a 2-room suite with 2 TVs)       Since our primary mission was time at Disneyland, we didn't spend time a the spa and pool - actually there are two pools - but they seemed clean and enjoyed by other guests.      Only downside is wifi in the back room was not usable.

Love love love it ! Walking distance to Disneyland!  Nice clean rooms!  Had a slight smell when we first arrived!  Breakfast was decent , hotter food would be great!  Overall was a good stay ! Would recommend it!

Excellent location if going to Disneyland.  The hotel is close to the parking lot so you can walk to it saving you parking costs.  The hot breakfast is a good way to get your day started right.  None of those silly parking fees. Why would you stay at a hotel & then have to pay to park your car? Parking is limited so arrive early.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to a conference or Disneyland.
Summary: Free in and out parking, while Marriott Anaheim charges $12 /day. Cortona Inn is great for families and offers free breakfast.  Beds were comfortable and room was clean. Given the number of families staying there, the place was amazing quiet on the first floor.

After a long day on our feet at Disneyland, it was real nice to come relax in our suite. The kids loved their bunk beds & all the beds in our suite were comfortable. We enjoyed their breakfast in the morning- great way to start the day!

This is more like a Motel vs a Hotel.  Entrance to room is from outside - however the location of the Motel is very safe and secure tucked back away from the street.  It is very quiet and very friendly staff.  Has FREE parking which is pretty much unheard of near Disney and the convention center.  And it has a FREE breakfast daily... it's not the best but it's free!  VERY friendly staff and very accomodating management.

My family stayed at Cortona Inn & Suites when we went to Disneyland, and we enjoyed our stay there very much. The price was very reasonable. We got upgraded to a larger room which was great. Everyone had their own bed, and there was plenty of room for our kids to play. It was close enough to Disneyland we could walk there. The bed was VERY comfortable, the room was clean, I have no complaints. When we left, we accidentally left my daughter's blanket and toy there and when I called, they still had it and were very diligent and patient with me, telling me how to get it back, sending me a picture so I could know it was actually our stuff, and they were very patient and helpful with me figuring it all out. I'm so glad we stayed there and would gladly go back for another stay next

We want to be close to Disneyland for my 91 year old Mom and my family to celebrate my great niece Birthday, The Hotel we pick was profit they had a shuttle ever 20mins they bring us back and forth to Disneyland and the hotel. great for my mom to rest back at the Hotel.  The hotel was clean,friendly and close to restaurant for walking,  I would go back definitely when we make a trip again to Disneyland. :)

I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel seems to have been recently updated. The rooms were clean and modern. We had the top floor and noise was not a problem. We liked that the front room and the bedroom had their own temperature control. The free breakfast was good, nothing fancy. The walk to Disney wasn't bad and the Disney parking lot is across the street. We enjoyed our stay.

We enjoyed our stay at cortona inn & suites very much. Very comfortable and clean. The staff was very helpful & efficient. Walk to parks with lots of shops on the way to get anything you may need. Would definitely stay here again.

I was going to stay at the motel 6 main gate like I always do but I found out about this place. I don't think I will ever go back to the motel 6. For $20 more to stay here the beds were amazing I still dream about those beds. The breakfast was alright but if you don't like it there it's only $8 and some change to eat next door at the Hyatt which I really recommend they also have a breakfast Buffett but it's way better. I loved that the room came with a nice bed and it was a nice environment. I would love to stay here again.

The beds are sooo comfortable!  Breakfast was mediocre. We had to wait for food to be brought out. parking is a bit tricky, but once you get checked in they validate the ticket and give you a permit to park in the adjoining hotel's parking area. Otherwise, our stay was excellent

The Cortona staff was most helpful and friendly.  The breakfast was simple but filling.  The hotel is so close and convenient to the Anaheim convention center - we could walk to all the activities and seminars!  We also appreciated the free parking!

We traveled as a family and had two rooms. It was convenient because it was close to the theme parks. The breakfast was good but they're in my opinion needed to be a little changeup. When you stay there a week it's difficult to keep eating the same sausage and eggs and potatoes

I recently stayed at the Cortona inn with my family and we where very pleased. We had booked a Toscana kids, which consisted of a king bed and bunk beds. When we arrived at the hotel we where told that the kids suite was not available. Now after driving for hours we where not happy. However, Esmeralda was able to accommodate us in a room which still had bunk beds, but it also had 2 queen beds. She was extremely helpful and apologized for the mistake that was made. She offered to take our luggage to our room (even though they where busy at the desk) and we had early check in. After checking in we where very happy. The room was nice and clean. The breakfast was also good and fullfilling. I would definitely stay here again without a doubt. Cortona is very lucky to have such

We booked the hotel a day prior to coming we did not plan the trip out much we booked a room with 1 king size bed we got their around 930 in the morning and check in wasn't until 3 but the kind lady at the counter got us a room with 2 queen beds right when we got their! Awesome service! Our room was nice and clean the air condition was perfect they had free wifi which was awesome as well they had free breakfast which was great pool and jacuzzi was nice, I mean everything was perfect free parking. Deff gonna stay at this hotel next time, we had went to Knotts berry farm which was about 18 mins aways and we went to santa monica beach which was about 1 hour and 45 mins away but nonetheless great hotel

Summary Heading: I'll say it again.... We will stay here every time we go to Disneyland!
Summary: We absolutely love staying at the Cortona! You can't ask for a more helpful and friendly staff! Short distance to Disneyland. The rooms are always clean & well maintained. Our son loved the pool too. This is our 7th stay in this Hotel and can not wait to come back next year. If you are a family looking to get the best bang for your buck book a room now.

Summary Heading: Fair room for a fair price
Summary: For a one night stay, this room was fine. We stayed in the suite with 5 people and it was clean and do-able. The bathroom door didn't close all the way and the beds weren't super comfy but again for a night it was fine. The ladies at the desk were sweet and really helpful!!  The breakfast was nothing to write home about... toast, cereal, juice it worked!

Summary Heading: room was good very quiet location
Summary: awesome room close to everything well priced room to move love the whole stray would stay again only a short walk to food outlets disney and other site seeing events  bed was comfortable had the best sleep in a long time plenty of soaps and hair products to use we totally enjoyed our stay buses out the front to take us anywere in anaheim but best of all the accountant of the cortina was at the front desk as i was asking how we could get to wallmart and he said i will take you there if you would like and he dropped us at the front door what service

We had a very good stay, this is the third time stay here in the passed 4 to 5 years.  Rooms are nice and clean and DON"T smell, and the beds very comfortable. I wish the doors were more insulated.  The outside neighbors and noises can be hear clearly when you are trying to sleep in.

Summary Heading: Nice budget friendly hotel with everything one would need
Summary: We really found this hotel to be a great value for the money. We were mostly sold on the option of two bedrooms (and near Disney). Pleased once we arrived. My kids loved the bunk beds. Great to have the space for us and our children. Found the kids' room to be very spacious. Fabulous to have a TV in both rooms. A large coffee table to be used for in-room eating and activities. An additional couch/hideaway bed also helped for sibling issues. The in-room microwave and fridge was great. On-site laundry was fantastic and ended up being needed. On a bus route, close to Disney, restaurants and small convenience store/drug store shopping. Quick drive to just about everything and many on-ramps. Pool and hot tub were great. Continental breakfast was a fantastic help--one less thing to

Stayed 4 nights for recent convention and was very pleased!  Easy walk to convention center, and though I did not go to D-land, that would have been easy too.  Quiet room, but I took advice of others and requested 3rd floor, away from elevators.  nice to have the continental breakfast as well as a refridgerator and microwave.

Summary Heading: Nice budget hotel surrounded by higher end properties
Summary: I made a last minute reservation for business to attend the nearby convention. My company only reimburses up to $200 and all other hotels were much higher so this was a good fit. Compared to all the surrounding hotels which are much newer the Corona is starting to show its age a little on the outside while the rooms look nice  and are comfortable and clean. Other reviews mentioned musty odor problems; I did notice a hint of this when I first entered by turning on the AC cleared it up.

The Cortona Inn is a good value for the distance to Disneyland.  We stayed in a Family Suite and were a little disappointed in the size of the room - the first room was very small - the connecting kids room was quite good size.  The photo of the family room on the website it a bit deceiving - it is just not as large as it appears.  Our room was on the first floor and our first night there was very loud - we could not fall asleep without earplugs. The kids room was spacious and quiet and very nice. The continental breakfast was very good - get there early if you want a table though - but it was great to be able to fill up before heading out to Disney. We looked forward to the breakfast every day.  The pool was nice for the kids - it was a little small but we swam twice - once as

Summary Heading: Great Guest Service and Super Comfortable Beds
Summary: This hotel has the best staff of any property in the Disneyland area.  I stay in this area a lot as a Disney Annual Passholder, and the staff at this property impressed me the most.  I especially want to give credit to Front Desk clerk Esmeralda who was super friendly when she checked us in.  We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, especially the fresh fruit.   The beds were amazing!  That had to be the most comfortable bed I had ever had in any hotel I have ever stayed in, and I've stayed at a lot.  Try them for yourself and you'll see what I mean.  It will be the best sleep you have had in a very long time

Summary Heading: Cortona Inn. Very Good Value for Money
Summary: Stopped here for the NAMM Show. Rooms ver very spacious and the hotel staff extremely friendly. The free breakfast wasn't too bad the only down side was although there were tea bags there was no hot water available. You had to ask a member of staff.  Free parking was good and the hotel is located to many restaurants as well as disneyland.  I'd recommend this hotel to anybody. The price was very good and the service was excellent.  ***HOTEL MANAGERr*** Please add a boiler of hot water for teas. Looking at past reviews this has been mentioned many times.

This is a nice clean hotel near Disneyland and the convention center, but the internet connection is the worst!  Great for pleasure, no good for business travel Many restaurants in the area Easy to get to

Summary Heading: Overall Great - Especially for the Price
Summary: We stayed three nights as part of a Disney family vacation. We got two adjoining rooms. This is the second time we stayed at Cortona in the same configuration. It was perfect for seven people. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and the site is reasonably quiet. The doors open to the outside, so there is some exterior noise that bleeds in, but manageable. The site is within a (long) walk to Disneyland entrance. My family chose to drive and park.   Breakfast is reasonably good for this kind of place. Sausage, eggs, waffles, toast, cereals, juices, etc. None of it is great, but it fills the kids and saves us from paying for it elsewhere.   Staff was friendly and helpful.   Will stay again!

I found the staff to be very accommodating and friendly. The beds and especially the pillows were fabulous!! I slept well.  It was quiet most likely because the facility is set back from the road. The breakfast was nice....

I just booked this hotel for this weekend and was blown away by Liz. P. She was super helpful with the booking of my reservation and she gave me a great rate. She also gave me lots of information on the amenities and some transportation tips. I love that I was able to call them directly to book my room. I can't wait to get  there.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel For Convention Reasonable Priced
Summary: We visited Namm show on Anaheim Convention Center on a specific budget. We've got the 2 room suite and the rate/vicinity to Convention/cleanliness / great staff combination was the right one. Breakfast can always get better but no complains.

We have stayed at many hotels in the Anaheim/Disneyland area. We usually like to get a kid's suite/two room suite, and this is probably the best kid's suite we have stayed in. There is an actual door separating the two rooms, and the kid portion of the suite included a nice TV, fold out couch and a bunk bed with steps (not ladder) to the second level.  The hotel was quite by Disneyland area hotel standards. They have a continental breakfast whcih includes some protein (egg/breakfast meat) so you can top off with a breakfast sandwich before starting your day. Every staff member we came across was great. They were all friendly and helpful with information including the hotel and surroundings. I was really impressed with how courteous the staff was. We will definitely try to stayr

Great trip. Nice staff that was always there to help. Plenty of parking. The rooms were ready when we got there and they were clean. The breakfast space was kept clean while we ate. The breakfast had a good selection.

Summary Heading: The room was clean and the staff was friendly
Summary: Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The only thing that I was a bit disappointed in was the two days we went to breakfast around 9, the sausage and eggs were gone. There was still other options just not any hot ones available.

The hotel is a 15 minutes walk to Disneyland. However, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel for ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) bus that will take you to Disneyland in few minutes. The hotel is kind of old and looked like a motel as it is in an open complex. The bedroom and bathroom size was average. The hotel provides free basic breakfast everyday. However, the staffs were nice and helpful. One lady even helped us to print a coupon for Discovery Museum.

My family and I had bought alot of stuff and just put then around the room without any locks, nothing went missing. Their housekeeping staff is really professional.  We had to wait 15 minutes before checking in because they were preparing the room for us, but that was an early check in, so what else could you ask for? I'm not sure this is a 3.4 star hotel, more like 4.

We had three nights here in a good sized 1 bedroom unit.  We were on the ground floor and could hear every step of the people above us.  No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but coffee available over by reception.  We were excited that breakfast was included in the cost, however, disappointed with what was on offer.  Clean and tidy, housekeeping great.  Reception staff were friendly and efficient. Easy 15 min walk to Disneyland.  Convenience shops close by.

We REALLY enjoyed the separate sleeping areas, with a door between them.  THe kids' room was very spacious and we liked that the bunk beds had stairs and not just a ladder.  We were disappointed, however, that the reading lights didn't work.   The couch in the kids' room looked like it folded out to a bed though we never used it.  Our biggest disappointment was that the kids' TV didn't work, even after we had someone come up to "fix" it.  They were really looking forward to having their own TV to watch and a selling point, so it was quite the bummer.    Our room was not as spacious, but we enjoyed the king size bed and the mattress was very comfy.  Bathroom had nice counter space.  Everything was clean, though definite wear/rusting was evident in the bathroom, especially its

My cousin flew in from new York and he already booked a room at the Hyatt. So I decided to book a room for the night right next door. Got a deal through Priceline before I booked it online I asked to see a room and the young fellow and young woman stated no you cannot see a room you must book it first if you don't like it then we will refund the money. That would be a process it would be easier to let the person see a room to determine if you would want to stay there. There customer service is beginner not very personable people. If I wanted that I could just go to a self checkout kiosk. But I did book the room I was impressed with the cleanliness of the bathroom the bed it comes with microwave and fridge.

We stayed at this hotel 2 days before and after our cruise so we could visit Disneyland. Both rooms we had were clean and a good value for the money we paid. The pillows could have been better but overall the bed was comfortable, especially after long days at the parks. The biggest factors for us were the free parking (first car only), close proximity to the parks,and free breakfast which consisted of sausage patties, eggs, waffles, toast, english muffins, an assortment of cereals, coffee, pastries, apples, oranges, and juices. I called for extra towels and pillows and they were prompt in fulfilling the request. Parking is provided in spots right below the rooms or in an underground parking garage where we never had a problem finding a spot. I would stay here again if in the

We had a great experience at the Cortona. The staff was friendly and helpful. We showed up an hour early and the desk clerk had no problem helping us check in early. Our room was c,Dan and comfortable. The proximity to Disneyland was great if you don't mind a bit of a walk or using the ART. We used the ART and had no problems. You can buy passes at the desk.the continental breakfast was good, my kids loved the donuts, though I suggest getting to it early as tables will be full if you get there after 8 am. We will definitely consider the Cortona again on our next visit to Disneyland.

This is a small hotel, close to Disneyland. It has great location, very close to the parks. It is not that close to go walking to the park (less than 1 mile), but if you want to save the parking ($18 a day), it may be worth a try. Nice, clean, big, comfortable rooms. They have the usual breakfast: bread, juice, meat patties, etc. it is a family hotel, everyone seems to go to Disneyland. Very good option for the price, as everything this close is outrageous. We took a 1 bedroom suite for $100 thru Expedia, I wasn't sure as I had bad experiences with independent hotels, so I booked only one night. When arrived, it seemed fine, so we stayed another two nights ($130, same day booking). The suite has two queen beds and a sofa couch, divided by a door, two tv screens, the usual. The

Staff was nice and helpful , hotel is walking distance, rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and have good blankets, it had a fridge and microwave, free parking with in and out privilege, breakfast is included and it was ok to start the day nothing fancy, we were comfortable in a two queen bed room. Cons bathtub didn't work and we stayed on the first floor which you can hear the neighbors above so the next time we stay there I will ask for a third floor room. we will definitely stay there again

This hotel is not clean. The staff is nice but the rooms leave much to be desired. We checked out 6 hours after checking in due to a tarrable smell coming from the heater (not the "usual smell" that the front desk try to convince us it was). Ended up at the Candy Cain Inn at midnight.

Summary Heading: Free parking and free breakfast at a reasonable price!
Summary: The cost of tickets to Disneyland and California Adventures costs more than the amount I paid to stay at this hotel for my husband and I! The reason why I picked this hotel when booking my trip was because they offered free parking (with in and out privileges) AND free breakfast (because you could easily spend a ton of money fast on food in the park).   Service: The front desk attendant was very nice and very helpful. They were able to get us ART/bus tickets for the Disney buses. They also sell park tickets there - super convenient!  Rooms: We were upgraded to a room with a huge jacuzzi - so that was nice. We had a corner room so we had tons of space. Although the decor of the room was very outdated. Free Breakfast: seating is very limited and can get packed quickly - so if you

This room was nice and clean the staff were really nice. We felt really comfortable staying at this hotel and we would stay there again on out next trip. Beds were comfortable and the room was clean overall.

This hotel is nothing fancy and I had a comfortable stay here. I dont like some of these hotels charging a resort fee which I dont know what it means. If you get this hotel for about $75 its worth it but not much more.  Its clean, location is good and offers breakfast.

We just stayed here a few days ago (Dec 15 - Dec 22) and had a wouderful stay. Let me start by telling you about the great staff this hotel has... when we arrived (Me, wife and 3 kids ages 10, 8 and 2) i asked for the price of an upgrade to a kids sute ( with bunk beds) and they did it with no cost, so this was the first of many things they helped us with our stay.. we needed Disneyland tickets and they sold them to us right there, so we skipped box office and headed straight to the gates. they have quick breakfast available with great options to get your day started. not only would i reccomend this hotel... i will surely come back on our next DL vacation.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your 5 Circle review.  We are happy to see that you enjoyed your stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Cortona Inn & Suites is a true Gem in the Anaheim Resort and as you discovered a very nice place to stay for familes.  Our Kids' Suites are spacious and feature very nice and comfortable King bed, bunk beds, fridge, microwave oven, 39 inch Flat Panel TV.  Add to that our free daily Continental Breakfast, free Wi-Fi and no additional charge for parking, truly a great value.  Thanks again and hope to see you and your family again soon.  Happy New Year!

Summary: The Cortona is everything a frugal yet picky traveler wants-free parking,  free and delicious breakfast,  clean and quiet hotel. After staying here,  I won't stay anywhere else.  You can walk to Disneyland or if your feet get tired,  ART picks up right in front of the hotel. We were on the bottom floor and it was very quiet;  no noise above and minimal outside nose.
Manager Response: Dear Kim M., Thanks for sharing your comments and review about the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Always nice to see another 5 Circle review from our guests.  You touched on many of the nice features that makes the Cortona Inn & Suites a true value when looking for a hotel in the Anaheim Resort that offers comfortable accommodations, quality amenities and exceptional value.  Thanks again!! We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.  Have a Happy New Year!

Summary: King bed very comfortable, bunk beds great for the kids. Pull out not so much,but that's normal for pull outs. Breakfast had a good variety, hotel staff very friendly. Great location to Disneyland and California Adventure.
Manager Response: Dear DElmona H, Thank you so much for your 5 Circle review!  We are very happy to see that your stay with us was excellent and that you our staff was attentive and welcoming.  Should your plans call for another visit to Anaheim please let us know. Thanks again and best wishes for a Happy New Year!

Summary: Our family enjoyed their stay at Cortona Inn & Suites, The staff was very accommodating, they always helped find parking for our extra large van, We knew parking in Anaheim was scarce, so chose one large van instead of 2-3 vehicles for the family. Everyone was very friendly and informative, answered questions, and let us store our luggage in a locked area since we were too early for check in.  We had 2 rooms that were queen suites, and one family suite.We found the rooms to be clean and comfortable.It was nice to have breakfast at the hotel before adventuring to Disneyland, Disney's California Adventure, and Downtown Disney. Total of guests were 14 people, ages 18 months - 72 years young.  We would stay again, and that says alot since two of the family members travel for work 40
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca O, Thanks for your taking the time to review our hotel and share your experience.  We are pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you found everything to your liking.  Most pleased to see that our staff was attentive and was helpful in making your stay enjoyable.  Great tip, by the way bringing one Van instead of two or three cars.  Makes sense I would say!  Maybe even saved a bit in fuel also. Thanks again for your review.  Let us know if we can ever be of service again!  Happy New Year!!

Summary: I had a good experience during my stay. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and right around the corner from the Disneyland parking lot. The hotel was recommended to me and I would definitely recommend stayinging at the hotel.
Manager Response: Hello laquessab, Thanks for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim Resort.  Nice to see that your stay was enjoyable and that you enjoyed our super comfy beds with pillow-top mattress.  Sure makes for a very enjoyable nights rest!  And you are correct, we are very close to the Disneyland Resort Parks!  About 1-1/2 blocks away.  Very close!  Let us know when your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort.  We would love the opportunity to welcome you back.  Best wishes for a Happy New Year!

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be.
Summary: This hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland and the ART (bus service). The room was very noisy and we found spiders in both rooms. Additionally, the smoke detector in one room was hanging down from the ceiling and when I mentioned it to the staff they did not seemed concerned and it was not fixed during our three day stay. The breakfast room is too small and people end up standing near some wooden (unfinished) cabinets to eat.
Manager Response: Dear Mary R, Sorry that we did not meet your expectations this time.  I would have to disagree and say that our staff does care about all of our guests and is willing to go out of their way to help make our guests stay as enjoyable and pleasant as possible.  Of course, the items you describe do not meet our standards and would normally be addressed immediately.  Please feel free to contact our General Manager to discuss your stay so we can better understand to see where we may have failed to provide you with the best experience possible.

Summary: The room was awesome the kids had their own bunk beds and it also had a pull out couch in their room. The only thing we didn't like is their parking it is too small we had to park far in a parking structure and that's just not convenient after a whole day of walking in disneyland and very tired kids that's the last thing we wanted to do, I wish you wold have enough parking for all the guest close to their rooms. Other than that I think we would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear guest, Thank you so much for your review and comments about your recent stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim Resort.  We appreciate the time you have taken to share your comments and are please to see that your stay was thoroughly enjoyable.  Although you were able to park your car nearby in a safe and secure parking garage, we understand the extra steps it takes after a long day at Disney.  We apologize for the inconvenience. Thank again for sharing your experience.  Best wishes for a Happy New Year!!

Summary: I don't like giving lower ratings,  but due to the bathroom not being as clean as I'd prefer and the horrible shower head I had to knock off a point. The rest of the room was very nice and the breakfast room and food were better than expected.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Sorry that the bathroom didn't meet your expectations.  Our standards are quite high for all areas of room cleanliness so I am curious to know if this was reported to our staff during your visit.  Sometimes, a call to the housekeeping department or front desk can remedy an overlooked item such as a need for extra towels, or any issues with housekeeping service.  We invite you to contact the General Manager to discuss your experience. Thank  you for sharing your comments.  Best wishes for a Happy New Year!

Summary: Rooms are showing their age. Beds are not that comfortable and couldn't keep the sheets in place. parking is terrible and even with having to park in fire lanes everyday, we had to pay 8 dollars to get out of the parking lot following check out. Never again.
Manager Response: Dear Mike O, Very surprising to hear that you didn't find our beds to be comfortable.  Most Trip Advisor reviews of our new beds are very favorable.  Perhaps there was an isolated case of the wrong size sheeting used for your beds.  Parking can get crowded, especially during days of peak occupancy in the area.  During peak occupancy we do offer Valet Service at no extra charge to our guests to relieve them of the parking issues and let our professional Valet hosts park their car.  Parking at the Cortona is always at no additional cost.  Had you inserted the Parking Exit Pass that should have been issued to you at check in, you would not have had to pay.  Also, there is a call button on the parking gate exit terminal that would have put you in contact with the front desk who could have verified your registration and assisted you.  We do try hard to make sure our guests are as comfortable as possible and have an enjoyable and pleasant stay and encourage our guests to bring any deficiencies to our attention for immediate resolve.  We ask that you allow us the opportunity to welcome you back for an enjoyable stay soon.  Best wishes for a Happy New Year!!

Summary Heading: Good hotel for price and distance to Disneyland.
Summary: We had this hotel recommended by a friend.  After reading some of the negative posts about this hotel I was nervous traveling such a long way and having a bad hotel. When we arrived we were able to check in early. The room was clean and nice and the beds were very comfortable.  We stayed for 4 days and we were very comfortable during  our stay. The breakfast was just right for the morning and it gave us just enough energy to start our days at Disneyland. The breakfast was different every day and it gave us a variety of foods so after 4 days it wasn't boring. The staff was pleasant and was able to answer all of our questions.  I think the only negative thing about the hotel is the walls are very thin and we could hear the people above our room the first night we were there. We
Manager Response: Dear Chris H, Thanks for your review our Cortona Inn & Suites hotel in Anaheim.  We are very happy to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with.  We have made some nice updates to our service and amenities that our guests find very nice.  New beds with pillow top mattresses that get wonderful reviews for comfort and a good nights sleep, 39 inch flat panel HDTVs, the addition of cranberry juice and raspberry iced tea served with our Continental Breakfast that will be complimented by the remodeling of our breakfast room that will feature more seating and an increase in serving stations.  The noise issue you mention is something we ask our guests to help with by observing quiet hours for the comfort and privacy of all guests. Thanks again Chris H, if we can be of service again soon please let us know. Thanks!

Summary: My family and I checked in on Saturday, November 28th around 6:30pm (if not later).  We dropped off our luggage in the room and headed out to Disneyland.  A few hours later came back unexpectedly as one of our members became ill.  We had to check-out that same night around 10:00pm.  I was told by front desk to call and see what they could do as far as a refund.  I called hotels.com the following day since that's the site I booked the room with, they in turn called Cortona Inn and were told that NO refund would be issued.  I can understand not FULLY being refunded, but not even to be partially refunded and have ZERO remorse for the circumstance is the WORST customer service.  I emailed the General Manager along with corporate telling them the situation and have yet to hear ANY
Manager Response: Dear Lisa M, We are sorry to read that your visit to Disneyland Park was interrupted by the illness of a family member.  You will be hearing from the hotel manager soon and will be able to address your situation and about refunds for reservations made with an online travel agency.   Thank you for your understanding.

Summary: Great hotel, location, and super comfy beds! Only complaint was the bathroom door needed painting  and was hard to close. Breakfast was ok...nothing special, but it worked for us. Room value was good as well.
Manager Response: Hi Melinda L, Thanks for sharing your comments about your recent stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are happy to see that your stay was enjoyable and that you found our new beds to be super comfy,  Comfortable beds, free continental breakfast and great value sums of your experience with us.  And for that we thank you.  Let us know if we can be of service again soon.  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: Value for money, and good location
Summary: The room was average accommodation for a family of five.  It was good value for the convenient location to Disney, with clean rooms and good, free wifi access. On site parking was convenient with easy access around Anaheim.
Manager Response: Hi Jackie W, Thanks for your nice review about our hotel.  Glad to see that your stay was enjoyable.  And as you mention, Cortona Inn & Suites offers wonderful value when you factor in our very nice free deluxe continental breakfast each morning, free Wi-Fi in guest rooms and throughout the hotel, fridge and microwave oven in all rooms, on site parking at no additional charge and clean and comfy rooms. Thanks again Jackie for taking time to complete your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.

Summary: The rooms bathroom was tired but good value and clean.  The breakfast was sub par but honestly the desk staff made up for it, very helpful.  I'm not too sure if this property had suites as all the rooms looked the same.  The bed was comfy and close to Disney.  Since you really don't spend a great deal of time in your room I would recommend it for the value.
Manager Response: Hi Shawnb1962,  Thanks for your review of our hotel.  Will be looking into your comments about the bathroom as  we have just installed new cabinetry in all bathrooms that provide more storage space and create a more appealing vanity area in our guest rooms.  We do offer 1 bedroom suites, including our Toscana Kids' Suite that features bunk beds, king bed and queen sofa sleeper.  very spacious and very comfortable for families with smaller children.  Thanks again for taking time to share your comments about your stay with us!

Summary Heading: Cortona Inn & Suites Hotel Review - good value for the money
Summary: This hotel is very clean and very basic and great friendly service...perfect for if you need a place near Disney/Anaheim that is reasonably priced.   We stayed in the 3rd floor suite that has a King bed, and a separate room that has a bunk bed and sofa bed.  It was nice to have the extra space there for the kids and for us when we ordered take out.  There was a TV in each room as well as a mini fridge and microwave which was very handy. I would definitely pay a little extra to have the extra room for the bunkbed and kids..it gives the room more space.   We were not able to check out the outdoor pool but was able to partake in the free Continental breakfast.  It is a basic breakfast with eggs, sausage, bread, donuts, drinks and fruit.   The location is very close to Disney and we

We had a great stay here, the staff were so very nice and very helpful.  The continental breakfast was more than we expected.  Easy access to the ART.  The room was very clean and updated, the bed was a little on the too firm side, but after a full day at Disneyland we slept just fine.  The only problem that we had was with the room key, it is very easily de-magnetized.  Be advised that if the key is close to your cell phone or any of your cards with a magnetic strip it will mean a trip to the front desk.  I would stay here again!

Our room was comfortable for 3!!!! The maid service was outstanding!!! The hot tub was warm!!!! Nice pool and not crowded!!!  Within walking distance of Disneyland!!!! Great breakfast!!!! Staff very friendly and helpful!!! Great cooperation with neighborhood hotels!!  Great place for families!!! Quiet for sleeping to be ready for a full day at Disneyland or California Adventures or any other attraction!!!!

very friendly staff. Service was great. Each night when we got back to our room not only was the room well maintained, but the housekeeper had also arranged the stuffed animals nicely on the bed our kids were using. Nice touch.

We always stay here. Clean rooms, comfy beds and great staff. A little back from the street so it's quiet! Breakfast is always great and there is always plenty. Water and coffee in the lobby and a gift shop for all the little things you need!

The room was clean and staff was very friendly. Pool was well maintained and the breakfast offered in the morning had enough variety. However the bathroom fan didn't work, parking was tricky, and we had to use a towel at the bottom of the door because of such a large gap at the bottom, daylight and sounds would just come into the room.

The service overall was great, loved the breakfast they serve every morning. Also liked the free parking for the first car, because most places around that area charge. What I disliked was the distance,  its a little too much if your planning on walking to Disneyland, because on the way back you get really tierd after walking all day to walk back 3 or so blocks. Also the room was extremely stuffy and we did not sleep comfortably any of our days there.

Great spot for family vacation!  Comfortable room, good variety of breakfast options, nice pool, great staff and walking distance to Disney parks with shuttle service close by for those not wanting to walk.  Would stay here again, particularly with children.

Mixed review for the Cortona Inn & Suites.  The room was satisfactory for our stay when visiting Disneyland, however there were a few issues that would make me look for a different place to stay next time I'm in the area.  There were three of us staying in a 2 Queen room, the space was adequate for our needs and relatively close to Disneyland, about a 15-20 min walk.  There's also a shuttle stop at the neighbouring hotel.  It's about a 20 min walk to Target and there are a number of restaurants in all directions.  We liked having a mini fridge and microwave in the room as well as the shower being separate from the sink.  Breakfast was adequate, with sausages each morning and then rotating between potatoes, eggs and biscuits.  There's also cereal, donuts, danishes, and fruit.

The Cortona Inn is a secret weapon when it comes to trade shows being held at Anaheim Convention Center. It is a very affordable and CLOSE option to the expensive, big properties just in front of it. Walk two minutes more and save a bundle. The Cortona is tucked behind the Marriott and Clarion on Convention Way but the address just doesnt show how quickly you can be on the show floor. They serve a free decent breakfast with fresh fruit, juice, cereal,toast and bagels etc. The rooms are all accessed from an outdoor hallway and parking is also free. The rooms are faded but beds are comfortable and rooms are spotless. The staff is really friendly and helpful and doesnt charge for taking packages.

Nice hotel close to Disneyland, about 20 mins walk. Nothing fancy, just a good hotel. Rooms were clean, staff very friendly. Breakfast was good, but as in other hotels, breakfastroom was small, so people had to wait or sit outside.

Summary Heading: This is our 3rd stay at Cortona Inn & Suites
Summary: We are very happy with your hotel, so much so that we keep coming back. You provide a safe and clean place to stay while visiting Disneyland. Each time we stayed we went to Disneyland. Anything we ever asked for while staying was granted.  Rooms are nice and clean but could be updated a bit.

Extremely comfortable bed, good breakfast, very helpful and friendly staff, lots of parking street level and in underground structure.  I highly recommend this hotel. Also walking distance to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good room size for a family
Summary: Pretty good room for the price. Our little girls loved the bunk beds in their own room. Stairs up to the top bed was so safe for our two year old. Didn't have hot water the first morning, but they got it fixed quickly. Front staff super friendly and helpful. Check in was quick.  Would recommend it for families on a budget.

Summary Heading: It Wasn't My Choice To Stay Here.....
Summary: This is your basic Disneyland adjacent hotel.  I was on a work assignment at the Anaheim Convention Center and this is where I was housed for 3 days.  The room I was in was a "suite" in the broad sense of the term.  The back room had bunkbeds for the kidlets, a couch and TV.  The from room had a king size very comfortable bed.  The room is seriously lacking electrical outlets for charging phones, etc.  Morning free breakfast was a tad below mediocre. Front desk staff was very helpful, nice and quite frankly, charming.  If you going to Disneyland with the kids, this place will work for you.

After we finally got our room, the door would not open and we needed to get new keys. Once inside, the door would not lock very well and was "loose" in the lock. No key provided for the in room safe. Dimly lit lighting. The bathroom was gross: shower curtain had orange growth on it, rust trails from the handrails inside, terrible water pressure. Carpet was uneven, dirty and old. Lousy soundproofing - could hear everyone above/below/outside.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for my business trip
Summary: Not fancy but quite nice. Conveniently located to the convention center and Disneyland. CVS and Walgreens within walking distance for urgent/forgotten items. Room was clean and tidy. The breakfast bar in the morning was enjoyed by both young and old visitors.

We have always stayed close to the Disneyland Resort when visiting.  We decided to try a hotel a little further away and it paid off.  We love the Cortona Inn & Suites.  First off, they have comfortable beds.  That's a must after a long day at the park.  Many of the closer hotels have awful beds.  Second, they offer free parking and a free hot breakfast.  We will definitely be back soon!

Summary Heading: Great, friendly staff, room modernization needed.
Summary: The hotel staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful.  Some features of the rooms such as the bathroom and vanity are worn and in need of renovation.  The heating and cooling units are old, manually operated and very noisy.

Summary Heading: Better than you should get for the price
Summary: Doubtless, a lot of people have commented on this hotel already. So I'll keep it simple:   The good: Fantastic location -- about two blocks from Disneyland; excellent room price; very clean everywhere; very friendly and knowledgeable staff that are fast to respond to questions and/or problems; close to pickup and drop-off points for Disney/Rapid Transit shuttles; parking included, although hard to find. Also, they have an extremely friendly "hotel" cat, a stray that hangs around but loves people.  The so-so: Free breakfast is a step above continental. Toiletries, such as shampoo and soap, are lower-end quality. Very few plugs in the room for charging devices. Room views on one side of the hotel are null due to lots of bush-like overgrowth (but there is worse to stare at -- the

As a first year annual passholder we have tried a few different places in the area to see what works the best for us. So far this one provides the best value for the money. A block and a half from the Disney parks is a fairly easy walk. I felt safe walking by myself with my three kids. The hotel is on the ART route should you prefer and it is close to the convention center. Parking is included in the resort fee (score)! The free breakfast is mediocre but not bad for the value. It worked and I didn't have to buy a second breakfast when I got to the park. The room was VERY clean and the beds were comfortable. I would probably put it in a 2 1/2 star category instead of 3 because the rooms were small (we were in a regular 2 queen room), the door opens right into the room, and the

Stayed 2 nights for Halloween at Disneyland. Got it through hotwire, so it was an excellent deal. Our room was clean. The beds were comfortable and the location was easy walking to Disneyland. Price was great compared to other hotels in the area. Parking was free and there were plenty of spots when we were there. There was free breakfast in the morning (average but good). Front staff was super nice for both days. The air conditioner not so good -- musty smell, didn't get cold enough even on high. Oh well, no big deal to us since it was October. We would definitely stay here again for a short stay for Disneyland.  Best tip: pick up the ART shuttle in front of the Clarion Hotel (ART route #3). You have to walk across the Clarion parking lot, but this shuttle has a much shorter

Summary Heading: How many hotels have bunk beds near Disneyland? Great option.
Summary: Went with 3 generations of family, and booked 2 adjoining rooms (301/302) and had 4 queen beds and two bunks to use. Fit the bill perfectly. Beds were clean and comfortable, large fluffy towels in the bathroom, fridge/microwave for snacks and drinks. About 15 minute walk to maingate, ART outside as well on Harbour blvd. Breakfast was basic as mentioned in other reviews, but got the day started with muffin/egg/sausage or cereal etc.  Only real complaint was the in-room coffee basket type packages were probably the worst I've ever tasted, so if you love a good cup of coffee when you first wake up maybe bring some from home.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and affordable hotel near Disneyland
Summary: The Cortona Inn was about what I expected for the price. It was quiet, comfortable, conveniently located, and safe. The hot continental breakfast was a nice amenity, as were the outdoor pool and friendly staff. The only things I didn't like were the musty smell in the room, maybe due to the humidity, and the lack of sound insulation, as the person in the room above us sounded like an elephant at 1am every day.

The hotel was good and the breakfast was great. However there were some problems with the showers and the ac (shower curtain was on a curved bar and it was not stable so the whole curtain would go to the middle leaving the side exposed and all the water would splash out leaving a puddle all over the bathroom floor; the ac was old I guess so it would feel super humid and uncomfortable).

Pro's The staff are absolutely awesome especially the two young ladies at the front desk The room was clean and tidy The cleaners do a fabulous job of keeping the room clean daily We were in room 334 which was quiet and cool (2 air con units blasting was like entering heaven after a really hot day out at Disneyland) The Inn is close to restaurants and food stores that are open late (handy for late night dinners) The ART shuttles pick up nearby and go everywhere. The Walmart on the map is a Walmart grocery store only - good for getting snacks, breakfast items and bulk bottled water for your fridge. The front desk sell Disneyland tickets and the ART shuttle passes (just buy and go) The bed - Really comfortable!!   Con's Breakfast - If there's no table available in the dining area

This is a great place to stay!!  Our room was very, very clean and plenty of space for our party of 4(Three adults and one child) We had the kid's suite(the bunk bed was a big hit with my little girl), and felt very comfortable. The beds were nice and comfortable, the bathroom was a decent size. We stayed on the 3rd floor and felt it was very quiet. Loved having a fridge in the room, didn't use the microwave, but both were spotless. The parking lot is a little tight, but we were easily able to move our car much closer to our room on our second day. They do sell shuttle passes at the front desk, which I highly recommend(The 3 day pass is a very good deal, compared to $18/day to park at Disney). Taking the shuttle is pretty easy and better than trying to walk a mile and half back

Room was great. Location was within walking distance to Disneyland. Staff to was friendly. The only setbbacks were the pillows were cheap, breakfast was too basic, and pool hours not enforced at night.

Summary Heading: Clean, good beds and a decent breakfast
Summary: The Cortona Inn is an older hotel but very clean and the beds are really comfortable.  It's too far to Disneyland for small children and tired grandparents to walk but the ART shuttle is available for $5 a day.  Parking is free at the Cortona Inn.  The breakfast is a little above average and has enough items that everyone should be able to find something they like.  The pool and hot tub are clean and heated to appropriate temperatures.

Relatively inexpensive for the Anaheim Disneyland vicinity, the Cortona Inn is a three-story motel out of the 1970s that has been upgraded and refurbished.  Located on Harbor Blvd about 2-3 blocks south of Disneyland, there is frequent transportation to and from Disneyland and it is not that far a hike to make it impossible to walk.  The room was comfortable, the bed was clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was very large with handrails on all walls.  Flat screen TV worked, A/C worked, hot water in the shower, coffee maker in the room - everything that I needed for a short stay.  Breakfast was very basic for an included meal; arrive early to avoid the crowds.  Parking for one car was included in the price of the room.  If possible, avoid a room near the stairs or elevator;

I stayed at the Cortona for one night to go to Disneyland. I bid through Priceline and was really just looking for a low price, so I didn't expect that much. However, the room / bathroom were very clean. The towels / carpet were all clean (no weird smells / stains). There's a mini fridge and microwave in the room. There was more than enough parking when arriving at ~9 pm on a Friday night. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the actual park entrance. There's a $5 / day city (ART) shuttle stop across the street. There's breakfast included which had cereal, toast, hard boiled eggs, danishes, sausage patties, biscuits, bananas, etc. Also, the front desk was helpful and very friendly.
Manager Response: Hi FurryFroggy, Thank you for your review.  Nice to see that you enjoyed your stay and were able to find a great deal on your accommodations.  Sounds like overall you were very satisfied with our free breakfast, clean rooms and friendly and helpful staff.  Thanks again for taking the time to share your comments about your stay with us.  Let us know if you plan to visit again soon.

Summary: Great place to stay for your Disney visit. Shuttle to disneyland, very clean economical room with living room to hang out in. Superior customer service. Nice breakfast room with a varity of choices that were very well stocked.  Gift shop prices were less than disneylands.
Manager Response: Hi Catherine S, Thanks for taking time to share your experience and comments regarding your stay with us.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and that you found our services, amenities and friendly staff to your liking.  We do have a great location in the Anaheim Resort and easy walk or ART shuttle ride to Disneyland.  And our free breakfast is a true money saver when compared to eating at a nearby restaurant.  Glad you were satisfied with your stay.  Let us know if plan to visit again soon.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary: It was a great location for our disney visit. We parked at the hotel and then walked to the toy story parking lot and took the shuttle bus to and from the park.  We will def. come back to this hotel in the future. VERY EASY!

This place is economical and close enough to walk to Disneyland. Some people complain that the breakfast eating area is small, if you get there early should be no problem. You can also bring up to your room.  I like the free parking. Also, Disneyland passholders get a discount. I wish the pool would stay  open a little later.  Parking is tight.

Would recommend the Family Room, has a separate room for the kids to hang out. Sadly WiFi not strong in kids room so they spent most of downtime hanging in our room- small critique. Fab place to stay.

Stayed here with a couple friends on a weekend trip to Disneyland.  The staff were helpful, and the breakfast was good.  The breakfast room fills up but we ate in the lobby.  There's a pool and a hot tub, although I didn't have time to use them, and the bus for Disneyland is only a couple blocks away.  Our room keys could be a little finicky, but we never got stuck out of the room.  We weren't in the room much other than for sleeping and getting ready to go out, but it was very comfortable.  Altogether, this hotel was a great deal for what we needed.
Manager Response: Hi Jacqueline K, Thank you for your review.  We are pleased to know that you had a very enjoyable stay with us.  Next time your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort please let us know. Thanks again!

Summary: I stayed at this hotel while visiting Disneyland. It was clean, but could use an updating. The staff was courteous and attentative. I would recommend staying here as long as you are not looking for any bells and whistles, but a place to lay your head.
Manager Response: Hi Kathy R, Thank you for your review.  We are please to know that your stay was enjoyable.  We shall look forward to welcoming you again soon.

Summary: Cheaper hotel close to Disneyland.  About a 10 minute walk.  Rooms adequate, air conditioner very noisey.  Attentive staff, clean and tidy rooms with a microwave and fridge.  Breakfast basic but sufficient.  Close to restaurants, walking distance.
Manager Response: Hello Jan H, Thank you for taking time to post your review.  We appreciate your comments and are pleased to know that you had an enjoyable stay. Thanks again!!

Summary: The staff was extremely pleasant and accommodating. Not only did they check us in early, they upgraded us at no additional cost and offered us breakfast too. They do charge for parking but its at a fraction of the cost of other hotels. Although I do not think any hotel should charge for parking especially if you are staying there.   The room was clean, a little older but clean none the less. A little far to walk to Disneyland but do able, but at the end of a long day, it feels like a marathon. Breakfast on day 2 wasn't great, I've had better but it certainly wasn't the worst I'd ever had either. Parking isn't the greatest either but if you get a good spot, don't move or you'll have to use the underground garage (really cramped, especially if you drive a big vehicle like a SUV or
Manager Response: Dear ACo1125, Thank you for taking time to comment on your stay with us.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable.  We appreciate candid comments such as yours and will share your comments with our department managers who always appreciate the opportunity to ensure that we deliver the best stay possible. Thanks again for your comments and review.

Summary: The rooms were cosy enough, although a little tired-looking (and no plush toys for the kids as per the website photos). Having travelled with 2 kids, the Toscana kids room was perfect as it was completely separate from the main bedroom and they had their own TV and space to play in (a must for families). Breakfasts were OK, although limited in its selections, along with it being quite crowded. As Disneyland was a good 20+ minute walk the ART was a must, especially after a long day walking around with kids...getting the multi-day ART hopper tickets was the best way. Have to say the staff were fantastic and always very helpful with any issue...major kudos to Erika for her exceptional service during our holiday! Above all a pleasant stay
Manager Response: Dear Rod S, Thank you for your nice comment and review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Happy to hear that  everything met with your satisfaction.  And yes, those two very photogenic plush Mickey's are permanent icons that are available for purchase in the hotel Gift Shop. Thanks again!

Summary: Vary nice rooms with great room service  Breakfast was ok beds were cozzy  I would stay there again. Disneyland  was two blocks we took the bus we  got the tickets at the loby bus passes every 15 mins. Pool was small and always full so did not go in it 3 floors. There is extra parking in the underground ...............

Room was fine but I found at least 3 live bugs!  The value was fine since I got it through Groupon but not worth more.   I did not go to the breakfast since it was full to capacity.  I did not like the location of the ART pick-up (located on the street /bus stop) many homeless people around and I did not feel safe at night with my children.
