The rooms have fridges which helps offset the pretty lackluster 'breakfast' option. Pool closes at 9pm so you're likely not going to get a lot of time to cool off if you're doing Disneyland during the day.  The hotel is a 20 minute walk to Disneyland entrance (just down one road). The rooms are clean, but the building is a bit noisy. The beds we had were like marshmallows which can be good / bad depending on your taste. Wifi was flakey. Free parking and no hidden fees make this a decent contender if you're trying to save some cash on your way to Disneyland.

This is my third time staying at this hotel. I am a Disney pass holder that lives out of state. It is a nice, budget and kid friendly hotel near Disneyland that includes breakfast. I was traveling by myself on this trip, meeting up with some friends in the area to enjoy the parks. I checked in quite early, knowing they had a secure place to store my suitcase, purchased my ART (bus) ticket, changed quickly in their lobby bathroom and I was off to the parks.  Upon my return that evening I asked for a recommendation for dinner, they were quite helpful with a map of local restaurants. (I chose a Mexican place around the corner)  Everything continued to go well, until my last day.  I woke up feeling really sick.  I went to check out at the usual time, 11 AM and they asked how my stay

No it was not the Hilton with all the glitz and glamour that is over price, just to say I stayed there. This is the Cortona Inn & Suites a quaint out of the way (within walking of anything you need). We had a one bed room suite for the seven of us, yes I said 7. Two queen beds in the bedroom, a pull out couch and blow up mattress in the living room. We were all comfortable, the room was clean and smelled nice. Even got to meet nice people from all over the world. The staff was amazing from check, cleaning and kitchen staff. For $136+tax we even had a nice breakfast (for 7 people that would normally be $80-$100 anywhere) all included. The big bonus, we walked across the street 1/2 block and we were in the parking lot of Disney, walked to the bus (free) that took up to the Park.

This is a nice hotel. The location is close enough to Disneyland. I mean after all the walking in Disneyland this walk to the hotel is just fine.  Rooms are nice and clean. And it's close to restaurants and conveniences.  I would stay here again.

I took my kids 2 Disneyland n stay here. They loved the room, it's clean n comfortable. Having a frig in the room, nice. My grievances r 1 elevator is hot n stuffy 2 no convenient parking if u comeback late.

Pros: The staff was very very friendly. They offer a free breakfast and the parking is free if you are only parking one vehicle. The walk to Disneyland isn't very far. It's about one mile away. The maids were all very kind.  Cons: There is not a whole lot of parking. The rooms are just average. The carpet leaves the bottoms of your feet black. The walk from Disneyland to the hotel at night is a little sketchy. It made me uncomfortable to have to walk past homeless people and drunk men begging for money as I was walking back to my hotel room at night. I have two young kids and I'm a young female so I'd rather just drive to Disneyland next time and pay the parking fee. I didn't feel safe walking at night. They also need to hire a pest control company to come out and spray. There

called the hotel to discuss a reservation concern/issue. Daniel was super helpful and was able to accommodate our needs.  We will definitely stay at the Cortona in the future. Thank you so much Daniel!

The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean & comfortable. My only complaint is the breakfast was not very good. The selection is very limited. The gravy for biscuits and gravy was more like soup, not thick at all.

I had a difficult time understanding how to enter into the property,  I had to buzz the hotel twice. I finally got in but got double charged the deposit in cash and credit.  The shower spout wasn't working properly

Awesome stay for the price, can't complain about anything. Everything was clean and neat and great customer service. I would definitely stay there again. Also free parking and breakfast. Near Disneyland, perfect place and cheap price for everything you get

You get what you pay for. Nothing extravagant, nothing luxurious. If you are looking for a place to rest after a tiring day at Disneyland, then this place should be good enough. We stayed for 4 days, 3 nights in August 2015. The room was clean. Furnitures are a little dated. We had two queen beds that's very comfy. The pillows were a little on the flimsy side. The bed itself was set high that my 42-inch-tall toddler was having a hard time "climbing" into. I had two major complains... First, water pipes. Though we cannot hear the next door neighbor, we can definitely hear if somebody was taking a shower. Second, the A/C. It was loud! We had it set on "low fan" all night. All in all, it was a comfortable hotel. Parking can be a bit of a struggle at night but I don't mind checking

Everyone I encountered at the front desk was wonderful and always willing to help. The staff for the continental breakfast was also really great. I was attending the D23 Expo at the Anaheim Convention Center so the location was PERFECT - literally walking distance from ACC. The room was a perfect size. I can't think of any complaints. It was all great.

Summary Heading: If you just need a place to sleep it's not bad.
Summary: Older rooms, curtain in bathroom wouldn't close all the way splashing water all over. Breakfast was horrible, not worth it. We were just there to sleep so not super bad, but it there is room for improvement.

Summary Heading: Convenient Place to Stay by the Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I reserved a 1 King bed room, but ended up getting a two-bed room when I arrived, which was around 5am. The place didn't look as fancy as they did in the photos. I liked that the air conditioning was set when I got back to my room.

15-20 min walk to Disneyland park entrance. Breakfast was provided but hot items eggs and meat looked unappetizing. The French toast sticks and pancakes appeared to be the frozen type. Waffles were Eggo. Cereal, toast, yogurt, pastry, coffee, juice, apples and oranges were available. Room safe was key type but there was no key.  Air conditioner was loud but our room was fairly quiet.

Good deal.  Price and location were withing our budget. I would recommend it to other families.  A lot of groups stayed there, and many foreign travelers.  We walked to Disneland each day without any trouble.

Excelent and very clean hotel. Breakfast is a little bit better than average. Very good location, near Disney and the convention center..... the lack of parking lot in the high season is the only issue.

Summary Heading: Great place, Great Value, and Great Staff
Summary: My family and I just completed a one week stay, and we could have not been more pleased with our stay. From the time I made our reservations, to the time we checked out, our experience was magnificent. The property is clean, well kept, and inviting. The rooms are clean, and the beds are very comfortable. The breakfast was great, especially when traveling with children, always something different on the menu. The staff, always smiling and helpful, answered all of our questions. Conveniently purchased park tickets at a discount at the counter, to avoid the long lines, and the resort transportation picked us up and dropped us off at the front of the property. Will definitely recommend and return soon!

The room was compact but cozy and comfortable.  I LOVED the beds; we all did.  The staff was very helpful with setting up a rollaway bed for a 5th guest with our family, which was very helpful.  Parking was the only downfall, as the spaces between this hotel and the Sheraton (?), which share the parking areas, was dicey at best.  BUT the saving grace is the parking garage, which I understand many folks would not use due to its separation from the main hotel.  Overall, though, the staff was all smiles and very helpful and accomodating.  Great people and great atmosphere; we loved it!

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay, nice and helpful staff
Summary: I booked my room via internet which was very straight forward, check in went smoothly and staff explained everything very well. The room was good value for money, beds were good. The room itself was a bit noisy as it was close to the stairs but this did not impact sleep.  Reception staff was very helpful, especially with special wishes like sending/receiving packages, printing documents etc. Housekeeping service was ok, on one they they were very late (came back around lunch time without beds being made, when I came back in the evening, everything was fine again). As the hotel seemed quite fully booked during my stay, sometimes I was not able to find a free parking lot on the hotel parking lot. Wireless internet was available for free, however sometimes quite slow. Overall I

Everything was great. Comfy beds, Great service, good food, but rated 4 do to parking.  We had a great night's sleep.  Not comfortable with valet parking and there was no opportunity to self park.  We couldn't park to even check in.

Got the two room kid suite. Plenty of room for our whole family. Breakfast was a great variety. Clean pool. Helpful staff. Thought it was closer to disney than it was.  Only down fall was lack of parking but they offer free valet parking.

Last year this place was good don't know if they change management but we just returned from our weekend and from the beginning. ..I got charged for the first night two days before we checked in ( hotel policy) that's what Claudia (employee) told us when we called to find out why we were getting changed in advance.  Then I guess as a punishment or revenge we got the most crappiest room ever!! We found skittles in the floor, rusted appliances, blood stains in the mattresses, blonde hair in the "clean" towels.... We definitely not staying here ever again. Blonde

Hotel staff was very nice and helpful but the hotel condition overall was terrible.  Room smelled of mold and mildew upon entering.  A/c unit was very old and made a clicking sound all night.  I also think that a "sky light" in the room is a terrible idea.  Sleeping in is one of the perks of being on vacation, and a "sky light" does not help.

This place is horrible.  The photographer did an excellent job photo shopping his pictures because it looks nothing like the photos in real life.  The breakfast was disgusting and I would not even feed it to my dog.  Not impressed.  Go down the street to Embassy or Springhill Suites by Marriott is you want a pleasant stay and wonderful food.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: Great place to stay  Close to everything  Clean comfortable rooms  Free breakfast was good...need a bit more seating if possible Parking was OK the underground parking helped a lot  Price was within budget

Summary Heading: Not worth the price, doesn't look like the pics shown on the outside of the property
Summary: We stayed in a suite, a room with two beds and a living room with a pull-out sofa.  Upon arriving, the parking lot was jammed full with no where to park.  So we go check in and the manager tells us to park in the underground parking lot (which we didn't know bc the parking lot seems attached to the other hotel) but they must share.  We were disappointed with the hotel bc we did not realize it was like a motel-type where each room has their own door entrance instead of a main entrance.  The photos are VERY DECEIVING. The rooms were ok, motel quality.  We arrived at midnight from Disneyland and overslept.  We called the front office at 10:30 a.m. (Sunday) and asked if we could check out at 12 the latest and they simply replied no in a rude way. They said we had to get out right at

I expected much less than we received. The room was nice and comfortable. Breakfast was quite nice and varied everyday. The room was modern and the pool was nice except I wish the pool hours we longer.overall stay was good.

See above. We tired  to find another hotel but all were booked.  Would never go back. Very noisy, expensive for what you get. No internet. Breakfast is ok.  Rooms musty and furniture  falling apart.   Go somewhere else.

Summary Heading: Very pricey and no good customer service
Summary: We stayed at the cortona inn for four night and it wasn't the greatest experience. The room was smelly parking was extremely limited and the customer service was about a 3 of 10. We won't be staying here ever again. They really need to step it up if they want to compete with the neighborhood hotel with better rates and better customer service.
Manager Response: Dear himynameis23, Thank you for your review.  Sounds as though the places you visited in the Anaheim Resort didn't meet your expectations.  We cant address your dissatisfaction with the Disneyland Parks, or the Napoli Restaurant, but we will offer our apologies if we failed to deliver outstanding customer service during your stay with us.  Should you plan a return visit to the Anaheim Resort, please allow us another opportunity to help make your stay an enjoyable one. Thank you once again for your comments.  John

Summary: Hotel had the best beds I've ever slept on ..customer service was fantastic I swear before I hung the phone the x tar towels were at our door..the only. Downside was the parking ...fighting with Hyatt place for spots..breakfast was phenomenal

While staying at this hotel I was not impressed with the check in. We checked in at 3:30  and our room was not ready. We were downgraded from floor 3 to the first floor. Crowded breakfast room with no where to sit so I brought it back to my subpar room. Only decent thing about this hotel is the location. Which many options around it like the Hyatt and Red Lion I would advise you to look elsewhere.

We were very impressed with this hotel and was close to Disneyland.  There was a pool nearby and the rooms were outstanding!!  The rooms were very clean.  We would stay again here if we went back to Disneyland.

The hotel was a great location not far from Disneyland at all. However, I do recommend buying the ART pass which is for the bus system if you are going to Disneyland because after a long day the last thing you want to do is walk back to the hotel. It is not worth parking T Disneyland as they have parking off site, which is across the street from the hotel so no sense to pay double parking.  Parking was covered as part of resort fee. Along with free Wi-Fi however it was not a good connection as I kept losing signal. Breakfast options was great since it was included as well. There was eggs, potatoes, sausage, waffles, toast, cereal, pastries, coffee.

This is an OK hotel for your Disneyland hotel. It's close to the parks and to the main streets. Rooms are spacious. Bathroom is quite disappointing. Carpet needs to be replaced. Guests do not respect the DO NOT SMOKE signs, and they smoke outside the rooms. Breakfast is very basic, it's all bread, no healthy options here, it's clearly geared towards kids. Parking was an issue: two nights I came back late and was assigned parking next to the fire lanes... thankfully I did not get a ticket for parking there...

Room was very presentable and clean, for the most part.  There were strands of long hair in the bathtub. I don't know how one could have missed those.  Our room had a fridge, which was very useful. The walls and ceiling didn't insulate the noise coming from the other rooms, though.  Two solid nights of footsteps and kids running.. If it wasn't so noisy I would have enjoyed the comfortable bed more. The parking was more than adequate.  The location was great.  Walking distance to Disneyland and lots of shopping and restaurants in between.

Stayed in a One Bedroom Siena Executive Suite...I was expecting a better room for the price. The website stated that some suites have been remodeled, apparently we did not stayed in a remodeled suite. The rug in the room was slightly damp and the room had a slight musty odor. The musty smell most likely came from the mildew stain we saw under the sofa bed itself, not only in our room, but observed the same in other rooms that were being cleaned. The sofa bed was uncomfortable, found a spider web and spider behind entrance door as well as a couple of spiders in the bathroom.   Continental breakfast was very good and accommodating. The ladies preparing the breakfast were very nice as well as the housekeeping lady.

Very affordable for family on a budget. Well maintained property, nice rooms, very comfortable beds. Nice pool. About 2 blocks from Disneyland, but close to ART & Disney shuttles. free breakfast was just average, but okay for a quick bite before heading to the park. plan on leaving your car at the hotel as parking fills up fast.

Rooms smelled like mildew and they were dirty, the pictures on the website are accurate, but they should take a close up. Couches were filthy and thread bear. Hotel staff was unwilling to help us once we told them we were checking out. We booked for 2nights,but checked out after 4 hours.

Like location. Have stayed last 6 years. Brought my brother for first time And they never were able to get a parking spot. Not once in three days. Ugh location changed when Hyatt built in their lot. !!

Ever since we became annual pass holders for Disneyland we had been trying different place to stay at. This stay was amazing and we walked to Disneyland so it was convenient. Definely we will be staying here again soon

Visited for 3 days.  Very close to Disneyland and DCA. We walked every day. It's about a mile. Room was very clean. The staff was very friendly.  I was able to park right out in front of my room. Breakfast was not elaborate but when traveling with kids they only cared about leaving with a full belly; which they did. Nice stay. Good value.

This hotel was perfect for my family.  Aside from a great price during peak season, the property and rooms were very clean.  We stayed in a King suite and had a great stay with our family.  The staff was very nice and very fast with requests for extra towels, requests were brought in minutes.  Breakfast was basic but well stocked.  Parking can get hairy but we had a spot every night.

We have just spent 7 nights here. The room was nice recently renovated very clean. The free breakfast isn't special but it has cereal toast and cakes & juice. Saves you looking for somewhere to get breakfast  but getting a seat can be hard depending on the time you go. There is free parking a bonus. Beds are comfy. There is a laundry with was clean. I would defiantly stay here again in fact I tried to extend for another 10 days but it was booked out.

Summary Heading: Great alternative to the big chain hotels
Summary: We always stay here when there's a 3 day tournament at the convention center. Walking distance from the ACC, and much more affordable than the big chain hotels nearby. Breakfast is included, and ground level rooms make it easy to get the kids and all their stuff in and out of the car. Big family suites with bunk beds are nice, but not as good of a value for the money. Standard rooms are still plenty big, and still include a microwave and mini fridge.

Summary Heading: Pleasant place to stay for families!
Summary: We are a family of 4 that stayed in the One Bedroom Toscana Kids Suite on the ground floor, mid May.  We LOVED it!  Lot's of space, perfect for families!  We found it was a 17-22 min walk to Disneyland.  What we loved about this Hotel: 1. Large suites for family - two room suite with bunk beds, couch, king/queen bed, sitting nook, reading lights on kid's bed, fridge, microwave, desk, 2 flat screen tvs, new decor and furniture. 2. Parking, Wifi, Breakfast included - they totally got the breakfast right!  Lots of options and really like the hot items and variety.  (eggs, round sausage, english muffins, toast, waffles, cereal, fruit, juice, milk, pancakes, donuts, etc).  The breakfast staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help. We asked for 2  bananas and they gave

This motel proves the "location, location, location" rule of real estate. It's near the Anaheim Convention Center and Disney, but has nothing else going for it. The room had no thought put into the design (no convenient electrical outlets), the toilet was running when I checked in (drought?), the pool was an oversized bathtub, and, since it's a motel, the window has to be kept covered so that people walking past can't look in. The complimentary breakfast was not worth the money. And I was charged about $190 per night for this.

Wonderful staff working there, very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast every morning in quite a spacious dining area, with a choice of hot or cold food, although I did miss my vegemite on toast (for those Aussies out there, bring your own from home).  Bit of a walk to Disneyland, but you also get a chance to check out what restaurants are about.  The room was comfortable and had all the mod cons like microwave, fridge, coffee maker, iron.   The only thing that bothered me was, as we were on the second floor (there are three in total), we could here every person walk or run from the room above us.  And when it happens at midnight or 1am, it becomes quite annoying. My only suggestion to those who will be staying is to request for a third floor room, and if you do get it, then please

The hotel's location is excellent if you are visiting Disneyland. It has access to a shuttle that will take you to the park. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the breakfast was good. The only complaint we had is that the ceiling insulation could be better.  We could hear the people in the room above us.cortina

This hotel is a few blocks from Disneyland, a walk we did a few times. However, I remembered from reading other reviews that hotel guests had used the parking shuttle offered across the road and so we did too! A constant flow of big blue buses ferry people from the parking lot to Disneyland, until 1 am each day. The hotel was set back from the road which makes it quiet, away from traffic. The room was big however there was a damp smell which wasn't pleasant. The beds were comfortable. However, they lost points for a very ordinary breakfast! So many unhealthy options, yuk! Also my biggest issue was the wifi. Not sure if this is a problem for all rooms but the wifi kicked us off every few minutes. Very very frustrating. Cortona could easily fix these issues and improve guest

The beds were by far the best part of the room. Comfortable pillow tops. The moisture in the air has given rise to a musty smell in the room that is unpleasant. The pool is a good size and the hot tub is a nice bonus. The breakfast was plentiful and easy to get to on your way to the parks.

We stayed with 3 kids and the bunk bed plus pull out couch was perfect! The free breakfast and free parking was a plus. We walked across the street to take the Disneyland shuttle bus as the walking distance to Disney is a bit far for a 5 year old after 11 hours at Disney. The bus worked out perfectly though. Since it is a family friendly hotel, it comes with lots of noise of kids running around until late at night and early in the morning, the only drawback.

I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We booked a complete trip to Disneyland and this hotel through Costco. We had booked a suite with 2 rooms, 1 with a Queen and 2 bunk beds, the other with a king bed. Because of some quirk, our room was booked. However they gave us a suite with bunk beds and 2 queens, and the enjoining room with 2 more queens. I believe they handled it correctly and we were happy. Some people complained on Trip Advisor about their breakfast but we felt it was adequate and we were content with what they offered: eggs sausage toast (etc.) plus plenty of sweets. It's not top notch, but very adequate. The pool was decent and the staff was very helpful.

Room was clean and comfortable. Has microwave and refrigerator. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room had a binder with menus of restaurants that delivered.  I've stayed in other hotels in this area and would definitely stay at The Cortona again.

The king suite was great! Loved the extra room. The bed was soft and wonderful and had plenty of pillows! Everything was clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. In and out privileges with parking was very helpful.

Stayed here in May for 4 nights so we could do Disneyland etc, very pleased with the proximity to Disneyland and cleanliness.   Rooms very spacious. Laundry facility was good. Pool and Spa pool were very nice.  Easy walk to Garden Walk for nice restaurants  I would avoid the breakfast, we only ate there the first morning, it was pretty terrible with the only healthy option being a piece of fruit.   If you need directions or need to know anything, I wouldn't ask the front desk ladies, they really had no idea. Even something as simple as where do we get the ART bus to Disneyland from made no sense (the girl told us a couple of times to catch the bus from the wrong place). In fact, don't bother with an ART pass, save your money.  They were very helpful however with organizing a

Room was clean and recently renovated with confy beds,  breakfast was pretty basic but did the job, little better than your standard continental breakfast.  You do have a microwave and small fridge in your room with stores in close range.  Parking is a little slim and you often have to fight for parking or they vale will park in some rather odd places.  While we were there construction was going on in the front of the property for another hotel chain that is not related to the Cortona.  Good think about this property is is is far off the street so you don't get any of that noise like the other hotels on Habor St.   Pool does the job,  basic with a hot tub.  Walk from Disneyland will seem very long after a long day. Staff was wonderful and very helpful.

Summary Heading: Noisy but comfortable. Avoid the breakfast.
Summary: Beds were comfortable and room was nice. I could tell the maids worked very hard. Had a flight cancellation that didn't allow me to get there my first night and was charged full price. It wasn't my fault, so don't appreciate being charged full price. Breakfast left MUCH to be desired.

Summary Heading: Great family place to attend Disneyland!!
Summary: We had 3 families attend Disneyland together so the Cortina was a perfect place to stay. The price was right and the location awesome. We were at Disneyland from 8am- 10 pm so it was a place to sleep and eat breakfast.

Just returned from a family trip to Disney Land.  The Cortona was a nice budget hotel.  The beds were excellent, new and very compfy. Bedding was new and clean. Housekeeping was very good.  Breakfast was just OK. We purchased food from the grocery store and preferred to eat in our room.  Breakfast consisted of toast, English muffin, fruit loops, oatmeal, apple juice, orange juice, coffee, sweet rolls, apples, bananas, oranges,and some premade hot food. Sausage partties, egg patties, warmed pancakes. Wifi very slow and kicks us off often. Pool was decent for a budget hotel.

Summary Heading: So many problems, its difficult to know where to begin...
Summary: I did like their breakfast. It was bulkier than a continental, but not a full breakfast. But, that's the last good thing I will say. Our room was located underneath the stairs and next to the laundry. To say that it was noisy would be an understatement - late into every night, and then beginning at 5am with housekeeping chattering away in the laundry room. Housekeeping made our beds, but left the sink area a mess; didn't replace the coffee at the coffee station, or even empty out the dirty filter from the day before. They also took our towels, and didn't replace them. Plus, they didn't leave any toilet paper when we ran low, so we had to chase them down when we were out of toilet paper. The wi fi was slow to non-existent. Each day we had to cancel out their wi fi and add it

Hotel was very clean and beds were pretty comfy.  I would stay here again.  Super close to Disneyland but I wouldn't walk there since you walk shop much at Disney as it is and the walk is about 10 minutes

Summary Heading: Friendly and good value for money. :)
Summary: Lovely place to stay. Friendly and helpful staff. All amenities provided. Pool and spa nice after a long day at Disneyland. Breakfast was good. Would have been nice to be able to heat the boiled eggs.

Dirty rooms that smelled bad.  Subpar breakfast.  Not worth the price to stay here.  The location was good, not far from Disneyland.  Seems to be an older property, pretty run down.  The class of guests seemed pretty bad also.  Shady looking people.  Would not leave my daughter alone there.

Summary Heading: Good choice for value and location
Summary: This hotel was close to Disney and reasonably priced. The room worked out well for us ( five beds in total). However, only one bathroom for five of us, and no lock on bathroom door. Showerhead was falling out of wall and we had to screw it back on. Window locks fell off if you touched them and windows were loose in their casings. Overall felt old but was clean and both TV's were newer and worked fine. Continental breakfast was limited and worse than most we've had. For a large hotel, they had one station of hot food which was never enough for the amount of people waiting to eat. Spent a lot of time waiting for them to heat and re fill, and often eggs/sausages were served cold. Need to increase quantity and choices offered to compete with other similar hotels.

The hotel looked decent and the beds were comfy. But the first three days we stayed the room key didn't work and we had to get someone to let us in every single time, even at 1am...after several attempts. We complained enough that they moved our room, which was nice. But in the midst of everything our two year olds Mickey Mouse light up sword was left in the first room. The staff was well aware that we were still in the hotel and didn't return the item. The next day when we checked out and noticed it was missing we asked to check the first room again (no one else was staying there due to the broken door) it was no where to be found. So very disappointed that they would steal from a two year old. All in all I'm not impressed and would not recommend this hotel. We will spend a

We arrived for family vacation at Disneyland with an infant and a toddler.  Had to wait as room wasn't ready. After an hour wait we received key to our room. Upon opening door we noticed a very unpleasant musty smell. Went back to front desk and requested another room. We were given key to another room. When we got to the room another family was just entering the same room with their key.  Back to front desk, third time lucky maybe?  Nope. But we were very tired from early flight and travelling with small children.  Checked in to room and immediately called Expedia to request help finding a clean room , without mouldy windows and musty smell. We ended up at the Best Western Stovalls Inn.    Clean and comfy.   La cortona? No thanks!!!!
Manager Response: Hi Denise, Thank you for your review.  I understand how you feel and would like to apologize for the less than satisfactory experience.  Our team has also been reminded to ensure that windows are cleaned and free of dirt or mold. Thank you again for taking the time to share your comments.  John

Summary: Pretty good rates has a decent breakfast rooms are clean but could use a little updating maybe some painting inside the rooms but overall a good deal got are Disneyland tickets through them and it was a cheaper rate
Manager Response: Hi Kristofer, Thank you for your review.  Happy to hear that you were satisfied with your stay.  Your comments are appreciated and taken very seriously.  Happy to know our breakfast met with your satisfaction. Thanks again, John

Summary: The biggest draw of the Cortona for us was the rooms, a king bed in one room with bunk beds and a pull-out couch in the other. It was so nice to have each kid in their own bed so we all slept better. The king bed was very comfortable and we could watch the fireworks from our room. Breakfast was ok, there was always a protein of some sort, oranges and apples and a typical continental breakfast spread of carbs. During the morning rush they didn't do the best job keeping the food stocked but we never had to go without, it just took 5-10 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear Melissa, Thank you for your nice review of our hotel. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and the room. We do hope that you will be returning to us in the future! Thank you.

Summary Heading: It did the job but that's about it.
Summary: Beds were comfortable and the room was clean. Water pressure was very low and the hot water did not get as hot as I like for my shower. It was about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. Our only big issue was that we spent 16 hours on our feet at Disneyland then made the walk to the hotel and walked up to the 2nd floor to our room only to find our key cards didn't work. Supposedly my credit card info was somehow "erased" from their system so the cards were deactivated to ensure I went to the office. I would have much rather had a courtesy call and stopped by the office on my way up. Breakfast was ok, not as big as a usual continental breakfast but again just enough to get the job done.
Manager Response: Dear Shaun, Thank you for your review of our hotel.  I'm sorry to hear that you had an issue with you key cards,  however pleased that our clerks were able to resolve the issue with you.   Please accept our apologies for the frustration this may have caused you.  Sincerely, John

Summary: It was my 1st visit to Anaheim, I do usually stayed at WDW Resorts when in Florida however I wasn't able to afford the rates for this past weekend. I saw the CI in one of the Flash Sales sites, they did not have availability for the dates I was looking for however as a Disney TA I was able to book over the phone with Disney  The  Front Desk Staff was extremely Friendly - Dulce and  Esmeralda made me feel at home  as I was travelling alone  Don't expect luxury  It was a Safe . Clean  and  for me walking distance hotel to WDW  - I did take the Art Buses coming back as my legs were so tired  I did not try the breakfast or pool however they were both available for no charge  The one little thing I was disappointed is that I have to buy  time in computer to print my boarding passes
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. Wow you traveled from East coast to go to Disneyland? That was a bit of travel. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and was able to have fun at the West Coast Disneyland park. We hope you come out again and stay with us in the future!

Summary: Overall I'm pleased with the Cortona Inn and suites. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. My only complaints are that our bathroom sink didn't drain well and the breakfast was less than great. But we were looking for an affordable option to stay close to Disney and got what we wanted.
Manager Response: Hi Lia, Thank you for your review.  We are pleased to know you enjoyed your stay and that we met with your satisfaction.  Thank you for taking time to share your comments.  Best, John

Summary: We got in at night exhausted from a full day at Disneyland to finally get settled in and get in bed to find the bathroom sink was clogged up. Being way too tired, used the tub. Got up early the next morning used the bath tub again. Rushing to make the marathon, didn't have the extra time to deal with someone to intrude to fix it. That was a bummer but we worked around it. All 5 of us.

The hotel was decent. Low prices and fairly close to Disneyland. Cons the noise from outside of the room, the room above, and the stairs was very loud, made it hard to sleep past 8:00 am. The maid left the door unsecured after she cleaned the room. we found it after a very long day at Disneyland. Nothing was missing, but our sense of security was shot, just got the towels ourselves.

This was a very nice place.  We had room on 3rd floor middle ways...elevator close enough, breakfast area was small but ok. We stayed 2 nights rode shuttle (ART) to Disney because of wheelchair. Front desk people were really nice and very helpful. Felt secure all around. Nice place to stay for money.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and will return someday!

Summary: Cortona has the best bed I've ever slept on. The staff was so nice, especially Esmeralda. Breakfast selection was good. Only complaint is Cortona advertises they are much closer to Disneyland then they actually are. Be prepared to walk a mile to get there.

I traveled with 3 sponsors and 13 high school students and found Cortona Inn & Suites online. It was a great find! The rooms were great, the staff was amazing, and they had really good service. Breakfast was just ok....but not bad. Bananas and peanut butter would be a good addition! Thank you!!

Mostly positive here. The best beds we stayed in, so very comfy. Good location and friendly staff. Breakfast was good had a few options, we didnt enjoy it though as its not what we normlly eat. Donuts and danishes for breakfast I couldnt stomach. Some times there was eggs and potatos. Housekeeping would be the worst complaint. When we first opened the room it looked clean but smelt awful, it smelt like someone had pee-ed in the corner. It was a ground floor so most likely damp and lack of fresh air. The day we has them come in and service they made the bed but didnt give us towels, then the next day we got a floor mat but no extra towels or toilet paper, it seemed as though no thought had gone into cleaning, or they were just very distracted and kept forgetting. The staff at the

As soon we got in the room the kids were fighting over the top bunk. Once we decided the boys got the bunks and the girls got the sofa bed, peace ensued. We were surprised to see that each bunk had it's own light. The large bed in the 'grown-up' part was wonderful. Much better than the one we have at home. The breakfast was great. I loved the orange juice and the premade waffles. The kids loved making their own sausage egg muffins and having donuts for breakfast dessert. It was great being able to fill up before a day at the Disney parks. If we had to be at a hotel 2 blocks from Disney, we were glad we got one as good as the Cortona. We also loved returning from a day at the parks and having orange citris water in the lobby before our return to the room, which was always looking

Overall our visit was good. Parking was free, rooms were clean and breakfast was tolerable. We went to check-in and the parking was packed, good to know we could Park underground. We were given Parking passes for 5 days (there's a gate to go into to park) even though we only stayed 3, which was cool. The guys inside were pretty helpful in our check in. Our first morning, housekeeping knocked on our door at 8am. I know and understand they want to get a head start and it was my fault for not putting the "do not disturb" sign. I still though it was early because checkout isn't until 11am and the Disney Park doesn't open until 10am. The hotel was super close the the Toy Story and Friends parking. Just walk across the street and take the free Disney shuttle to the park. We saved a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We will talk to housekeeping as they should try not to  go into rooms too early as you said. however they do need to get rooms cleaned for the next guest that would check in . Guests want to check in by 3pm so it does not give housekeeping much time to get rooms cleaned. As you said you could have put a do not disturb sign out and would avoid housekeeping knocking on the door. Good point to make to other travelers! Thank you.

Summary: The positive side of the stay was that the staff was extremely friendly. One of the friendliest hotel staffs I have encountered. What was not so great was the fact that the door to our room was WIDE OPEN after we checked in. Check in starts at 3pm and we got to our room around 3:40pm. I think that is plenty of time to have the room ready...it was odd. Then, upon leaving our room, we discovered that our room keys didn't even work. Had to take them back down to fix them. Hotel room was what you'd expect from a mid-range hotel. Nothing impressive but nothing terrible. Also, the shuttle to Disneyland is not free from this hotel. It is $5 a person per day. I think next time I might spend a little more on a nicer hotel with a complimentary shuttle.

Terrific value, includes breakfast and a sunny pool. This is a very family friendly budget hotel but worked great for my business conference at the Marriott. Close walking distance to the Marriott and Convention Center.

We have stayed with Cortona Inn and Suites in the past and they are very customer service oriented!!  The hotel in Anaheim, CA is beautiful and the two room suite is amazing.  We are extremely happy with all the staff including the assistant manager Arron who was more than accommodating for us and our trip. I would highly recommend their hotel.
Manager Response: Kathryn, We are glad to hear that you recommend our hotel. We look forward to your next stay with us. Thanks for praising Arun for his accommodating assistance.!

Summary: The hotel was close to the convention center, 8 minute walk.   The most annoying thing was the fan was always on when the bathroom light was on, and the fan was so loud! Beds were comfortable, large suite, plenty of room.  Parking was a bit of a hassle, but we used the Hyatt parking garage, not sure if we were supposed to or not, but oh well, once you're parked, you can walk anywhere anyways.  I would stay again for the price I paid!

I was staying at this hotel for the Star Wars Celebration in April. I felt ripped off paying $200 per night, when locals were getting this hotel on Groupon for $60.  The hotel was maybe a 2 star and a basic, clean hotel.  Nothing Fancy at all, but it was a nice, quiet and clean hotel, i would stay again, if i am around, but not for the outrageous price of $200.  I would be ok paying $60-$70.  The WiFi was in and out, not fast at all! Breakfast was really good everyday, eating area was clean!

Summary Heading: Good place to stay with a family and very friendly and accomodating staff.
Summary: The hotel is convenient to Disneyland and a good place to stay with a family.  The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable, except the pull out couch. There are nice linens on the bed and thick towels in the bathroom.  The continental breakfast was average but did offer some protein every morning as well as cereal, fruit and pastries.  The ART shuttle to get to Disneyland is close to the hotel and comes frequently.  We would stay at the Cortona again.

Summary Heading: In expensive but comforable Hotel Inn.
Summary: Stayed there for approximately 10 days. Arrived very early (8am) to check in into the hotel , the staff were very accommodating. The room was in very good condition, fresh towels (everyday), complementary coffee, sugar & cream & safe provided. We found the staff to be were very professional, friendly & helpful. The Inn is situated within the convention area roughly 12 mins from Disney. There are many restaurants around this area, just ask Esmeralda (hotel concierge) at front desk. All shuttles can be caught in and around this area, ask at front desk if you need to travel to various locations. I  recommended this Hotel for the budget conscious travelers for great deals for accommodations, you wont be disappointed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn and Suites. We are glad to hear that you  stay was enjoyable and that you would recommend us to others.  Good to see that you also gave some suggestions to other travelers. We hope to see you on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Met basic needs, not much else
Summary: Liked: price, location, cleanliness, friendly staff Disliked: noise (2 out of 4 nights), breakfast (lacks fresh, healthy options), room lighting, long wait at front desk at morning checkout. If you're traveling with family and want an affordable base for Disneyland or other local attractions, this place might suffice. If you plan to spend much time in the room or have needs beyond basics, you may want to think twice.

The room was fine. Few spots on decorative pillows- basic room.  Fine for price. However the room was located right next to the laundry room. I had employees and cart noises that woke me up from 5 to 6 am- horrible when I needed to sleep.  Breakfast was good for the price of the room

Aneheim is a great location to use as a base for college hunting in Socal.  We had never stayed at the Cortona, but found a great deal," Welcome Weekend," online and thought we would check it out. We stayed on the 3rd floor,the top floor, which I would recommend.  We had been upgraded to a suite and it was very comfortable and spacious. The only negative was that some of the towels had long hairs all over them (but there were plenty of other towels) and the bed sheets were discolored. The breakfast was perfect for a grab and go day and the service was pleasant. if you have young kids it is a bit of a walk each day to and from Disneyland, but doable. I would stay here again when visiting the Happiest Place on Earth.

We stayed here for 3 days with my family. 2 adults and 2 teenage daughters. The rooms were huge considering how reasonably priced it was to stay. Free, breakfast, free wifi and free parking and close to everything you need. The staff were so helpful and friendly even when we were having trouble paying for our accommodations and found our credit card had been skimmed in New York, our bank had put a hold on the card. They were happy to keep our booking until everything was sorted out. Very professional. The beds were very comfy and it was great to have a fridge and microwave in the rooms. We would stay here again.

Went to Anaheim for a convention, didn't want to do one of the over priced tower hotel chains, and didn't want to venture too far from the convention center or try one of the Disneyland Dives across from the theme park. Cortona is nestled between the two big box hotels inside the same city block as the convention center, a short walk from door to door. Staff was very friendly and accommodating, like most great independents are. Parking was free and adequate (they were sold out so I didn't get to park right outside my room, but still easily found a spot). The Wi-Fi was spotty at times, but I have to admit I was using an older model Ipad with some very dated software. Definitely will stay here again if I attend another event at the Convention Center.
Manager Response: Steven, We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and will be returning in the future. Yes we are very convenient to the Convention center and Disneyland! Look forward to you next visit with us!

Summary Heading: Helpful staff and close to Disney
Summary: I took a group of 29 high school students on a senior trip to Disney and we stayed at the Cortona Inn.  The staff was so very helpful and accomodating.  There were only a few drawbacks for a large group that needs to be supervised such as all of the rooms faced the great outdoors making it more difficult to police, and there were several young couples smoking pot in the parking lot late at night.  We had absolutely no problems and the hotel was so very helpful letting us have two rooms for a late checkout  so we could go to the beach before our flight and have someplace to clean up before we left.  I would recommend this property to any family or group.  There is public transportation (ART bus) for $12 for a three day pass making Disney so much more appealing.  Otherwise, the

I had a few special requests, and the hotel staff was very responsive.  The maids were timely and very helpful.  Even the front desk was helpful throughout my stay.  Best of all, parking was included in the room rate, so there were no surprises.

Stayed here 3 years in a row for a convention.  I like the ease of breakfast, staff is always restocking if needed.  Walked to Disney a few times and the other person staying with me took the bus, location is easy to get to Disney and really easy for the Convention Center.  Clean, friendly and reasonably quiet.

Summary Heading: Successful vaca for this family of 6
Summary: The hotel staff was amazing and very accommodating.  We were traveling with our 5 month old baby so we needed extra stuff.  They helped move the stroller and swing that we rented to our room, as well as set up the crib for baby.  Our other 3 kids loved their room with their own beds, their own TV, and a door that closed.  We purchased Southern California City passes from the hotel.  The front desk didn't have enough, so the manager came in to get a few more for us within the hour that I had originally inquired about them.  They also saved us a lot of money by buying the passes from the hotel.  The hotel was close enough to Disneyland that we were able to walk back and forth. It was also close to the freeway, so we were able to jump on and off when we went to the beach and Sea

Staff was very helpful and nice, Close by to Disney, Liked how it was off the main road a little, it made it more quiet and peaceful.  Me and my family of 6 stayed in a suite with a pull out bed.  Was nice and comfy.

The hotel was great overall! I was definitely impressed by the distance it was to Disneyland. Although not right across the street it was definitely an easy walk to head back to the park without worrying about transportation again. Breakfast was fine in the morning! They kept it clean and refilled at all times and their staff was very nice. I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend it to someone else.

The location was great for a good neighbor hotel.  The staff was great and easy to work with.  Tickets to Disneyland were the best deal that I had found.  We were able to easily get to Disneyland.  However, the hotel was not great.  Our pool view was on the bottom floor looking at the parking lot.  The room decor was updated but the duvet cover had a big hole in it.  Air conditioner did not work great and super musty.  The bathrooms had bugs everyday in there.  The walls were super thin.  It was definitely a low cost hotel.  The continental breakfast was not good.  Very limited supply of everything and everyday was the same.  Not many cereal choices, bagel/muffin choices, or fruit options.  The donuts were so moist they tasted like they had gotten wet.  By the end, no one even

Nice hotel just 10 minutes from disney. The hotel even sells tickets to the park. It was a bit loud but that was expected at a hotel that caters to young families. The free breakfast was nice. They warn you that you might have to wait but we only waited a few minutes for a table 1 of the 4 mornings we were there.

I took my kids to anaheim on a last minute whim before spring break passed. This hotel made our stay better than what I had planned. The continental breakfast got us off to a great start every morning, my kids just hoped the pool would stay open later. The room was clean and the beds were oh so comfortable especially after a long day at the parks or sightseeing. Even when I thought I couldn't find a parking spot the security guard came to the rescue and found a perfect spot for us. I would definitely stay here again!

Stayed here for 8 nights with my daughter and boyfriend. We upgraded to one of the suites  so we would have extra room because a little privacy is needed for anyone after a week. It was fine. Positives: the "living room" was a nice feature and after haggling on price got the suite for the same price originally quoted for the standard room, there was 2 air conditioners (we could keep the bedroom and other living space at different temps, the fridge was a decent size (bigger than the average beer fridge), the pool had later hours than many places I've stayed. Negatives: room smelled musty (we think from the air conditioning, there were no screens on the windows so if we opened it to air out the room bugs could come in, the tub drain was clogged, the room wasn't always cleaned

Rooms were very small. Everything was clean. A/C unit cover was coming off. Carpet in corners were raised. Room door had dents. Staff was friendly. Sliding door for closet with a safe. Not what I expected, disappointed.

Our cheer team came back again this year!  Reina and the whole staff were terrific. We booked six suites for our moms and cheerleaders.  The cheerleaders loved the free early breakfast and had a great time in the pool. The suites gave us plenty of room to gather and enjoy the stay. We will return next year!
Manager Response: Regina, Thank you for your review of our hotel and the nice comment about Reina! We look forward to your next stay with us and thank you for your loyalty!

Summary: We went to So Cal for a quick Disney trip over spring break.   We had two rooms (attached by a common door) which was good for traveling with teenagers.  The rates were competitive and they sold Disney tickets which was convenient.    The "deluxe continental breakfast" was not so good, low quality.  Parking was scares and we ended up in a garage if we came back late at night.  Parking was free (bonus) but if you are in the garage, its a real trip with luggage.    Rooms were updated, clean, and had plenty of room (no bugs is sight)

Summary Heading: Not bad, had a nice quick stay.
Summary: Our stay during our Disneyland trip. The hotel was ok for the price. We were mostly gone the entire day, and only slept their. The room was always cleaned with new towels every day.  The kids enjoyed a quick swim in the pool. The breakfast was just ok, the hot choices were a little bland. The kids ate cereal.  Better coffee would have been nice!! You can tell that the hotel is well used, the place was so busy every day. Pretty clean for the most part. The wifi was a little off & on, but ok when it was on. The staff were nice and helpful!

I suppose this is what I get for booking last minute and letting price be a huge factor. Searched the hotels within walking distance of the convention center. This one stated that is usually costs $220 a night and they were offering 35% off. I would have been even more disappointed had I paid full price. It's small and outdated. The front desk people were pleasant enough, but looked fairly disheveled. Shirts were wrinkled and they just looked tired. Even though they had just come on shift. Once, we entered our room, we were hit with the aroma of an old stale motel 6. Room was clean and simple. Awkward lighting around mirror and way too small to leave anything near the sink. It was quiet and beds were comfy. Don't bother staying for the "breakfast". Lines long, not enough food

Summary Heading: Not impressed and cancelled remaining days
Summary: First off the only reason I stayed here was because the Marriott property I wanted to stay at was booked and no one else had availability for a 2 room suite type but Overall it was pretty run down and is basically an upgraded motel 6. I booked the 2 room kids suite and the first thing I noticed when walking in was the smell which wasn't necessarily a very bad smell but smelled like a chlorine scented swimming pool changing room.  while the kids room was a fairly good size you have to take into account it had a bunk bed that made the room look bigger than it actually was. The main entry room where the queen bed was placed was considerably small with limited room to move around comfortably and the Breakfast was not worth the time. The parking is very limited and you'll most likely

Summary Heading: Good for quick stay but skip the free breakfast
Summary: Stayed 2 nights in the executive suite which was 2 queen beds and a sofa bed for a family of 5.  The room was decent and we had lots of space.  We did not use the pool or hot tub due to time constraints.  We opted to walk to Disney parks and Downtown Disney instead of paying $17 for parking.  The walk was not bad at all and probably could have made it in 10-15 minutes if we didn't stop to buy bottled water both ways.  We had the free continental breakfast only one morning because it wasn't worth going to a second time.  Basic breads, cereal, sausage patties and eggs. The waffles looked like the thawed out rectangle kind and the orange juice dispense wasn't working very well.  Parking is limited but they did offer the underground parking if ground level wasn't available.  Overall

Summary Heading: Isn't our first visit to Cortona Inn & it definitely won't be out last!
Summary: So, my family and I have stayed at the Cortona Inn & Suites AT LEAST more than a half dozen times the last few years and I must say, each time seems to get better and better. So being a budgeting person, I like to have every dollar accounted for. When my initial reservation deposit wasn't taken out I called them. The loved front desk staff not only found my reservations quickly but said it was because I had 2-cards on file & were going to wait until I checked in to take the money out. I verified which card & they offered to take my stay amount over the phone, to save me time checking in. I must say, the amount of time from my initial check in until I get to my room was less than 10-mins. I told them about the special occasion we were celebrating and a request I had to be on the
Manager Response: Thank you for being such a loyal guest! We are glad to hear that you have stayed with us so many times and will return! Yes there are some great tips you gave, as some people complain about the distance to Disneyland, as its really not that far, but I guess the anticipation of getting there makes people a bit  anxious. I know that If I park my car in the parking lot that Disney has, it actually takes me much longer to get to the main gate! We look forward to  your next sty with us!

Summary Heading: Good price but you get what you pay for.
Summary: The good: Free parking, good price for hotel stay fairly close to Disneyland (we booked on the Cortona site for the best deal in the end), free breakfast, fridge in the room to store our snacks, and a pool. The bad:  We walked to Disneyland and we walked very briskly (passed most everyone) and it took twenty-two minutes to get there and a grueling 25 minutes at the end of the day to get back.  They said it was 10-15 minutes when I called and asked.  The walk to Disneyland was so much further than we presumed and at night after walking around the park all day the walk back was literally painful.  It was just too far and next time I will pay more to be closer.  We originally thought we might come back to the hotel at lunch and swim and rest but we just didn't want to do that walk
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write your review of our hotel. We are working on increasing the seating for our breakfast. We are also looking at more efficiencies to help keep up with the flow. I will talk to housekeeping as they should not be blocking our guests pathways! Thank you

Summary: Cortona inn hotel was a great choice had a very clean room,pool,gift shop,continental breakfast and great and fast service. The staff is very friendly especially the front desk were you check in. Disneyland and restaurants near!

The Cortona Inn was a fantastic place to stay during our Disneyland vacation.  The room was quite big and very clean.  We thought the beds were comfortable as well.  The staff was very friendly and answered so many questions for us.  The hotel offered a continental breakfast which was above standards.  Lots of choices from fresh pasties to pancake and waffles.  They even served biscuits and gravy one morning.  The only problem we encountered with this hotel was our room placement was right next to a stair well which is used to access the 2 and 3 floors.  The noise from people coming and going was horrible.  Seriously no insulation in the walls.  Had to go buy ear plugs for our entire family after listening to the sounds of talking and stomping feet till 2 in the morning.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experiences on your review. Glad that you had enjoyed your stay. However as you said some people forget that there are other people trying to rest and relax at the hotel. We try to keep the noise down. We hope you will return in the near future.

Summary: Our family of six had plenty of room, and a place to put everything!  We all enjoyed the pool and short distance to everything we needed.  Good on the budget.  We had excellent maid services. The room had some drywall cracks, and did not vent very well, but other than that no complaints.

enjoyable stay. although non smoking room had smoky smell. excellent breakfast buffet. QUIET ATMOSPHERE, Kids enjoyed the pool. Short walk to Disneyland. Many restaurants within walking distance to the hotel.

Summary Heading: Good Fit for Family on a Budget
Summary: Very clean, and very friendly staff. We have stayed with them 3 times now, because we are always on a budget, and we trust their property and service for the price. They are always very well organized and accommodating. Within walking distance of the park gates. A perfect fit for a family needing affordable lodging, and not looking for any resort extras. No doubt, we'll be back.
Manager Response: Dear Helene, Thank you for your review. Its good to hear that you are a loyal guest that enjoys our hotel! We look forward to your next visit with us!

Summary: If you're on a budget and not expecting anything upscale then this is the place for you.  The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. That's the best thing I can say about this place. The breakfast wasn't amazing but it's free so who can complain?  I liked that they sold Disneyland tickets. They are also a few dollars cheaper than what the park sells them for. The walk to Disney was maybe 15 min.  I really disliked the fact that people would smoke right outside the rooms. They should have a designated area for smokers. I'm not a fan  of my kids breathing in second hand smoke. I'm amazed at how many people would stand smoking right outside the rooms.  Would I stay here again? Probably not but like I said. If you're on a budget and don't have high expectations

Summary Heading: Overall  very good with some minor annoyance
Summary: We stayed for 7 days at the Cortona. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful, they even pranked our teenage sons when they went to the front desk for some change, we had a good laugh when our boys told us the details.   The Pool was clean and adequate size for playing around in. If you're looking to swim laps it won't be adequate for that.   Parking, while not always available right outside your door, was good and even in the worst case is just a short walk away (less than 1 minute) from your room. I would drop my family at the room and then go park the car. I have used hotels with underground parking that was significantly more  of a hassle and much farther of a walk.  The rooms, while having some definitely older characteristics, were modern enough to be quite

Summary Heading: Excellent rooms for a family of 5
Summary: Very clean and well organized.  Our room was great.  It had a king bed, a bunk bed, and a sofa sleeper with lots of room.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was usually eggs, sausage, pancakes, and cold cereal.
Manager Response: Thank you for  writing such a nice review of our hotel. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We try to do our best to make sure that all of our guests get the best service we can deliver. We look forward to serving you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Resort and excellent customer service!
Summary: We recently stayed at the resort and we were so please with the cleanliness of this resort and also with the friendly staff. Michael went above and beyond to meet our needs. This is where I will be staying from now on when we are in the area.

Walking distance to Disneyland if you like to walk :) good breakfast, clean hotel room, nice pool/hot tub in the center of the whole property.  Great advice when we bought our Disneyland tickets from front desk staff.  Very helpful in explaining details of the parks.

Very nice, friendly staff. They were very helpful and were able to answer all of our questions. There gift shop was well priced and many items to select from. The design of the rooms were well layed out and met the needs of our family. We would stay there again.

Pros: I will start by saying that the staff are very friendly and helpful. They do have a breakfast included which was great as eating out all the time can get very pricey. The room we stayed in had 2 rooms, which was a bonus and it was kept very clean! Tip: Do not stay by the elevator though, as it is very noisy. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland, which was nice. Cons: The free wifi is terrible, if you can even get on! There is a hot tub and pool, but the hut tub is very small and does not fit very many people, and is extremely over chlorinated (to the point of making my eyes burn). I would overall; however, recommend this as a place to stay when you travel to Disneyland for its close proximity and included breakfast.

We stayed Oct of 2014. We got two queen beds on the second floor. The beds were super comfy and the room was clean. Looks like they have done some upgrading because everything looked new. The Staff was great. They provided a continential breakfast which was amazing. Completely different from what I am use to. They have waffles, suasage, you can make breakfast sandwiches, orange juice, apple juice, etc. i would highly recommend this place to everyone.
Manager Response: Dear Stephanie, We are so glad that your experience was to your satisfaction and that you recommend our hotel for other travelers. Some people had made comments of our breakfast that makes it seem like a basic continental breakfast, but as you said there is sausage to make breakfast sandwiches, etc. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: We stayed in January.  Our room was a Suite with two queen beds in one room and a sofa sleeper, desk and entertainment center in another.  We could tell that everything in the suite had recently been renovated and we loved it.  We did not have any of the issues others have described.  The desk and dining room staff were great.  We walked to Disney which was great exercise.  Compared to the surrounding hotels which were much more expensive and offer no free breakfast or internet this was a gem.    We will stay again next year.
Manager Response: Dear Sharon, Thank you for such a nice review of our hotel. Yes there are different opinions and or experiences that people will review us on. Most people have a wonderful time and enjoy our hotel like you. We do hope to see you again soon! Thank you.

Summary Heading: We will stay here every trip
Summary: For the price, this is the best hotel in the Disneyland area. It is a short walk to Disneyland, its family friendly & clean. The staff is always friendly & courteous. This is our 4th time staying here &  look forward to coming back.
Manager Response: Dear Thomas, Thank you for your review of our hotel. You are a pro having stayed with us over 4 times! We are so glad to have you as one of our regulars! We look forward to you next visit with us!!!

Summary: The Corona is close to Disneyland but the complimentary breakfast is terrible. The air conditioning doesn't work well in the rooms. Rooms were clean but there are cracks in the ceiling. The gift shop has strange hours. Staff were friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that your stay was not to your satisfaction and certainly do apologize  . We are working on breakfast as each person has different tastes. I will check into the airconditoner issue in your room as our airconditioners work rather well and in some rooms we have two. However your may have had an issue. I hope you will give us another try in the future.

Summary Heading: Place to sleep, don't expect any bells and whistles
Summary: Stayed for 4 nights in a recent trip to Disneyland.  The room looks a lot nicer on their website - it's really just a basic room.  Not too plush.  If you're here just to sleep, it was fine.  The bed was comfortable.  The room was clean, not crampingly small, comfortable enough.  Not too many easily accessible electrical outlets around.  The room had a mini-fridge, flat screen TV with basic cable, iron & hair dryer.  Our iron was missing the setting knob - still worked.  The iron was also connected to the bottom of the board by a cord which made it difficult to use as it was hard to reach the top of the board.  The hair dryer was loud and really didn't work too well - took awhile to dry hair.  Tub/Shower were okay, although the tub seemed narrow.  Hot water available all the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. You gave some great suggestions to the readers. We look forward to your next stay as you had mentioned you would return.

Summary: Stayed 5 nights here and only have a few small complaints .  1.... The rooms are a little out dated and cheesy . Although it was clean , it felt like we were staying in one of those cheap motels along a dark desert highway . Needs updating and FAST ! 2.... The staff were not very keen to help nor bubbly at all . Although they did help when asked for it , but not one staff member went out of their way to ask if everything was going ok during our stay .  3.... The breakfast is disappointing ! If you want a decent breakfast , go down the street to anywhere but here . Even McDonalds is a better option , unless you're a health freak and like grains so much that you could do without your hot bacon and eggs . Lets face it , we all like to eat healthy , but when on a break you wanna let
Manager Response: Thank you  for your review. Your experiences are important to us and we take everyone's opinions as a n opportunity to improve. We are looking into breakfast items to help improve our breakfast. The walk to Disneyland is not bad as you said however, walking back is tough after a long day at Disney. I always suggest if you have young kids to take the ART shuttle as it makes its less painful walking back. Thank you for your review, and as you said you would consider us in your next visit.

Summary: Checking in was a breeze, even got upgraded to a suite w/o asking. Very polite and efficient person (Ruth) behind the desk. Suite was very clean although smelled a bit musty when you first walk in. The carpets or padding needs replacing but otherwise looked clean. Also when you first turn on the faucet in the  bathroom sink you can smell a sewer smell which is strange because the P-trap under the sink should have prevented that.  But anyway,,,we still liked the place overall, highly recommend it as the place to stay if going to Disneyland.  Free breakfast which was good, nice pool and hot tub, and free parking! WI-Fi was adequate, could have used a stronger signal.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to send out a review of our hotel. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and we look forward in you next visit with us. We will look into some of the items you mentioned as there should not b a smell in the sink as you mentioned. Thank you.

Summary: Big, clean spacious room!  Loved the spa and pool!  Breakfast was delicious!!  We weren't hungry until dinner time!  They let us park in parking lot until midnight the next day!  It was only about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland, so we saved money on parking and breakfast!   For $105 with tax it was an awesome deal!  We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Dear Melissa, Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are happy to hear that your stay was enjoyable and that you liked our large rooms! Good to hear that you will be returning to us and we look forward to that day! Thank you.

Summary Heading: Good value for a popular location
Summary: Excellent price for a decent hotel.  Rooms are clean, has everything you need.  Great for families!  I would suggest planning transportation to Disneyland though, the walk is too long for little ones who are exhausted from a long busy day at the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to give us your review of our hotel. We are glad to hear that your stay was to your satisfaction and we do hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: I was very surprised on how large the rooms and how spacious they were. They were very comfortable.. The bathrooms were a little small.. The only thing I can complain about was the complementary breakfast I feel if they just work on that it would be great!!! some people just need a little more to eat.and a little bit better quality of food just work on that and this hotel would be a 5😊
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to post your review of our hotel. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and felt that our rooms were a good size. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: The property was clean and a convenient location to Disneyland. It was about a 15 min walk to the gate of Disneyland on the same street. There were a variety of restaurants and a cvs pharmacy in the area. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write your review, however you may have been confused as to the ranking. You mentioned that you enjoyed your stay and would stay again yet you rated the hotel at 1 star meaning that you were not satisfied? A five star would mean that you were very happy with the hotel. So in you review your mentioned that you were happy with the hotel and would return? I think you meant to rate us at least a 5 ?

Summary: We stayed in this hotel because it's close to Disneyland but it exceeded our expectations. The staff was really helpful and the rooms very comfy, since the beds are brand new and really spacious. Breakfast was nice also. The price includes the parking and WiFi, and altough Disney is a 10-minute walk, it still beats the price of Disney's parking. I definetly recommend it.
Manager Response: Dear Jose, Thank you for all your wonderful comments of our hotel. We are happy to hear that your stay was to your satisfaction. You have mentioned some nice things and we are really glad that you highly recommend our hotel. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: our 12 night stay was overall very pleasant, the rooms were well appointed and kept very clean. We had a junior suite which was very large and gave both of us enough personal space. With the exception of one girl on check in all of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We had to wait a couple of hours for our room to be ready - despite being told to come back in an hour and it would be ready ..... the girl even requested our room be cleaned while we were still there...... but when we returned we were told rather rudely by another staff member we would have to wait as checkout wasn't until 1100hrs..... after a 15 hr flight and over 22 hrs. travelling .... not happy Jan.  The location was perfect within walking distance of the convention centre and hotels. An easy cab

Summary Heading: Better then some, but needs improvement.
Summary: My family used this hotel for 5 days in January. The room was spacious, and hand more then enough space for our stuff and our family. The room did have that worn feeling, but it was clean, which is a plus. The main issue we had with the hotel was the internet. It was mentioned that this hotel had both WIFI and wired internet. The wired internet was disconnected, and the WIFI was so slow you could go visit Disneyland for a day and come back before a page was loaded. Highly recommend you bring a WIFI hotspot with you, it will work great.  Staff was very helpful, and the pool was great. Breakfast was above standard then other hotels, and great that it was included, b/c breakfast anywhere in town will cost you.   I would stay here again, now that I have my own WIFI hotspot.
Manager Response: Dear Chris, Thank you for your review. We are glad that you were able to enjoy our hotel facilities. We have worked on the internet to help with connectivity and speed. You should see a difference on your next stay with us. Thank you.

Summary: Prior to our Disney trip I read reviews for the Cortona & they were all over the place!  'Great place', dirty, smelly rooms etc.   We didn't know what we were actually going to get.  We were very pleasantly surprised!  The newly remodeled rooms were clean, spacious & comfy.  There were 4 teens & 2 adults in our party so we had the Family Suite, which is just two connecting rooms.  The new mattresses were extremely comfortable.  The only downside to the rooms was the noise from the plumbing.  You know exactly when someone next door, above or below flushes a toilet.  The room was walking distance straight to Disney.  Our second night we took a cab back to the hotel for only $6.  Forget the ART Shuttle at $5 per person.  The staff was friendly & accomadating.  The breakfast was the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write down your comments regarding your stay with us. We are glad to hear that your stay with us was to your expectations. Yes breakfast at I hop gets expensive. We are glad to hear that you feel that Cortona is a great value for travelers. Thanks for the tip on transportation as well. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: I expected the "mini suite" to be just bit more than a small sofa and writing table, however it met our needs.....Did not see the "Deluxe" part of the continental breakfast, toaster waffles, pastries, and cereal really seem average to me - nothing special or Deluxe ...Overall a very good place for a small family to stay while visiting Disneyland parks, helpful staff and just about a 10-15 minute walk straight down Harbor Blvd to the Disney Parks entrance.
Manager Response: Dear James, Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are glad to hear that your stay was to your satisfaction and we look forward to serving you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Good value for money but bad breakfast
Summary: Staying the night before going to Disneyland was a great idea. No stress in the morning trying to beat LA traffic to get to the park early. The room was in good motel standard with two queen size beds. There's an outdoor pool and jacuzzi that were very appreciated by my daughter. We payed $100 for the night, two adults and two kids, including a hot deluxe breakfast. The later was, although good for a US motel, not so much deluxe in my to my taste with only high sugar items like fruit loops, donuts and waffles.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am sorry to hear that you felt that breakfast was not to your satisfaction. We appreciate your comments and look at ways to improve our services. We hope you will stay with us again in the future as we strive to make improvements.

Summary Heading: Nice place, but false advertising on the location
