Summary: Pros:  Super friendly and helpful staff, clean and well appointed rooms, free breakfast, nice pool and hot tub area.  Cons:  Here's where the false advertising comes in.  Their website advertises "just 1-1/2 blocks south of Disneyland Resort Parks" as well as "truly walking distance to the Disneyland Resort Parks" and even "Disneyland® Resort Parks just moments away".  Well, technically any place is walking distance if you have the time.    If you look at Google maps, it even kind of looks like one and a half blocks, but it turns out from the door of your room to the front gate of the parks is 1.2 miles.  I measured.  There are also three or four major intersections to cross between the hotel and the park.  When you've been walking around Disneyland all day, believe me, the last
Manager Response: Thank you fro your review . I understand that you felt that the distance to Disneyland was false advertising. Many of other guest responses reflect that it is not that far. However I guess it depends on how accustomed you are to walking. I walk to Disneyland from the hotel and it takes me 15 to 20 minutes depending on the lights as you said. However your suggestion of taking a shuttle is well noted. I often suggest to guests that if you are not used to walking a lot, I would take the shuttle as after a whole day at Disneyland you are a bit tired. Thank you for your comments.

Summary Heading: Better than expected, would come back again!
Summary: So my family stayed here for a week. We had certain expectations and not a huge budget. We were a little worried due to seeing mixed reviews. The outside is not like the pictures online but everything else is. The beds were very comfy! Bathrooms were clean and looked practically new. Breakfast was good just get there a little early to get a table. The hotel was close to everything! The walk can be tiring after a long day at disneyland but you can always take the shuttle which is a great deal we wish we checked into sooner! We would definitely come back and stay here again. Everything we wanted and needed in a hotel and the staff was great too!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write such a nice review. We are happy to hear your stay with us was great! The beds are new and I personally like them as well! We tested them fro several months to get guests feedback before selecting them. Thank you and we look forward to your return.

Summary: i needed to be near the convention center and it was just a few minute walk.  actually most of my activities were at the Marriot and I was surprised to find that this was next door for a fraction of that place.  Breakfast was ample and the room was clean
Manager Response: Dear David, Glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us during your convention. Yes our little gem is very close to the convention center and as you said is a fraction of the cost of the Marriott or Hilton. Plus you get the free breakfast, free internet and parking. So yes I agree with you that it is a great location for convention guests to stay. Plus the walk to the convention center is 5 minutes so after a long day at the convention center its nice to know your room is 5 minutes away! Thank you for your review.

Summary: This was the first time staying here and I was very pleased.  The room was very clean and spacious.  The beds were comfortable, great shower water pressure, all the TV channels were HD, and the A/C worked like a charm. And FREE PARKING! I think this is my new go to hotel for my Disneyland trips.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review of our hotel. We are glad to hear that your stay was great and that this will be your hotel of choice in the future. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary Heading: Good Hotel for Families if visiting Disneyland
Summary: The Cortona Inn and Suites is spacious  - with a separate bedroom for children. The place was clean. There was free breakfast every morning, but it isn't that great (lots of donuts, white bread etc). They also often ran out of food and drink. However they would come and restock if asked. It's a 20 min walk to Disneyland (about 4 large blocks). There was free wifi but it was pretty slow at times.
Manager Response: Dear Sarah, Thank you for your review of our hotel. we are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to your next visit with us . We try to keep up with the breakfast rush, but sometimes we fall behind, but as you said just a little patience and we get the food out for our guests. We are working on ways to minimize when an item runs out on the buffet table, however just like any buffet, we try to make sure we have a fresh tray ready to replace when an item runs out or low. Thank again for your review.

Summary: We had the family suite that has bunk beds in the kids' room.  The bunk beds were awesome, lots of storage space built in.  And there's a sofa sleeper in the room, so you could actually sleep 4 kids comfortably in there.  And the bed in the main room was very comfortable.  The tv is nice and big, which was nice.    They say there's free wifi, and they provide the password, but the connection is terrible.  You have to go to the front office for wifi.  I would not count on any wifi in the room. And they say free breakfast, but it's not appetizing or at all healthy, so if you love breakfast, save yourself the disappointment and go out to eat. The juice isn't real juice, the eggs are from a powder mix, the pancakes are rubbery.  Gross.  Just gross.
Manager Response: Dear Natalie, Thank you for taking time to write to us about your stay. It sounds like you enjoyed the bunk bed room, but was not happy of the internet and breakfast. We certainly apologize for your displeasure in these two areas. We are looking into what we can do to fix internet issues and also changing some of the breakfast items. So we hope you will return and those issues will no longer exist. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Great location, comfy beds at an affordable rate.
Summary: This suited our needs just fine. Clean, comfortable, good size fridge and microwave and breakfast wasn't fancy but did the trick. Check in was smooth. Every time we called for something service was polite and efficient. There was some noise outside our room, but that is to be expected in a motel type set-up. We got what we paid for and we're even pleasantly surprised.

Let me start off by saying we have stayed at many hotels in anaheim as we are passholders at disneyland and we've stayed at many places from the sheraton to motel 6..and this has been our best visit yet ! First off the price was right we paid 106 a night and there was no parking fee! 2nd customer service was impeccable! ! We were able to check in early ,they greeted us with a smile and got is checked in very quickly ! 3rd our room was so clean and every day they called us to see if we wanted our room cleaned because our so not disturb sign was up which i thought was great..they really care about their guests. 4th free breakfast and a very short walk to disneyland! This was honestly the best stay we've ever had the staff is amazing. Thank you for ensuring we had an excellent and

I was really pleased with the front desk service, especially the Manager. I had to reschedule some days due to work and he worked that out with me and I DID NOT have to pay anything extra. The hotel is really clean, the room was nice and the best thing of all at a very fair price. I forgot to mention that the parking is included and so is the breakfast. You cannot beat that! I highly recommend this hotel, I will definitely come back!
Manager Response: Dear Brian, Thank you for your wonderful comments about the staff and your experiences at the hotel. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to your return stay with us in the future!

Summary: Easy on-line reservation process.  When sale came via email I was able to call and cancel and rebook again on-line for new discount.  When I needed to change room type they were very accommodating.  The young lady at the time of check-in was friendly and super efficient.  She was able to answer all questions we had.  The kids suite was a good size for my family of 5 with my 3 children in the room with bunkbeds and a sofabed.  Breakfast was more than I thought it would be....it did the job on our way to the park.  The staff at checkout was great as well.  They held our bags, directed us to some lunch places and contacted taxi services for us.  We did not give it the highest rating because the internet connection was not good at all and it is a little further than I would have
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property. We appreciate you comments and also the tips for travelers to see. We look forward in your return!

Summary: I reserved a two queen size room, it  was clean. Beds were comfortable. Only thing was wifi was not working.Tries using the password they gave me but would not connect. Requested a crib and was brought to my room immediately. Staff was very courteous.

We stayed at Cortona for three nights. When we first pulled in we were very hesitant as the hotels surrounding it are much bigger. The first thing we noticed when walking in was the cleanliness of the lobby. The staff greeted us right away and checked us in early at no added cost.We were in town for our daughters 5th birthday and were completely greatful that the staff went out of their way to put a gift in the room for her. Through out our stay we came to the lobby several times to ask the typical questions tourists usually ask Ruth and Dulce were very helpful and recommended a couple of close by restaurants. They were really helful and friendly. We didnt spend much time in our room other than at nights. Breakfast was decent but a little more variety wouldn't hurt. Our trip was

Summary Heading: We had a great time, happy kids equals happy mommy!
Summary: Booking was easy, good size room for my kids and myself, clean rooms, with fridge and microwave, & good location. Breakfast was more than the boring continental breakfast! Free parking! Definitely booking our next Anaheim trip here.
Manager Response: Dear Laura, Thank you for your nice review of our hotel. We are clad that everything went well for you and you are a happy Mommy! We look forward to see you in your next visit with us.

Summary Heading: Clean Spacious Rooms with complimentary breakfast
Summary: The rooms were clean and spacious. Parking is difficult, there is not enough spaces for the number of rooms. I agree with the other reviewers, the beds were very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was decent. We took the shuttle back and forth to Disneyland which was very easy and convenient. The staff was helpful and courteous.

I called down to the front desk and told the lady I was in need of two bath towels. I am sharing this room with two other women and there are not enough towels to begin with. I shared with her that I was waiting to shower because I did not have bath towels. I called at 7 am. I called again at 7:15 am and again at 7:30 am. How long does it take to get something you need around here from housekeeping? I am here for a conference at the convention center. Please... Save your money and stay somewhere else. There are plenty of other options in the area. This place is not worth the money. Still waiting for the bath towels!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write your review. I  certainly apologize for the lack of service you experienced from my staff. I have addressed this as this is not what a guest should experience at our hotel. We take your comments seriously as this will help us to improve our staff service. I apologize for the inconveniences you experienced and thank you for your honest opinions.

Summary Heading: Clean, met our needs for the price.
Summary: We stayed over the Thanksgiving weekend. I had read previous reviews so I knew what to expect and it pretty much met our expectations. We walked to Disneyland on one day. About 2 1/2 blocks, but they are somewhat long blocks, yet still an easy walk. On the second day it was a little dreary looking outside, so we walked over to Disneyland/CA Adventures Toy Story parking lot that is across the street from Cortona Inn. You have to walk into the parking lot a little to get to the lot's shuttle buses, but it's a shorter walk than going straight to Disneyland and the bus stops right in front of Disneyland and will save your legs a bit for the walking you'll do at the park. It's also free. At the hotel, we had one room with two queen sized beds for the 3 of us (my husband, our toddler

We spent 5 nights here. We were so busy every day and there is so much to do around here that all we wanted was a nice clean hotel with a good bed. The beds were awesome. Almost as good as home.  The breakfast is soso and the staff were ok but we got a great price on the hotel and didn't have high expectations. I'm happy to say that it did exceed them. Some tips... we stayed top floor and with  heaps of people leaving early for disneyland it may cause an issue sleeping in. You can also get a free bus to disneyland  from the car park just down the road from the hotel which is very handy. We got this tip from another trip advisor review. All in all this is a motel but its a pretty good one and I'd stay here again if I got the same price.
Manager Response: Dear David, Thank you for taking time to write a review of our hotel. We had replaced our bed a few months ago after testing several beds out with our guests. I am happy to hear that your experience was what we found with most of our guests is that the beds are great!! That is important after being at Disneyland all day and wanting to get a nice bed and room to relax in.! Thanks for the tips for our other guests who may be interested in your review. We look forward in seeing you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Did not meet expectations - We'll stay somewhere else next time!
Summary: I booked this hotel as part of a girl's trip to Disneyland. I had originally booked us at the Best Western Park Place & Mini Suites, but cancelled that suite in order to book the family suite at the Cortona Inn (which is basically 2 queen rooms connected by an adjoining door). I got a good rate on the room by booking 2 back-to-back reservations while utilizing their online specials.  I was a little put-off by the other reviews, but decided I would go ahead with it anyways since the price was right. It is a "Resort" after all, how bad can it be? I was impressed by the look of the website--the brightly lit, modern rooms, that were "newly renovated". It sounded great!   After I booked, I called the hotel to confirm that the back-to-back reservation would be placed in the same room.

We spent two nights at the Cortona while visiting Disneyland.  This is a remodeled motel which has positives and negatives.  The rooms are big and everything has been redone nicely, but it's still an ugly 3 story motel building on three sides of the pool and office.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean.  Towels are thin, motel type and the in room coffee was awful.  Wifi worked OK.  I could use my laptop but my wife's iPad2 couldn't connect.  What's with the lack of trash cans in the room?  Breakfast was OK but the breakfast room was too small for all the families trying to get to the park.  The ART shuttle was easy and efficient.  I would try a different place next time but in a pinch would come back here.

Had a great stay at the Cortona, except that I left some items of clothing behind that held sentimental value to me. The staff at the Cortona were very helpful in assisting with getting my clothing all the way back to New Zealand.

We stayed here because other family members were already booked here and we thought it would be nice to be all together...wrong. Being Disney passholders we stay in Anaheim frequently but normally stay at the larger hotels. ( Sheraton, Marriot, Hilton etc.) This "hotel" is 1/2 step above a motel 6. For the money (and fees) we spent here we could have easily stayed at any one of the larger more professional properties that would've included a real breakfast and free shuttle service to the park. People outside smoking ( cigs and pot at 8 a.m.) and one elevator at one end of the rooms inconveniently placed were definitely not a plus. We'll just chalk this up to a lesson learned. Flourescent lighting is really disgusting by the way and very dated...

Great location, about 1-1/2 blocks south of Disneyland – walking distance for Disneyland visit.   Beds are very comfortable compared to many hotels in the same area and it is a great price even compared to the Hyatt. Good parking space, perfect for a holiday package for family.   We stayed here for 3 nights on Thanksgiving holidays on a 2nd floor room.  Breakfast is great each morning and rooms are very clean and quiet. We were 4 adults and one child less than three years.   Good eating restaurants on some walking distance!  Not a 5 or 4 star hotel but a very comfortable, very satisfactory and very enjoyable experience! Good value for money…

If you need reliable Internet during your vacation, this is the place NOT to be. Connection was extremely slow and disconnects all the time. We end up at McDonalds free "WiFi". We talked about the problem with someone from front desk, they advised to call the 800 number. And guess what, the number was busy all the time. Having a business we strongly depend on the internet and 4 days without a reliable service was a real nightmare. The "new renovated rooms".... I saw some new calking around the bath tub and toilet, that´s it. Faucets, etc. are still from the mid 80´s. The room itself (carpet, wall interior) did not look "new" to me. For me this is false advertising. The "Deluxe Breakfast"... the same variety you get everywhere, others call it "Continental Breakfast". Overall a

Very clean and well kept hotel.  The staff was very pleasant. Was great to have breakfast there in the mornings. The hotel was in walking distance to Disneyland and to the hotel in which we had to attend our conference.

This hotel is at a walking distance from Disneyland parks (about 2 blocks), so that makes it very convenient. The was clean at our arrival and the service was pleasant. We traveled with kids, so the "continental breakfast" was not convenient for us because we prefer complete meals for them. The only bad things i have to say is that the bedrooms had a constant humidity smell and the wi-fi was useless.

Loved it . The room was as specified . Very spacious and clean. Awsome . Glad we stayed here for our layover and would happily stay again .  Loved it . The room was as specified . Very spacious and clean. Awsome . Glad we stayed here for our layover and would happily stay again .
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to place a review on our hotel. We are happy to hear that your stay was what you expected and that you would choose us again in the future. We look forward in serving you again!

Summary: This hotel is close by to disneyand (about 15 min walk) and very nominally priced. We found the room to be spacious and functional. Beds were really nice. The hotel has elevators so made it easy to haul stuff to third floor. The only thing they can improve on is the breakfast. Its supposed to be deluxe continental breakfast. It would be nice if they had some something hot (like scrambled eggs etc.).  But overall nice hotel for a decent price.

Summary Heading: More of a Motel than a Resort
Summary: The set-up was more of a fancy motel than what they advertise as a resort. Parking was extremely scarce. The rooms was updated and seem clean upon entering but once you start to look around it was evident the cleaning service needs to take a little more time cleaning the rooms. My 4-year old son found a sock under the bed and thought it was his Dad's (it wasn't), I went into the bathroom to get the water going for our baby and I found hair (that didn't belong to us) in the tub.  Unfortunately there seemed to have been some sort of domestic dispute going on on the 1st floor which caused the police to come on the property. Although the price was right, I don't think we will  be back.

We arrived to the hotel and checked in with very nice staff. Once checked into room we were very disappointed. Smelled musty and gross, found hair in the bed and sheets were all bumpy, bathroom tile was falling apart, and the water smelled like rotten eggs.:( we were bummed! We had a great fall2014 deal and excited to try out this hotel! We left hotel and manager was very nice and refunded us our money. We then found another hotel.

I travel quite and bit and my family comes to Disneyland a couple times a year. We've stayed at several nearby hotels and this is by far the worst experience we've had. On the plus side, the room was clean and the soft goods (comforters, curtains, etc.) appear to have been recently updated. That is about the only pleasant thing about this hotel.   It is definitely not as close to DL as they'd have you believe. The walk isn't bad, but be prepared for a 15 min walk. As other reviewers have stated, you can take the ART, but it is not inexpensive. We paid $9 for one adult, one senior, and one child for a 1 day pass. A 5-day pass is $20 for an adult. There are nicer hotels MUCH closer to DL.   The breakfast is typical of what you might find at a Hampton: breakfast breads, Danish,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It seems that you had several issues that were unpleasant for you s you had mentioned that there were some good things about your stay, but unfortunately had some issues with the hotel. We certainly apologize for the inconvenience you had when our plumbing had issues. We tries to get repair work done ASAP, however I know it is difficult when issues come up that delays your plans for the day. We appreciate your comments regarding g our location and breakfast. We need to improve on our communication with guests as they check in so they can get a safe key at time of check in rather than coming back to the desk to get one. I will address this immediately with staff. We hope you will give us another try in the future as we strive to improve our services.

Summary: Near Disneyland second time we prefered this hotel.Its price , comfort, service is nice..staff is so kind and  helpfull..Parking,internet service is really good.Walking to Disneyland is about 15 minutes which you can see a lot of people who are walking on the same road to Disneyland was fanny:)

Overall the hotel was good.  Great beds, not to close to the park but I personally didn't mind the walk. Breakfast was great as well for the price of the hotel. Overall it exceeded my expectations.  Staff was friendly, not very competent or helpful.  I would return to this hotel based on the beds alone.

Our room was very clean and much larger than expected. Staff was very helpful and friendly. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland. You also have the option of taking ART or walking a block to the Toy a Story parking lot and taking a bus from there. Breakfast was better than expected...fresh bagels and donuts, and hot food.  Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write about our hotel. Our staff and I are pleased to hear that your stay was to your satisfaction. I am sure other that read your review will appreciate the comments you have made. We look forward in seeing you in the future!

Summary: Stayed there three nights and all three night where good the front desk people where very helpful and the maids where very good.there continental breakfast was good everything was always fresh. They only thing that I didn't like was the parking the park

we stayed at the Cortona for 11 nights. The family room was great, comfortable beds, a separate room with bunk bed and fold out couch for the kids. Both rooms had TV so adults and children could watch what they want. The pool was good, clean & not too cold. The breakfast room and food were adequate, didn't have any trouble finding a table even though the hotel was quite full. The best part of the stay was the fantastic service provided by the staff, whatever we wanted they provided, they organised hire cars, cabs at the best prices, lots of excellent suggestions on things to do & see. Nothing was too much trouble, we have stayed at lots of other hotels from budget to 5 star but have never found better staff than at the Cortona. Whether you are travelling with a family or by

We have stayed at the Cortona several times over the past few years as our daughter goes to college near by, It's across the street from Target by a block or two and just a few blocks from Disneyland. The rooms are comfortable. No view of fireworks from any room however, kind of a bummer. Breakfast is a challenge as there are not enough dining spaces and some people tend to sit around and chat after they've eaten while others stand around, waiting for a spot. Great value and comfortable stay overall.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney trip!
Summary: The room was clean & spacious. Plenty of free parking. ART shuttle (tickets available at desk, cheap!) to Disneyland is a very short walk to the left of the hotel. BUT, the Disney Toy Story parking lot is directly across the street from the hotel. You can hop on a bus that takes you to Disneyland for FREE. Just walk into the lot & hop on a bus. Buses run back & forth frequently. Beds were very comfortable. Free breakfast more than plentiful, with eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, juices, and you can take it to your room if you like. Front desk staff helpful & cheerful. Close enough to walk to Disneyland, but why? (Especially if you have little ones).

We just stayed for ten days at the cortona the service was amazing . Clean room, front desk was very helpfull. The only problem was they brought out a waffle machine on our last day for fresh waffles. And I missed out .... Lol. Thank you so much.
Manager Response: Dear Scott, We appreciate your review on our hotel. Seems that you had a great stay and just missed out on the Waffles. You stayed ten days and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your time at our hotel. We hope that you will return soon and get the chance to try our waffles!

Summary: They do not have a shuttle to Disney. The girls who work there could be a bit more helpful giving directions. Instead of answering my question about a shuttle to Disney with a yes, go to the left. When you walk out of reception and go to the left there's a parking lot where my son and I waited for quite awhile. No shuttle. I also asked if I can charge the ride to my room. They said yes.  The truth is:  it's the city bus/shuttle. You need to make a right into parking lot to the street and make a left to the bus stop!  No, it's not charged to the room, but you can buy tickets at reception.  Breakfast was great. Great selection including waffle batter and waffle maker.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. It seems that you had a good stay, however did not get the right information from the desk staff. I will address this with them. It is unfortunate that you were given wrong information as to the shuttle service. I am glad to hear you enjoyed breakfast and the hotel. We appreciate your comments.

Summary Heading: Walking Distance to Disneyland...Avoid 'Dollar Rent A Car'
Summary: My Husband and I stayed at this resort on our honey moon in early October. The staff on the front desk were lovely to deal with & the place was kept nice & tidy. The pool is great & the room was nice too. The room had two queen beds, a flat screen TV, bar fridge, bathroom & airconditioning unit. The room was serviced daily, beds made & all toweling & soaps etc replaced + bins emptied. The only slight issue we had was that the guy in the room next to us had the TV going all night & we could hear it through the wall. To fix this we just had the aircon unit running at a comfortable temp all night. There was breakfast offered down in the dining room daily which offered a basic breakfast of toast, egga, fruit loops, oranges & apples, dounuts & waffles. There was also orange juice tea
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write your review all the way from Auckland! Our team is pleased to hear your stay with us was to your satisfaction and that you will be returning to us in the future. You had some great comments as to your experiences at the hotel and where to eat and go shopping. I am sure others who read this will appreciate your comments. We look forward in your returning to stay with us in the future.

Summary: The (ONLY BIG ISSUE) We Had Was The (HEATER) in our room. It Smelled Like (URIN) and the fire alarm went off.  I Reported!!!  They sent a maintenance guy he said it was normal. I explained to the maintenance this is "Hazardous" Especially people with. "ASTHMA" .I personally don't think he knew what he was doing?.  We travel all the time to different hotels and motels never had an issue until now. Sorry about the inconvenience but this issue must be addressed.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking  time to review our hotel. I apologize for the heater issues and how the staff handled the situation. I will address this with the team as this is not what our customer wants to experience. It is not normal for the heater to smell and it will be addressed. We hope you will try us again as heaters should not smell, and it looks like the rest of your stay was to your satisfaction. Thank you for your comments.

Summary: Hotel is not top of the line, but very clean. Staff was very, very nice. If you needed anything they would get it. Deck employees went above and beyond to help. My grand kids loved the pool. Very close to Disneyland parking lot and other services.  Rooms were clean and quiet. Would stay again.  Only draw back was high resort fees.
Manager Response: Dear Michelle, We appreciate your taking time to share your experiences with others on Trip Advisor. My staff and I are pleased to hear your stay was enjoyable for you. Its good to hear that the staff did all they can to make your stay a great one! Thank you, and we look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary Heading: Perfect if you are looking for a hotel with a decent price near Disneyland
Summary: Could be cleaner and staff could have been friendlier, but other than that it was great. Great location. Bed was beyond comfortable compared to other hotels and its a great price even compared to the hayatt which is in the same parking lot. Perfect if you are on a budget but still want a classier experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and all the experiences you have shared with us. We are glad to hear that your stay with us was to your satisfaction and that you will stay with us again in the future. Thank you for giving other potential guest some insights as to your experiences at the hotel and going to Disneyland. We look forward in seeing you on your next visit with us.

Summary: Ill just say right up front this is not a 5 star or a 4 star hotel but by looking into the reviews or the hotel website you already know that.  I traveled (single mom) with my 3 young kids and my mom we liked the hotel it was clean the room had a micro and fridge in the room and the beds were comfy.  We did not try the sofa sleeper but the beds themselves were actually pretty nice and i am pretty pick with beds.  There was never a time we ever felt unsafe the hotel staff is always helpful and the property is clean and maintained.  The rooms were updated.  i was a bit worried about the exterior entrances but soon realized many hotel in Anaheim are this way.  The breakfast does get busy .... not a lot of room to sit so we did have to stand a lot and wait for the table to open up.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a great review of not only the Cortona, but also tips for guests that will read your review! We are pleased that your stay was to your satisfaction and that you will be coming back to stay with us again. We look forward to your next stay and appreciate your wonderful comments.

Summary: First of all, be very aware of resort fees. They add up! I was assigned a handicapped room although I didn't request one and don't require one. (I had booked ahead several months). The bathroom was very long (about 11 feet), and there was only ONE light in this room, and it was in the middle of the room. It wasn't even very bright. The sink was at the end of the room. To say that the lighting was poor is an understatement. There were no towel racks or hooks by the sink so they had to take valuable vanity space. There were no towel racks or hooks close to the tub. I found it a big nuisance, and I'm not handicapped. Someone needs to rethink the planning of the handicapped bathrooms. The WiFi is spotty. The air conditioner fan was very, very noisy. Someone came up and made an
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that your stay with us was not to your satisfaction. Your comments regarding the room is appreciated so that we can improve our services to our guests. I certainly apologize for the poor lighting and noisy air conditioner. We are currently changing the lighting to get more light into the bathroom as you have a valid comment. Your comments of the towels is also appreciated. I hope that you will try us someday in the future as we do have reviews from people that have had a great stay with us. We would love to have that chance to make this up to you. Thank you for your honest comments.

Summary: we stayed here for a full week - had a 2nd floor room - breakfast was always great each morning - room was clean and quiet - pool was nice for the kids and hot tub great too - easy drive to Disney and a few places to eat within walking distance - we would def stay here again !
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. You stayed with us for a full week and we appreciate your comments about our hotel. Sounds like you had a chance to use all our facilities and enjoyed our breakfast during your stay. We look forward in seeing you again in the future! Thank you for taking time to write your comments .

Summary: We stayed here for eight nights & we were very please with the service we received. On the first night both our children were vomiting all night, housekeeping was fantastic nothing was a problem .The service from the staff at the front desk was very good and very helpful they did bookings for us gave us maps etc. The beds were very comfy and the rooms clean.we will definitely stay here again thanks Cortona :-)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write about your experiences at our hotel. You stayed several days and we are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for praising our staff as they do work very hard to make our guests feel welcome. Your comments are shared with our staff and they will appreciate that their work has been appreciated by our guests. We look forward in welcoming you again on your next visit with us.

Summary: When the travel agency we used booked us for a Disney vacation at a hotel that wasn't even open yet we thought our vacation was ruined. But thanks to Cortona inn we were able to get the kids suite at short notice and it worked out perfectly!   The rooms are really clean and the maid service was fantastic. The front desk was very helpful.we were extremely happy with the room and the beds were so comfortable! Thank you for saving our vacation!

Close to Disneyland.  Comfortable room.  Nice breakfast.  Friendly and helpful staff.  We enjoyed the pool.  Parking was a challenge.  People smoked on balconies which wasnt good.  Ice machine far and sofa sleeper ok for kid but not very comfortable.  Close to everything.  Had lots of fun.

On one of their sites online they state Disneyland is one and a half blocks away.  That is if you count Disneyland's parking lot!  To walk there it is one mile.  Tour buses do not come to them if you go to Knotts or to the airport.  You have to walk to the bus stop for that.  Our bathroom floors grout between the tiles went from light grey (in the corners) to a horrific black in the areas you walk.  The pool was o.k. but, every single lounge chair was broken. Every one of them.  The front staff was good.  Room service o.k..  No really good family restaurant with out more walking.  Would not send my dog or my worse enemy there.  Stay away from this place, unless you like lots of walking and goodness only knows what black mold is on their floors.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your stay was not  to your satisfaction. The distance to Disneyland in our city blocks is correct. I walk to Disney many times and it takes about 15 minutes of walking to get to Disneyland. I understand that after being at Disneyland all day walking another  15 minutes back to the hotel can be tiring. There are shuttle services available as you stated at the bus stop that is in front of our driveway of our hotel. The bathroom flooring is tile with a dark colored grouting. There is no mold on the flooring. The grouting may have faded in certain areas, and I appreciate that you bring this up as we should look into the color consistency of the grouting.  The lounge chairs are being replaced. We are glad to hear that you felt our service was good. We have received many great comments, and we are sorry to hear that your stay was not satisfactory for you. Thank you for taking your time to write your comments as we do want our guests to enjoy their stay, and whatever comments we receive will help us to improve.

Summary: This was our first stop on a month long family holiday.  We were really happy with the size of our room.  We booked a Family Suite which has bunks in a separate room plus a pull-out couch, huge wardrobe and TV.  My teenage girls (13 & 14) loved having there own space.  Had a wee issue with cleanliness when we first arrived but they fixed this immediately and were very apologetic.  Cleanliness for the rest of the week was amazing! To be honest if you are staying here to go to Disney etc you really only need a place to lay your head.  All days are speant at the parks.  Very easy short walk to Disney.  When we wanted a relaxing day this place was perfect - so quiet.  Would not hesitate to stay here again, all staff very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Wish we would not have chose this hotel
Summary: We booked toscana kids suite online but when we arrived they told us there was no way we could have that they were all booked and they weren't sure how we were able to book online...but they took our money. They put us up in a "like" suite did not even up grade us. When my daughter was getting into sofa sleeper there were chips still in the sheets!!! There was throw up on the curb by the stairs which never got cleaned up. The only nice thing I can say is my husband liked the comfort of the bed we slept in. Would not recommend this hotel!

Had a 2 night stay in a family executive suite for a good price.  There was about 8 of us going to a convention.  The people at the desk was so wonderful.  Despite us getting there really early to check in, the man at the desk gave us access to the swimming pool, he had made the experience very wonderful.  Everything was clean, they had a refrigerator, microwave, a separate living room with a sofa that was also a full pull out bed.  They had a decent continental breakfast provided for everyone.  If i ever have to go back to Anaheim, I might just stay here again.

Would definitely stay here again clean rooms awesome service very good breakfast included eggs, sausage, cereal, pastries,juice,coffee,and fruit walking distance to disney parks pool is a little small but not bad the staff is very nice and helpfull they made sure we were comfortable also got brand new comfy mattresses

1.) Thin walls made it hard to sleep every night. Complained to the front desk about that. Guess the facility shouldn't take all the heat for others rudeness. 2.)Only place with continental breakfast but very tight dining facility with a brokedown toaster. Continental breakfast is overrated. 3.)Parking is not great. 4.) Must say the service was pretty good. Friendly staff.  5.) Location was pretty good. Maybe I'm being a little tough but the website and the real thing just dont correlate.

Summary Heading: Not what I had hoped for.
Summary: This is an average hotel stuffed in between other hotels.  Would not have been my first pick if I had seen it beforehand.  It is clean, parking was not an issue, and the proximity to Disneyland is decent.  I was looking for something reasonably priced, but I'm not sure my travel agent has personally seen this hotel or she may not have recommended it based on what we were looking for.  However, nice budget hotel in a seemingly safe area.

Having visited many US hotels we got exactly what we expected here.  We did a two night tour from Las Vegas to Anaheim, to visit Disney.  The trip was organised as a package through Viator and this was the hotel they used.  The room was clean and well equipped, with a big tv, microwave, fridge and coffee machine.  The staff were vey helpful.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Affordable accommodations  near Disneyland with excellent service
Summary: My 16 year old son, toddler daughter, and I stayed at Cortona for 5 nights while on a quick trip to Disneyland.  We arrived mid morning, and we were allowed to check in our room immediately with no extra fees, which was very helpful.  The lobby is nice, with a small store and all day coffee available.  There was always someone at the desk to help out.  They sold discount Disney tickets (no timeshare stuff or fake tickets), as well as passes for the ART bus that transports to Disney and the local area.  The discount was significant- about $28 a ticket.   The bus pass was between $4 and $5 a day (unlimited use) depending on how many days you planned to use the pass.  Pickup was right outside the hotel.  You can walk to Disney from there-it is on the same street.  However, it is

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and affordable. Good rooms.
Summary: Tub drain would not allow bathing. The laundry room closed too early. There was no shuttle to Disneyland. Other than that the rooms were pretty nice and the service was very good. Breakfast was also very good. Overall it was worth the price. Thank you.

this was our 2nd time staying here such a nice place staff very friendly rooms very clean and what a great breakfast.thank you for all your kindness.[esmeralda it sure was great seeing you again and thanks for the hug.]
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay and that Esmeralda was attentive and courteous.  See you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great room, location and friendly staff.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay very much. The room was great. Loved having a refrigerator. The location was excellent. Close to Disney so we could walk. The staff was friendly and efficient. We would gladly stay there again.

2 adults, 2 children have just had a great time in Anaheim staying at Cortona Inn & Suites. Nothing to complain about at all. Fantastic, friendly, helpful staff!! My granddaughter had her 11th birthday there. The office & housekeeping staff came out as she walked through the foyer, lined up, sang happy birthday & gave her hugs. They also decorated her room and left her a bag of goodies. She felt very special. We had a couple of self made disasters which the staff fixed promptly. The kids somehow locked themselves out of their room by locking their door then closing the connecting door between the rooms. Maintenance came up straight away and rectified the situation. One child vomited all over the carpet during the night (too much Disneyland I suspect). We cleaned up, reported to

Summary Heading: Ok place to stay for Disney visit
Summary: When I checked in they gave my room keys and upon arrival to the room it was already occupied. Glad no one was in the room. Front desk immediately gave us another room which was nice. Hotel has an old feel to it. Rooms good enough for a nights sleep. Included breakfast was typical stuff you would find at a hotel like this. Staff very friendly.

Summary Heading: The most depressing place in Disneyland
Summary: My family (3 kids) was on a California road trip taking in the parks at San Diego, Disneyland, LA and onto San Fran. Our UK travel agent booked the Cortona Inn & Suites as they are a supposedly good value hotel right on Disneyland Drive. However the family room we had was so wretched we checked out 15 minutes after we had checked in, as soon as we had found alternative accommodation. There are loads of hotels on the same street with mad names like Candy Cane, and I would have picked any of them in preference to the Cortona. The hotel is actually the standard motel style, with a carpark surrounded by rooms on 2 floors. Ours had a double bed at the front, bunk beds at the rear and a sofabed (which had not been made up for us - and no sheets provided). The room was brown all over,

I stayed at the hotel during a trip to Disneyland for my birthday. When checking in, not only did the staff sing to me and give me a gift bag full of snacks, but they also upgraded my reservation to a spa suite at no extra charge! I'd love to be able to give a review of 5 stars for the staff service alone, but am settling on a 4 due to the fact that the walls were kinda thin and I could hear other people taking showers. I'm guessing that might be due to the building's age. But aside from any cosmetic or otherwise small issue, I stand by the fact that the staff was amazing. :D

The staff was very nice and friendly. The room was big, clean; the room rate wasn't hight for the side of the room they accommodate us. Close to Disney theme parks and Angels Stadium. We will consider it next time there.

Summary Heading: Loved the family suite with bunk beds!
Summary: Nice place, great deals on Disneyland tickets, kids loved the bunk beds with their own reading lights.   Breakfast was sufficent but not spectacular.   Room was spacious and clean.   Can walk to Disneyland but it is about 15 minutes.  Parking is limited, don't expect to get a spot near your room if you check in late.

Summary Heading: Average Hotel. Poor Breakfast. Better Places To Stay.
Summary: The hotel itself and room where standard there were some nicer places in the area but also some worse. parking wasn't great and the pool facilities weren't very appealing. Breakfast was terrible in many ways, firstly little variety and low quality. A massive issue was there was 10 tables for 150 or so rooms. Frequently you would wait or give up. We had breakfast at a Denny's down the road most days which was nice and clean also had a good menu and great staff. There are much better places to stay for your money.

I know the $100/night price tag may seem like a lot for a motel-esque hotel but let me tell you, this is very worth it. Clean rooms, great housekeeping, Jacuzzi and pool included, free breakfast, and more!

We generally stay at Cortona when we visit Disneyland. The only drawback is the old parking lot has been transformed into a new and under construction hotel. Not an extension of Cortona but still loud and most importantly creates lack of available parking spots. They do offer free Valet but thats not the same. Otherwise enjoyed hotel and most certainly will be using them again on our next Disney trip.

So here we are tonight at Cortona Inn and "Suites."  First time and the last time.  It all started with the reservation. I booked a kids suite online, through the hotel and about 3 hours into our trip I received a call telling me the kids suite was occupied and we would be unable to stay in that room.  I was told my family could stay in a similar room and was given a small discount.  This was good.  When we arrived the parking lot was full and after checking I was told that parking was in another lot adjacent to the hotel.  I was told first come first served. Now the kicker was the two cockroaches that were in the bathroom.  One was dead and as big as a "suite" and the other was alive in the waste basket.  When I called the front desk it was like it happens everyday. "OK we will

cortona inn was excellent the rooms were clean staff were excellent helpful and kind, 4 grandchildren were happy, loved the hot breakfast and the pool.would definately stay there nexttime,  great location close to the park and very happy disney vacation.

Summary Heading: Poor, unfriendly service.  Probably the worst hotel we have ever stayed at
Summary: Trying to think of a few positive things about this hotel and all I can come up with is: The in-room fridge is a good, bigger size The rooms are well decorated and clean Parking and breakfast is included  However, the walls in our room seemed to be paper thin wherein we could hear every little noise including our neighbours flushing the toilet next door. Beds were terribly uncomfortable with springs poking through. Our door to our room didn't open properly and kept sticking so we literally had to hip check it every time to open it which made a huge bang and shook the window.  Breakfast was okay but the breakfast staff were not at all friendly, food seemed to take a long time to be refilled, the room was always full so always a wait for a table, tables were dirty and staff didn't

Loved the location of this hotel & it's amenities. Very clean & wonderful staff. Excellent location & close to all destinations we needed to go to. Everyday the breakfast was different & had a variety of items to choose from.

My first impression when I entered the lobby was, "wow." For the price I paid I was not expecting it to be so nice. The room was spotless. We could see the fireworks from Disneyland the night we arrived which was a plus. The pool was inly 4 ft deep but clean and the breakfast was great for anyone without a gluten intolerance. The did run out of coffee and I had to drink the coffee in the room. We paid a lot less to stay here. The only thing I did not like was that it was very noisy from the room above us. I suggest bringing earplugs, expect cleanliness, and good location.

The room was clean, well priced, & included a mini fridge.  Housekeeping was good, and beds were average on comfort scale.  What really stood out was the Customer Service.  Someone called the room every evening to ask how our stay was and if we needed anything.  They stored my luggage before check-in time & after check out, so that I could attend my meeting at the Anaheim Convention Center, which was within 5-7 minute walk.  I was very happy with the overall experience, and would certainly return.

Our children's suite was nicely appointed.  Pros:  Employees helpful and friendly, lots of space, updated accommodations, free breakfast, great pool.  Cons:  Carpet was dirty, a/c smelled, bed was too firm to my liking, get to breakfast before 8:00 as it gets very crowded.  Our family of seven enjoyed our stay and we'd book with them again.

The rooms are spacious.They are fairly clean. We found ants when we arrived but they were gone by the next day. Beds firm but comfortable. The breakfast room needs to be WAY bigger. There was very little seating considering it was a full house and the food was being eaten as soon as it was put out so we missed out two mornings. Mainly because we aren't pushy type people) The laundry was down on our first day but was fixed the next day. Front desk staff didn't even know about it the next day. Also the vending machines kept taking money and not delivering goods.  Staff did refund but it's a pain when you have kids wanting a drink.  The ART shuttle is across the street or you could walk to Disney in about 20 minutes Overall good value for money though and the staff were mostly

Summary Heading: You've got what you paid for
Summary: Stayed for 2 nights business suite for the proximity to Disneyland.  Room is okay, positive for the 2 new LCD and clean beds, negative for the sofa bed (sheet looks old).  Staff is nice in general, but don't seem to know much beyond the basic.  For example, there was a RV parked inside probably belonged to the construction crew for the hotel next door and there was foul smell.  I complained to the front desk, but they said they are not aware of that.  Also, there are a few potholes between the new property and theirs and again, the front desk staff said they are not aware of.  Oh, don't put too much expectation on the free breakfast as it is very basic and we didn't even want to eat on the second day.  My advice is to stay away from this hotel until the construction is over.

Summary Heading: I felt like I never left the cleanliness & comfort of my own home. Thank you
Summary: I only have one issue.... they kept running out of food in the morning! My kids had to sit there and wait for sausages, biscuits and gravy to be refilled. But some never even came :C other than that; the room was great! Is nice to leave and come back to beds being done. They neatly set my son's stuffed ninja turtle in the middle of the bed, he said he was happy because they treated his "Leo" like a king!

We stayed at this Hotel in December 2013.  Construction next to the Hotel but did not effect us at all. Clean rooms, including Breakfast, The Shuttle to Disneyland is in front of this Hotel and takes you to the front gate of Disney, $5. pp.   Walking distance to good Restaurants and shops.  Friendly staff.   Great price.

This is a nice family hotel. Well worth the money. We stayed in a family suite. The only things that would have made it better; larger trash can and a sink separate from the shower. Overall the experience was good. The breakfast was good and considering it is free I have no complaints. The front desk ladies were awesome very friendly. Check-in was a breeze. The kids took advantage of the pool several times.

There are many options of hotels but I found this to be a good one. It is near Disney and a lot of restaurants and shops. The staff and rooms are great. I had booked a regular suite and checked in and they gave me a presidential which was two rooms one a king bed and the other room has a bunk bed for adults and kids and even their own TV had I know I hadnt rented two rooms cause you get your own privacy. Well definitely recommend thos hotel But one thing park early because there is construction going on and parking spaces are limited.

Summary Heading: Nice Place to Stay near Disneyland
Summary: Rooms are clean and they changed the towels and set the bed every day.  Construction is going on next to this hotel so parking might not look clean.   Tips: 1)  This hotel is near Disneyland Parking,  suggest you to park your car in the Hotel parking and walk to the Disneyland ( 1 Mile around 10 Min). 2) They change the WiFi Password every day.

We had booked 2 suites, had confirmations, turned up early (luckily) and they had nothing booked for us, we got two standard rooms, no compensation, I asked for the manager to make contact with me twice and nothing happened, we were given our suites  after the first night, but that was the end of the sleeping, the noise on the ground floor was unbelievable from the units above, and the so called internet, I had to wait to leave to even get onto trip advisor

My husband and I brought our kids for the first time to Disneyland. We booked this hotel because they offered kids suites and free breakfast daily. The staff is extremely friendly and will accommodate special requests. I had asked for Minnie and Mickey mouse stuffed animals to be placed in the children's room on their bunk beds as a surprise. The staff not only took care of setting the room they went above and beyond by included little goody packs for the kids. When planning a future family vacation for Disneyland we will definitely be booking here. Thank You Cortona Inn and Suites!

I took the bus to Disney land and it dropped me off outside the hotel which is across from the park. It was pretty, spacious and clean had everything we needed and was not expensive! The best thing was it was a 2 minute walk to Disney land!! There was a bunch of fast food places around the hotel as well which was nice.

We stayed here for 2 nights during our Disney trip which was up the road. Clean, nice rooms as pictures show, free wifi, good variety for breakfast including: oranges, apples, cereal, doughnuts, Danishes, egg biscuits, coffee, and oj. I will say that I booked a few months in advance so the price was perfect for us. Only drawback this time around (2nd stay here) was the limited parking due to construction.

Summary Heading: Stay at the motel during Disneyland visit
Summary: I like the customer service, cleanliness and peace. The motel is close the Disneyland, could say walking distance, all the food restaurants and fast foods are at walking distance too. Free breakfast was great, a lot to eat. Discount tickets to purchase and guidance for next trip too, and you get discount at second time to stay with them, great.
Manager Response: Dear Mandeep S, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim Resort.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and peaceful.  We shall look forward to your return visit soon! Thanks again!!  John

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 4 nights (from Australia). Room was just as we anticipated - a place to rest and recover before heading to Disney. Walking distance to Disney was a bit longer than anticipated, but taxis were literally around the corner and made the journey that much quicker. Room was always clean and ready for us at the end of each day...which was greatly appreciated. Breakfast room was only crowded if you got their later in the morning, which happened to us on one occasion. We merely headed back to our room for 20 minutes and then went back to the breakfast room and their were ample seating available. Car park did appear to be a "hectic", but we had no car so it was not an issue for us. Would highly recommend ...
Manager Response: Dear Barney B, Thank you sharing your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that our hotel and services met with your satisfaction.  I believe that some of the rooms on the 3rd floor may have a view of the fireworks.  One thing to note though is that the fireworks at Disneyland are much more than they ever have been and the best way to see the real deal is to be inside the park on Main Street to capture the full effects of the stories that are synchronous to the fireworks display.  This is an awesome show now and very cool!!  Safe travels and again thanks for your review and your stay with us! John

Summary Heading: Family of four trip to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is OK, close enough to walk to the Disney park and the staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in a junior suite on the ground floor which had a king bed in the main area and a bunk bed in a separate room. The suite was clean, comfortable and  fine for what we required. Our only complaints were insufficient parking space and an inadequate breakfast area, we had to stand in the reception area to eat on the second morning.
Manager Response: Dear LeodisLad, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable albeit the busy breakfast situation.  Of course, we value your comments and appreciate the time you have take to share your review.  Thanks again!  John

Summary: We stayed at the Cortona in a family suite room, 2 adults and 3 children. We choose this property based on the overall value and the breakfast that had been included in our price. We chose to catch a bus to Disney as with a young child the walk is a bit long especially after walking the park all day. We made use of Denny's across the road and especially enjoyed the Cheesecake Factory at Garden Walk. We found the staff could not do enough for you and were never rude. At the end of the day you get what you pay for and after all your not there to spend all day in your room... Your on holidays, get out and enjoy yourselves and stop worrying about the small things that are not important!!!
Manager Response: Dear Emily U, Thank you for your comments and review of the Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim Resort.  We are pleased to know that your stay was pleasant and comfortable and that our staff was attentive to your needs and that our services and amenities met with met with your satisfaction. Thanks again!  John

Summary: Set up was really great. Kids had their own room with bunkbeds, couch and tv. Room smelled musty which was gross, but not so bad it was unbearable. Pool and hot tub were nice. We did not partake in breakfast, but it looked inedible. About what you'd expect. Great location to decent restaurants and shops. It really was only a 10 minute walk to Disney with almost teenage kids.
Manager Response: Dear Jenn J, Thank you for sharing your comment regarding your recent stay with us.  Sounds as though we could have done a bit more to have made your stay more enjoyable.  Your comments will be shared with each department manager so we can ensure that these issues are addressed and resolved.  Thanks again and please let us know when you plant to return to Anaheim. Thanks again!   John

Summary: Unfortunately we were very dissatisfied staying at the Cortona.  Upon our arrival, the front desk clerk was not friendly or welcoming.  She argued which credit card we had used to make our reservation.  Shortly after we checked into our room, we noticed their were tiny ants running along the window sill in our room and their were also other types of flying bugs by our window.  The solution that was offered was to spray chemicals in our room and I did not want my family to be inhaling the fumes all night. We requested a new room and unfortunately they didn't have anything available until the following evening.  The room we were moved to was in the corner, on the upper floor.  We were woken up at 7am each day to the sound of trucks due to the construction at the Hyatt Place.  My

I stayed here for a convention at the convention center and I loved that it was so close. The room was nice and comfortable and clean. Staff was helpful. The only issue I had was with the wifi...even after contacting the provider, it didn't really work for my entire stay.

This is a hotel that says it is a 2 block, 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  It is really about a 3 block walk that took us about 20 minutes in the morning and 30 minutes at night.  There is quite a bit of construction in front of the hotel making it awkward to get in and there was not enough parking for some who had to park near the street due to the work being done (and employees parking there).  The rooms are spacious with a fridge - ours was a family suite with bunk beds, a queen pull out and a king size bed in the front room.  The bathroom was ok but the door didnt shut well and was missing a hinge.  The guests before us apparently smoked in there before us but hotel staff was all over that so the room smelt a bit from the chemicals used to clean it.  By day 2, the smell was
Manager Response: Dear Mommaof5kiddos, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience you experienced with parking.  I can report that the new hotel is scheduled to open on or about the first of August, 2014 and with that, parking issues will become a thing of the past. I can assure you that guest comments are taken very seriously and efforts are constantly addressed to ensure that we continue to offer the best service and value possible.  Thanks again! John

Summary: My daughter and I were delighted when we saw our room. It exceeded our expectations: microwave, frig, coffeemaker, desk and  two big flat screen TVs, fabulous selection of channels, clean, quiet and the sofa & bed were SO comfortable! Great breakfast selection in the morning and the coffee always hot and plentiful....and an easy walk to Disneyland or we could grab a bus directly in front.  Cortona staff was professional and friendly. This is our favorite accommodation choice now!!
Manager Response: Hello Leah L, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know your stay was thoroughly enjoyable.  All of our rooms have been refreshed with beautiful new furniture, 39 inch flat panel HDTV's, sofa sleepers, headboards and more.  We have received many compliments from guests about the comfort of our guest rooms as well as our many value added amenities including a very nice free hot breakfast each morning and new, faster and free Wi-Fi access.  We value your comments and appreciate the time you have taken to let us know about your wonderful stay.  Thanks again! John

Summary: It is a very small hotel about 3 blocks from Disneyland. We purchased the ART bus pass. I don't recommend getting it. It's a long wait you can walk faster. The hotel was clean. The beds were uncomfortable. They do give you complimentary breakfast. This was my first first to Disneyland. If I ever return I would stay at one of the on site hotels or a Good Neighbor Hotel that is across the street.
Manager Response: Dear Janrico76, Thanks for sharing your review about our hotel.  I completely understand your comments about the ART shuttle.  I must admit though that it is a very good option for those that might have little ones in tow.  Another value feature that we offer is no additional charge for parking.  Hotels across from Disneyland may charge daily parking fees that can add up over a few nights.  But completely understand your point about the wait for the shuttle and do appreciate the time you have taken to share your comments.  We shall look forward to seeing you again soon!  Thanks again!!  John

Summary: The front desk staff always courteous and willing to help. The rooms are clean, neat and tidy with comfortable beds, which is needed after along day at Disneyland. Close to restaurants if needed.Breakfast simple and basic but okay to start your day with.A great place to stay in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Happy Aussies50, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We value your feedback and are pleased to know you enjoyed your stay.  Its always nice to know that our guests that arrive from afar find our hotel to be comfortable, convenient and satisfying.  Thanks again! John

Summary: This hotel was not as close to Disneyland as they make it seem. The hotel claims 2 blocks away but they are really long blocks which ends up being about 1.5 miles. Not so bad in the morning but torture when you're walking back from the park after a long day. Despite the distance, the rooms are clean and the rates are fair for what you get. The beds are springy and the pillows are flat but we were so tired it didn't matter. I do have to say the rooms are spacious and we had plenty of space for the 4 of us. The continental breakfast offered was actually a nice variety and enough to keep us full until lunch. The only reason I wouldn't stay here again is because I wouldn't want it walk so far to the park.
Manager Response: Dear Angela B, Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We are pleased to know that with the exception of a couple areas, your stay was pleasant and enjoyable.  And I want to let you know I understand your thoughts about our distance to Disneyland.  Although the precise distance is 0.8 miles( zero point eight miles), most hotels in Anaheim will make reference to distance to Disneyland in blocks.   In fact, a great way to get the most out of a Disneyland Resort  holiday is to take advantage of the one day or multiple day ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) pass as it will not only provide transfer to and from our hotel and Disneyland, it will also take you to Knott's Berry Farm, Main Place Mall, Target, etc.   Thanks again for your valuable comments and hope to see you again soon at the Cortona Inn & Suites.

Summary: Had a great time staying at Cortona Inn...kids loved the pool.  I do recommend probably more tables bigger room for the breakfast...both days we had to stand waiting for available tables.  The room was clean and service was awesome.
Manager Response: Dear Marisa L, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know you enjoyed your stay with us.  If we can ever be of service again, please let us know. Thanks again! John

Summary: My niece and I arrived weary from our red eye flight and a long bus ride from lax in the morning. They pre checked me in so when we returned from Disney we could just grab our ticket and go to our room, and offered to store our luggage while we were at the park.  I messed up and didn't get an ART pass and the front desk lady was super helpful and showed me exactly how to get there.   Our room was conveniently on the ground floor. Walked in to a clean room with good amenities. The microwave, coffee maker and fridge were very clean and in good  condition.   The only negative was the floor was wet like they had shampooed and didn't let it dry enough. The a/c worked well, and the linens were soft. Pillows were excellent and the beds were  comfy and soft.  The manager was the one to
Manager Response: Dear Sarahsmithdisneyaunt, Thank you for taking the time to share your review of our hotel.  We are pleased to know that your visit was most enjoyable and that you were very pleased with our services and wonderful amenities.  We work very hard to ensure that our guests are always comfortable, satisfied and made to feel welcome.  If your plans call for another visit to Anaheim soon, please do let us know.  Thanks again for taking the time to share your comments about the Cortona Inn & Suites.  John

Summary Heading: If you want a place near Disneyland this is the place for you.
Summary: The hotel staff were very helpful in assisting with directions to various tourist hot spots, bus stations, restaurants and stadium.   The hotel was clean and quiet.     They have limited parking due to construction but they had valet parking.    Great stay!
Manager Response: Dear Joann H, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We value your comments and appreciate the time you have take to share how wonderful your stay was.  Let us know if you plan to return to the Anaheim Resort again!  John

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay. We visited Disney. The location was perfect and we walked to dinner and the park it was great. We will probably stay there again. Some construction going on but it wasn't bothersome.
Manager Response: Dear Kyra, Thank you very much for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that your stay was most enjoyable and that we met with your satisfaction.  Please let us know when you plan to visit again soon.  Thanks again!  John

Summary: yes there was construction in front but i never heard anything and it did not interfere with my families stay at all. the price-great, the room was clean, modern with all the amenities-fridge, microwave, flat screen tv's, bathroom-small but super clean and modern. the staff was incredibly nice and very attentive. it might not be 4 star hotel but it definitely felt like a 4 star hotel. i will definitely stay there again and i have already told my family and friends about it.  Excellent service Cortona!
Manager Response: Dear Charlene, Thank you for a very nice review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are most pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and that you found our services and amenities to be to your liking.  Please let us know if you plan a return visit to the Anaheim Resort.  Thanks again!!  John

Summary: We had a very relaxing stay and the walk to Disneyland was not that bad. Very friendly personnel assisting u in all matter. Will definitely come back here . It was a great value . I loved the fact that the tv was High definition , I didn't have to leave the room to watch a dodgers game with great quality . I recommend it to all!

Summary Heading: Nothing special, but I would stay again.
Summary: We stayed for nearly a week. The following is my assessment:  Pros: 1) Relatively close to Disneyland (less than a mile). We walked everyday, and it only took us 15-20 minutes. We've always taken shuttles from hotels in the past, so this was very positive to us in that we never felt trapped. 2) Although the motel is relatively old, it looks like it has been updated inside and out somewhat recently. The bathroom was nicer than other hotels we have stayed at (because of the updates). The beds were average (or maybe a bit below average). Our room smelled a bit musty, but in general, I felt the room was clean and satisfactory. We stayed in a "suite", which was probably the smallest suite we have stayed in, but again, it was satisfactory. 3) This isn't necessarily a pro, but I did

Summary Heading: Nothing Special, I wouldn't stay here again
Summary: We booked 3 nights here while in Anaheim for our trip to Disneyland. We booked due to the close proximity to the park and the good price which included breakfast and wifi and the beautiful pictures. The hotel itself is okay, not like the pictures at all though. The rooms were small and not very comfortable, outdated and just dirty looking. The beds weren't very comfortable either. Check in was good, the front desk staff were very friendly. There was noone to help with luggage, so it was a struggle to get our 3 bags, carseat, stroller and toddler up to our room. There are no amenities on site except a small gift shop that sells the usual souvenirs and pop, but that closes early. If you need food, a late night snack, water or milk you are on your own walking quite a ways to get

I stayed Just one Night for The Dental Convention right Around the corner. I was Received With a very Pretty Smile from Karla at the Front Office. She checked me in and I was more than satisfied with the customer service. I walk into my room and everything look spotless and smells great. While I was there I received a phone call from the reception room asking is everything was great in my room. I have never been at a resort who have ever checked up with me regarding any needs until now which made it a (Wow) Stay. I would definitely recommend this Resort.

My family of two adults and three children stayed at the Cortona Inn for four nights this last week. The room was perfect for us! The bunk beds and pull out sofa were perfect for our kids and, they had their own room. It was nice to get up and go get them something to eat for breakfast as well. The pool was wonderful! We had a great time and, the staff was wonderful. they even called to check in to see how we were doing. I would stay here again! We could even see the fireworks from Disneyland on the third floor. We had an amazing time!

Rooms are clean. But the property doesn't look anything like the photos. We had a two room suite and it was small not what I expected. Do not try to sleep in here, the kids are up at 7 am or earlier and scream and cry and run. Other guests are rude. Next time I will be staying somewhere that has a shuttle to Disneyland if you are that far away!
Manager Response: Dear JLovato23, Thank you for your comments regarding your recent visit.  We have just finished a rooms renovation which included new furniture, new 39 inch flat panel HDTV, new desk chairs, wall art and more.  New images of the hotel will debut on the introduction of our updated web site soon.  Please accept our apologies if the appearance was not what you were expecting.  I would also like to apologize if our desk agents did not inform you of the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle which is the designated shuttle service for nearly all of hotels in the resort to transport hotel guests to and from the Disneyland Resort Parks.  Our apologies also for the noise you experienced from the excited little kids that were apparently a bit overwhelmed with the thought of going to Disneyland for their first time.  Thank you again for taking the time to express your thoughts about our hotel.

Summary: they are really good people there the rooms are clean in shorts terms it is a nice place a nice hotel...just neet to put atractions for the kids and a restaurant in there too but my family and i like the days we spend there togeter... thank you for ur services
Manager Response: Dear mamasusan a, Thank you for your comments regarding your stay.  We appreciate the time you have taken to express your thoughts and kinds comments.  So happy to hear that you and your family had an enjoyable time during your stay.  We look forward to seeing you again on a future visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: We were here with about 10 eighth graders for a robotics competition and I was very pleasamtly surprised.  The price for our stay and the area was, I thought, completely fair.  The room was clean and housekeeping came daily restoring to the room to its original conditions.  Clean towels, replenished amenities.  The breakfast was adequate for our needs and complimentary. I think the one thing that stood out was the helpfulness and courtesy of the staff.  There were several times I needed to rely on them ans even though I knew I was putting them out, they couldn't have made me feel more at home.
Manager Response: Dear campsintents, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Happy to hear that you and your group had an enjoyable stay.  Our team of helpful and courteous housekeepers and desk staff are always available to assist our guests and I am happy hear that you found them to be most efficient and helpful and also that you enjoyed our complimentary hot breakfast.  Thanks again!

Summary: Recently stayed at the Cortona Inn and Suites for our trip to Disneyland...as this was the first leg of our trip and wasn;t looking to break the bank for the 5 day stay but needed space to accomadate 2 adults and 3 kids this worked out very well. Have stayed at other hôtels with Kid Suites in the area and I would say this compared very well with the others. The pool was actually quite nice and even though it was in the middle of the parking lot the trees and plants kept in private from cars and such. The rooms were clean and maybe not as large as pictures would show online but we made it work and honestly after 8-10 hour days at the park a comfy bed was a welcome sight! The breakfast would be my only complaint as it is always very crowded and the quality of food not very good.
Manager Response: Dear redwoodsbay, Thank you for your review and comments about the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We appreciate the time you have taken to share your thoughts about hotel.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and pleasant.  Construction of the new neighboring hotel will be complete in June and that will end any dust that you mention.  Glad to know however that this was just a minor disturbance to your visit and did not affect your stay.  We do pride ourselves on our value added amenities which included our hot breakfast, free Wi-Fi, no additional charge for parking, walking distance to the Disneyland Resort.  Also nice for our guests is knowing we do not have the vehicle and pedestrian traffic congestion that is all too frequent for hotels along the busy area north of Katella.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary Heading: Clean room, but amenities and service are poor
Summary: Let's get the positive item out of the way. Our room was clean, and the property itself is in generally good repair. Now the not so good. WiFi was nearly non-existent on my iPad.
