No cleaning service on our third night.  Oh, and then there's the parking. There is a new hotel being built in front of this one. There are not enough parking spaces for the current guests. But, don't worry, there is valet parking!  For a motor lodge. You pay a ten dollar a night resort fee, then have to tip the valet, which you have to use when you can't find a parking space, which is most all the time. The breakfast items are so so, nothing special. Many of these items I could overlook, except that we paid $120 a night to stay here, and could have gotten more for our money elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear 326Shawn, Thank you for your review.  We value your opinions and appreciate the time you have taken to share your thoughts.  If I can just share a thought....  Valet parking will cease in June once the new neighbor hotel opens.  So, although tipping for valet parking has always been optional, Valet parking will not be needed beyond June.  Should your plans call for a future visit to Anaheim we ask that you contact us again and allow us the opportunity to help make your stay enjoyable.

Summary: The rates are high for the quality of the room.  I would value this hotel at around $100 a night not the $179 that I had to pay.  I had to pay extra $20 per night verses a co-workers rate for a room at the same place that was not consider a suite.  The rooms are not that much nicer to justify the additional cost.  I would have rather stayed at the Hampton Inn down the street and shuttled to the conference.  I stayed at the Hampton in 2009 for the same conference.  The breakfast they have is not bad, but be sure to get down there before 9am.  One morning they were picking it up before 9:30am.  There was still construction going on next door, and our room was right beside it.  My husband stayed in the room all day.  He said that you could not hear it much from the room.  I would
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing your comments.  We value all guest comments and appreciate hearing from our guests.

Summary: This hotel is very convenient to the convention center. Was nice to have breakfast provided so my guest could eat. And with a microwave and refrigerator, it was easy to store left-overs from all the food that's a short walk away.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review.  We appreciate the time that you have taken to share your thoughts and comments about our hotel.  We value all guest comments and want you to know we appreciate hearing from our guests.  Thanks again!

Summary: I was attending a conference at the convention center and the cortona inn was less than a 10 minute walk.  The room was clean and quiet.  I usually have sleep problems at hotels because of loud neighbors or people in the halls but had none of that here.  I would definitely stay here again!

Nothing fancy, but a clean room at a good price.  I would have loved to have been able to open a window to get some fresh air.  The room got stuffy quickly without the A/C running.  Very helpful and friendly staff.  Close walk to the Convention Center and a Disney Shuttle.

Clean rooms and nice employees. There was a lot of construction going on around the hotel area but that really did not bother me. The best part was that if we did not feel like taking the 15-20 min walk to Disney or from Disney the location of this hotel is directly across from the Toy Story Parking lot and Disney has a free shuttle.  When we got to the parking lot we asked if we had to park in this parking lot in order to take the shuttle and the response of one of the parking attendants was, if you are headed to Disneyland to spend money then the shuttle is free.  He laughed and said yes of course anyone that wants to get on the bus and take a ride to Disneyland is welcome.

Summary Heading: Good value, clean rooms and close to Disney!
Summary: My family of four and my parents just arrived home from our three night stay at cortonainn. Check in was fast, our room was ready early and parking was jot a problem. They are doing construction next door but we never heard a thing, and they had a valet to help with parking for free if you choose to use it. The room we got was the suite, so basically two rooms with adjoining doors. The rooms were clean, had a microwave and fridge( awesome for bedtime snack for kids) and the beds were comfortable. We used the free shuttle at the disneyland hotel to get to the main gates, it's a 5 min walk. The main gates are maybe 20 mins walk, so I suggest save your steps for the park and hop on the free disney shuttle bus.breakfast was ok, it did change somewhat day by day. I wouldn't say it's

My family and I are Disneyland pass holder, we like to go for the weekend. This hotel is perfect for us. We stay here because the rooms are clean, the beds are not bad, and the breakfast in the morning is not too shabby.

Summary Heading: A good value for the price.
Summary: It was a pleasant place to stay. It would help if you had more places to sit for your breakfast. The hotel was full and a good 30-40 min wait to sit. We left some items behind and was pleased to hear that they were turned into lost and found. Thank you for an honest staff.

We picked this hotel because we had 6 people and loved the family suite with the bunk beds. It was very reasonably priced and had breakfast sand was close enough to the Disneyland parks. We walked to the parks for the most part. It's about 5 blocks. By the third day we were tired so we used the shuttle. Breakfast is ok, it's enough to get you going. Our coffee maker broke at one point and they were quick to get us a new one. The pool is heated which was nice. Overall, the room/bathroom was a bit smaller than we thought and not really Disney themed in any way as the pictures lead you to believe, but it worked out perfectly and I would stay again.

My stay at Cortona was satisfactory.  The desk clerk, Dulce is an excellent employee and was very friendly, had great customer service and met our needs.  Even though the hotel is older, the rooms were very clean.  All staff were friendly and helpful.  The Valet Staff were great.  The only problem I found is the wifi service.  It was so slow that I tried for 2 hours to process work on my computer and was unable to do so.  By then I just turned my computer off.   Otherwise things were great.

Was attending a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. Super location for that venue. Room is just fine, a little dark, since it is a "motel" type hotel and depending where the room is... Breakfast was great if you could find a place to sit and not trip in a 3 years having a "tandrum" on the floor. Always too busy. The breakfast room is too small. The staff are incredibly noisy at 7:00AM,rolling their stuff around and screaming at each others, so no sleep allowed.They are building a Hyatt, literally in their parking lot at the moment, so not sure what will happen to this hotel.  So for the price, I would go a little further. Not a good deal.

Excellent Service, Perfect Location, Great Value for the price we paid.  Free parking and WiFi Parking was a challenge but they offered Free Valet parking when the lot was full.  Great Service for the price we paid and super close to Disneyland.

This is the second time I've stayed at the Cortona. The first time we stayed in a family suite since we had a larger group. This time we stayed in a double queen room. The staff is always friendly. It's such an amazing value I'm sure we will come back. The construction next door was not an issue because Cortona kindly gave us valet parking. The rooms were very clean and the housekeepers did a great job. The location is a little far to walk if you have young children but ART is steps away. The pool and jacuzzi were great after a day at Disney, although I wish it was open a bit later. The breakfast was great, especially because it is included in the rate. The only minor complaint I have is that I wish the beds were a bit more comfortable. They are very firm. Altogether, both times

Summary Heading: Perfect location, clean, helpful, great value!
Summary: Worth the stay, clean, great value, perfect location, you won't regret it! We stayed almost a week in jan 2014. Family of six. I did a lot of research before trip. Reviews of hotel were good and accurate as of our trip also. The hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland shuttle. Very clean!! Great value!! Breakfast was good and well taken care of, clean and food hot & fresh!

Stayed 5 nights. Room just renovated i.e.  painted and new cabinet and table. Clean room. WiFi free, but at times overloaded and connection breaks or you cannot get connected. Breakfast modest. Walls thin so one morning I woke up at 5 am as neighbor was making phone calls. Excellent service at front desk. I wonder why they call it a resort, it's a typical motel. Located walking distance from the Convention Center.  Found out that in Anaheim they add lots of taxes to quoted room rate. I had totally 27% taxes added (City bed x 2, Resort Fee, Tourism Improvement). So be careful in Anaheim about the price quoted and what you pay.

My family stayed here for 1 day only even though we booked for 4 days as it did not have any stove. That was a key requirement for us. The suite was smaller than we expected but the staff was very courteous and understanding. Helped us through this and got the reservation cancelled without any penalty. Really appreciate that as I could shift to another hotel as per our requirements.

My family and I stayed here for 7 nights in February while going to Disneyland, and it was wonderful. The price was very affordable. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and we didn't have any issues with noise from the construction going on next door where a new hotel is being built. They have a deluxe continental breakfast every morning that was great, including waffles, eggs and bacon or sausage, juice and coffee and pastries. All staff was kind and helpful, and housekeeping was kept up well. We would definitely recommend staying here if you are looking for a disney trip on a budget. Not too far from the park, there is a park shuttle across the street, and many restaurants and some fast food within walking distance as well. We also used taxis a few times to get to and from

We are always greeted with a caring and friendly smile. One person that continues to stand out is Esmeralda! She remembered us although we hadn't been there in a year!   We have stayed here many times within the last few years   since we have disneyland annual passes.  Pros:  -You can't beat the price.  -Rooms are clean -Front desk staff are very helpful and polite.  -Free parking  -Free breakfast with a great selection!  Cons: -Free wifi (not the greatest signal) -Mattress is very firm (but we were told they are doing some upgrades little by little.)   *Note: you can buy ART bus passes for $5 a day per person which drops you right in front of the disneyland park!*

We stayed at the Cortona for 7 nights. Family of 4. 2 adults and 2 children. The free breakfast was not worth it. The restaurant area is to small. Not enough seating for all guests. Same thing every morning. Rooms are kept clean and made up daily. I agree with others the construction next door was not to bad but the kids running up and down the hall ways at 7 am is annoying. Rooms are NOT sound proof at all. Could hear everything that was happening in the parking lot and in the swimming area. Also stayed right in front of the stair well, so when people arrived in the middle of the night early in the morning we could hear them very well. Walk to the park was not to bad. Even with 2 children. Also noticed a really bad smell coming from the sink drain. 1 day had very poor water

We stayed here for 3 nights and it was very pleasant. The room was clean and spacious for our family. We used to go out after the breakfast and come back in the evening and the housekeeping cleaned the room everyday, which was a blessing as I can't stand dirty bathroom or unmade bed. The location is prime! almost everything quite near the hotel..will stay again!

I decided to take my two kids (9 and 13) to Disneyland for a short 4 day getaway to Disneyland. The check in process of easy; they held our luggage since we arrived early.  There is construction right next door, but it wasn't too much of a problem.  We stayed in room 234 (right in front of the stairs on the second floor).  We had a king suite.  The bed was the most uncomfortable bed.  The pillows were foam, but felt like they had chunks of foam in them not one foam piece.  Every time the upstairs (324) shower or sink was used, we could hear the water really loudly in our room.  The outside noise level was fairly contained from 11 PM until about 6 AM.  After that, it became noisy with kids running around screaming.  The free deluxe breakfast wasn't worth it.  We walked to get

Summary Heading: Don't believe the hype! Check it out for yourself!
Summary: So, let me begin this by saying: ANY where you go, you will find something to complain about. If I try, I can find something wrong with every other surrounding hotel. I would rather you hear about all my amazing experiences. So, I've stayed in multiple rooms ranging from double queen bed room, King Suite & Spa Suite. So, first room I've ever stayed in there was the Spa Suite. It is a whole separate room, unattached from the bathroom, with a HUGE tub in it. The bed was king size, the tv was nice & we got AWESOME breakfast options in the morning. The next room I experienced was the King Suite, as my fiance & I went w/ her daughter. The room had 1-king bed inside of it's own separate bedroom w/ it's own separate tv. The living room area had a queen sofa bed & a desk w/ it's own tv.

We began our family reunion here, staying in a group of rooms.  We booked it, because they were offering rooms for $109 per night due to the massive construction occurring onsite, and because we could walk to Disneyland from there.  We were the only ones in our group that had an issue with one of the beds.  We had a bed that gave way in the center and made a racket every time the person in it turned or moved.  I am a light sleeper, so it kept me up much of the night.  The other rooms did not have the same problem and so the rest of our group slept well.  The breakfast was not good and that was disappointing.  We had the option of staying an extra night, but chose to move to a different hotel in the area.  We have been to Anaheim enough that we knew we could do better.  Overall,

Summary Heading: Booked for 2 nights, could only stand 1
Summary: Unfortunately we had a bad experience here. Quite a few things went wrong, have listed them in order: 1. Booking time: Went on their website & noticed a special offer for black friday, no where on the website did it say it was for online bookings only (or would have just booked online). So went to front desk & asked if had vacancy & about offer. Was told have to book online to get special deal, so used our own internet on phone & then took approx. 15 mins until the confirmation came thru on their system! So had to wait in lobby without being offered anything a coffee or anything etc.  2. Room: When booking finally came thru, was told room i booked was already booked out & would upgrade us to a 2 queen bedroom, was ok with that. The actual room wasn't very nice at all. Dark

Summary Heading: I'm pleased I watch my credit card statements ...
Summary: The hotel was functional, and the beds were comfortable ... but there were two issues. (1) there was substantial building taking place, and if I am expected to stay on a building site when on holiday, I should be told - I believe - and (2) In addition to the room and resort charge, they took an additional $25 off my credit card - not a 'hold' as most places do, but a 'take'. I eventually emailed them about it and whilst I didn't receive a reply, the $25 was returned. Watch your credit card statements! ...

This Inn offers free wi-fi, in room safe, ironing board and iron, TV with remote, fridge, microwave an coffee maker. It was very clean. There is not a big dresser to put your clothes and bags into. You can stack the bags in the closet, and there are 3 small drawers below the TV. I would recommend traveling with minimal baggage.  The best part about this place is that it is located right next to Disneyland parking or you can walk to the park within 15 minutes or take a bus.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  The front desk staff was awesome, Ian and Esmeralda checked us in and they were so friendly and helpful!  Our king suite was very spacious and clean.  We will definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Good motel at a great price.
Summary: Very comfortable hotel, friendly staff. Had a small problem on check-in when they sent us to a room not cleaned up yet, but sorted out very quickly & no fuss. Easy distance to Disneyland & quite restaurants in the area. Only disappointing thing, breakfast is nothing to write home about but then again it is free so can't complain really!

We stayed here for 10 nights in September on what was our first family trip to the USA and Disneyland.   There was construction going on in front of the Hotel but this did not affect our stay.  We booked a Kids Suite and it was excellent, was great to have a separate room for the kids.  Was an easy 10min walk to Disneyland, and we used ART buses which had a bus stop outside the Hotel. Breakfast was included which was great, and we made daily use of the Hotel Pool. The Hotel was clean, comfortable and staff very friendly and helpful in terms of recommending places to go and arranging tours,etc. Hotel was a convenient walk to local restaurants, 7eleven, etc Free wifi was patchy at times, but we didn't care as we were on vacation.

I chose to stay here because I was attending a convention at the Anaheim convention center and it was within walking distance. This turned out to be the only thing about this hotel I found to be even remotely satisfactory. Here is my list of grievances, in the order I experienced them: The parking was beyond inadequate - probably 20-30 parking spaces for well over 100 rooms. The room itself fell far below my expectations. It was cramped, ugly, and bizarrely configured. The wifi was slow to the point of being unusable, making nights in my room frustrating, stressful and boring. The breakfast was alright, but for some reason they played a VHS copy of Hook every morning in the dining area and it just struck me as being a little insane. I might have been willing to overlook some of

We stayed her for a week (Oct 30-Nov6, 2013). I read the prior reviews about the construction noise but we didn't find it bothersome. They didn't start until after 7am, and we were out for most of the day. When we did come back during the day, if our windows were closed we didn't hear the construction. Keep in mind our room was not next to the construction  We booked a king suite; but somehow got a king suite wheelchair accessible suite. This meant there was no dividing door between the living room & bedroom. Would have been okay, if we didn't have a toddler who woke up at the slightest sound.   Housekeeping was daily. Didn't see any bugs. Bathroom was clean but a little banged up. Bed was comfortable. The room was a little stuffy; but the a/c worked.   The included breakfast

Summary Heading: Average, about what expected... but a few issues
Summary: About what expected for the price. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable (although probably because I was so tired after days at Disneyland, California Adventure. I would have been able to sleep on a park bench, lol). Amenities basic. Its close enough to Disneyland for the price.   Breakfast was about what expected, although the dining room was very small and certainly not big enough to accommodate as many people eating breakfast as there were during the hours breakfast was available.   The staff were helpful with advice for theme park tickets and room key issues we had.   WiFi was abysmal and totally unacceptable in this day and age when most hotels have free working WiFi. Half the time you couldn't connect, and the rest of the time you'd connect only to get dropped

Stayed with a preschooler and 10-month old.  Clean.  Enjoyable walk with two strollers to Disneyland and California Adventure (about 20 minutes) on Harbor Blvd.  Deluxe breakfast rotates with make your own egg & sausage english muffins, pancakes, frozen waffles, and make your own waffle bar, fruit (bananas, apples, oranges).  Complimentary crib.  Comfortable beds and clean sheets and towels.  Construction in the front, but it didn't bother us.  We didn't use the pool because we were busy at the amusement park.  Front desk was courteous and helpful.  We stayed 5 days during Halloween week. Purchased on priceline for $50/night.  Hotel adds an additional $12/night resort fee on top of it.

Summary Heading: Old but well maintained, self service laundry, spacious.
Summary: The place is old but well maintained. Meant for families, the rooms are split between master and children's rooms, with connecting door. Self service laundry in premises is cheap and convenient. Ample parking. Not as noisy as other reviews may state. In fact third floor rooms are very quiet. Friendly helpful staff. Free breakfast is ok, nothing fancy.

Stayed at the hotel on business for several days.  Here is a quick rundown on the good/bad aspects of the hotel:  THE BAD   -Construction- Hotel sold the front of their land from the lobby to the street to the City of Anaheim.   Anaheim, in turn, sold the prime land to another hotel. Buyer beware because construction is now constant to open this other hotel and dust is everywhere.  If you expect to take an afternoon nap or sleep in...good luck.   - Ease of Access - While several have commented about the easy access, I can state that several others are far better and even offer free shuttles. You are over a mile from the hotel lobby to the front of Disneyland walking on the sidewalks. I used the Nike App while running late at night so I know the distance was 1.15 miles each way.

Located a block from the Anaheim Convention Center. You can cut through Clarion's parking lot as a short cut. Room value was better than many others on the list of hotels. Room exceptionally clean. Quiet. Only thing that could be better is the breakfast. Frozen waffles make Eggo's seem like gourmet. Many high-carb items, but they do have fresh bananas and apples.   The location is good even if you're going to Disneyland or California Adventure. It's about a 10 minute walk to the main gate. Several restaurants within 3 blocks. Staff are nice and accommodating.

We chose this hotel as we were attending a convention.  It was excellently located: a 5-minute walk (max).  Appreciated the free breakfasts (there is no restaurant service otherwise).  Rooms were clean and nicely decorated; beds were comfortable. TVs are old.  The major disappointment was the wi-fi, which was one of our main reasons for picking a hotel.  The connection was awful at all hours.  Multiple people could not connect at once, and even then it was impossible to do things like skype.    The construction was not an issue for us.  We did not notice any noise from it.

Stayed at Cortona for 2 weeks in a kids suite. The room was large and clean.Beds very comfortable and the staff were excellent.The breakfast is good, with a variety of choices.The carpark is always full at night, but i always managed to find a spot.It is a good 3 star hotel in a good location near Disneyland and a number of great restaurants. The pool is open until 10pm so it can be a bit loud outside until then. The stucture between the floors appears to be timber floorboards so you can hear every step the people above you take. We were lucky that most nights, the people above went to bed early..If you are a light sleeper you will need a top floor room or go elsewhere. Overall it was a good place to stay with kids, the constructon next door didn't bother us at all, we were up

We took our first family vacation and stayed at this Hotel Sept. 15 - 19 2013'.  The beds were very comfortable.  However,  They had to upgrade our room because they booked our room to someone else to begin with.  Thinking great more room - Not the back room the floor was soaking wet the entire time - we ruined many socks (We're a family of 7)  the back air conditioning unit was broken and continually leaked all over the carpet our room had a terrible smell. The continental breakfast was good for a Gut Truck. I went to the front desk but that's ok if they didn't listen at least they were nice about it. We saved a long time for the trip - but at least Disneyland was amazing and our family made precious memories!

Summary Heading: OK Hotel within easy walk to Disney
Summary: We deliberately decided not to spend too much money on out hotel because we figured we would be primarily at Disneyland and just needed a place to sleep. We pretty much got this. There is nothing worng with this hotel, and I suspect as good as you will get at this price level. The rooms were fine, the beds were comfortable, it was clean. However, there is nothing special about it. The pool area is OK, and nicely heated, and the spa was OK too. The breakfast was quite good considering it is included in the price. There is a major construction site happening at the front of the hotel, but they dont start work until 7:00am, and even when they did, to be honest we didnt hear them and our room was the closest room to the site. We didnt have a car, but could see that parking was at a

Summary Heading: They didn't disclose the fact that their is very bad construction nearby
Summary: I wanted to have a nice family resort vacation for the end of summer.  For much better quality and location I could have spent maybe 40 bucks more a night at marriot.  The management is well aware of the MASSIVE construction taking place right next door its loud noisey and not to mention BLOCKS the path for parking. Completely hazardous and dangerous. The room themselves are poor quality for the price worth no more than $99 a night.  Even after they clean your room you walk in and it just feels sticky, smells awful, and very creepily dark.  I had to call room service multiple times to remind them about items i requested and they took forever. The pool was a joke Small and multiple lights in the pool and in my hotel room were broken.  The tv sucked.  The only reason why I am not

Summary Heading: Do not book an exectutive suite
Summary: My son and family checked into the Cortona October 4th.  Upon arrival we noticed major construction going on very close proximity to the hotel.  We had booked the executive suite because we had a 4 year old with us thinking nap time would work out better this way. We checked into our room and right off the bat noticed a horrific smell in the room.  The smell was similar to cat urine.  The living room part of the suite was very small.  The rug was very dirty and stained.  The bedroom was fair but the air conditioning was not working.  The room was full of sand and dust from the construction site.  The bathroom had numerous bugs in the tub.  We went out to use the pool area.  We could not sit in the chairs because they were covered with dirt and dust. The pool water was dirty and

Summary Heading: First family holiday to America was great!
Summary: Cortona Inn and Suites fully catered for all of my families needs. In particular, ersamalda (sorry dont know how to spell her name) offered the best service of all the employees. She always went out of her way to help and talk to us with her friendly personality.

My family of 6 stayed at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. All in all this hotel was decent, not great but not bad either. It had some good points and bad points, so I'll start with the good. We had a Family Suite, which consisted of 2 queen rooms with a connecting door. The rooms looked just like the website, spacious, clean, nice decor, and nice firm beds. Bed comfort is all a matter of opinion though. The free continental breakfast was ok. I've had much better at other hotels, but it was acceptable. Good location to Disneyland...even walkable if you don't mind a little hike. The pool area is a bit small, but serene and pretty, and the hotel staff were all very friendly.  Here's the bad parts. There wasn't enough parking to accommodate the whole hotel. The construction out

pros: 1 min walk to Anaheim Convention Center and very close to Disneyland, and everything. Provides complimentary parking. Had a pool which we didn't use. Room was clean. Breakfast was not surprisingly good but still provided several choices.  Cons: AC was a little noisy. Wifi connection was not stable.

The Good News: The staff is excellent! Cheerful, helpful and welcoming. The beds are comfortable, towels and hot water are plentiful.The pool is clean and a nice temperature. Breakfast is good with lots of seating. The Bad News: Ants in some rooms. Parking stalls are hard to come by on the weekends, and the pretty green lawn you see in the pictures is now a huge, dusty, noisy, construction zone.

Nice big room, comfortable beds and pillows.  Expect lots of kiddies screaming and running up and down the balcony walk due to its close proximity to Disneyland.  But, I'd recommend this place if you're going to Disney... good value.  Breakfast room is impossibly crowded in the morning... just like Disneyland so you'll feel right at home.  LOL  Front desk people were great and very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear artispaul, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable.  And thanks for the great tip, also.

Summary: Last minute reso ($$$) but wanted close to Disney (careful of construction, limited parking, easy to miss) Rooms were okay (older decor), but beds were hard as a rock (sheets remained the same for the 2 nights), and could hear construction traffic on the ground floor. The continental breakfast was great, but get there early as it fills up and you might eat at pool area (see pix, plenty of space). No shuttle to Disney, but a leisurely 4 block walk (20 min. appx). The front desk staff were extremely helpful/friendly and provided some discounted tickets.
Manager Response: Dear DesertArt, Thank you for your review of our hotel.  You touched on some areas that I would like to address just in case others are interested.  Typical with hotels these days is the practice of changing sheets every other day unless needed or requested by the guest to help reduce the amount of chemicals released into the environment during the laundering process.  But again, if a guest requests them to be changed every day, we always observe the guests preference.  Breakfast is one of our most popular free amenities so that being said it does get busy.  But it is a great cost saver for families traveling on a budget.  Shuttle service to and from the Disneyland Resort is provided to guests of all Anaheim Resort Hotels (including the Cortona Inn & Suites) by the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) shuttle service.  There is a very modest daily fee for adults and children, but the service is excellent and takes guests not only to the Disneyland Resort but to Knott’s Berry Farm, The Westfield Santa Ana Main Place Mall, The Shops at Garden Walk, Target and many other fine locations.  It even serves the Anaheim Amtrak Station for guests arriving by train.  I would also like to thank you for recognizing our Front Desk Staff.  Their primary purpose is to ensure that every guest is attended to professionally and with the utmost of care and to ensure that their stay is comfortable and relaxing.  And finally, the new hotel being built in front of our hotel has reached a phase that will see less and less noise intrusion as the earth moving and underground parking garage comes to completion.  The construction process of course is only temporary with this new hotel opening in June of 2014.  In the meantime, efforts are employed to maintain noise at a minimum during the day with work only performed while most guests are away from the hotel.   Thanks again for taking time to share your comments about our hotel and your stay and I assure you that next time you stay with us, you will be very, very pleased.

Summary: We booked this hotel for our stay while visiting Disney because the pictures looked nice. I had read the reviews about the construction but wasn't too worried about it. To my despair, this hotel I a former days inn and the rooms are exactly the lay out of a motel 6. Single payned paper thin windows that don't properly secure, filthy carpet and towels I wouldn't even use to wash my vehicle!! After much complaining we received a refund for the 2nd night we had already previously paid for and moved to another hotel. If your looking for a nice, family friendly hotel that's nice, don't stay here. I should have known when I was greeted in the lobby by a clerk that had multiple stains all over her wrinkles uniform that it wasn't the place of place I wanted to stay.....
Manager Response: Dear TellinDaTruth, Thank you for your comments about our hotel.  I apologize that your experience did not meet your expectations but can assure you that what you have described is not the service we are known for or the product that we deliver on a regular basis.  The Cortona Inn & Suites has an inventory of rooms to accommodate guests who prefer Spa Suites, Executive Suites and Kids' Suites and deluxe rooms with one King bed or two Queen beds.  We also offer amenities that are typical of most 3 Diamond rated hotels that include a very nice and free hot continental breakfast, free High Speed Internet Access, parking at no additional charge, 100% Non-Smoking Rooms, and in-room safe.  We have also used your comments to remind our staff of the hotels uniform standards. Thank you again for sharing your comments about your stay.

Summary: great location but sad hotel for the price charged. changed hotels for a better price ,ambience and value for money.hotel is developing property and trucks drive thru the parking area disturbing our sleep.rooms are old and dated. for hotel owners- if you charge 25% less then you are fine.if not you need to renovate. for guests -- shop elsewhere for better value for your money. finally -- the property needs to be pulled down for a complete renovation and re fittment
Manager Response: Dear Al Khobar, We appreciate the time you have taken to share your comments. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Great price for a great location
Summary: We had a king suite it was great layout for what we needed. Great location close to lots if restaurant close to Disney. The only negative is hotel doesn't provide transportation to Disney. We just parked at park way more convienent. Breakfast was good pool was nice. There was construction but it didn't bother me sometimes I forgot about it. Great friendly front desk staff!
Manager Response: Dear guest, Thank you for sharing your comments about your recent stay.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable.  It is also nice to see a positive word about the new hotel that is being built in front of our hotel.  When completed and open next summer, this will be one of the nicest hotels in the Anaheim Resort.  We are happy to have them as a neighbor as well.   Thanks again for your review and kind comments about our Front Desk Staff that truly does their best to help our guests. Thanks!!

Summary: The room smelled musty and old with very poor air conditioning circulation from the moment I stepped into my room.  There was no gym so I went down the way to another hotel for a workout the first morning before going out for work.  When I returned to my room I found my shower did not work properly and sprayed everywhere in my bathroom.  I called the front desk and no one was available to fix it and my only option was to use another room clear across the hotel.  I was now pinched for time and had no choice but to bathe.  The reason for my stay was business and the internet service was horrible!  The connection would be lost and was constantly cutting in and out.  The hotel is very family friendly ad comes with the chaos and noise due to the high volume of children. I would not
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about your stay.  We do apologize that your stay was not up to your standards and would like to invite you back next time you are in town so we can make this up to you.  Free Internet service these days is a challenge for all hotels with an increasing number of internet devices being used by more and more people. In the past, a laptop was the norm for guests using hotel internet.  Now, cell phones, laptops, tablets used by each family member has greatly challenged the bandwidth capabilities of most hotel internet service and hotels now find the need to undergo major changes to the way internet access is delivered to hotel guests.  Please allow us some grace as we go through this period in which systems will be upgraded to satisfy the increasing demand/bandwidth placed on hotel internet services by mobile devices.  And as you mention, we do appeal to the individual business traveler and families coming to visit the Happiest Place On Earth, Disneyland Park and Disney's California Adventure Park. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: what a great place.my family and i were treated like gold.everyone here is so nice and friendly [Esmeralda was a doll] .the rooms were nice and clean beds nice and soft and the breakfast was really good with lots of choices also the pool and the hot tub were really clean..the only drawback was the construction going on out in front of the hotel but other than that this hotel was great.we will definitely  stay here again when we visit disneyland it is our new favorite hotel.
Manager Response: Dear breezeman, Thank you for your very nice review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  I am very pleased to pass along to Esmeralda a "Job Well Done".  Esme, as she is known by her colleagues, is a gem.  She takes her job very serious but delivers a level of customer care with a smile and welcome greeting.  She is "tops" and we are very pleased she finds her place with us.  I am also happy to inform you that the construction phase that you may have experienced is behind us now, with the parking garage nearly completed.  This means no more earth moving, or heavy machinery with their back up whistles.  The next phase will see the actual framing and completion of the hotel which will be a very quick process with noise levels at a minimum.  But the prize is when it is finished; the Anaheim Resort will have one heck of a fantastic, major brand hotel that will be incredibly beautiful, modern, and yes, within walking distance of the Disneyland Resort.   Thanks again for your kind comments and review and we shall look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay when visiting Disneyland.
Summary: I stayed at the Cortona Inn and Suites during Labor Day weekend of 2013, as I ran in the Disneyland half marathon. The rooms were decent, and had a mini fridge and microwave at no additional charge. This was great for storing cold Gatorades and breakfast foods for our run. The breakfast was satisfactory, and the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) stop is at the end of the driveway, which is a great bonus. We rode the ART to the Angels game and it was convenient. All in all, if you're looking to get a lot of bang for minimal buck, this is the place to hang your hat in Anaheim. It's no-frills but decent.
Manager Response: Dear MandyLake, Thank you for your very candid and heartfelt review.  This is the type of review (in my opinion) that actually helps others decide where they may want to stay.  I am pleased to know that you took good advantage of the room amenities, ART, our free breakfast and had a wonderful time.   Thank you again and perhaps we will have the chance to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice motel near Convention Centre and Disneyland
Summary: Cortona Inn is aged, but well maintained.    The staff here is extremely courteous, friendly and helpful.  Free breakfast has good quality food but dining area can be crowded.  Rooms have refrigerators, microwaves and coffee maker.  Linens white and crisp.   Have swimming pool with clean water.       Parking here is free, other lodgings nearby charge a daily fee.   Motel is within walking distance to the Convention Centre but a little farther to Disneyland.   Nice place for families.
Manager Response: Dear gene201_13, I would like to thank you for sharing your comments about your recent stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased that you were very satisfied with your stay and found our hotel to be accommodating.  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort please let us know.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: ok hotel but, I wouldn't stay here again...
Summary: I stayed at this Hotel for a work conference that was held at the convention center just a short walk away. The room was ok, nothing special. Very loud though, you can hear other people talking (and kids screaming) in the rooms next to you and above you. The room was clean other than what looked like black colored mold around the bathroom mirror, the shower head was leaking water and got the floor all wet, and some the towels had holes in them. The bedding was clean and the room appeared clean. There is construction right out in front of the hotel so you will start your morning with that noise at around 6am. There is a pool and a hot tub. I didn't go in them but, they looked clean. Basic continental breakfast of bread, bagels, toast, cereal, scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles,
Manager Response: Dear Devonshire27, Thank you for your review.  We appreciate the time you have taken to share your opinion and experience.  It appears that we could have done better and for any imperfections on our part I offer an apology.  I would also like to invite you back so that you can experience a stay that is not bittersweet, but absolutely wonderful.  If you care to give me a call, please ask for the Director of Sales and I would be happy to speak with you about a future visit. Thanks again!

Summary: when I got there gentle man at the desk gave me my key,I went to my room it had not been cleaned .I when downstairs to complain ,the man at the desk said housekeeping had left and the was nothing he could do.if I didn't like it i could go to an other Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Please accept our apologies for the manner in which you mention you were treated.  This is not representative of the level of customer service we are known for.  We would like to thank you for your time submitting your review.  If you should visit the Anaheim Resort again I invite you to consider us again to experience the level of service that you desire and the service that we are know for.

Summary: You know when you go to Disneyland that really only use your hotel room for is to sleep and bathe, and Cortona Inn & Suites is fine for that. But be advised of a couple things for right now: 1. If Wi-fi is very important, this isnt the hotel for you. At least not in your room. 2. There is a construction project right in front of the hotel. This means construction noises starting as early as 7am. (so forget that quiet nap time in the afternoon) and parking is effected because of the construction. They do have a valet service to help but there is double parking every morning and it might take a while to get out in the morning.  This is August 2013, so in the future, ask if the construction is still on-going, if this is important to you. The staff was very polite and accommodating,
Manager Response: Dear Patty323, Thanks for submitting your review.  We are pleased that you found our hotel satisfactory for the most part as well as a couple areas that are being improved on.  Although there is construction of a brand new hotel in front of Cortona Inn that will open next summer, they have taken measures to ensure that noise intrusion to the Cortona is minimal.  Also, the phase of construction has passed that may have attributed to your experience.  Valet Parking is being offered to hotel guests if and when parking assistance is needed for the convenience of our guests.  Wi-Fi is currently being improved to accommodate the increasing number of Wi-Fi devices that are becoming more popular including telephones, computers, tables, etc.and will continue to remain a no cost/complimentary amenity to our hotel guests.

Summary: Got sick and tired of being told by the staff "oh we do apologise". Seemed to be the standard response to any inquiry. Wifi was crap - even if it did manage to work. Had to move rooms half way through our stay due to a stuff up at check in. Had to get our key cards reconfigured at least three times even though they were no where near a cell phone or credit card. Couldn't get a late check out even though we were there for 10 nights and weren't even offered storage for our suitcases after check out.  The desk staff could do with taking customer service lessons from the Disneyland personnel. On the plus side it was close to Disneyland and we did manage to have the pool to ourselves a couple of times.
Manager Response: Dear Linda, Not sure if you were the guest that I had the pleasure of meeting upon your departure, but I would like to apologize for the less than satisfactory experience you mention.  To ensure that our guests are always treated with the utmost of respect and service, we continue to provide our staff with training to see to it that our guests are comfortable, informed and satisfied with their stay.  I do thank you for your review.

Summary: Don't even bother... Wifi didnt work we were stuffed around with rooms we stayed in! free breakfast was the worst,  Denny's up the road way better.... Only thing going for it even with children is the location if u can get past the unhelpful staff than stay here!  Oh and the building of the new whatever next door is a massive inconvenience...
Manager Response: Dear Kristin, Thank you for your review.  Although our continental breakfast is offered as a no cost amenity we recognize that some guests would prefer purchasing a breakfast  at any one of the well known restaurants nearby. Our complimentary Wi-Fi service is being upgraded to be able to handle the increased level of bandwidth that is needed for todays net-connected traveler.  Many hotels find with the increasing number of guests traveling with Tablets, Laptops, Smart Phones and the popularity of accessing movies on these devices has required hotels to upgrade their existing service, such as what we are in the process of doing currently.    We do thank you for your review and trust that should you return to the Anaheim Resort you will allow us the opportunity of delivering a excellent stay.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Great service prior to check in!
Summary: This was the perfect place for us to stay with our two daughters.  The location was great with only a few short blocks to get to Disneyland and the Garden Walk for good restaurants.  A bus stop is right outside the hotel if you want to take the shuttle to Disneyland and save your feet for the big day ahead.  The rooms were well presented and clean and it was great to have a large separate bedroom for our daughters to sleep in.  The pool is small but good for a swim at the end of the day.  We were particularly impressed with the service prior to arriving.  We ordered gluten free food from a local supplier to be delivered to the hotel so that it would be there on our arrival.  The online payment process using a New Zealand card proved difficult so the hotel purchased the food on
Manager Response: Dear Kelleeb123, Thank you for your kind review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Your review is very typical of the comments we receive on a daily basis.  Our in house Guest Comment scores reflect the basic summation of your experience.  We are delighted to know that our services, as well as the services that you utilized to accommodate your dietary needs were equally pleasant.  Perhaps we will have the honor of accommodating your family again soon.  Thanks!

Summary: Had 2 nights here as family of 5 (kids 11, 9 and 7).  Had a kids suite which was surprisingly large.  Even with the fold out couch in use, the room was large enough for play.  Didn't use the breakfast room. Front desk staff were very polite and accommodating.  We flew north initially and were able to leave some bags at the hotel, prior to booking in.  Thanks so much.  Wifi was ok, parking good.  Walking distance to parks and restaurants.   Would stay here again.  Small enough to get "personal" feel.
Manager Response: Dear Mandmva, Thank you for your nice review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that your stay was pleasant and that you found our staff, services and amenities to your liking.  We try hard to ensure that everyone has a pleasant experience and your review shows that our efforts are appreciated.   Thanks again!!

Summary: Just got done staying here for 3 nights.  Rooms are designed nicely, lots of space available.    We did walk to the park on the first day, but we were soo tired the next day from all the walking that we took the bus the next 2 days.    Breakfast room had video games inside it.  That that adds tackyness to the room.  They should be moved or removed.  Parking was a problem since another hotel is remodeling.  The valet person had me move my car from "a unauthorized area" to another area.  That next morning at 6:30 got a phone call, saying I need to move my car (which is where the valet told me to move it to)
Manager Response: Dear Jetlag89, Thank you for your review.  Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience you may have experienced during your stay.  Of course, the construction of new the hotel that is being built next door to our hotel is temporary and when finished will be a very nice addition to the Anaheim Resort.   We are pleased to know that you found our rooms to be spacious and accommodating and met with your satisfaction.    If your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort, please allow us the opportunity of delivering a completely and satisfactory stay.  Thanks again !

Summary Heading: Excellent service and great location for Disney
Summary: Esmeralda was super helpful...so thank you to her personally. I have to say all members of staff we met were helpful too. The location is perfect for Disneyland/California Adventure. If you take the shuttle for $5 per person a day that saves money on parking or the walk. As you will be walking enough around the parks when you are there. The rooms are clean and comfy. The breakfast was ok but if I had to critique anything is that they need more of a selection of hot breakfast items as I only saw sausages, biscuits and gravy. However there were waffles, Danish pastries, donuts, fruit and cereal.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear pap1973, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that you found our hotel and services and amenities and customer service to be to your satisfaction.  Our front desk staff meets hundreds of people a week and does their very best to assist them however they can.  The fact that you mentioned Esmeralda indicates that she left a memorable experience for you and your family.  She is one of our best and she continues to assist all guests with the same level of service that you experienced.  I will be sure to pass along to her your kind comments.  With our breakfast, we try to mix it up so that each day there may be a different item(s) to choose from to ensure that there is always a choice of popular breakfast food favorites.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary: The desk staff was wonderful and when we wanted to stay an extra day they even found a discount for us. We stayed on the ground floor but the extra noise was worth the convenience. I agree that the shuttle was worth the price because we saved our energy for the Disneyland walking. The gift shop had a great selection and good prices (cheaper than Disneyland for the same items). Continental breakfast was almost a full breakfast -- sausage was great! We would definitely stay there again. Swimming pool was great with extra towels so you didn't have to use your room towels. Hot tub was wonderful.
Manager Response: Dear mggallegos13, Thank you for your very kind and informative review of our hotel.  We are pleased that your found our hotel and our popular amenities to your liking.  Not all hotels in the Anaheim Resort offer a free/complimentary breakfast, or one that can compare to the free breakfast we offer.  One interesting thing to know is that breakfast on average at any of the local family restaurants can cost a family of four nearly $40.00 or more per day before tip.  Perhaps this is one of the many reasons that makes our hotel such a popular choice for guests coming from all parts of the world.  We are also pleased to know that we met with your satisfaction not only with our breakfast but with our staff and other great amenities.  Thanks again!!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel because it was close to Disneyland. We had excellent service and staff was very friendly. The walls were very thin and we were located next to the janitorial room. In the mornings, it was very loud (the walls are thin) which would wake us up. After spending a day at the parks, we needed our sleep! We would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Jill F, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  I am pleased that you found our staff to be friendly and helpful. Should you return to Anaheim for another visit please allow us to accommodate you again in a quieter location away from the janitorial room. Thanks again for your review.

Summary: Rooms were clean, excellent amenities, complimentary breakfast was crowded at times, but still good.  Shuttle service was very convenient.  Although very close to Disneyland, taking the shuttle at the end of the day was worth the $5 per person per day fee.
Manager Response: Dear Nick336, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  All I can say is thank you very much for sharing your total satisfaction and appreciation of your experience.  There isn't much else I can say or even need to say.  Your comments are frank and brief yet show the appreciation you have for the dedication to the job that our staff works to achieve on a daily basis.  Thanks!!

Summary: We are staying to this hotel since 2010 and we allays come back due to excellent service, professional customer service, location, and appearance, Very nice hotel, clean, excellent breakfast, and friendly, helpful and always willing to help  personnel . They won my business for life any time when I will go to Anaheim - California or neighborhood. Congratulation for Esmeralda, a wonderful lady waiting for us with such a nice smile, happiness and professionalism, Way to go Cortona. I will see you in August 2013, when we'll be your gusts for a week.  Nick from Canada
Manager Response: Dear Nick336, Thank you for your review.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and we are very happy to have the opportunity to welcome you back again soon.   Thanks again!

Summary: Our family stayed here for a convention and we were so glad we did. At first I was worried about how small it was compared to the surrounding monster hotels but when we realized we could walk to the convention center in 5 min and we got a decent complimentary breakfast we were pleased.

We are a family of 5 and it's hard to find rooms that fit our needs but Cortona Inn has a room with a King bed in the front room and a bunk bed and sofa bed in the back room.  This worked fantastic for our family and the price was very reasonable.  The breakfast is OK but there were a lot of guests eating at the same time and the seating is limited.  My only 2 complaints and the first is a very minor one would be the lack of parking by your room, if you don't get a spot early you may have to park in the front area and it's a bit of a walk depending on room location but not real bad.  My biggest issue was the noise from other guests leaving early in the morning!  At 5:45 A.M. there were kids and adults talking full volume outside our room, which was on the ground floor, and while

Neat, tidy and well appointed rooms. Very helpful staff. Breakfast was great but there was a big shortage on seating so people were eating in the lobby. Car parking was also a real nightmare too, there seemed to be a shortage in car spots. Those returning at the end of the day had to park right near the street, not fun when there's a lot to load/unload. Location was great - quick walk to Disneyland, plenty of restaurants and shopping local too.

We have stayed at this property two times in the last year.  Both experiences have been excellent.  Esmeralda handled our reservations both times.  She is very helpful and remembers names of guests.  When I called this year she greeted me warmly and seemed genuinely pleased to have us as return guests.  The staff went beyond the normal to provide excellent customer service.  The beds were a bit hard for our condition  so they readily provided padding that helped.    We will no doubt stay with these nice folks again.  The rooms were clean and fresh.

Yes, the photos need updating. The large work on a new hotel in front have changed the charm shown in the pictures.  We did not have a car, but could see the issues those that did encountered.  Buses could not come in, so had to drag cases right up the drive.  Early noise from building site.  The room was great. Very large and we had some separation from the kids who were up the other end where they had their own TV and sofa. The breakfast was very disappointing.  Is polystyrene plates and plastic cutlery the norm in US hotels?  Much lower quality than we were expecting. Carbs and sugar .  About a 10 minute walk to Disney and we had a 7-eleven stop on the way which was good to grab water and snacks to avoid Disney prices.  Felt safe walking back even after dark.  All we needed,

The outside is a bit of a mess with construction going on but was pleasantly surprised by the quality and cleanliness of the room.   I was attending a conference at the Convention center and it was perfect location.  It was also walking (long walk)  distance to the Disney Parks and Downtown Disney.  For the price I was pleased, breakfast was decent and the staff was friendly.

Summary Heading: This is a great value stay!
Summary: Brought my robotics team.. 20 kids with 5 rooms.. plenty of opportunities for Cortona Inn to dissappoint but they did NOT. Everything was great. Clean Rooms, friendly staff, nice B-fast, Free Valet parking because of the construction.  As for the previous review.. in the case of a fire or an earthquake, you're gonna drive your CAR away??? WHAT??!!! Some people just need every opportunity to complain.  This is a great location with super reasonable rates. Enjoy your stay!

There is major construction going on and we were not advised at booking time.  There is no parking.  They block your car in the middle of the night without notifying you.  I wouldn't want to know what could happen if there was a fire or earthquake and we had to get out quickly.  The carpet in the rooms is dirty and disgusting.  It is noisy.  The "free" breakfast was so nasty that I refused to let my kids eat or touch anything.  We paid over $100 for this room.  I don't often write reviews but I feel I need to warn others!
Manager Response: Dear Ostergin, Thank you for offering your review regarding your recent stay at the Cortona Inn.  We regret that your stay was not up to your expectations.  With respect to the hotel that is being built in front of our hotel, there is an update on our main landing page mentioning this new hotel.  Parking issues have been relieved with the return of additional parking being installed along our entrance.  In addition, we offer complimentary Valet Parking for all of our guests to assist with the parking demands.  As for breakfast, unfortunately its not stated what in specific was not to your liking as we serve the basic Continental Breakfast items such as Danish, donuts, toast, orange juice and coffee, but in addition we also feature hot items such as sausage, eggs, waffles and hard boiled eggs. Also, two fresh fruit choices, coffee, milk, and apple juice are always offered.  We try to do our very best, and 99% of the time we succeed.  In your case, we failed and for that we offer our apologies and ask that you allow us another opportunity to show you a more satisfactory stay next time. Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: Quality of experience depends on your room
Summary: Hotel is clean, normal continental breakfast.  Be sure to ask what room you're in...some rooms are hidden in a dead end hallway with poor ventilation, no air circulation and next to noisy maintenance rooms.  If you get one of those few rooms then you won't have a great experience.  Also beware that there are about 20 fewer parking stalls than cars so you'll be slightly inconvenienced if you need to get in and out quickly because of all the double parking.

I read ALL the reviews of many of the hotels before I booked this one.  Some people even put this hotel down.  Apparently it had been under renovation and is no longer BUT, and I DON'T fault the hotel for this but there is another hotel being built right in front of this one.  This makes for a difficult parking experience.  I stayed there for one night because the other hotel I wanted was full for this night.  I had a lot of expensive equipment in the car and the valets were excellent.  Ian made sure to take great care watching my car.  He was perfect.  It can be a downer to go there and see the parking but if  you get past that, they have an excellent breakfast with hot food, they have some great rooms with nice bedding, attractively remodeled.  Because of the design of the

This was a business trip for me. Four things that angered for paying such a high price for this hotel when I could have easilt stayed at the Hilton down the street. The parking was PACKED and I had to wait a long time for valet staff to clear the over packed parking lot of one truck. Then a second truck was blocking my way and the staff was too lazy to move it and made me maneuver and inch my way out of the parking lot. They could have easily moved it 10 feet forward. Lazy. The lobby computer was a rip off as it would not work properly for internet connection yet I was charged a lot of money for access. The internet access in the room was HORRIBLE. No access at all yet they market the hotel as if it does. I saw three renters outside on the balcony with their tablets trying to
Manager Response: Dear JulioP839, First, let me apologize for the less than satisfactory experience you mention in your review.  I cannot emphasize enough though that this is not the level of service that we are know to deliver.  Valet Parking is offered as a no cost service to hotel patrons during construction of a new hotel being built in along Harbor Blvd in front of the Cortona Inn and is only temporary during the constriction phase of that hotel.  Internet service is being addressed at this moment and is in the process of being enhanced to be able to accommodate the increasing number of devices guests  are using to access the internet for voice, data and movies. Thank you for submitting your review.

Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights in August 2012 as a stopover on our way to Canada.  Hotel room was reasonably spacious with separate bunk bed area off the main bedroom.  Air-con unit was noisy at night but not sure you can do anything about this unless they were upgraded.  We took a sneak peak at the brightly coloured preservative added breakfast and were glad that we didn't include this dining option instead choosing to eat at one of the many reasonably priced local restaurants/cafe's.  Walk to Disneyland took about 15 minutes along a very pleasant tree-lined main route.  Would stay here again if passing through again

We stayed at this property because I loved the idea of bunkbeds.  Upon arriving, the room smelled very strongly of urine and mold.  We asked to be moved and the front desk gave us the key to another room which had the same odor.  They explained that the rooms just smell like that when the AC has been off and it would dissipate.  The AC made no difference.  Also, we found a sweatshirt from a previous guest on the floor.  When we took it to the front desk, they gave it back to us explained that they were not responsible for lost items.  I don't think they understood that we were concerned that the room hadn't been cleaned.  Anyhow, our kids were excited about the bunk beds, so we powered through it, but strongly considered checking out due to the smell.  I slept with coffee

My family of three stayed here a few weeks ago... It was very clean, tucked back away from the main street and conveniently located at the end of the driveway is the bus stop providing transportation to Disneyland. We found that if you cross to the bus stop on the other side of the street it's a straight shot to the park with minimal stops. The park is also a short 15 min walk if you decide to do so, which we did for the Magic Morning at Disneyland. There is no restraunt on site but they do provide (minimal) free breakfast in the morning and there's a coffee stand all day in the lobby. The staff was friendly.. They do have a pool and hot tub. There is a small store in the lobby for those little forgotten items and souveniers. Great for the price!

Booked at the Cortona based on a sale price on Expedia.   +: Good price. Exterior is nice and clean. Rooms are back away from the street and traffic noise. Pool is shallow, but heated.  Hot tub was great after a long day on our feet.   -: Our room smelled strongly of urine and the windows are bolted closed, so we couldn't get rid of the smell. We were placed 2 doors down from housekeeping, so we were woken at 8:00 am every day by the sound of them talking loudly outside of our door.  Rooms were overall not well insulated, so you heard every person walking by, elevator, and ice machine all night long.  Overall would probably pay a little more next time to avoid the noise and the smell.

We booked a room at the Cortona Inn through Disneyland.com.  When we arrived to check in at the Cortona Inn they had our reservation, but no available room!  The hotel admitted that they oversold the rooms.  After a very long day at Disneyland with two children, this was NOT the news we wanted to hear!  They sent us across the street to a very noisy Best Western.  The manager was not available to resolve or discuss the matter until Monday and only offered us 50% off our room rate. The Best Western was priced less than the Cortona anyhow.  This was my children's first visit to Disneyland.  I am dissatisfied with the lack of service that we received here and I will NEVER book a room here again.

Stayed there for only couple of nights. Staff was great, breakfast was lovely and the area the hotel is in is great, close to everything. the hotel has limited amount of elevators but this really did not ruin my stay as I pack quite light but if you have alots of cases then just ask for the room close to the elevators. Rooms were clean and specious. Would definitely stay there again.

Entire place was clean, staff were friendly, breakfast was great they changed the menu daily  and front desk staff were very helpful. It was a 25 minute walk to Disneyland but there was a shuttle available if you wanted.

Summary Heading: It was ok, but we wont stay there again.
Summary: We stayed here in 2 adjoining Queen rooms for a trip to Disneyland.  At check in the clerk was on the phone and he motioned me over and checked us in without saying a single word to me.  It seemed rude to me at the time, but I guess at least it got me into the room faster than waiting until he was done with his call (It was a business call, not a personal call)  Good: Close to the Disney parking lot, so we just rode the free shuttle in every day. Free Parking Beds were fine. Housekeeping arrived daily.  Friendly Service  Bad: The room smelled musty.  The bathroom and closet smelled like urine.  Many items didnt work, like the clock, TV remote, the light next to the bathroom, and the heat sometimes.   We tried breakfast the first day  and didnt consider it edible.   Our kids nap

Summary Heading: Clean place to stay, Beds are too hard for us.
Summary: We recently stayed for a quick trip to disneyland.  We booked a king suite and the size was fine.  The livingroom was fine, the couch was comfy but I would have preferred a table with two chairs to a desk with one.  The bedding was nice and the place is clean however, we found the beds to be too hard.  They do not have luggage racks.  The bathroom vanity is quite small, no room to put anything on it.  The breakfast was average.  Although we heard noise when kids were passing down the walkway, we did not have noise from other rooms.  They charge a resort fee that is kind of laughable since I would not consider it a resort but a motel with a pool and hot tub.  Rather than take your car into the Disneyland resort it is quicker to go across the street and take the shuttle buses from

My mother, son, and I have stayed here twice now for visits to Disneyland. The walk to the park is about a mile, but it's an easy walk and what's another mile when you're walking all day at Disneyland? The breakfast is good, they have a good selection of protein (usually sausage and eggs), pastries, donuts, juice, cereal, etc. We haven't had a problem finding seating at breakfast, or there is a tray in your room if you'd prefer to carry it back.  The rooms are pretty big. Even with the pack-n-play for my son set up (which they've never had trouble providing), there is still plenty of room to move around. The bathroom counters are big enough to feel comfortable, and the shower is great.  Anytime we've needed anything from the staff, they've been very courteous, helpful, and

Summary Heading: Fantastic stay at a fantastic location
Summary: We stayed at the Cortona inn ans Suites for 7 nights in late October/early November 2012, This Hotel is incredible value for money, the room was immaculate and the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The location is fantastic and its walking distance to Disneyland as well as numerous Restaurants etc. We rang and asked for a early check in and late check out on the final day and they were happy to oblige. The Breakfast was really impressive and constantly replenished but you need to go to the breakfast room early to avoid the crowds as there is limited seating available. The Family room was well set out and the beds were comfortable and having the benefit of a separate room for the kids was fantastic. Everything was extremely clean and the cleaners did a great job each

Summary Heading: Stay here every year, love it
Summary: We stay at the Cortona every year while visiting a convention. Very close, withing walking distance to the convention center.. and disneyland!  They now have Keurigs in the rooms.  The staff has always been friendly and helpful.

The room had a musty smell when we first arrived, so we had to air out the room.  And by the closet the carpet smelled like someone urinated there.  My biggest complaint would be the lighting in the bathroom, awful! No lights over the mirror, just one big not bright enough light in the middle of the bathroom.  Very hard to put on makeup.  Very roomy bathroom which they could have done more with all the space, like put in a double sink, there was only one sink and only one outlet. Not even a towel rack for the hand towels, weird.  2nd pet peeve, was every morning the maids would stand outside of our room and talk for 2 hours starting at 7:30 am, very annoying ladies!  And the elevator was by our room so that didnt help, as the maid carts and this sounded like a loud disney ride

Our stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites was fun and relaxful.  The room was quite clean and comfortable in spite of the fact that the hotel itself seemed like a older structure.  When the neighboring room turned on their shower, we can really hear it in our room.  However, this is the only noise that we heard.  You cannot hear people talk, or the TV from any other room.  My husband had a terrible cold, so getting good sleep was important.  We had to add on a couple of extra nights and the manager Arun, was very professional and accommodating for us especially during this time when a huge convention was going on also.  The internet connection was slow and unreliable.  Anyone here on business will get frustrated with the connection.  The hot spa and heated pool on the other hand was

This hotel is clean and comfortable.  It offers a hot, although mediocre breakfast.  The staff people are friendly and accommodating.  My only complaint was the internet service, and it was the absolute worst I've ever seen.  If this is important to you, stay elsewhere.  We were unable to connect or, if connected, we were kicked off repeatedly, night after night.  This wasn't a random but consistent connection problem.  Complaints to the front desk did not resolve the problem.  Complaints to the general manager did not resolve the problem.

Reina and the staff at the Cortona Inn and Suites went above and beyond my expectations to ensure that our family reunion was a hit.  The rooms were very comfortable and the breakfast was more than adequate.  Our group totaled more than 30 individuals and everyone was very happy and satisifed with their stay!  Thank you everyone at the Cortona!!!!  We will see you again very soon.

Summary Heading: Good location, good value for a budget
Summary: We booked this hotel through BookIt.com, and were originally expecting the family suite for our family of 5.  However, we had (apparently) booked a 1 bedroom suite.  The front desk was very accommodating with this error, however, and brought us a roll-away bed free of charge for the 4 days we were there.  We liked the location....if you are going to Disneyland, you could walk there from the hotel, and there are also restaurants all around within easy walking or driving distance.  We actually did not go do Disneyland (opted for Knotts and Universal Studios), but because we were on the South side of the hotel, we could watch the Disney fireworks every night which was an added bonus.  On the plus side, you get a decent breakfast every morning, which was an important reason we were

The Cortona is actually a motel in that you drive to your door (or to the stairs leading up to your door.) The rooms were clean and the pillows weren't bad. The breakfast was okay, but overrun with families and kids on the weekend (hard to find a table at which to eat). The coffee was hot and plentiful. People seemed busy making cereal and waffles, though we only had coffee. The pool seemed to be heated because there were kids splashing around during the early evening when it was about 40 degrees outside. In the morning we did see a porter cleaning the pool and preparing it for guests. We always found a parking spot, even during the busy weekend. The staff was friendly and helpful. The internet was spotty. The lobby computer requires payment, but the staff were happy to have us

wonderful stay for our family vacation.  Mordern rooms, very clean.  Great water pressure in the shower and hot water the whole shower!  good free hot breakfast.  A little walk to disneyland but it wasnt bad, even after a long day at the park.  we would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Friendly, clean and value for money
Summary: We have just spent 7 nights here, January 2013. The first thing i want to say is how friendly, helpful and courteous are the desk staff, especially Esmerelda and Ernersto, they are a real credit to the hotel . The rooms and the Cortona are clean and functional, we had 2 queen size beds, a coffee maker, microwave and fridge ( ice was available by the lifts). To be honest we did not spend hours in the room, really only to sleep, and we had no problems with noise. The wifi was not brilliant but then again we found that the wifi iwas generally not as good as back home in UK. There is a small pool and a hot tub in the grounds A breakfast is included which consisted of cereals, danish, donuts, bread, waffles and usually sausage patties and egg, this certainly set you up for the day.

Summary Heading: Nothing fancy but it is clean
Summary: This was the 2nd time we chose to stay here and it will be our last. First of all, the beds are sooo uncomfortable. It is hard enough to sleep when you're traveling, but the beds are terrible and we all literally woke up hurting. Next, the WiFi didn't work at all over the 4 nights we were there. Each time we called to complain they would say, "Ok, we will reset the router"...but then nothing would happen. Highly disappointing. It is close enough to Disneyland to walk, but we were sorely disappointed in our stay this time we will not be returning. There is a decent breakfast available, but good luck getting in to get any. Not enough seating.

The rooms are advertised as having queen beds, they were definitely smaller than standard queens.  Breakfast is included, but don't get your hopes up for quality options....   The air conditioning unit in our room operated as a fan, not an air conditioner.  We visited during cool weather, but our room was still very stuffy.  Thank goodness we weren't there when it was HOT outside.  We had adjoining rooms with my Mom.  Her bathtub plug lever was broken.  She REALLY wanted to soak in a hot bath after a long day on her feet at Disneyland.  The maintenance man told her to use a plastic bag to plug the bathtub.   Sometimes when our shower ran the plumbing made horrible squeeling noises, no adjustment would make it stop.  Then on our last morning there, my son killed a HUGE cockroach

Problems with the stay: The walls were thin. Based on room location, I was unable to receive WIFI from my room. When the room next door showered, it sounded like a lawn mower next to the bed. The faucet handle was broken. The bed side lights did not work. Customer service was just ok. I will not be returning to this hotel.  I would not call it a resort.

This hotel had potential, but failed to deliver.  The suite we had was just right for us and our 2 kids.  However, you can hear everything, and we do mean everything, that is going on in every suite around you and what is happening on the walkways outside.  The pipes are unbelievably noisy and you hear every sink, flush and shower from every room around you.  This is all a shame, since the room itself is actually quite nice.  The buffet breakfast was more than adequate with a selection of hot and cold items.  Enough to fill up on and take some snacks to the parks for the day.
Manager Response: Dear Jean-Paul O,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. We strive to accommodate all of our guests and their needs and I’m disappointed that we did not meet your expectations with regards to the noise. We are sorry for the unusual condition of the room you received. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously, and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.  Yours in Hospitality,
