Summary: Esmeralda helped us make our reservations and helped us at check out.  We were shopping for the nicest hotel, at the best value, closest to the park.  Esmeralda was very friendly and helpful and, because of her we chose Cortona.  I am grateful because the experience was satisfactory in every respect.

The "newly renovated and remodeled" room was musty and moldy!  We were often awakened by the noise of the giant ice maker right outside of our door.  The bathroom was small and the complementary toiletries provided by the hotel were different from day to day.  Bring your own if you decide to book your stay at this hotel. The free breakfast was good and offered a variety of items for my family of five.  The walk to Disneyland was not too long.  It would have been nice to have a free shuttle from the hotel.

It was very very noisy.  There was yelling in the middle of the night that woke us up each evening and had to leave the TV on to keep the noise down to a tolerable level.  The staff was very nice but that really doesn't make up for not being able to sleep.  I would also recommend not using whatever spray is being used after cleaning the rooms.  It doesn't make the room feel fresh just like it needs to be aired out.  The breakfast could use a revamp as well.

We were thrilled with our stay at Cortona. The "Kids Suite" has a door so the kids had their own separate room!! The bunk bed and pull out accomodated all 4 of our kids comfortably and we loved our King bed. The breakfast was best when they offered the waffle maker but the kids loved it the entire time. The Inn is only the 2nd stop on the way back from Disney on the ART 3 line. We never waited more than 10 minutes to catch an ART on the way to Disneyland but we recommend crossing the street and catching an ART in front of the convention center for a faster trip.  We loved the location and the convenience of getting back and forth to Disneyland. We definately would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Not the worst place I've stayed, but inconvenient for Disney- especially with kids or elderly.
Summary: Transportation options to Disneyland include 1) a 20-30 minute walk, 2) Anaheim Resort Transit at $12 each for a 3-day pass, or 3) about a 10 min walk to the Toy Story lot to catch the Disney parking shuttle.  Hotel was OK.  Will probably not stay there Will probably not stay there again.  The hot breakfast might as well be called a pastry breakfast because that's about the only thing worth eating. There were biscuits and gravy, it's but the gravy might as well have been flour soup. The hot waffles are toaster waffles. The only eggs to eat are hard boiled and who knows how long they have been sitting out.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel.We usually stay at the Anaheim Plaza which is right across the street from Disneyland. But we have been noticing it becoming very much more run down and old. The Cortona was very clean, comfortable beds and pillows. Free parking, even for two cars for one room! and the best part is a great breakfast buffet. We love to get our kids good and full prior to going into the park. The shuttle picks up right out front too. Very reasonable price, I highly recommend it!

Summary Heading: Good stay at the Cortona Inn
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Cortona Inn December 5-9 2012.  The room was clean and maintained (and it was an amazing price when I booked it!). This was certainly not a 5 star hotel, but for the price it was a great experience.  Most importantly, this hotel is in a great location because you can walk across the street and hop right on the disneyland toy story parking lot shuttle (woody) for free.  And the shuttles run constantly.  We never waited for a shuttle when going in or out of the park, even at the busiest times.   My only complaint is that the room was a little bit loud.  Since the room doors face the outside (shaped like a horseshoe) you could hear things that were going on outside.  That wasn't really a problem for us, as my family is quite loud in itself and we are

Summary Heading: Not a great visit at all
Summary: We stayed at the Cortona Inn for 3 days and I will never go back. First, we made accommodations for 4 people and we 3 towels and 2 washcloths. So if I were staying in a room by myself, I guess that means I get 1 towel, 1 hand towel, and 1 washcloth. Then we called to get more and it took 2 hours for them to get to us. We went to breakfast and there is 11 tables for over 200 people coming down from there rooms to eat, so we had to sit in the lobby and eat. The next day we had to get there by 6:30 am just so we could sit down at a table as a family to eat breakfast. I will pay a little bit more next time and stay at a much better managed Inn.

We recently stayed at the Cortona Inn and Suites. We chose the Tuscan Kids Suite because the pictures on their website looked really nice and the price was good compared to other hotels in the area. The location was good but that was about it. The parking spaces were tiny. The walls of the room were paper thin, the door had a gap around it that allowed us to hear everything and everyone that went by at all hours of the night. The bathroom was tiny. We killed no less than three spiders. The refrigerator stopped working after the first night. The wifi was a joke. The tv volume kept going in and out and the customer service was horrible. We will not be staying there again and we will not be recommending this hotel to anyone.

The property is pretty on the outside and overall, relatively clean.  The bathroom was clean, although there was something (dried meat??) that missed the vacuum.    Check-in was smooth, although I was not asked if I wanted a key to the in-room safe, so had to go back down to get that after getting to the room.    Breakfast the first morning was so poorly stocked @7:30 (breakfast is served 6:30-9:30) that I left without eating anything.  The next morning I arrived at 6:30, doors opened late, but it was better stocked.  The room was never serviced after we arrived.  We received a notice in the door that they tried three times and the "Do Not Disturb" sign was in place.  It was there only one time that they claimed that they tried to clean the room - the other times we were not in

I felt the staff were indifferent to customers. They weren't overly friendly and luckily I had little interaction with them. The funky smell someone mentioned, I think they were cleaning the carpets and they hadn't fully dried yet. I saw one room ALL night, open with a fan blowing. The room we had, ants had been exterminated I think just recently as we saw dead ones and a few live ones (mostly in bathroom area). The hotel is in a horseshoe shape so any loud noises at the pool can be heard throughout. There were kids screaming one night and we called the desk and they took care of it. Since we were on the third floor, we heard no noise except anyone walking/running outside. The bed was hard as a rock which caused some issues with sleep with lower back issues. The last night I

We have been staying at Cortona almost exclusively the past 4 years. Everytime we go to disneyland we stay. Great deals and quiet enough. We've been there a few times when there have been competitions going on and even then it was still relatively quiet. I recommend this hotel to anyone staying by disneyland. Will be making another reservation in a few months for our February disneyland trip.

This is your everyday hotel with decent breakfast, rooms and location. However, if you use the internet often, you will quickly find out that the internet is extremely slow. For me, the internet is part of my soul, so I found this highly annoying.

Summary Heading: Cortona Inn is the place to stay for families on a budget
Summary: We were very pleased with our stay here at the Cortona. The room we stayed in was spacious. It had a separate room with 2 beds in it and a sofa bed in the living room. The room also had a fridge and microwave which came in very handy. The parking and interent were free, which is a big deal because so many places charge for both. The breakfast was very satisfactory for being free. The waffles made it better than a normal continental breakfast (they were very good). The location of the hotel is good also becuase you can either drive, take the shuttle, or walk if you are feeling ambitious! We did not walk, but I think it would have taken about 20-30 minutes. The front desk staff was very nice and sold us our Disneyland tickets. We will definately stay here again!

The service was ok and the room was clean (although there was a bit peculiar odor...). The hotel is 15 minutes walk from the Disneyland main entrance, which is good. We had a five person family room on the first floor (room 135, I guess), located next to some very noisy machine. Bypassing hotel guests disturbed our good night sleep as well. The breakfast was rather awful, at least for a European.  Anyway, the price/quality ratio was tolerable, and without finding a better candidate, I could consider coming again.

From walking in the door, I was not greeted. The woman at the desk had an attitude as if she was doing me a favor by showing for work that day. She did not say hello or thank you. The lobby still had pumpkin decorations up (mid November). Maybe they were still up for Thanksgiving, but to me it had a feeling of laziness because they looked like Halloween decorations. We travel from Vegas to Disneyland 4 times per year and we thought we would try another hotel. Disappointed! The rooms were clean, but in the restroom the wallpaper was peeling and you can see rusty door hinges. The neighbors above us were noisy and the walls are thin (could hear the neighbor's television to the side). The continental breakfast had a nice selection and the pool area was nice and clean. There are

As long as you don't go expecting to get a four star experience and realize you are staying at a discount hotel than the Cortona is great.    My husband and I really liked that the continental breakfast had more options than other places we have stayed.  Although seating is a little tight in the dinning room so plan a little extra time to scout a table.   The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful.  Our room was well cleaned although the toilet was a little quirky to flush (we had to jiggle the handle.) Finally the walk to Disneyland is not bad at all.  It took us about 15 minutes.   .

We liked the privacy of having a kids suite where both sides had their own TV and very comfortable beds. Walking was more like 2.5 blocks but the exercise was good. Cleanliness was good, friendly staff, lots of parking and fair breakfast. There were noisy children early in the morning and adults talking late at night outside our door but the staff took care of when we called the office. Taxes and fees where high but perhaps it's like this at all hotels.

I read the reviews on this hotel and was not sure what it was like before booking.  I found the room to be spacious and clean.  The beds were excellent.  The walk to Disneyland was not that far.  Continental breakfast was regular fare but there were choices.....boiled eggs, sausage, muffins, rolls, cereal, juices, milk, fruit etc.  I would definitely stay here again

We stayed in a few hotels while in the States and the Cortona was middle of the road, comfortable and well priced.  Staff were friendly, rooms were clean and the suite with bunks and sofabed was great for allowing our family to have some of their own space.  We found the walking distance to Disneyland perfectly acceptable even after a long day of walking in the parks.  We did hear noise from other guests towards the weekend when it was busier. Our kids thought the place was great and had lots of fun in the pool.  We were there for a few days so got a bit tired of the breakfast (as you would) but it was perfectly adequate and there was something to suit all members of our family.  Would happily go back.

This was our second stay at Cortona Inn & Suites.  Large Family Sized Rooms with Refrigerator and Microwave.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Walk to Disney Parks was about 20 minutes. I would advise taking the shuttle to save the feet for the long days at Disney.  Breakfast was better than most.

Summary Heading: This is a dump. Stay elsewhere
Summary: We checked in this afternoon. We'll be leaving tomorrow morning. Think Super 8 Motel and if you're happy with that go and stay there and save yourself some money. This place is 2 star at best First the positive. Girls at reception  were friendly and helpful.  Night receptionist was helpful in trying to get us another room when pipes played up. Staff do the best they can but honestly the place is a crumbling wreck.  Now the cons. Elevator smells like urine, body odour or something equally funky. Sink in bathroom had a 'ring' around it that looked like dried vomit. You stick to the carpet when you stand still. When rooms around you take a shower you have to turn up the TV to 20 so you can still hear it. Yes the noise from the water pipes is that loud!  Cushions used as pillows are

Summary Heading: Excellent Price & good sized rooms for families
Summary: We just finished our stay at the Cortona after lots of research on hotels with family rooms close to Disney parks. We have three kids (6,4 &3) so enjoyed the separate room & space of the Kids Suite. We were in room 236 which was in the middle so heard some walking above us and were conscious of our kids stomping around. It was a good location away from stairwells/lifts/laundry room.   The beds were just okay (I used an underlay) but everything else great. Staff very friendly and the free breakfast is very generous (but not much space in the room so you need to pick a time & be patient).   The location was probably about 2 blocks too far to walk after walking km's around Disney (we lost a few kg's!!!). The number 3 bus out the front wasn't very frequent as advertised but we

The room was clean and they were very accommodating.  The breakfast was good.  It consisted of sausage, biscuits and gravy, egg Mcmuffins, fruit, Juice and toast, cereal, hard boiled eggs.  I was actually impressed.  It was 20 minute walk are so to Disneyland.  I would return.

Check in was a lil bit sketchy to say the least, first assigned a room and we are on our way when the counter girl says "oh wait I need to check something" so we wait 10 minutes ( no biggie ). She comes back and says she needs to find us another room. So she assigns us a room we get the keys and go to our room, open up the door and to our surprise there was someone's belongings in the room, it hadn't been vacated! Soooo we go back to the lobby to get our 3rd room assigned. This time they give us the king jacuzzi room, ( sure whatever ) no friggn wifi! Keep your tub and give me wifi instead? I told the same flake that set us up in all 3 rooms and she tells me to call the I.T. Department myself. Ok I'm easy to please usually so now ill state the "ok". The free breakfast isn't bad

Summary Heading: Good enough for what we needed
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for three nights.  Upon check in my husband wasn't that impressed with our room but we were really only there to sleep each night and didn't spend much time in the room anyways.  The bathroom floor wasn't clean when we checked in - that always grosses me out!  The girl behind the desk wasn't helpful with my Disneyland questions...she seemed like she hadn't been there before?!?  LOL  The breakfast was mediocre - my kids liked the powdery doughnuts for breakfast...yuck!  Lots of carbs but it did save us some money so we always like that!  Oh ya...the coffee was really weak.  We didn't even want to drink it; therefore, we didn't have our caffeine fix each morning which is NEVER smart especially when one is heading to fight the crowds at the park! :o)  We

We have a 5 and 7 year old and this is the second time we have stayed at the Cortona inn and suites.  The breakfast is good and offers things like apples, oranges, cereal, boiled ages, waffles, toast, and  egg mcmuffins.  We love the suite that has bunk beds and a pull out coach in one room it also has 2 TV's which is always great.(Well priced)  A large fridge and microwave oven.  Rooms are nice and clean as is the pool and hot tub.  Staff are always cleaning and able to help.  ART station is right out side of hotel on Harbour BLVD. Easy walk to target.  We will stay here again!

We usually stay at one of the hotels right across the crosswalk from Disneyland, but since this was a last minute trip during a very busy weekend all our regular hotels were all booked up. Staff was super friendly, rooms were decent sized and beds were just ok. We were exhausted by the time we turned in for the night so kids and I thought the beds were good. My husband on the other hand had trouble sleeping hence the ok rating. Breakfast was decent. They had cereal, toast, muffins, apples, oranges, banana, oatmeal, eggs and sausage. We'd end up making sausage and egg muffin sandwiches which were pretty decent. Housekeeping was great, although I don't understand why trash bins are not lined with a plastic liner. It was great to see a recycle bin in the room too. The pool was a

Good position, approx 10-15 minute walk to disneyland. Comfortable hotel, not a big as it looks in pictures but comfy all the same. Breakfast is included but you wouldnt pay extra for it. It was the same foods everyday and not many healthy options. The little gift shop has some great things, there are restaurants such as Dennys very close by. The staff are friendly and helpful and we would definately consider staying there again.

Spent 8 nights here on out arrival in the USA. The hotel was average. The front desk staff were fantastic and were always helpful with the best way to get around, and any other questions we had. The hotel itself is not that far from Disneyland and can be walked however we chose the ART bus and purchased a 4 day pass. This was the best after the long exhausting days at Disney. We had booked the Toscana kids suite giving us 2 rooms which was a plus. The breakfast was ok and gave us something to eat before the long days at Disney. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. This is a good basic hotel.

Summary Heading: A great family hotel with Kids Suite
Summary: A great family freindly hotel close to Disneyland with great staff and best of all a "kids suite". Not a 5 star hotel but clean, big rooms and close to all transport if you do not feel like the walk to Disneyland (which is about 20 mins and much quicker on the ART bus). We arrived early and were given an early check in. My kids loved that every time we got back each night their stuffed animals were strategically positioned differently each day which made the experience fun for them. The free breakfast was a bonus, very simple but did the job.

We were here for only one night but the suite was perfect, we were 4 adults, 2 kids and 1 baby. The breakfast is not good but it's free and it saved us at least 80 dlls. that we were able to spend at Disney.

The Cortona was a wonderful place to stay.  We were able to do early check in so decided to explore the area since it was supposed to be 1 1/2 blocks from Disneyland.  Word of warning - it's not. It's much further than that.  That being said, we made use of the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) and was able to get around with ease.

Good, basic hotel. Unfortunately couldn't get into our room on arrival, but we were very early having arrived from Brisbane on the early morning flight. Staff were very pleasant though and stored our bags while we went for a walk for a couple of hours. Our room had two queen beds which were clean and comfortable.  As mentioned in another review, the pillows are small, but there were 4 on each bed.  The same with the towels in the bathroom; small, but 4 of them.  Rooms had free Internet which was useful. The deluxe continental breakfast was very good, great to see fresh fruit available.  It's about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland and close to restaurants and fast food outlets.

When I arrived, the hotel parking lot was filled to it's capacity. I had to walk a half a mile to get to the property. The rooms are overpriced and smell like mold. I heard kids stomping all night long after a long flight. If you want a peace of mind please don't stay here.

We took my daughters to Disneyland for their 3rd and 5th Birthdays and we were not disappointed with this hotel. It was a wonderful value. The rooms were large, which is great for two little kids, the pool as a nice size and the hotel staff was wonderful! We arrived earlier than that 3pm check in time and our room was ready and available for us so they allowed us to check in early. The breakfast was decent and had a little bit of everything. I read up a lot of reviews for months before selecting this hotel, and the few complaints I could find on this hotel from other reviewers I found to be trivial. The ONLY thing that bugged me about the room was the bathroom door was hard for my 3 year old to open and I had to help her each time, and that is nothing. I didn't realize it until

We arrived before the 3pm check in time ( we got there around 1pm) and they had our room ready for us so we got to unpack our stuff before heading to Disneyland which was pretty nice. When I got into the room, I realized that there was no pack and play for our baby so I called the front desk and they offered to bring one up at no charge to us, so that was a plus. The trash bins didn't have liners in them which I fund to be a bit odd and either overlooked or dirty in my opinion. The room is small, but it fit our family fo 5 fine for the night we stayed there. The room itself looks very nice, the beds are nicely made, clean and pretty much exactly what you are paying for. They don't offer hand soap (or it wasn't in our room anyway), so thankfully we brought our own. The pillows

Booked for a trip to Disney and the room is ok but really worn. The outside is fairly nice and the breakfast is average and free with the room. Breakfast room is small to try to move around it to get items. The beds are real bad worst we have ever had. If you want to sleep after going to Disney think twice due to the beds. They need to update the beds. TV's are older not the new flat screen. Does have a fridge and microwave in room. Can get a room with a pull out sofa and bunk beds in a second room, older furniture. Linens on beds are older and not sure how clean the comforter is. Check in was in the evening and no issues. Parking is tight and can be hard to find a parking spot. Close to Disney but if you walk you will have a ways to go on foot.

Near from Disneyland. There is a simple but good breakfast, and a good pool. Our room was big, with a cofee maker, refrigerator and microwave; wireless is complimentary; it`s a friendly place for stay with children, and not expensive.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the Cortona for five nights. Our flight arrived into LAX at 7:00 am, and getting an early check-in was no issue. It isn't the Grand Californian, and it doesn't pretend to be. You get what you pay for - clean modest rooms, spectacular location, and friendly service. Breakfast was slightly sub-par, but it filled a hole, and there was lots of it. Ernesto and the team at Guest Services were very friendly and helpful - and organised our tickets/tour to Universal Studios when we checked in. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Anaheim who would rather spend their money on the many other attractions in the area, than on a place where you will only sleep.

So we chose this hotel for a number of reasons: Reasonably priced Large enough rooms to accommodate our group of 3adults and 3kids Proximity to Disney.  Really there is nothing I can be justified in complaining about. For the price - it was pretty good value!  We arrived at the hotel at 9am after a 14hr flight from Oz. The staff were very understanding and managed to get us into our room promptly.   The ART shuttle stops right near the hotel - which is handy.  We stayed for 3 nights but only ate the included breakfast on the first morning - that was probably the biggest disappointment of our stay here.   Overall though it was a good hotel if you don't plan to spend a lot of time there and just need a comfortable and clean room to sleep in.

It was very nice, clean, and friendly!  My only issue was that the breakfast was a bit lacking.  Front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  The bus to Disney picks up and drops off right in front of the hotel!!

We stayed at the Cortona for three nights and had three rooms with my extended family. It's a good hotel for the budget-minded. The rooms are quite large and the beds are comfy. We had the kids suite that came with bunk beds and a trundle so it could sleep up to 3 kids plus two Queen beds. There's a fridge and a microwave, which is always nice for water and snacks.   We stayed on the third floor (walk-up, no elevators) and it helped us stay away from any noise. The rooms have wall unit air conditioners but they worked well in the 90-degree heat when we were there. The wifi is pretty week in the rooms. The breakfast is minimal, but it's free. Donuts, toasters, cereal, apples, oranges, and some eggs/sausage.   Here's our trick for the walk to Disney: Forgo the shuttle, turn left

We stayed at the Cortona Inn for 6 nights. Our room was on the ground floor, so on many occassions we would hear children in the rooms upstairs. There were a few times when we would hear children screaming in the morning, which used to be disturbing. Staff at the Cortona Inn were very friendly, especially Esmerelda and Rebecca. Rebecca went out of her way to get a booking for us to visit the Alcatraz in San Francisco. Both staff had good knowledge of the area so getting directions from them was very helpful. My only concern was that the room we were in had a fowl smelll, but by the end of our stay, we just could not be bothered making a complaint

I stayed at the Cortona for three nights with my two teenagers. Esmeralda was extremely nice and took care of us in a fast and efficient manner. She insured the room was ready to go when we arrived in the early afternoon. The breakfast was better than most of the places I have stayed, especially for the cost of the room. Free WiFi and Parking is a big plus along with the breakfast. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. When we needed anything, it was brought right up to the room.  I would definitely stay there again.

Long fingernail on the floor by lam in room (bedroom).  No wash cloths 2nd & 3rd day of our stay.  Turned off our fridge while our drinks & left over foods were in it. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Other than that, this place is beautiful and the employees are real nice and greeted us and answered all questions I had. While waiting for the bus, I called the front desk and she went right ahead and called the station to check my bus arrival, called me back and told me they're running late. Food was good. Coffee good. Nice TV's in the rooms. Beds are excellent. Pull out bed in sofa was very comfy. They called and check on us to make sure we were happy. The pool was excellent. Lots of stuff to do in the area where Cortona Inn is

Summary Heading: Good rooms, bad breakfast ( but it's free)
Summary: We stayed at the Cortona In Early August. The staff are very pleasant, the rooms are ok for the price, beds are comfortable, good up to date bedding, clean rooms, great room service, local television and free wifi and parking. The pool is tiny so we didn't use it much as it was always too busy for our young children. I didn't enjoy the continental breakfast much. It's sustaining but lacks variety and fresh produce..... It was 'free' though so can't really complain. All round a good hotel. If we head back too Anaheim I'd look for a hotel closer to Disneyland as the Cortona isn't really within walking distance... Especially for young children.

Summary Heading: We wish you could've kept it up
Summary: We've stayed at the Cortona multiple times and have had varied experiences. You have to get this hotel at the right time of year. Their customer service and off season prices (way too high for what you get in busy season) are what has brought us back. Most of the ladies at the front desk are extremely helpful and accommodating, especially Deana and Rebecca who always go out of their way to make us feel welcome and our questions not feel stupid no matter how busy they are. On the other hand some help just leaves us confused and wanting more. For example if they are really busy and have a line, while the people at the front work their way through the line and phone calls, a manager will come out from the back office and seem very helpful and come up to guests and ask how he can

We stayed at the Cortona Inn & Suites on our recent trip to the area. Check-in was quick and efficient. When we walked into the room it was clean and ready for us. We had a Toscana Kids Suite, with bunk beds and a sofabed in the second bedroom. There were not enough towels in the bathroom for the party, but the front desk provided the needed ones for us. We had a baby with us who is crawling, not walking. He got really dirty from the carpet. We reported this to the front desk, and to their credit, they did send the carpet cleaner to the room that day. The problem is that the carpet does not really dry thoroughly before it is walked on, and gets dirty quickly again. Also, the air conditioning works in only one room at a time. If the door is closed the bunk room does not cool if

We opted NOT to stay at the Marriott for the RWA--Romance Writers of America Conference because of the expense and decided upon the Cortona. We were not disappointed in our stay. The room wasn't fancy, but comfortable and large, although I would have like a luggage rack so I didn't have to bend over to get my clothes. Parking and internet were free and that was a big bonus, even if we did have to hoof it around the corner to the Marriott all the time.   When we had a running toilet, the front desk sent a worker immediately to repair it. The staff was very responsive and very courteous. The beds were comfortable, the pillows plentiful and fluffy, and the room surprisingly quiet. We ate at the buffet a couple of mornings and the offerings, although not grand, were filling. I would

The rooms were mediocre, but clean. The breakfast was a donuts, sugary cereal, waffles and pancakes. Not a lot of freshness. Very disappointing! Surely fresh fruit could be included as there is plenty of delicious fruit available in California!  We had 2 fantastic women on the front desk who MADE our stay.  We would return to the Cortonna to say hi to them, but not to stay.

Cortina staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a problem with our front door not closing tight, so I mentioned it to Esmeralda who was at the front desk. We were off to Disneyland that morning, so didn't get back till late. The door was fixed when we returned. The breakfast staff in the morning were very helpful. They cleaned and replenished as needed all during the serving time. I definitely would recommend this hotel, especially to people that had children and/or were on a tight budget. Thank you.

The staff on the reception when we arrived were very friendly and made us feel very welcome.  The rooms were large and very clean.  Pool area area was clean and central.  We had a 3 day Disney pass and we found that although the Anaheim resort buses run from across the road it was an easy 20 minute walk to and from the parks and downtown Disney.  On the date of our departure the staff did their best to enable us to stay a little longer if we needed to as we had a very late evening flight. Breakfast was free and plentiful as was parking.  The only thing we found let them down was something that you can argue was outside of their control and that was that the flooring is not very sound proof and as we were on the ground floor, the guests staying above us didn't really have much

Summary Heading: Not Too Bad, Not Too Good, Just OK
Summary: This hotel had many great characteristics, but nothing out of the ordinary.  We booked a family suite, which we didn't realize was really just two adjoining rooms.  The rooms were recently remodeled and very clean and nice.  It is not an indoor hotel, it is closer to a motel where  you enter from the outside.  The staff was beyond EXCELLENT!  Especially Deana.  She should be working at a 5 star hotel.  Anyway, the hotel is close to Disneyland (within a few blocks).  The pool was small and the hot tub even smaller.  However, the kids enjoyed it without complaint.  Parking was scarce if you came back late.  There are not any elevators for the 2nd and 3rd floor.  The breakfast is fair, but nothing out of the ordinary.  There is not much room to eat in the dining area so we ended up

Summary Heading: Clean friendly long walk for little ones and room was awkward...overall very nice.
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here breakfast was good and included.  The room was clean and in good condition.  The walk to Disney was fine for older kids the little one struggled a bit on the way back.  Overall we would recommend it to our friends and stay there again.

Summary Heading: More a Motel than a Hotel
Summary: The main advantage of the hotel is the location close to Disneyland. It is a Motel Style building with three stories, they have free internet, free breakfast (which was quite good) and very important in this area they do offer free parking. The (H/M)otel itself has a nice appereance and the reception is well and friendly staffed. The rooms need some updating and my room had this moist smell. This  2 Star (H/M)otel is a little bit overpriced for what they offer. Even I would try to get another hotel in this area next time, this is still a good compromise if the better hotels are fully booked due to the vacation season.

Deana did an outstanding job helping us secure two existing hotel rooms for an additional day at Disneyland.  She was friendly, helpful, and truly tried to help us keep our existing rooms so we didn't have to move to new hotel rooms.  She accomplished this and I'm truly grateful for her assistance and pro-active attitude.  Good job Deana and the Cortona Inn and Suites!

Our flight arrived early in the morning and we were allowed to park our car in the lot all day before check in and also on the day we left after we checked out at no charge. Also, Esmeralda was very helpful when there were no roll away beds to rent (I had not realized my room wasn't set up for the 5 people on the reservation), she got our family into a larger room and called to check to make sure it was all ok. Great service!

This is the 2nd time we stayed at the Cortona Inn while in Anaheim to visit Disneyland.  We initially booked this hotel because it was close to the park and seemed reasonably priced.  There is a free shuttle a block from the hotel and there is complimentary breakfast which is perfect for starting your day at Disneyland with the family.  The room was clean and there is a pool and jacuzzi if you have time. The staff is friendly, and the housekeeping was exceptional.

Summary Heading: A strong 3 star hotel perfect for families
Summary: My family stayed at the Cortona for 7 nights.  We arrived woth some trepidation because we had read the terrible reviews on Trip Advisor and in fact had tried to cancel our booking before arriving (but couldn't find alternative accommodation).  I am so glad we didn't cancel.    The welcome we received after our long flight was excellent.  Staff were well informed, conmsistently polite and very helpful.    The rooms were clean and simple (although the constantly damp carpeting - presumably because of the air conditioning and lack of fresh air circulation- were a bit disconcerting) and the beds were extremely comfortable.  My children slept better than they do at home; a combination of exhausting days at Disneyland and the comfortable beds.    We stayed in a one bedroom suite

A pleasant, comfortable hotel in a good location.  The staff were most accommodating, friendly and helpful.  Although the hotel was 90% booked out, the director, John Rozatti kindly arranged for us to enjoy a late check-out (15h00m) thereby allowing us time to prepare for our long return flight home.

Before coming I read reviews of the hotel, some of which concerned me. On arrival and after the 4 night stay I can safely say I did not find any of the complaints excluding the wi-fi to be valid. Sure it is a little walk to Disneyland resort but nothing too bad, 15 minutes at a normal pace. Staying in a ground level room I found both the beds and pillows comfortable and the rooms clean and tidy. People complain about the lack of choice in their breakfast but considering it is free I found it perfectly acceptable. The reception staff were friendly and offered great advice on rental cars and tours to other parks. Would stay here again without a second thought.

Reception wasnt friendly. Our room smelled and was well below average.  As for the plastic and styrofoam cups for drinking and making coffee, how low can you go!   The breakfast was okay and you had to be lucky to get a table. I asked for a glass and they don't have any! The linen was old, the bed hard and as for the small lumpy pillows, terrible. I went to laundry and they have 2 washers and dryers, but I didn't feel safe.  I would never recommend this hotel. There are lots I didn't know about for the same price and after a couple of inspections, they were much better, so do more homework on accommodation, please!

We are just recently back from the Cortona and we were absolutely delighted with it. We were in a ground floor suite and my 17 year old son loved having his own room with bunk beds a sofa and a TV. We had a lovely King size bed with a microwave, TV and fridge. Disney is literally 10 minutes walk away so there was no hassle wandering along in the mornings. It was also ideally suited for Knott's Berry Farm and Universal. The staff couldn't have been more helpfull - We arrived 12 hours late, in the middle of the night, after a really awful flight and there was no issue at all. The room was immaculate and the front desk staff couldn't have been better. Every day almost they google mapped us directions to wherever we wanted to go. There are loads of places to eat nearby which is

Summary Heading: Great: location, price, amenities -- but lousy Internet
Summary: I stayed here with my teenage daughter while attending a conference at the nearby (5-7 minute walk) Anaheim convention center. We managed to get by without a car, but if you want to go anywhere other than the convention center or Disneyland it would be more convenient to have wheels. The ground level room -- excuse me, the 2 room suite -- was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Two queen beds in the bedroom and a pull-out sofa in the living room which we never pulled out. There was a strong smell right at the entrance but as long as we kept the air conditioner on it was OK. Microwave, mini refrigerator, TV in front room and bedroom. The free breakfast was fine though a bit limited: apples/bananas/oranges for fresh fruit; scrambled egg product/sausage patties for hot items;

Good hotel for the price. Free parking and continental breakfast can't be beat. I agree with most the reviews that our room smelled, smelled of wet mildew,but we just opened our window and turned on our air and than it was fine. Our bed was average as far as comfort, but we were soo tired after walking all day we just passed out. I can say that our room was very clean. For the price of this room we would stay here again. The walk to Disneyland was a little longer than I had hoped for, it's about 3 blocks. But it's better than paying for shuttle.  The pool area is small, but it's not like we're here to swim laps. It's perfect for an evening dip after a long day of Disney.

We really enjoyed our stay at CortonaInn & Suites. Our family suite was fabulous. It was just right for our family of 7. We loved how everytime we come back to our room after our whole day/night at Disneyland our beds were made, fresh towels and clean bathroom and vacuumed rugs. We especially loved how spacious and roomy our room was and how we could close the door to have our privacy while our kiddos were in their room with bunk beds and a roll-out queen size couch. The only thing I was a little disappointed was no belgium waffles at breakfast, which is always a hit with our family when we stayed at other hotels. Thank you very much for having us and we would definitely recommend this Hotel to families and friends. :)

we stayed at the cortona inn from 1st june to 8th june.  during our time we had the most pleasant experience with them.  all staff were extremley helpful and gave advice when we needed it.  we stayed in the one bedroom sienna, as we have three children.  it was clean and was a good size for all of us.  had no problem with the wi fi and the kids loved the pool.  we could walk to disneyland which was about 15 mins or we got the shuttle which cost all of us $11.00aud for the day.  the only thing that stopped me giving an excellent was i feel that they they need another room with washing machine/dryers.  breakfast was ok, not like home but as they say while in rome do as the romans do.  we will definetly stay again. thank you

My wife were in Anaheim for a conference recently and stayed at the Cortona as it just around the corner from the Conference Centre - it is also about a 25 minute walk to Disney Land. We found the staff pleasant the room very clean and well kept. Our only gripes are the Wi-Fi service - which was so slow as not to be there and the use of cleaners which may cause an allergic reaction.

we stayed for 3 nights...free buffet breakfast is okay...would have been better if they don't use styrofoam plates and cups (especially for coffee)...carpet needs a good deal of cleaning...we started wearing socks when we saw our feet black after walking barefoot...our socks are turned black too!  we booked a room for eight people that says Family Room for 8 with 2 queen beds in each room...so it could be deceiving...we were expecting there would be a some sort of a common living area in between the two rooms...it turned out that there are just two regular rooms separated by an accessible door in the center wall...but service is good, front desk staff are polite...and the location is good...close to disneyland....just take a shuttle and you're there...few minutes drive and there

I had previously read some good reviews and bad; needless to say, the bad reviews left me with anxiety about our stay at Anaheim Cortona Inn BUT it couldn't have been more wonderful! Great location: close to the park but far enough away tha mom and dad could get a little break at night from the Disney mania! ;) The cleaning staff was wonderful, all employees we encountered were friendly and helpful. Our room was spotless, the pool is a little small but perfect for children! The continental breakfast was pretty standard and is served from 6:30 until 9:30 a.m. For the best selection, go between 7 and 8. It gets quite busy down there from 7:45 on. Our nextdoor neighbors were noisy but this was in no way the fault of the Cortona and the hotel should not be blamed or held responsible

the staff was extremely rude to me the entire time.They were very unhelpful and made sure to only call over priced cabs if you needed to request one. The room had potential but it was stuffy and the airconditioner when running smelled like straight up mold, the pool is small and not heated. However the pool was at least clean I will give them that. It is not walking distance from disney. I walked to disney twice from there and I wouldn't recommend walking to and from on top of walking around the parks all day, just take the shuttle that they bash at the desk because they lie, it does get you there fast. Only reason we stayed at this place was because it was the ONLY place available ( what does that tell you ) The other pro I will say is I was really scared because it really

I recently stayed here for a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. It's an easy 5 to 10 minute walk to the center. There  is quite a lot of road construction right now on Harbor Blvd,  so a route through neighboring hotel parking lots was devised and works well.  The Cortona is set back from the street with a large grassy lawn facing Harbor Bld. (I understand that another property is going to be built there.). Very friendly and accomodating front desk staff. Good free breakfast, spread over 3 counters. I arrived at 8 am for the conference. Natrually I did not expect to check in at that time, but they gave me a parking permit for the whole day, and invited me for breakfast as well.  Comfortable clean room, not luxurious, but very decent business quality.   They have a

Summary Heading: We should have seen it coming...
Summary: To begin, upon check-in we were charged for $25 for incidentals which I did not find out until I was checking out, not a big issue, but the gentleman checking me in should have told me. Then when I went to open the hotel room the key was not programmed for the door. I had to take my 9-month old out through the parking lot to go and get the key reprogrammed. As soon as I stepped into the room it smelled like someone had used the bathroom and forgot to flush and the second bed closest to the bathroom looked like someone had sat on it prior to exiting the room. My husband turned the fan on in the bathroom thinking it would air out. As I walked over to put our suitcases in the closet I looked into the trashcan, which by the way, did not have a bag to find a dirty diaper. This is

Sub-par hotel.  Would not stay at again.    #1 you will NOT get internet access unless you go to the lobby.  Even going to the lobby it's VERY slow.  There were times I couldn't even connect there.  The night manager was so rude to me and another gentlemen when we were asking him about the internet. He said it was shared, that's why it's so slow.  I said no, you can't even get a signal in your room and at 5am. You can't tell me that so many people are on that early in the morning that it's causing it to be so slow.  He told me and the other gentlemen we didn't know what we were talking about.  Then he literately told the other gentlemen to SHUT UP, he's the manager and he knows how to do his job! This man should lose his job and learn how to speak better English and how to treat

I can't review the hotel, because we didn't stay there. We got stuck in traffic coming out of Vegas, and had to stay overnight in Primm. I called the Cortona, knowing that it was too late to cancel the reservation and receive a refund, simply to let them know that we would not be coming, so that they could sell the room to someone else who needed it. The manager offered, without my asking, to refund our money!   Next time we're in Anaheim, we'll be staying at the Cortona Inn. Free parking, free wifi, free breakfast, and a manager who knows what customer service really is.

Summary Heading: Average room, average hotel, great service.
Summary: Stayed 4 nights at the Cortona for our Disneyland trip...the stay was OK. We usually stay in nicer places...but to save money we chose this hotel. The room was clean, a bit stuffy with the threat of mildew in the air. We opened the screenless window and cranked up the AC to air it out. Stayed in a 2 queen bed room which was fine for a family of 4. The beds were comfy but kinda worn. Noise could have been a factor but with the AC full blast and amount of Melatonin we all took it wasn't a problem. Pool area was really nice...kids liked it almost better than the parks! Free breakfast was free...not going to complain there. Best part was Rebecca at the front desk. So super nice. We arrived before check in and she gave us a coupon to eat lunch while our room was being prepared! A
the kids suite was great, the kids enjoyed it very much. The place is well kept and offered great breakfast ( Free!)

My Husband and I took the kids to Disneyland and California adventures  for Memorial Weekend and stay the night at the Cortona Inn & Suites Resort. The people were nice, the room look just the pictures in the website. I would recommend this hotel and I would definitely could stay there again.Everything was clean and neat.

Comfy hotel, we didn't want maid service so every morning called for fresh towels and were always there quickly! Lots of parking which is so convenient for us families with big suv's! Will definitely stay there again

we have stayed here twice and each time we have loved every second of our stay. staff are so lovely. food at breakfast was simply yummy. rooms were clean and comfortable. great location too. Will be back soon :)

We stayed at this hotel from May 1-5.  I had a meeting at the convention center and my wife and kids came along to go to disneyland.  I liked that it was close to the convention center and close enough to disney that my wife could walk with the kids in a stroller.  They also had the shuttle if you would like to take that.  The rooms were nice and seemed like they were renovated recently.  We stayed in the family suite that had two bedrooms.  This was nice because the second bedroom is very large and the kids loved the bunkbeds.  We also liked that we could put them to bed and not have to go to bed immediately ourselves.  The breakfast was very good for a continental.  Overall for the value and location I thought this was a very good hotel.  I would recommend this hotel for

We had a great trip and got such a great deal on our room it made it just that much better. Free breakfast was awesome and the room was perfect! We will Definately be coming back and staying there again!!!

Very nice hotel. We were there for a conference at the convention center and the convention center is just a short walk from the hotel, very convienient location for events at the convention center. We were on the 3rd floor and it was very quiet and restful. No loud children or parties going on. The only complaint my wife had was that there was no light over the bathroom mirror and it made it hard to put on makeup.  The staff were all very friendly and very professional. They were ready to answer any questions and they made us feel very welcome.  The room is very spacious and clean. It is not a modern hotel but it was still very nice. The room has a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker but we never used any because the free contiental breakfast was much better than in-room

Summary Heading: Do not stay at this dump
Summary: Do not stay at this dump. Mismanaged bad property with inadequate parking and subpar rooms "dressed up" to look pretty.  The walls are paper thin. Do *not* expect a good night's sleep. Screaming children, yelling parents, blaring television, car horns, sirens, rushing water, jacuzzi motors, or the sweet sounds of hippotomous love-making - this hotel's got it all!  Enjoy.  The free wireless internet is worth exactly what you paid for it: nothing. Bring a cantenna and point it at the Clarion next door - or the Hilton across the street. I walked around the outdoor halways with a signal mapper and the room signals were consistently fair, poor or just undetectable. If you do manage to get a signal, you probably won't get an IP address. Their router appears to be busy doing something

As local Southern California residents, we have never needed to reserve a room for a trip to Disneyland before, but it was my sons 5th birthday and we wanted to avoid the wasted time we would spend driving to and from the park and booked this room for just an overnight stay. My mom booked the room for us and one of the main reasons we chose this location was because it was one of few places that claimed to accomodate 6 guests. We ended up only having 5 guests, but once we checked in we realized that this was not a place to accomodate a large group. Check-in was seamless and the front desk staff was beyond friendly. My family and I reached the location first, so we checked in and got our free parking pass. We went straight to our room and soon discovered how small the room was.

This hotel was a great deal with its online offers.  It was a fifteen minute walk to Disneyland, had a free parking for one car, and a decent, real hot breakfast that was always packed.  I would stay here again.  Looks like the pictures and perfectly clean.  It has nice complimentary soaps as well.  Best deal found for surrounding hotels.

Summary Heading: Hotel rooms were nice and the hotel overall was very beautiful.
Summary: Its very pretty. Great location, near disney and several restaurants. Wonderful breakfast with fruit and waffles, pancakes, cereal, etc. very helpful people too. Will definitely stay here again!(:  They also give you a 15% off coupon upon checkout!

It is a very clean, friendly hotel. The breakfast buffet has a lot of stuff, eggs, pancakes, fruits, sausages, milk, juice, coffee et al. About 20 minutes walk to Disney park. The only downside is their wifi service, which does not work well in hotel room. You have to take your computer to the front desk area to get good reception.

Summary Heading: Bring ear plugs, or don't come at all!
Summary: I want to start off by saying my Fionce and I ignored the negativity others had to say as I felt some guests like get anything free.... .. But! The noise level is unbelievable! My Fionce payed for this getaway as a stress reliever for me, guests pay to relax and SLEEP. Specially after a long exciting day at Disneyland. I cannot begin to explain the inconsiderate house keeping this hotel has to offer. It does not seem to matter how early, nor of your "Do Not Dosturb" sign is at display... They will yell across the halls and absolutely gossip their job away. Guests do not want to hear what your cousin or nephew has done... I have never stayed in a hotel where housekeepers stand around to gossip, we saw 4 housekeepers chatting on the doorway of a room that was "suppose to be"

This was our 2nd stay here and this time we had the extra room with the bunk bed for our two kids, we really enjoyed having the extra space. The rooms are kept very clean and it's our pick for  a family vacation to Disneyland.

I thought I found a gem when I booked the kids suite at Cortona Inn. I was excited for my kids to sleep on a bunk bed and I loved the free breakfast, wifi and parking.  However, after sleeping there I woke up one morning to see a small bed bug crawling on the sheets I was sleeping on. Needless to say I was disgusted and will not stay there again. Which is such a shame because like I indicated before I thought I found a gem. For the sake of future guests I hope they thoroughly clean the place.

Summary Heading: a real find used trip advisor to find this one
Summary: This is a small establishment compared to the big corporate hotel chains around Disneyland   but I like the smaller places they are much more personal. We arrived after a 12 hour flight and 3 hours waiting to get through immigration at LAX (this place is getting to be a nightmare) for the delays the airport is so badly organized for moving such large ammounts of people. Anyway when we arrived here were greeted by very friendly staff and got to our room promptly The rooms are well appointed and very good beds to sleep in, the continental breakfast is very good and there is a lot to choice from
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review and comments.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed the services and amenities that we offer and that our staff was attentive to your needs.  Despite the minus welcome upon arrival to LAX it sounds as though you had a wonderfil visit to Southern California and the Orange County/Anaheim Resort area.  Thanks again and perhaps we will have the honor of your return visit soon!

Summary: This was a pretty good motel. The rooms were kept relatively clean, but ours smelt a little musty. The beds were pretty comfortable. The continental breakfast was decent, basic stuff: bagels, cereal, donuts, and fruit. The biggest feature of the hotel is that it is within walking distance of the convention center.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing your comments regarding your recent stay.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable.  And as you mention, the Cortona Inn & Suites is very very close to the Anaheim Convention Center and just 1-1/2 blocks away from the Disneyland Resort Parks.  Thanks again for taking time to share your comments.

Summary: Great prices, hot, yummy breakfast, friendly, helpful employees, shuttle to hotspots! This hotel located in the heart of Anaheim was the best find. Located with in walking distance to the Convention Center, Downtown Disney, and the Garden Walk. Additionally, they have a shuttle that will take you right to Disneyland (as well as other places). The prices were fanstastic. We paid $135.00 a night for a Suite! ... 2 Queen beds, and a queen fold-out couch, Refrig, Microwave, Coffee maker, 2 t.v's, non-smoking, very clean, fresh towels. Then there was the daily hot breakfast of eggs, saugage, english muffins, juice, coffee... or have a bowl of cereal and fruit. Very family FRIENDLY. Highly recommend this hotel. Can't wait for an excuse to go again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Indeed it sounds as though you had a thoroughly enjoyable visit to the Anaheim Resort and enjoyed your stay with us.  As you mention, we offer a great list of value added items that can really help keep the travel budget slim without sacraficing comfort, convenience and exceptional accommodations.  We are pleased to know that you found our services and amenities to exceed your expectations and were comfortable and well accommodated during your stay.  Should your plans call for another "excuse" to visit the Anaheim Resort again, please do give us call.  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: spacious family suites that are clean and tidy with bonus breakfast
Summary: Great hotel for families.Clean and spacious rooms.Friendly staff.My husband and 2 kids had a Toscanna 1 b/r suite.The kids had their own room with bunks and a sofa and t.v.We had a comfy king bed in the main room with another t.v,desk and mini fridge.Bathroom had a bath and shower and was very clean.Nice pool and heated spa.Bonus breakfast of sausage,eggs,cereals,juices,fruit and yougurts and coffee and tea.You could take it back to the room if you wanted.The front desk were very accomodating and nothing was a problem.There is a small convenience store down stairs and a drink and chip machine outside when the office is locked up.There is a bit of a walk-about 10-15 min but its a fun walk as everyone is excited walking to Disneyland.On the way you pass a few shops to pick up
Manager Response: Dear Guests from Sydney, Thank you so much for your nice review and comments of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you especially enjoyed your Toscana Kids' Suite.  As you mentioned, these suites are quite spacious and offer comfort and privacy that familes find attractive.  And you are also very right... there are several places within our immediate area to stock up on snacks and supplies to help make the stay even more enjoyable.  You discovered one of the best secrets on how to enjoy a family holiday while keeping the daily expenses to a minimum.  Not only that, we hear frequently from our guests  about how much money our complimentary hot breakfast saves a family which over a period of a few days could add up to a tidy sum.   Thanks again for sharing your comments.  Perhaps we will see you again soon!

Summary: My business group and I have been to the area before and stayed in the pricey big name hotels around the corner for easy access to the convention center.  This time, we decided to get a suite at Cortona to be able to accommodate an extra person.  The mini fridge and microwave were wonderful to keep us from eating out for every meal and the breakfast provided was yummy and filling! We asked for extra towels the first day and they kept them coming each day after that.  All the staff was extremely welcoming and helpful; the kind of service that makes you smile!  Anything we asked about was taken care of immediately (roll away bed, earring recovery from sink drain, extra blanket). We will definitely always stay here in the future! Being right around the corner from Disney World,
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review.  We are very pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable.  Your comments are compelling evidence of our focus to ensure that all of our guest's experience excellent customer service that makes for a pleasant and enjoyable stay.  Thanks again for sharing your experience with those that are looking for clean, comfortable, convenient and customer service oriented hotel accommodations.

Summary: Good value for money, close to theme parks, room was spacious and American Breakfast was ample.  Staff were helpful and courteous.   Families returning late from theme parks created some disturbance. Parking was excellent.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and comments regarding your stay at the Cortona Inny & Suites.  We are pleased that your stay was enjoyable and that you had a wonderful time.  Thanks again and if we can welcome you back again soon, please be sure to give us a call.

Summary: The Cortona Inn is very well priced, great value for money, and excellently positioned.Happy helpful staff and great place to stay. Clean rooms great facilities.

My grandaughters and I stayed in the kids suite.  This is a two room suite, with tv's in both rooms and a door to keep things quiet and separate.  Spacious and clean. It had an outdoor pool, which we did not use, but it was also very clean.  The breakfast, which is included, was very complete.  It had a large dining room, and attendants watching over all of the activity.  The front desk was extremely friendly, polite, and helpful.  Although it was within walking distance to Disneyland, it was stilll quite a hike at the end of the day.  I was able to purchase a 3-day pass on the bus for only $10.  The bus (#3) dropped you off right next to the hotel. I believe it was an excellent deal.  I gave it a mark of 4 out of 5, only because it is a little older, and a tiny bit far from

Stayed there last weekend on a business trip. It was a great location very close to Disneyland. They are located right across the street from the Disneyland parking lot. You can walk over and catch the tram to the front gate. I'm going again in two weeks and will be bringing my family. The breakfast room had arcade machines and I spent a few dollars playing after work everyday, they also had a good looking swimming pool and jacuzzi but I didn't bring a bathing suit. I checked out a little late on Sunday and the two girls at the front desk Judy and Deana were very friendly and helpful. Overall it was a great place to stay and I can highly recommend them.

John Rozatti and his staff were very helpful with helping me plan our family reunion. The rooms were clean, the staff nice, and the breakfast filling. We like it so much we are planning another trip in November 2013 with the Cortona Inn & Suites staff.  Disneyland is a little futher away then we like, but if you walk to the Toy Story parking lot, you can hop on the shuttle and be dropped at the front gate.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for your comments.  It is nice to know that your family group enjoyed their visit and hotel accommodatins and amenities.  And you are right, it is nice to have the Toy Story lot just across the street for quick and easy Disneyland parking and transportation.  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: Great Inexpensive Option for Disneyland Vacation
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights for our trip to Disneyland.  I was surprised to find a rate for under $100 and decided to take a chance based on positive reviews and pleasant pictures posted by fellow travelers on TripAdvisor website.  The hotel is more like a motel, but was given some "facelift" by addition of somewhat nicer linens and bed-covers.  The room was spotlessly clean and two queen beds were very comfortable, totally adequate for just a night sleep for 2 adults and 2 kids under 10.  Both check in and check out process were quick and efficient.  The shuttle to Disney runs every 20 min. right in front of the hotel reception area.  We were provided some nice coupons to a few local restaurants.  There is a free WiFi in every room at no extra charge.  Breakfasts were included into
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for your nice review and comments about your stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites.

Summary Heading: My experience at the Cortona, beware
Summary: I have to say that this was the worst hotel ever. I even checked out one day earlier since they pretty much ruined our vacation. We get there on a Friday at 12pm. They gave us an option of checking in early but that would mean getting a room right in front of the elevator which I turned down since I knew the level of noise would be intolerable especially since I have a little one who is going to need her sleep after disneyland. We went to disneyland got back to the hotel at 8pm and guess where our room was at?! right in front of the elevator after I told them I did not want that room. The next day I look at my bank account and guess what.....THEY CHARGED MY CREDIT CARD TWICE! After wasting my time to get everything cleared up we decided to check out one day early and end our
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay.  Please accept our apologies that we were not able to accommdate your request for a room away from the elevator.  More often than not we can accommodate most requests and are we sorry that we were not able to comply with your request.  Your other issue was an error that was corrected immediatly.  We do apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused you.  We would like to welcome you back so we can have the opportunity to serve you and your family again soon!

Summary Heading: Good and clean and close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed four nights at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We had two rooms interconnecting.  The rooms were clean and well maintained.  There is a laundry for guests to do laundry which was very handy especially with kids.  We walked to Disneyland, which was only two blocks away, approx 20minutes.  Close by to restaurants.  And further down the road where the hotel is situated is a big Target, which is handy if you need to buy things.  Breakfast was very minimal though, not a great variety but ok.  Overall very satisfied with the hotel and the staffs and services.  Would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks for taking a few moments to provide your input and feedback regarding your recent stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We value the opinions of our guests and always appreciate knowing where we do best and the opportunity to improve if there is an area where we can do better.

Summary Heading: Great first stop for excited Kiwi's!
Summary: After a 12 and a half hour flight and a 2 hour wait in LAX customs, arriving at Cortona was bliss! Front desk staff were friendly, accommodating and had our check in done super fast! We had emailed ahead to advise that we may arrive before check in time, and received an email to say that it was no problem and that it would be more than likely that our rooms would be ready early to which we were very grateful. Our rooms were excellent - nice and cosy for our family. We stayed in the 1 bedroom Siena Executive and it was perfect for us. Bathrooms are especially nice and the beds were very comfy after long days playing at Disneyland. The shuttle stops right outside the front gate, and purchasing tickets for this is made easy at the front desk. We utilised this service and came back
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for your very informative and candid review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  It sounds as though you and your family thoruoughly enjoyed your stay with us and your visit to the Anaheim Resort and all that there is to see!   Thanks again!!

Summary: After a 12 hour plane ride, the only thing you want to do is check in and sleep. We arrived quite early, and our room wasn't ready, so we had our bags stored and went for a wander around.   On arriving back we checked in properly and had a nap - although we could hear a bit of noise from other guests, we figured it was just disney excitement - and daytime - at night it was much quieter.  The hotel is not too far from Disneyland - around a 15 minute walk (for adults). The staff are very friendly and attentive - and the reception staff are a definite credit to the hotel! Having a lounge and separate bedroom meant that when I fell asleep from jetlag, my hubby could watch tv without disturbing me - a definite plus in my book!  The free breakfast was good - the pool area looked nice
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your nice comments and review of the Cortona Inn & Suites. We are pleased to know that your stay with us was very enjoyable and that you found everythng to be quite handy.  Perhaps if you come back again will have an opportunity to be of service to your and your family again.  Thanks again!!

Summary: Right by all the fun stuff. Very helpful with extra help we needed for our son in a wheelchair.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks for your comments and review.  Its always a pleasure to asisst our guests and offer them the best experience possible.  Thanks again!!

Summary: This Hotel was recommended to us by a friend and we were looking forward to taking our daughter, granddaughter and her mother-in-law to Disneyland when the mother-in-law became ill on the trip from Wisconsin to California and ended up in the hospital.   As you can imagine our disappointment with concern for our family member.  The manager at Cortona Inn and Suites in Anaheim was kind enough to give us a refund for our rooms.  We do plan to go again and to stay at the Cortona Inn and meet the manager there that was so kind to us. Thank you so much.  The Boggs family.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks for notifying the hotel of your family matters during a more diffucult time than usual I'm sure.  We offer our best to your family member that all is well and that you will have a chance to visit the Anaheim Resort again soon.  If we can be of assistance, please let us know.  Thanks again for your heartfelt review.

Summary Heading: A basic base for your holiday
Summary: We stayed here for 9 nights. it is your basic bed and breakfast. Staff at reception will help you when you ask but considering it's a holiday spot they are not as pro-active as i would have expected. There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel but transport in the area is not good! I don't drive and could only get to places by booking tours. We flew in to LAX airport and this is quite a distance from the airport. The rooms are clean enough and spacious however the walls are paper thin. We were on the ground floor and for a few nights had some very heavy-footed people in the room above! There was a lot of noise about and sleep was disturbed so be prepared to be up early although if you are on holiday you probably will be anyway! Breakfast is provided but i would suggest
Manager Response: Dear Guest, I would like to thank you for your comments and review of our hotel.  We apprecite the comments of our guests and thank you for taking time to share your opinions.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: OMG such an amazing hotel to spend your vacation with!
Summary: I was nervous about booking a hotel online without seeing it first. So when I arrived at this hotel and went to our room, i was sooooo pleasantly surprised!!! The room was clean, it smells clean and it was very spacious. We had the king suite and loved the idea of a separate living area and bedroom. The water pressure was good and the bathroom was roomy. The sink area was a little small for my liking but nothing that i couldnt work with...there is a small shelf in the closet area(right next to the sink area - within arms reach) that i used for the bigger stuff that i couldnt fit. The bed was comfortable, the pillows mushy and PLENTY of them!!!! I always bring my own pillow, but if i hadnt i would have still slept great!!! I had to ask for another blanket(we're cold people) and
Manager Response: Dear Guest(s), Thanks for taking the time to share your comments and review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We appreciate your commetns and your opinions and are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and fun!  Let us know if you plans call for a future visit to the Anaheim Resort!

Summary Heading: good value, good rooms, ok location
Summary: Only booked this on the morning we arrived in Anaheim; there are quite few places closer to main gate but these were all booked up. However, we were happy with our choice when we arrived. It's one of the more attracive properties around, in a sort of Spanish colonial style. The pool was warm and pleasant seating area. Rooms were well appointed for a property of this price. Staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast room  and the breakfast were a  bit cheap and cheerful, but otherwsie we liked this hotel. The walk to disneyland was a bit of a drag as we did it 4 times in one day! Could have used the shuttle, but it's not quite as frequent as we thought, and the exercise was good for us after all ther burgers we ate in America! Overall would probably give it 3.5 stars, but as I
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for choosing the Cortona Inn & Suites for your lodging needs while visiting the Anaheim Resort.  Very pleased to know that you found our hotel to meet or exceed your expectations!  Thanks again!

Summary: We stayed for 4 nights, and we had an enjoyable stay here.  All the staff were very frinedly and welcoming.  The room was clean, beds comfortable.  Their complimentary breakfast they offered had a good variety of stuff.  They had eggs, sausage, pancakes or french toast sticks, cereals, toasts, english muffins, pastries, donuts, hard boiled eggs, fruit, juices, and coffee.  For a free breakfast I think that's a pretty good variety!  No need to purchase the ART tickets to go to Disneyland, becasue it only takes about 15 min. to walk from the hotel to Disneyland.  We walked each day to Disneyland with no problems.  We didn't get a chance to use the swimming pool becasue we were too busy, but the pool did look clean when we walked by it.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks for your comments for your most recent stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are always pleased know that our guests are more than satisfied with their hotel choice and that our services and amenities met your expectations.  Thanks again for your comments.

Summary: This was a good location but the extra Room tax and resort tax were extra $30 per night. We stayed here three nights and will never stay again. The beds are hard and the sofabed squeaks so loudly if you move an inch. The walls were paper thin and we heard every conversation next door. The people above us sounded as if the were going to fall through the ceiling. Everytime they walked around it woke us up. To top it off there was a group of kids drinking until 2am. We will never stay here again. There are plenty of better places to stay!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank youf for your comments.  We apprecaite all comments and opinions and thank you for taking the time to submit your review.

Summary: We stayed for 6 days and walked to Disneyland and back for 4 days (15 minute walk). Shuttle to Legoland and Universal pick up at the bus stop right out front on Harb. Blvd.Lots of eating places near by, convention center around the corner. Rooms were very clean and staff very nice. Free breakfast was excellant with a good variety of  hot food, and lots of it. We had a suit for six, two queens and a pull down couch. Couch was not to comfortable but ok. All in all a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guests from Nanaimo, BC... Thank you very much for your review and comments.  It sounds like you did indeed have a wonderful time while visiting Southern California and the Anaheim Resort.  We know you have many options for hotel accommodations in the Anaheim Resort and we are pleased that you found the Cortona Inn & Suites to be a wonderful choice.   Thanks again and perhaps we will see you again soon!

Summary: i couldnt find trash bags in the room.i asked housekeeping and told me one have it,the hotel doesnt have any.can you believe this?we used walmart bags for the room trashcan.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your comments and concern about plastic trash bags.  For our guest rooms, we do use a type of trash bin that is of a washable rubberized plastic type that does not require trash can liners.  This type of trash can is advantageous for the environment as it helps to reduce the amount of plastic waste that is disposed of in landfills.  They are also easy to clean and maintain.  That being said, we do have  trash/storage bags that are available should one be needed.  These items, as well as tooth brushes, tooth paste, shaving cream and other toiletry items are available upon request by contacting our Guest Services Staff.  We are also pleased to know that in all other areas you expressed your satisfaction. Thanks again!!

Summary: My wife and I were there for the National Cheer Competition. The hotel is two blocks from Convention Center, four blocks to Disney and choice restaurants very close. With all the teenagers running around, my wife and I had no problem falling asleep. Clean rooms and grounds neatly manicured, Down-side no work-out facilities but did a lot of walking.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for your review and comments.  We appreciate hearing from our guests and are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and comfortable.  Perhaps we will see you again next year should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort.  Thanks again!!

Summary: kids loved it great service good communication caring average room but still good do reccommend for familys great breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review and comments.  Very pleased to know you had a wonderful visit and enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Thanks again!!

Summary: Best value using hotel tonight.com. This room was only 3 blocks from Disney land and free continental breakfast! Rooms were standard and clean!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review and comments of the Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim Resort.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: I've made arrangements for my two older teens and their friend to visit Disneyland and boy did Arun at the front desk make it smooth and worry-free - and all over the phone. He advised on shuttles services, entry tickets and he's even arranging for nice birthday basket from the hotel for my daughter since she'll turning 19 away from home. The custom, caring service is like no other. Thank you Arun! I'm sure their stay will be more of the same.
