Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks for taking the time to offer your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites Anaheim Resort.  The customer service that Arun delivered to you is an example of how we take care of all of our guests.  With the best intentions in mind, always, we do our utmost to ensure that everyone is comfortable and completely happy with their stay.  Thank you again!

Summary: We chose Cortona for its value and proximity to Disneyland.  We arrived to find that they had overbooked the spa suites but they had already arranged to upgrade us to the family suite at no extra charge and to move us to a spa suite the next day if we wanted.  Both rooms were clean and well maintained and spacious enough for our family of four.  The jacuzzi worked wonderfully and was such a nice reprieve after 12+ hours on our feet.  The walk to Disneyland was indeed under a mile and easy enough.  The breakfast is nothing to scream about but we were able to fuel up enough to not have to pay for breakfast at Disneyland.  We would stay at Cortona again!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks very much for submitting your comments and review.  We thank you for your understanding with the room change and are pleased that you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to your return visit soon.  Thanks again!

Summary: We recently stayed at Cortona Inn with 4 adults and 2 children.  The children stayed in the sofa bed so I can't comment on the bed.  Yes the bathroom was small and we had to do the waiting routine but hey that is to be expected.  I must say that the breakfast was more that we expected.  We had a scrambles egg circles, sausage, hot cakes, one day we had fresh made waffles, fruit, cereal, hard cooked eggs, juice, coffee, milk, danish rolls, bread, English muffins, waffles to toast, so if you went away hungry I can';t figure out why.  The staff was so friendly and helpful.  The grounds were really clean and well kept.  Nice hotel to stay in for the money. Glad to see an elevator as I recently had ankle problems and needs this service.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for your review.  We are pleased to hear that your stay was enjoyable and that you enjoyed breakfast.  We did just very recently add sausage to our breakfast menu as well as a really smooth and tasty Premium Roast Black Velvet Coffee.  As you stated, its quite a hearty offering and even nicer, it can save a family a bundle of money each day.  That can add up fast!  We shall look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort! Thanks again!!

Summary: Our stay @The Cortona Inn was a great experience.  We were looking for something close to Disney and affordable.   Cortona staff was very helpful, and the rooms were very spacious.   I would strongly recommend Cortona Inn to anyone looking for somewhere to stay with a family.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for your review and comments about our hotel.  We work very hard to deliver a memorable stay to all of our guests.  Our management staff constantly monitors key areas of guest concern to ensure that rooms are clean and comfortable, our hotel grounds are well kempt and manicured and that our services and amenities are made available to our guests.  And thanks for sharing a great tip!  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: The pullout sofa belongs in the dump!
Summary: We booked this suite for our family of four.  We were planning to use the pullout sofa for the kids and adults in the king bed.  We definitly appreciated having the space of a suite, but the pullout bed was beyond repair, the kids rolled to the middle all night long and everytime someone moved it sent a screech into the night!  It never occured to me that a hotel could have something so horrible on its premises.  The font staff was not at all helpful.  We asked what people do to book transportation to Universal Studios - she had no clue and the person next to her kept interrupting us for no good reason.  Later that week another family told me the shuttle would leave from Disney and get you there.   Lastly...the much talked about breakfast.  It really is a zoo in the breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for for comments and review.  We value all input  from our guests and use this infomration to evaluate areas of concern to ensure that we are able to maintain our commitment to guest comfort and satisfaction.  Please accept our aplogies if your questions regarding transportation were not addressed correclty.  Our clerks keep up to date on the different options for transport to and from most southern California theme parks and amusement parks and have great information available to share to ensure efficient transport to and from these locations.  As our ongoing evauluation of our services that we offer to our guests, we have made some nice changes to our Continental Breakfast.  We did just very recently add sausage patties and a brand new fresh brewed Premium Roast Black Velvet Coffee which is incredibly smooth and tasty.  I can assure you that this coffee is some of the finest you will find, being very smooth almost buttery smooth and a rich hearty flavor.  It is fresh ground and brewed fresh.  With the addition of sausage patties, one can now enjoy their Egg McMuffin style sandwich and cup of coffee for a quick grab and go breakfast or enjoy our full deluxe Continental Breakfast in casual sit-down setting.  We invite you to come back and give us another try.   Thanks again for your review and comments!

Summary: Stayed there 3 nights for a trip to Disneyland.  The "suite" was a decent size, bathrooms are small.  We got a room on the 1st floor and it sounded like the people above us were going to fall through the ceiling.  Their walking was so loud it kept us up at night!!  We could also hear our neighbors conversations pretty clearly.  I would not recommend this hotel if you plan to stay in the room for any length of time.  Also, the lobby had a very strange odor that permeated into the breakfast room.  My kids couldn't eat their food because the smell ruined their appetite.  It's a good 20 minute walk.  If you plan to go to back to the hotel during the day, stay closer.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review and comments about the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Please accept our apologies for the noisey disturbance your experienced.  Thanks again!

Summary: I booked this hotel online from their own website and got a confirmation. After a drive from San Francisco, upon arrival I am told to go a hotel next door. No sorry, no apology initially. Just a message saying they are over booked and that they have a blocked few rooms next door. After I started to argue, I got an apology and was told that next door is better hotel anyway. I don't know at that point if that's correct or not but after 6 hour drive and with 2 kids eager to go to DisneyLand, I didn't have time to argue. In fact I am told that if I want to cancel the reservation, they will refund all my money. What a joke! When I check-in next door hotel, I am given full size bed and not queen size bed as I had booked here. Well, there are many better holes in this area so why
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Please accept our sincere apologies for the unfortunate relocation to another hotel.  On rare occasions and often for reasons beyond the control of any hotel it may be necessary to find alternate accommodations at a neighboring lodging establishment.  This is done as a last resort but with the intentions of ensuring that the guest does have accommodations of at least the same quality or higher for immediate occupancy upon their arrival.  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort we ask that you give us the opportunity to be of service to you and your family.  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: A Motel (not an Inn or Suite)
Summary: This motel is cheap and fine. Nothing exciting about the room. But also not horrible.  Close to the park, about a 5 min. drive. You could walk, but with kids it would take a while. The free breakfast is a nice perk. Food was fine.  You enter the rooms from outdoors. (Not an enclosed building). There isn't anything special about room. You have a TV, bed, small bathroom, separate area for sink and mirror. All in all, a good deal.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your comments and nice review.

Summary: I can tell you that this hotel does not care what you think about it. We called this hotel directly to express our concerns in their take on "hospitality": Which as recently noted, involves personal attacks on consumer reviews and public shaming. Please take some ownership!  I encourage you to scan back through the reviews and look at the way this hotel responds, and can tell you from first hand experience they are just like this in person. I would also encourage you to look at local hotels in the area and spend the extra 50 bucks a night for a better experience.    As for my stays:  I have nothing outrageously terrible to say about this hotel. I have nothing moderately terrible to say about this hotel. It is, just a hotel. There is a bed to sleep in, and you will have a decent
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to submit your comments.  When we respond to guest comments we do so only after reviewing the initial guest comments and to determine the cause of any less than satisfactory areas that were mentioned in the comments as well as for areas where there were positive comments.  We believe the customer deserves the best accommodations and service possible and we make every effort to deliver that experience to all of our guests in a friendly and professional manner.  We apologize if we did not deliver this experience to you and ask that you allow us the opportunity to serve you and your family on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.  Thanks again.

Summary: read reviews, it wasnt solid performer but after our 3 day stay I am absoubtedly thrilled with my decision to stay @ Cortona Inn. Spacious lobby where you never felt in  the way and we stored 7 bags until early evening when we departed - unpacked repacked !  Large storage rm was great. Most helpful reception folk looking online for anything I needed to know - breakfast rm staff most kind and cleaning folk very courteous. Rms were spacious for 5 of us (1 bdrm suite), 2 TVs, fridge, clean bathroom - 3rd floor was very quiet.  For the cost I was amazed. Kids swam - nice pool and towels available. Breakfast - basic but cereal, coffee juice was most adequate! Very happy with our location and stay.  I would stay again.   Top hints -  Hotel is situated back off the rd so was private
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review and comments.  We are pleased that you were satisfied with your stay and your hotel selection.  Your experience truly demonstrates the effort we put forth every day to ensure that all of our guests find the Cortona Inn & Suites to be an excelleant choice for lodging, and that our Guest Service Agents make every effort to deliver the best care possible.  Our housekeeping staff takes great pride in their ever so important job of making sure that everyone enjoys a sparkling clean and comfortable guest room or suite and our breakfast staff delivers a fantastic breakfast that is offered complimentary to all guests every day.  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort, we will look forward to your return.  Thanks again!!

Summary: Stayed here for 3 days after the last NAMM convention so my wife and kids 2 and 4 could go to Disney. While the suite was spacious, upon entering we were met with a powerful mildew smell that never went away even after running air conditioner. Windows would not open btw... Being a non smoking hotel, smokers would congregate on stairwells leaving lots if butts everywhere that we're never picked up and we had to run a gauntlet of smoke everytime we left the room. Continental breakfast was spartan to say the least and one morning the juice had a distinctive moldy flavor. All in all next time we'll stay up the street at the nicer Suites hotel and spend a few extra dollars for clean rooms and better food.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review.  Your comments are appreciated and as a result of your comments we have increased our signage throughout the hotel to remind guests that smoking is not permitted in the walk ways or within 20 feet of the buildings.  Of course, we also appreciate those who do observe the non smoking signs for their concern for guests that do not smoke as well.  Just recently, we added sausage patties to our deluxe Continental Breakfast and a new and buttery smooth Premium Roast Black Velvet Coffee.  The additon of these two breakfast items in addition to two cold cereal choices, oatmeal, danish, donuts, toast, hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, two fresh fruit choices (alternate apples, oranges, bananas), belgian style make your own waffles, english muffins, orange juice, apple juice, tea, milk make for a great money saving breakfast that is complimentary each morning.  A true money saver that deliveres a wonderful choice for breakfast.  Thanks again for your review!

Summary: We planned a last minute trip to Disneyland and I really wanted to find a place that was within walking distance, not too expensive, and at least a 3-star place. This hotel fit the bill nicely. It isn't fancy, but it's a solid 3-star AAA rated hotel (this is important to me). It took us 15-20 minutes to walk to D-land, pushing a double stroller. It would've taken much longer for us to drive, park, unload the kids, etc. so I felt good about the walk. (We were even able to walk home for a nap mid-day to re-energize, which I highly recommend if you're traveling with little ones.) Along the way, there were a couple of places to get semi-decent coffee/snacks and any basic things we may have forgotten. We upgraded to the Spa Suite for like $10 extra, and although we never used the
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to offer your review and comments.  We are pleased to know that your stay was very enjoyable and that you enjoyed the choices offered with our continental breakfast.  We are also pleased to know that you appreciated our guest parking at no additional charge.  Again, thanks for your review and comments and we look forward to seeing you again soon on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort!

Summary: I'm not sure how much we paid for the room, but my husband and I stayed two nights in December.  Room was fairly clean but there was hair in the tub (eww!)  Bathroom was large but no light near the mirror.  Access to the room is from the outside so it is more motel than hotel.  Both mornings someone was outside our room sweeping which sounded like something trying to get in under our door!  Our room was near the elevator so we could hear all the footsteps and talking of everyone coming and going.  Heat and air worked fine.  Continental breakfast was ok.  We've had more choices but it was fine for our needs as it was just the two of us.  Walk to Disneyland was a longer than I would have liked and definitely too far for younger kids if not in a stroller.  Staff was friendly
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your comments and review.    Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort, please allow us the opportunity of serving you and your family again.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel to attend a event at the Anaheim Hilton; where the rooms were pricey with $30 a night parking. Parking was free here, but you still get hit with a $15/day 'resort fee' which allows you to use a smallish dull pool and a teensy hot tub.Breakfast free and  will fill you up. The room was fine, coffee maker,refrig and microwave. Across the street and down a few blocks is a new Target store with a market inside.One night when we were exhausted,we bought fresh soups and salads and ate in our room! Next to Target is a Viva 99 store, a latino version of the 'dollar store' where we found some cool souvenirs! No, this is not a luxury resort, but it met our needs, was clean and safe and the staff was great!
Manager Response: Deat Guest, Thank you for your review and comments and great tips on where to save some cool cash for cool souvenirs.  We are pleased that your stay was enjoyable.  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort, please let us know.  Thanks again!

Summary: We enjoyed our recent stay at this hotel.  We spent two nights and we walked to and from Disneyland without any problems.  We had a clean room and the staff was great to work with!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your nice comments.  We are pleased to know that your visit to the Anaheim Resort was enjoyable and that your stay was wonderful.  Let us know if we can be of service to you and your family again soon!  Thanks!!

Summary: Me, my husband, and 3 kids stayed here for four nights on our recent trip to Disneyland. The beds were comfortable, the room was properly cleaned and towels restocked each day, and the Kids' suite was very large -- it is where all five of us sat to watch tv and unwind after a full day at Disney. The pic on their website shows a child table and chairs in the Kids' suite, but there was not one in ours. However, since we did not plan on spending much time in the rooms, it wasn't that big of a deal. There was a slightly unpleasant smell in the Kids' suite area, and when you flushed the toilet there was an unpleasant sewage smell. We did not complain about it though, because it wasn't bad enough to make us want to go through the trouble of switching rooms. However, if we had, I'm
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thanks for your nice review.  We appreciate your comments and are pleased that your stay was enjoyable.  Our staff works very hard to ensure that everything is in fine working order.  If not, we want to hear about it as soon as possible to ensure that your contnued stay is exceptional.  Good news is, is that since your stay we have made some very nice changes to our complimentary Deluxe Continental Breakfast with the addition of scrambled eggs, sausage patties and a really nice and buttery smooth Premium Roast Black Velvet Coffee.  This is in addition to our exisitng line up of great morning favorites that is a great money saver as well.  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort, we invite you back to experience all we have to offer again!  Thanks!!

Summary Heading: Upset that I ever gave this hotel a try...
Summary: Long story short our kids suite had hairs on the pillows, in the tub, heater did not work, and the front desk was beyond rude. When we called to ask if they could fix the heaters they told us that we needed to turn them off and they would "switch the breaker" two minutes later the heaters where out again. Called the front desk the man on the other end said we could only have one heater running and only on low. After stating that I payed for two rooms and two heaters the man proceeded to insult me by telling me to "get an education white-y" followed by faul language. Working in hospitality myself I could not tolerate being spoken to that way. I packed the kids up and left to the Portofinna Inn a few doors down. Now the manager refused to give us a refund stating we stated there
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your comments.  First I would like to offer an apology for your less than satisfactory experience.  Second, I invite you to contact our General Manager as soon as possible to discuss your stay.  You can contact our General Manager by contacting the hotel diectly and asking for the GM.  We look forward to hearing from you soon. Thanks!

Summary Heading: Great for Family - Kids Suite was HUGE!
Summary: Cortona was wonderful, let me tell you why. The kids suite was huge - made me and my husband want to sleep in the bunks and have that room - way bigger than ours was! and that's where the closet is. Next, I never walk around barefoot in a motel. I woke up and i was really warm, so i had taken off my socks. Had to go to the bathroom so I walked to it adn came back to bed - my feet were NOT dirty. No smell, no funk - that means this place is CLEAN! Lastly - the breakfast was excellent. different Warm items every day. Monday was scrambled egg (in the shape of a circle) with cookies to choose from, Tuesday there was hard boiled eggs and biscuits with gravy and muffins, Wednesday I think we went back to scrambled (i'm drawing a blank, can't remember) with muffins. BUT, each day you
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your comments and review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are very pleased to read that you and your family thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us and that you found our services and amenities to your liking.  Especially our Continental Breakfast which as you have described it as excellent.  We do offer a great variety of menu items and have very recently added sausage patties to the menu as well as a very nice, buttery smooth Premium Roast Black Velvet Coffee that is just amazing.  That being said, again we apprecaite your comments and thank you for recognizing our staff for doing a job well done.  Each of our hotel staff works very hard on a regular basis to ensure that our guests enjoy their stay and that guests can count on them for assistance any time of day.  Thanks again!

Summary: Whilst on our recent trip to Anaheim, we stayed at both the Red Lion Hotel Anaheim, and the Cortona. The Red Lion is just opposite the Cortona Inn And Suites. What a difference !!!!! I certainly wouldn't stay at the Cortona again. It all started with our arrival, we were due to of stayed for three days but  I had phoned them previously to reduce the stay to just one day. Of course when we arrived the whole stay had been cancelled We eventually got our room, which was noisy and of low quality. We could hear every noise from the room above and from the car park. I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, in fact for just a few £s extra a night, stay at the Red Lion. We stayed there at the beginning of our trip, all I can say is quality !!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your comments about your recent visit.  Please accept our apologies for the error regarding your reservation.  Should your plans call for a future visit to the Anaheim Resort we ask that you please allow us the opportunity of serving you and your family again.  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!!!
Summary: Would not recommend this hotel. The rooms are are clean and nice for the price. But you do not get any rest the walls are super thin. I was able to hear EVERYTHiNG through the walls!!!! Learned my lesson pay a little more to get a descent place where you can actually rest.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for commenting on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate your feedback amd take all comments very serious.  Please know that your concerns have been addressed to help alleviate them whever possible.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Good hotel with location very close to disneyland
Summary: Was staying there for a conference nearby. Room was clean and staff were friendly. Disneyland is 20min on foot. would stay again
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We get asked often if we are truely close enough to walk to the Disneyland Resort and your comment answers that question perfectly!  We are for sure close enough to walk.  If you have a car with you, that means you can keep your car at the hotel and enjoy parking at no additional charge and save on the parking fees for Disneyland parking.  Thanks again for your review and as always we are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.

Summary: Was in town for a 3 day convention at the Marriott, which is only a 10 minute saunter around the corner.  The hotel is set back from the street, so you get minimal road noise.  I kept my window open all night for fresh air).  The hotel upgraded me to a king suite which has a desk, sofa, tv and mini fridge in the entry room.  Maid service was efficient and the front staff were very nice.  For your money, you get a nice clean rental room with a complimentary continental breakfast.  If toast and cereal doesn't cut it, you can walk down the street to Denny's for eggs & bacon.

Summary Heading: Close to Convention Ctr, Disney - and affordable
Summary: I stayed here for four nights while attending a convention at the nearby Hilton - at a much lower cost.  Room was clean, comfortable and did the trick; it's a five-minute walk from the convention centre and maybe a 20 minute walk to Downtown Disney. Downsides: my ground-floor room could be a bit dark (they're long, rectangular rooms with 1 window) and the shampoo and hair dryers were lousy.   I appreciated the free internet (though the wifi was incredibly slow, so I borrowed a plug-in ethernet cable) and the included continental breakfast had a variety - cereal, toast, bananas/apples, donuts, make-your-own-waffles, etc. All staff I interacted with were very friendly - helpful with directions, making change, etc.   This hotel is easy to get to using the SuperShuttle service (£17
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us and that your travel needs were taken care of.  We are currently  sampling different types of bathroom toiletries and have not settled on a product but will keep your comment in mind about the shampoo when we update the guest room toiletry items.  As for our very close proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center and the Disneyland Resort, you did discover that we truly are very close which makes it very convenient, especially for those who may not have their own vehicle with them while visiting Anaheim.  I am also very pleased to see that you enjoyed our Continenteal Breakfast.  We put a lot of thought and effort into our complimentary breakfast and although we cannot please everyone all of the time, we do have about a 98% favorable rating for having a breakfast that includes more than just toast, coffee and juice.  The fact that it can save the average family a fair amount of money each day on foods costs is also nice. Thanks again for your review and we shall look forward to seeing you on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed one night after a full day at Disneyland. The double queen room was clean and comfortable with a microwave and refrigerator. Disneyland is within a 15 minute walk unless you opt for their shuttle service for a fee. Breakfast was complimentary with an assortment from cereals, toasts, pastries, belgium waffles and fruit. Gift store in lobby is convenient with souvenirs and snacks and beverages. I recommend families to stay here if you are looking for an affordable hotel and close to Disneyland.

Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights while attending a conference. Staff were extremely helpful and attentive. From the hotel I could reach several shopping malls with buses 83 and 43.There are good restaurants around and grocery stores. It is also close to Disneyland.

I stayed there for two nights by myself. First room I had was on the ground floor right next to the elevator. I called and they told me all the king size bedrooms were at the same spot on the other levels so they switched me to another room with two beds on the second floor in the corner. Room was nice and really liked the fridge in the room. Could hear the kids running on the floor above me. Not to happy with breakfast. It seemed if you were not there early you missed out on some of the food choices. Good place to stay if you plan on just sleeping there and taking a shower.

Summary Heading: Clean, well maintained and perfectly located.
Summary: The room for the four of us was very large, exceptionally clean and well decorated.  It is obvious that this resort is kept up properly and that the owners (or the company that owns it) has invested some profit back into the property.  The one criticism - I know the buffet breakfast is complimentary but if everything has gluten, there is nothing for celiacs to eat in the morning.  Yogurt, fruit, something else would be appreciated.  But overall a great property.  We'll stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for your informative review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that you were satisfied with your hotel choice for your visit to the Anaheim Resort.  You are right in knowing that we do take great pride in our hotel and make every effort to ensure that our guests are treated to clean, comfortable and spacious accommodations as well as a variety of value oriented amenities that are included at no additional charge.  We do understand the different dietary needs of our guests and offer selections that can be helpful to most guests.  For example, a celiac diet can include eggs, oatmeal, oranges, milk.  which we offer but understand that other items would have been enjoyed during your stay.  Please accept our apologies that we were not able to completely satisfy your dietary needs.  The fact that you were able to enjoy your stay overall is always nice to know.  Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Checking in was a breeze. The lobby area was well kept up and clean. They have elevators, so taking luggage up to the third was made a lot easier. The toons themselves were very clean and the beds were super comfortable. I used the laundry service and they were quick and reasonable. I didn't try the breakfast so I can't comment on that. Overall id have to say its stay here again. Great job.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay and that our services and amenities were helpful.  Sorry that you missed our wonderful deluxe Continental Breakfast.  We get a lot of compliments on our breakfast for a variety of reasons including the best reason is that it is free and helps families save on meals costs which they can then use for other vacation treats!  We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Thanks again.

Summary Heading: we got a good price, but then an added "resort fee"
Summary: updated hotel, but beds have not been updated so didn't get a very good night sleep.  micro and fridge are welcome sight.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We appreciate the time you have taken to share your experience while visiting the Anaheim Resort.  Thanks again!

Summary: The Cortona was OK this time.  The beds were really comfortable The motel  is clean the pool is nice and clean.  The service was good.  They do have blowdryers in room.   The food quality has gone down a bit we were there on 10-10-11 and there was not very much breakfast to choose from except for lots of doughnuts and no where to eat your breakfast except for the curb outside.  The coffee in the lobby tastes cheap kind of like instant or something.   I have stayed here before and thought the breakfast was much better the last time.  So I would not choose this hotel because of the breakfast.  The hotel was clean except for the corners of the bathroom had a bit of debris build up and it was loud one night due to kids running with luggage carts back and forth for a few hours up
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Seems as though we met your expectations in most areas but with some dissatisfaction with our complimentary continental breakfast.  Just to touch on our breakfast as we do offer a more extensive breakfast than some hotels currently offer.  For example, every morning for breakfast we serve:  three cereal choices, toast, make your own waffles, donuts, Danish, muffins, orange juice, milk, coffee and tea.  In addition, we also feature a hot item that varies by day.  In addition to the above, we also serve one or two of the following each day:  scrambled eggs, French toast, biscuits & gravy, hard boiled eggs and pancakes.  These hot items are rotated on a daily basis to provide a little more variety to our breakfast.  To accommodate our guests, we serve breakfast from 6:30am to 9:30 am each morning.  A great tip to avoid the crowd would be to take advantage of our breakfast before 8am.  Or, for grab and go convenience, a cup of juice and piece of fruit, coffee and a donut, toast and milk can all be quickly served and you’re on your way.    And although the shampoo provided in our guest rooms is a Conditioning Shampoo, we thank you for your great tip to remind travelers that have specific toiletry item preferences that they are partial to to bring them with.  We also have a Gift Shop that carries health and beauty products such as shampoos, conditioners, pain relievers, etc for your convenience.  Thank again for your nice review and we look forward to your future visit to the Anaheim Resort!

Summary: One of the worst places me and my family have ever stayed in stunk rotten in the room even my clothes the next day stunk not even mickey mouse would of gone near me!the phone in the room was broken and we was all to scared to get in the sheets incase of boogies!

I had a convention in Anaheim and decided to not stay at the large convention hotel and chose the Cortona based on reviews here at TA. It was a great decision. Normally I stay closer to the park, but since I was here for the convention I needed to be closer to the center. I arrived at about noon but Ian was able to get me checked into my king suite!  The check in area is nice and the process was fast. I was in room 234 and it was fine. Like any other motel with excited kids running, you could hear people at the pool or walking by, but it was fine.  I was glad that I had suite so that the bedroom was at the back.  Very quiet.  The room was clean and the bathroom was also clean.  The vanity area was really small and would be a problem if you actually had a family in the suite.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for such a insiteful review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are very pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and that your found our hotel to meet your needs both for comfort, amenities and service but also for our close proxmity to the Anaheim Convention Center.  And I am pleased to see that you followed a tip left by a previous post suggesting options for shuttle transport to and from the Disneyland Resort.    I would like to add that although we are located just 1 block further than hotels directly across the street from the Disneyland Resort, it can mean a substantial savings on the entire hotel stay and still be within walking distance of the Disneyland Resort, or for those riding the convenient ART shuttle, just a short ride away with service every 20 minutes up until Disneyland Park closing hour.    Finally, a hearty "Thank You" for recognizing two of our Guest Service Representives who assisted you during your stay.  All of our clerks are willing and ready to proivde outstanding customer service and to recognize them means a lot to them.  Again, thank you!  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort, please let us assist you again with your accommodation needs.

Summary Heading: 5 star status in a inexpensive package
Summary: I usually stay at Westin Hotels for business, but because I had my family with me, we decided to get a hotel with an extra room for the kids. This hotel was way over expectations. Staff were super friendly and more helpful than any other hotel I ever been in. The suite were as clean as other much higher priced hotels and the continental breakfast was well...continental. We're definitely staying at this secret gem again. But I hope this review won't make it harder to get a reservation in the future.  Thanks Cortona Inn and Suites for making our vacation first class at an affordable price.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us and that you were very satisfied with our services, amenities and location that were condusive to your comfortable stay.    Thanks again and we hope to have to the opportunity of seeing you again on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort!

Summary: I stayed two nights at the ground floor a couple weeks ago on a business trip.  I needed to get to the Anaheim Convention Center and the location was great. I saved $12/day in parking at the Convention Center because parking is free at the Cortona and it is only a 5 minute walk away.  When I checked in the carpet of my room seemed like it was just shampooed because it was wet and the room smelled musty.  I had to turn the air conditoner on all night because of the musty smell. I also had to keep my shoes on before hopping on my bed to sleep.  The bathroom was good, with the exception of the sink, which smelled of sewage.  The room itself was of good size and the bed was comfortable.Having the air conditioner on all night irritated my throat the next morning.  Breakfast  was
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review of our hotel. We appreciate your comments and are pleased to know that overall your stay was enjoyable. We apologize that you were assigned a guest room that had had the carpeting shamppoed earlier in the day that was not completley dry.  We do use the services of a professional carpet cleaning agency for the routine cleaning of guest room carpeting and have been informed by them that due to the rather humid weather we have experienced lately, drying time can take longer than usual.  Thanks again and we look forward to  your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: We stayed here last year on a Family trip.. We got the room with the bunk beds!! we loved it! The kids had their own area and the door between the rooms kept things quiet! (It was perfect since our youngest was only 2 months at the  time) Every thing was clean! Check-in was easy and the staff was friendly and helpful. The desk agent even gave the kids chocolate and a cute little valentine when we left (such a cute little touch, we left on Valentines Day)... The breakfast was pretty standard for continental breakfast (good enough for us) The kids loved the pool!!   .  We would most definitely stay here again!
Friendly and accommodating staff. The room was clean and everything worked.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your nice review of the Cortona Inn & Suites and for sharing a great tip.  In fact, this is a great for almost any hotel that one may choose. Thanks again for taking a moment to share your comments!

Summary Heading: Took a chance and it paid off…..
Summary: I travel to Disneyland from out of state often, at least every other year but this year we purchased an annual pass and visited twice in one year.   We’ve stayed in several hotels in the area and even have a favorite.  This time, since it was our second trip of the year I was looking to save a bit on our hotel.  The Cortona had a deal Sunday – Thursday that not only saved us a little per night but also included free parking and breakfast which are not available at our “favorite”.   Being familiar with the area I knew just where this hotel was and what it looked like from the outside but I had no idea what it was like to stay there.   We had a bad experience with a motel on our drive down so I was worried when I arrived.   Wow, what a nice place.  The front desk staff were so
Manager Response: Dear tkbl, Thank you for taking the time to provide your comprehensive review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are most pleased that you had a fun visit to Disneyland and enjoyed the services and customer care at our hotel.  Its not always easy to find a pearl in an oyster so to speak, but it is easy to find a gem in the Anaheim Resort at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We do work very hard to make our guests feel welcome and at home.  By offering great amenities such as our very nice deluxe Continental Breakfast and parking with no additional fee and free wi-fi, the recognizable savings can really ad up.  We are glad you found value in our hotel and clean and comfortable rooms.  And thanks for the great ART shuttle tip!  Its input like this that can really help others discover ways to help make their visit to Disneyland Park in the Anaheim Resort more enjoyable and fun!  Thanks again.  We look forward to seeing you soon!

Summary Heading: Staff very friendly, good location and clean
Summary: Excellent location particularly for Disney. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good local knowledge. Nice clean hotel and pool.
Manager Response: Thanks so much very your review.  We are pleased to know that you found our location to be convenient and ideal for a visit to the Disneyland Resort Parks.  And thank you also for sharing your comments about our friendly staff and our hotel.  Realizing that there are many hotel choices to consider when visiting the Anaheim Resort, the Cortona Inn and Suites is a great choice for those guests that are looking for convenience, comfort, cleanliness and value.  We hope to see you again soon!  Thanks again!

Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel and never would we return. Upon our arrival to the hotel the bus that took us from the airport to our hotel had to drop us off at the bus stop outside where the hotel is and then you had to walk with all your bags up to check in, when we asked the bus driver why this was he said that it was because how the hotel had the entrance set up. When we got to the hotel the check in took a little bit and when trying to ask questions the lady at the front desk was not the most friendly person. She made you feel as if she had better things to be doing at the time. When we finally got to our room we weren't very happy as we had requested a king bed and instead we got 2 doubles, when we went back and asked about this they told us that they seen this but at
Manager Response: Dear Ashley102, Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We understand your frustration with the airport transportation that brought you to our hotel.  There are a few choices available to those that are in need of transportation to and from the airport, but only the van style shuttles are able to enter our drive way and pull up and stop directly in front of our lobby.  Full size coaches may not always have easy access to all hotels and drivers are unable to move in reverse due to safety reasons.  For those passengers looking for a more convenient method of transportation, albeit perhaps priced slightly higher, there are two other van style companies that are highly recommended as well.  As for your room type, we do make every effort to accommodate all requests, however certain reservations that are made through agencies other than our own may only sell rooms with two queen beds and other bedding options are on request.  Most of the time we can accommodate these requests.  We offer our apologies that a King bed was not available during your stay.  Our complimentary Continental Breakfast is a great money saver as breakfast in some of the restaurants nearby can cost a family of four close to $40.00 per day.  Considering that our breakfast is free, the savings can really ad up for those that stay a couple days or more.  Our staff is on duty throughout the hours breakfast is served and while some of our breakfast choices may be depleted quicker than others, our staff does monitor and replenish food items as needed.  A quick mention to the hostess will resolve any issue with regards to any food choices being offered that day.    A previous guest who comments on Trip Advisor left a great tip for those looking for transportation to and from Disneyland.  This guest suggested the following:  "Helpful hint: The bus route that serves the Cortona #3 has quite a few stops after the Cortona, it is faster to take the bus that picks up around the corner on Convention Way #6 to Disneyland and the Cortona bus on the way home only."    Perhaps this will help future visitors to the Cortona Inn & Suites and if so we would love to hear your comments also about this tip.  Thank you again for your review and comments.

Summary: We stayed at the Cortona for 4 nights from August 18-22.  The location is perfect for anyone attending an event at the convention centre.   The microwave and fridge in the room were very handy and the hotel is within walking distance (20-minutes) of a grocery store or the Target which has a great grocery selection as well.   The breakfast room is nice with a decent selection for a free breakfast (cereals, toast, waffles you could put in the toaster, donuts, pastries, fruit and one hot item - pancakes, egg patties, french toast sticks).  The room was quite clean and comfortable.  We found a good room rate but the extra $10.00/night "resort" fee is a bit ridiculous.  At least call is something else, a resort is saying a bit much.   All in all, if I had to be near the convention

We found the Cortona Inn to be the best value for our family of 6.  We stayed in the Toscana Suite, which was very roomy and very affordable.  The  breakfast was good, but can get crowded, so try to go early.  The pool was small & basic, but what you would expect for that price.  The lobby & room was clean, staff vas friendly & very helpful.  We've stayed here 3 times, we've also stayed at Disney's Grand Californian 3 times - when we don't bring all the kids, and the Ramada 2 times.  For "value" we will choose the Cortona Inn (if we can't stay at Disney GC - it's about 5 times the price).  Friends have stayed at other value hotels, and I would say Cortona Inn is the best.  The walk to the park is about 10-15 min.  We will stay there again this winter.

Great free breakfast and free parking.  The rooms had nice new spreads and were very comfortable.  If you like to walk it is a nice one down Harbor right to the Disney parks.  Location seems very safe and the hotel staff was nice. The pool was on the small side but we spent most of our time at Disney so pool time was not a priority. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear 32950Donna, Thank you for your review.  We are pleased to read that you found our breakfast and parking amenities to be of great value to you and yoru family.   Sometimes it s the little things that can make a hotel stay just that much more enjoyable and help with the vacation budget at the same time.  Your testament of our location to the Disneyland Resort parks is sure to help others who may also be interested to know that we are just a short walk away from Disneyland Park and Disneys California Adventure Park.  We have had some very warm days and that being said, pools can become a bit crowded but...I did hear a guest say that any pool is better than no pool.  I kind of  liked that.  But all in all very glad to know you had an enjoyable time in the Anaheim Resort and as our guest.  Should you have plans to visit the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim again, please give us a call.  Thanks again!!

Summary: Stayed here during a trip to Disneyland. Very convenient. We were able to walk to the park within 15 minutes. Our room was huge and bed was comfortable. The pull sofa not so much . Rooms could have been a little cleaner and the safe required a key and deposit. There is also coin laundry onsite which was so so handy! Nice pool, but internet not so great from the room. Still would recommend this to anyone going to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Bosgirl123, Thank you for taking the time to post your review about the Cortona Inn & Suites in Anaheim.  We are glad to know your visit to the Disneyland Resort was fun and memorable.  Your comments will be shared with all of our departments to remind them that our guests take notice of a job well done and to remind them of the high level of customer satisfaction that we work towards on a daily basis.  Thanks again for your comments.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit the the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim, CA.

Summary: This review is long overdue.  We stayed here for 5 nights last July.  As others have mentioned their front desk staff are not the friendliest around and coming from a CS background this should have been red flag #1.  Everything was okay until the 2nd night of our stay.  You have to provide the deal with your liscense plate number so they have that info- well low and behold at 2am after a full day spent at Disneyland someone's alarm went off.  And it went on for about 30 minutes.  People where waking up yelling out their windows to shut it off! I finally called the front desk to tell them to knock on the door of the owner and tell then to shut it off... Another 20 minutes later it goes off. I do agree their was a strong odor in our room as well- and it's a pretty far walk from
Manager Response: Dear Issy425, Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your stay.  We appreciate the information you have brought to our attention and apologize for any disturbance you may have experienced.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: I ALWAYS ENJOY MY STAY HERE
Summary: My fiance and I have stayed here 3 separate times, and each time is always a pleasant experience! The staff is very friendly and professional. The rooms are VERY clean as well as the bathrooms! The beds are comfortable and clean and the pillows are too! If you are a AAA member you get a discount and they do have promotions which you can see online. The breakfast is yummy and they make sure there is plenty to go around.
Manager Response: Dear Missestrange, Thank you for your comments.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay and found our team to be courteous and our service and amenities to your liking.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our first ever trip to USA, we arrived from Las vegas about nine at night, the staff were obliging, the room was clean and just what we needed for our nine night stay. Convenience stores close by a bit of a walk to Disneyland, more so after a day of walking the park, but just being there was a buzz so didnt matter too much. The only drawback was the noise, we were on the second floor so could hear when people were awake and showering etc. Also we were right by the stairwell and on some mornings parents didnt seem to have any regard that there may be people sleeping and let kids be very noisy. All in all though a nice clean place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear disneyfan062, Thank you for your cordial and informative comments.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable.  Please accept our apologies for the noise disturbance you experienced.  Disneyland is such a fun place, for big kids and little kids and sometimes the excitement can be a bit overwhelming.  So again, our apologies to you and thanks for sharing your comments.

Summary Heading: My work screwed up—Cortona to the rescue!
Summary: This review has been months in the making, but here goes: I was in Anaheim on business, my first extended travel trip with my company, and scheduled for a three night stay with the Cortona. Long story short, there was a mishap on my company's end that left me roomless for the backend two nights of the trip. Unfortunately, the hotel had rebooked my room after several unsuccessful attempts to get in touch with the company (my boss left the office number instead of his cell and this was a Sunday). The staff was incredibly nice, hospitable and helpful, even assisting me book elsewhere in the area and holding my luggage while I attended a mandatory work function. Thank you Cortona staff for making an otherwise stressful situation manageable!
Manager Response: Dear kg5387, Thank you for your review.  Not only is it nice to see that you found our staff to be courteous and helpful, but that you took a few moments to let us know of your positive experience.  Sometimes it seems that the nicesties may go unnoticed to some however in your case it was proven again that we do take great pride in delivering quality customer care.  Should your plans call for a future visit to the Anaheim Resort, please be sure to give us a call.  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: the worst experience in a hotel
Summary: they charged me discounted price $86 instead of $136 and i assumed I got a good deal. however the smell of the room and the bedding was so bad and also the room was so noisy because of the laundry facility next to it. we moved in the next morning to the Hilton where they charged us even less then Cortona and we had excellent time there.... the room in Cortona does not worth even $20 per night
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review.  We value all guest comments.  We realize that everyone has their opinion.  We do, however take great pride in knowing that a very high percentage of our guests report very satisfying guest experiences about our hotel.  Most guests rate us on our services, location and amenities such as free deluxe Continental Breakfast, Free Wi-Fi, and so much for, as well as cleanliness and convenience for which we are adamantly engaged in delivering.  We are very sorry that you were not satisfied but certainly look forward to another opportunity to serve you again, albeit perhaps a bit further away from the laundry room.

Summary: This hotel was CLEAN! The staff was very friendly, and helpful. There were a lot of kids there yet it was very quiet. The Breakfast was good, there was something for everyone's taste. I would stay there again. I highly recommend it.
Manager Response: Dear pruselady, Thank you for your review.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your visit to Anaheim and that your stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites was pleasant and enjoyable.  I especially appreciate your comments about our breakfast, as we do invest a great amount of time resources in this particular area to ensure that we remain consistent with the quality and selections that we offer and that it is appealing to most guests.  Not only is our breakfast a great money saver for the traveler looking to shave off a few bucks on food cost, its also a great way to re-energize and start the new day!  Thanks again for your review and for sharing your experience and opinion with others.

Summary: This was a nice hotel for the price. We stayed May 25-May 30th and had very few problems. There were a couple instances where the front desk staff was not very friendly and there was noise from the pool but not after 10pm. It was clean and housekeeping came in everyday and straightened up. We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing your experience at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We value your opinion and comments and appreciate the time you took to let us know how we did.  Not that we are perfect but we do place a great deal of emphasis on ensuring that quality customer care is delivered to all of our guests.  We share all guest comments with our team and your comments will certainly be discussed as a friendly reminder that team member must deliver the best care possible one hundred percent of the time.    Our Housekeeping staff is quite meticulous and I have to say they are very mindful of their job.  I am pleased to hear that their efforts were recognized by you and your family.    Thanks again for your review and opinion and we shall look forward to welcoming you again soon!

Summary Heading: Good deal to get a head start at the parks
Summary: We live in San Diego and were going to drive up to Disneyland in the morning but had heard that it's better to get a very early start to beat the crowds.  But, we were only going to book a hotel if we got a deal, so I found this place on the internet.   When we figured what it would have cost to get breakfast and pay to park at Disneyland, we ended up getting the room (and our early start) for super cheap.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, room was clean and the we were able to walk to the park.  I will say that "a block and 1/2" from Disney is technically true but the blocks are really big, so it's a bit of a stroll, but you walk all day at the park anyhow, so whatever.  The breakfast was as expected, mostly cold cereal, toaster waffles, etc.  But, it worked great for
Manager Response: Dear fancybutcheap, Thank you for your review and opinion of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased that your hotel stay was enjoyable and also that your visit to the Disneyland Resort was fun and exciting!  There are so many tips and tricks one can employ when visiting the Disneyland Park and you have found some of them.  The early bird gets the worm so to speak.    As your experience will prove, our team does invest a great deal of effort in their unique duties to ensure that guests are treated well, that guest rooms are meticulously cleaned and that our amenities such as breakfast and free wi-fi are delivered consistently.    Walking to the Disneyland Resort Parks is easy and measured in blocks and is 1-1/2 blocks  from the hotel.  It is also nice to know that the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) bus will take you to and from the Disneyland Resort and to other dining/shopping and entertainment venues close by.  ART will also take one to and from the Anaheim Amtrak Station.  As for kids running around and noise, we like to think that our guests are considerate of others and make efforts to keep their kids excitement in check.  Noise issues are not unique to our hotel, though.  Granted we are not a library but sometimes a parental "shhhh!" may be needed, so to speak,  for the comfort and appreciation of other guests.  Thanks again for your comments and opinion.  We look forward to seeing you again at the Cortona Inn & Suites.

Summary Heading: it is a hotel and the breakfast is great
Summary: We had the pleasure yes pleasure to stay in the Cortona Inn for 7 days. We arrived having been up for over 24hrs to be greated by friendly reception staff who gave us a choice of either 2 queen beds or a kingsize.We chose a kingsize as this is what we have at home.Our room was on the top floor which is up 2 flights of stairs not an issue for us.  Our room was very spacious very clean and the bed was huge and comfortable. We had plenty of pillows.Our room was suitable for disabled persons which neither of us was and as stated was on the top floor which did surprise me but again was no issue as a lift was right outside the room.  The room was cleaned daily and was always spot on.I have read a lot of comments on the towels and found that there were sufficent for us.No they are not
Manager Response: Dear blade1404, It is with great pleasure to respond to your comments knowing that you found our HOTEL to be to your liking.  It is always satisfying for our team to read comments such as yours as we all work very hard at making sure that our hotel can deliver clean, comfortable accommodations with value.  Each team member takes great pride in knowing that their efforts help make pleasant memories possible for our guests by ensuring that their stay is satisfactory.  With respect to the "Kettle", we do what we can to ensure that guests from all over the world are made to feel at home and comfortable.    I especially appreciate your comments about our FREE, yes FREE breakfast.  Although it is a complimentary deluxe "American" style Continental Breakfast,  there is always something for everyone.  There is a variety of breakfast favorites served each morning, as well as tea, coffee, milk, orange and apple juice.  Considering a jump across the street to a popular branded American family restaurant  will set you back and average of $30.00 for a family of four, our breakfast represents an incredible value.  So, thanks for your appreciation of this amenity in particular.  All in all, your review is quite thorough and pleasant.  You left Anaheim happy, content and with many fun and memorable memories of your visit.  And that, is great!  Should you plan another visit to the Cortona Inn & Suites, please be sure to drop by and give a knock on my door.  Cheers!

Summary: We stayed there for 5 nights. For the price we payed it was an alright experience, Besides we were out most of the time during the day. Just one thing though that put us really off. There was a strange smell at times that was coming out from their sink- looks like there was a drain running thru or something. That was just aweful.  Besides that it was alright.
Manager Response: Dear Sherry1975, Thank you for your review.  Your comments are certainly helpful.  We have checked the odor you mentioned and find it to have been an isolated occurrence that was remedied easily.  Pleased to know that you had a pleasant experience and that you spent your days seeing as much as possible while visiting Southern California and the Anaheim Resort. Thanks again!!

Summary: We book it online because it looks really nice on the website and it says hotel but it is actually a motel.  I was really dissapointed when I saw the place and room.  Amount you pay is too much.... + resort fee??? Where is the resort???  It is so loud and you can here next rooms tv and talking.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review.  To be frank, we had had this discussion a few times about what constitutes a Hotel or a Motel.  I invite you to visit one any major search engines and look for the definition or description of either.  If you search on a popular online encyclopedia site for the definition, you will find that a hotel: is an establishment that provides paid lodging on a short-term basis.  The Cortona Inn & Suites is exactly that, and therefore we are known as a hotel in the Anaheim Resort.   As for the value of our hotel, we are very competitive in our market and offer very reasonable rates plus many free or no cost amenities such as:  Free Deluxe American Style Continental Breakfast, fridge and microwave in all rooms, tea/coffee makers as well.  Our Resort Fee is typical of many Anaheim hotels that are located within the Anaheim Resort.      Thank you again for your opinin.

Summary Heading: Nice place to rest after doing DisneyLand.
Summary: Upon first arriving the Hotel desk clerk was very friendly. We got a room on the first floor close to the lobby. Which was awesome having two children and a stroller. This place has a pool that looked nice. It was a little cold to use it when we were there. The room we were in was nice. when you walked in you had a coffee table,couch, Tv with Armoire, a small fridge/freezer, and a desk. The next room had two beds and a tv and chair. The room was pretty clean. I did find a wrapper under the bed and a brand new Disney shirt behind the couch. That really didn't bother me though the rest of the room was clean. The rooms were cleaned and beds made everyday. The breakfast was, well the usual hotel breakfast. We just usually got the pastries and oranges which both were very good. The

Summary Heading: Charged us $200 for a "no show" when we tried to check in twice
Summary: The service was atrocious.  We arrived at 2 in the morning after a 20 hour drive, only to be told that their prices listed online were incorrect and that we would have to pay $90+ tax to add an extra night on our two day package.  The man at the front desk was rude so we decided to look around at the surrounding hotels for what they had to offer.  We found a nice hotel down the street closer to Disneyland for the same price and because of the hassle of getting a room at 3 in the morning they allowed us "early check in" for the following night.  When we returned the next day to pick up our tickets for the park, the woman was relatively friendly and said we could check in later that evening so we went to the park for the remainder of the day.  When we tried to check in for the
Manager Response: Dear guest, Your comments do not accurately describe the situation you mention.  According to notes made on your reservation, we had no influence on your decision to leave the hotel to search for other accommodations.  We cannot emphasize enough that guests traveling from a distance are best to reserve in advance since rates previously viewed on a web site may not be available at the hotel upon your arrival.  Many factors can affect rate, and being sold out is one of those factors.  Your decision to not check in and seek other accommodations meant that you did incurr a late cancel/no show fee as we did in good faith hold your room for you.  The Cortona Inn & Suites operates fairly and always in the best interest of the customer.  Your claim of being charged twice for a no show is incorrect.  Should you wish to discuss this issue  with our management staff, please contact us at your convenience.

Summary: I stayed at Cortona Inn for 4 nights while attending the Keller Williams Convention, which was held at the Anaheim Convention Center. I parked my car when I arrived, and never moved it! It was a 5 minute walk to the convention center and a 20 minute walk to Disneyland. Perfect location. My room was clean and well maintained. The little microwave, refrigerator and coffee pot worked just fine. The front desk staff were super nice and helpful. I have only two complaints. The info in the room says you need a cable for the internet, which you get from the front desk. That connection seemed pretty slow. At the end of my stay, I discovered they also had wireless, which was much faster. And the towels are horrible! I looked at it as a dermabrasion treatment with every shower!
I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were clean, and the continental breakfast was an added bonus.

We had 6 days at this hotel. the hotel is small by other Anaheim hotel standards. my initial impression was that the room was quite dark, but i soon became to appreciate that as it allowed sleeping in when it was quite light outside. Breakfast is free, it is basic, but not unpleasant. the breakfast room is small so there was sometimes the feeling that you needed to rush to vacate your table for others.  the reception staff were on the whole pleasant and accommodating. we found Dan to be very helpful over our queries and other matters. the rest of teh staff were all very pleasant but didn't appear to want to go the extra mile e.g.we had a hiccup with having booked a late check out, when we returned from our last monring in Disney, that hadn't been processed and we were locked out

Summary Heading: Very basic motel that needs to update their environmental policy and practices.
Summary: This is an old motel with good size rooms and suites. Price was good value for families. A free breakfast was included that was very basic and completely unhealthy but the worst thing was the complete disregard for the environment. To save washing up, all food is served on foam disposable plates, plastic disposable cutlery and cups. It was horrible to eat from and created a huge amount of waste. Close to Disneyland but no free shuttle service.

I recently visited LA with my family and lived at Cortona Inn & Suites near Disneyland. There was an incident that is worth acknowledging. My youngest kid forgot to take her baby doll when we checked out. Later when we realized it was too late to return. I had a tough time to convince her and tried getting a new baby doll instead. But, there was a lot of emotional attachment she had with the older one. She cried continuously for the doll. I then called up the hotel and they were prompt in validating that they had found the doll and kept it safe for me. I was on business trip a week later and collected it from the hotel. When I surprised my daughter with the doll, she was very excited and happy to have it back. She said I was a hero and the best dad ever.   I was impressed by the

Came here because the reviews seemed decent and we paid $80/night to stay here. It included a buffet breakfast, but the quality of the food was poor and was mostly bread, muffins, small waffles and egg substitute patties.   Keep in mind that when the site states it's 2 blocks from Disneyland, these are the longest blocks known to man. There are lots of affordable hotels closer to the park, and I would recommend looking at those first.  Our room was clean, sufficient for sleeping, but if you're looking for a place to spend time at, the atmosphere leaves much to be desired. The pool is very small and there aren't any good restaurants in the vicinity.  The staff wasn't very friendly, they ignored us when we were standing at the front desk, and did not go out of their way to answer

I stayed at Cortona inn for the second time, and read some reviews before.Some were annoying, some just stupid/funny like the guy whom complain that he couldn't see his car from his room! (take a picture of it next time!) Some people want the Hilton services for 1/3 of the price. I found the staff very friendly and helpful, the room very clean with everything you may need, and the price was more than fair. breakfast was more than fine...and free(just a reminder again for the complainers) Noise?, well after a long drive and checking in at 2 am, some inconsiderate people woke us up at 7am by beeping their horn for a good 15 minutes! what the hotel has to do with it? well in conclusion this hotel was very good and I will stay here again without a doubt! So people, get real! you

after a long drive from fairfield, ca, i went to the aid of a latina front desk to check-in.  i gave her my last name and to my surprise, she told me that i did not have a reservation.  i repeatedly said, you don't have a reservation under (lastname) and i left frustrated and nervous because now i'm trying to figure out how am i going to find rooms for the family, including my two grandchildren.  i went back to tell my girls about not having a room and asked lisa if she kept the email i sent her on her ipod.  we proceeded to go back to registration because now i was determined to speak to a manager.  another front desk helper was available and i approached him and asked him if i could speak to a manager.  he was more helpful and the other lady who did not want to help me at all
Manager Response: Dear Maloy114, Thank you for providing us with your recollection of your check in process. Not quite sure what propelled this situation from a routine check in to the state in which you describe, so a review of the situation with our clerks on duty that assisted you revealed the following: Your reservation was input into our property management system with the last name spelled incorrectly.  An honest, human error.  The clerk that originally assisted you was hopeful that because she could not find your reservtion under the correct spelling that you iterated to her, she was asking for a confirmation number that would reval the reservation record that would  allow her view your booking and if necessary, update the last name with the correct spelling.  In this process, you quickly departed the front desk and came back a few moments later with your daughter but proceeded to our other clerk on duty who was able to locate your reservation by your first name as the first clerk had suggested to him.    What was not revealed in your comments was the concern of both clerks to properly identify you and locate your reservation so that your check in could be completed in as timely a manner as possible.  But, there was no reason for insults to be levied against our staff, especially towards the young lady that initially tried to help you.   Thank you again for sharing your views.

Summary Heading: Would Def. stay again and again
Summary: WE LOVED the Cortona for our recent trip to Disneyland.  We have two boys 5 and 2.  We swam in the pool and hot tub (both heated) and really enjoyed their FREE breakfast.  We stayed three nights and had a different hot breakfast option each morning among their waffles, cereal, donuts, muffins, etc. that you would normally get.  I thought the staff did an amazing job keeping everything fully stocked and we never waited to get food.  The rooms were very clean and up to date, cleaned and stocked each day with extra care even.  They folded my boys blankies and put their stuffed animals on the bed.  As far as walking distance to Disneyland...it took us about 10-15 min. to walk there on our first day.  The boys rode in the stroller so my hubby took the brunt end of the trip.  Second
We stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. Perfect location. Room was perfect. Breakfast was perfect. Great location. Staff were all friendly. Cant wait to come again..

We are halfway through our stay at Cortona and I have mainly great things to say about this place. We booked a kid's suite because we have a young child. Booked everything over the internet from Australia so we were a little worried that things would not be as good as we hoped. We arrived earlier than check in was allowed - we arrived at about 10.30 am. Check in was 3.00pm. We were really jetlagged and begged for a bed in any room until our room became available. The lovely staff found us a kid's suite available immediately at no extra charge.  The hotel is in a great location. You just walk down the driveway and turn left, cross the road and there is a bus stop. The #3 bus takes you straight to Disneyland. You could actually walk to Disneyland if you felt like it as it is not

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, excellent price!
Summary: We took a trip to Disneyland earlier this month and booked a room at the Cortona Inn. Considering that this hotel had mixed reviews I was a little bit nervous about staying there. Once we arrived I was very pleasantly surprised! The hotel sits far back off of the road so it's very quiet. The landscaping is simple and nice, it looks just like the pictures from the website. Our room was very modern, comfortable, and clean. The pool and hot tub area is nice, we just didn't get to use it much considering it rained almost the whole time we were there. The continental breakfast is pretty much your typical hotel breakfast, nothing special. A couple times we took the area shuttle to Disneyland, but we were  tired of waiting for it to show up so we decided to walk there. It's quite a

The Cortona Inn appears in the Virgin Holiday brochure and Virgin don't use poor hotels.   It is indeed more of a motel than a hotel but as part of a three week trip to the west coast it met our needs perfectly. We booked a spa suite which was roomy had the spa bath and another bathroom, a microwave, refrigerator and a safe. There was a very large closet and it came with a full size ironing board and an iron. there was an on site laundromat and the shop had washing powder.  It was within walking distance to the Disney parks and the spa bath was very relaxing after a days trudging around in temperatures in the high 90s. The Inn was set back from the road so there was no traffic noise and we slept well.  The breakfast was average but plentiful and you could make your own waffles.

We stayed here during our family trip.  There was me and my daughter, my sister and my parents.  There was plenty of room for us to all spread out.  The only problem was we only had one bathroom for the five of us, but that wasn't the hotels fault, we just booked a room with one, they do have them with two.  The service was good and housekeeping was very good.  We did have the black stuff on feet off the carpet, but with everyone walking and also people with scooters, we just alway take a pair of flip flops to wear in hotel rooms.  The pool area was a nice respite in the afternoon when the temperature was 100 degrees.   Having the breakfast room in the morning was a real plus.  They did have a decent selection of food to choose from, hot and cold. We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice room but too much noise!
Summary: The room looked nice.  Bed was comfy and bathroom counter was marble.  But a nasty smell hits you as soon as you open the door.  I sprayed fabreeze inside but it only last so long.  The room came with a microwave, Coffee machine and fridge but I had to dig around the back and mess with the cords.  Only 2 appliances can be plugged in at the same time.  That was dumb.  The maid service was awesome.  They folded all of our personal blankets and even put our picked flowers in a cup of water.  Nice touch!  The deal breaker for me though is the noise.  You can hear everything as if the window is open.  At first I thought it was open and checked.  People talking outside, walking by, cars shutting their doors.  Then worse is people walking above you going to their room and even the room
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  With respect to the plugs you mention I want to think there were other outlets that were not being used.  In any event, we are checking all rooms to ensure that these types of housekeeping details are corrected quickly.    Our aplogies for the noise facter you mention.  Perhaps additional signage around our hallways and parking area to remind our guests to kindly consider the comfort of others will help.    For everyone who reads TripAdvisor I will be brief but focused on our Internet Service.  First, we are in the process of converting to all wireless.  Second, our existing service has always been a hard wired High Speed Internet Connection in all of our guest rooms.  A couple years ago, we added free Wi-Fi designed to be received only in our public access areas such as our outdoor pool area, breakfast room and lobby.  The signal is not designed to be received in our guest rooms at this time.  Although your computer may be able to sniff out a wireless signal, the strength cannot be guaranteed.  As for the internet cable that is provided to you at our reception area is needed to connect to the internet from our guest rooms, there is not a charge associated with the use.  We do ask guest to sign for the cable to encourage its return upon departure.    Thanks again for your review.

Summary: We stayed at the Cortona Inn during our recent trip. We were close enough to walk to Disneyland, but far enough from the road and the park to avoid the noise that I read about with many of the other off site hotels. Our enjoyed the breakfasts that were included and the people were all very nice to deal with. The pool was small, but nice. Having a fridge and microwave included was a real plus for a family. Great for a group on a budget, and easy access by walking, car or bus. I would come back the next time we visit the area.
Manager Response: Dear Scurb, Thank you for taking the time to give your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased that we met your expectations and that your stay was enjoyable.  As you noted, being set back off Harbor Blvd does lend itself for a very peaceful and quiet stay.    We shall look forward to your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: If you need the air conditioning to work, I wouldn't stay here!
Summary: I would consider Cortona Inn Anaheim more of a Motel rather than a Hotel.  The room furniture is pretty nice but the beds aren't that comfortable and the air conditioning freezes and does not work.    I actually saw ice of the air conditioning unit and the room was pretty warm most of the time we were there.  When I turned it off for a while, the ice thawed and got the carpet all wet.   There is no free internet access, not even in the hotel lobby.   It was nice to have a microwave and a fridge. It was my first time staying there and probably the last.
Manager Response: Dear Johnfcar, Thank you commenting on your stay.  I do apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced.
