The good news is that the issues you described have been remedied and were isolated to your guest room only.  I do want to address your comments about our Internet service.  We currently offer free Wi-Fi internet access in our public areas which include our lobby, pool area and breakfast room.  All guest rooms do have free wired high speed internet access.  That being said, the Wi-Fi signal may reach some of our guest rooms depending on varying conditions, however the signal may be weak and drop off as it is currently only intended to be accessable in the public areas mentioned above.  As part of our on-going efforts to offer value, exceptional amenities and service to our customers, Wi-Fi will be extended to our gues rooms in the near future.  Bedding as I have expressed so many times before is very subjective depending on ones preference for hard or soft.  Funny there is no middle ground with beds.  Its either too hard or too soft.  So, we tend to be in the middle.  Our hotel beds are a popular national brand designed for hotel use and are designed to provide a standard level of comfort without being too hard or too soft.  Thank you again for your comments.

Summary Heading: Ideal for a cheap Disney break!
Summary: Having visited the Anaheim Resort on several occasions over recent years, I have  stayed at some of the bigger (and more expensive!) hotels the resort has to  offer. However, in the summer of 2009, myself and a friend took a trip to The US  to celebrate our graduation. One of our many stops was in Anaheim. We opted for  cheaper accommodation in Anaheim to enable us to stay in a more luxurious hotel  with a central location in Hollywood.  We stayed at The Cortona Inn & Suites for 5 nights (September 16th-21st) having  got a great rate direct from the hotels website with their 'Stay 3 Nights and  Save' promotion. After researching a lot of similar hotels within close  proximity to Disneyland Resort, The Cortona came out on top - for almost  everything! The hotel isn't the closest
Manager Response: Dear simba_one, Thank you so much for your comments...and quite detailed.  I beleive that your comment will be useful to other travelers who can appreciate your candor about the positive aspects of our hotel.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary: I picked the Cortona Inn because i'm a college student and can only afford so much. I went with my boyfriend (hes never been to disneyland), and best friend. We got a room on the 3rd floor in the corner so it was really quiet with the 2 queen beds. luckily we didnt have trouble finding parking and we were there 4 days! no1 messed with the car thank god! when we arrived check in was super fast and u get the key to the safe there 4 free and we did bc we have laptops. we were pleased after such a long day at the park that our room was nice and clean. Our beds were really comfortable thank god bc i need a soft bed to sleep on. what i was impressed on was that the fridge was big compared to other hotels iv stayed at! other hotels also charge a convience fee but not Cortona. This was
Manager Response: Dear amandam78,  Thank you for a wonderful review.  Most pleasing to read that your stay was enjoyabel and that your found most everything to be to your satisfaction.  I cant help but mention in my reply to you that our previous guest comment was not so positive about our bedding, and as you mention, you found our bedding to be quite comfortable.  Therein lies the dilemma for any hotelier when faced with comments about beds.  So, I should say that because you found our beds to be comfortable I will believe that this is more the norm than not.  And its from a guest perspective which would be reassuring to others that may use these forums for research.  I am always pleased to read positive comments about our Continental Breakfast.  I believe, and as you mention, it is truly a great breakfast that is free, complete and can save a family a fair amount of money on a daily basis.  We offer a great selection of items for free each morning, and what we dont offer may be found on the menu's of restaurants that charge anwhere from $4.00 to $12.00.  We always want to keep our breakfast in perspective and remember that it is a free deluxe American style Continental Breakfast.    For those guests that are internet savvy, and if you are reading these comments you are,  I would ask everyone to do two things:  Google search the definition for  "Hotel" and the definition for "Continental Breakfast".  The results that will be returned for those two topics will help define the discussion about breakfast and what determines whether a hotel is a hotel or motel.    Of course, because the Cortona Inn & Suites offers rooms for rent, offers a breakfast, has a swimming pool and meeting room, we area considered a Hotel.  So, again, thanks for your comments and review.  I know it will prove useful to other travelers who depend on honest and useful information such as your review.  Should your plans call for another visit to the Anaheim Resort, please contact us again.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a weekend away at Disney
Summary: We stayed here for two nights to enjoy the delights of disney. As a group of four adults we found the rooms comfortable enough. The rooms had a fridge, and microwave which was handy. The room appeared to be clean and the bathroom spacious. Breakfast was a little bit of a disappointment. Coffee was disgusting, boiled eggs seemed like they had been pickled and bread seemed like it had been left out for days. It was hectic and very busy with not enough space.   We didn't spend much time in the room as we were at Disney. It's about a 10minute walk to the gates, so perfect distance.....  For friends going to Disney I would recommend for a couple of nights. Any longer, maybe book into a better hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Samiantha, Thank you for your review. Pleased to know you were satisfied with the room accommodations and not so satisfied to hear of your experience with our breakfast.   Honeslty, with the number of people we serve on a daily basis, it would be hard to find a slice of bread that was retained for more than a day.  Coffee service is a measured automated system and is designed to dispense a consistantly good quality coffee with each cup.  Boiled eggs that are not consumed by expiration date are thrown away.  I would like to invite you to consider us again on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort and allow us the opportunity to meet your satisfaction.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Definitely needs to buck up - no more excuses pls
Summary: We booked Corotona after reading the reviews on this forum. It sounded like the Inn gave point by point rebuttals to any 'bad' reviews and there were some good ones. So we took a chance given that they had a "Suite" that could hold our party of 6.   So the real deal...   It is not a hotel. At best, a motel. I'm even bordering on family dorm. the only part of the pictures in the website that was "real" was the check-in lobby in the middle of the hotel. The room block was old, doors were thin and everybody could look into your room if you forget to draw your curtains.   We got an "executive suite" - nothing excutive about the room (not calling it a suite). We opened the door and i wanted to walk out. The carpets were filthy! It was the only place that i didn't want to remove my

Check in was easy.  My coffee maker didn't work, called front desk all they offered was to go downstairs and have some at the Lobby. Due to it being after hours. Instead went to my other room i booked, only to find a cockroach laying an egg in the water reservoir of the coffee maker. Called front desk to notify, only to be brushed off and instructed to go downstairs.  Lastly called for extra sheets only to be told I have to walk across the inn to get them myself.(again mind you it being after business hours) P.S.    Gift shop in the Cortona Inn sells merchandise with the Disney Brand which of course are not registered trademarks

We stayed here for 8 nights during our honeymoon and our stay was absolutely excellent.The check in was quick and took 5mins,also being late at night the counter staff were able to tell us of places still open to get something to eat.We had a corner suite and the room was very spacious,not 5 star in terms of the place,but its great value for money and the location is only 1klm from Disneyland.The counter staff were also able to organise day trips and the manager even took us to Denny's,which was fantastic service.
Manager Response: Dear gchappycouple, Thanks for your review.  Nice to know that your visit to Anaheim and your stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites was satisfactory.  Pleased to know also that our staff delivered excellent customer service.  Please come back and see us again soon!

Summary: From the pictures we imagined actually a hotel - but Cortona is more like a motel. Pros is that it is near Disneyland, and that the busroute leaves near the hotel (3 mins walk). You can't walk to Disneyland, - you'll be too wornout to enjoy the park. We bought at 3 days pass at the reception. Bad things are that the doors are very thin - so you'll hear everything going on when other guests come and go. Breakfast was OK - but the room is to small for the amount of guests, so we had to wait a bit every morning to sit down to eat.
Manager Response: Dear Perkja, Thank you for your review.    Since your comment makes mention of motel versus hotel, I have referenced a definition of HOTEL that can be found online:  HOTEL - A hotel is an establishment that provides paid lodging, usually on a short-term basis. Hotels often provide a number of additional guest services such as a restaurant, a swimming pool or childcare. Some hotels have conference services and meeting rooms and encourage groups to hold conventions and meetings at their location.  Interestingly enough, many of todays current terms describing hotels and motels date back many years and may be of French origins.  In any event, I have seen this comment in the past and I thought I would take a new approach to help solve the question on what exactly a hotel and/or motel truly is.    So, that being said, Cortona Inn & Suites, with a 3 Diamond AAA rating, pool and meeting room, can appropriatly be referred to as a hotel, having met the criteria as defined above.  Now with respect to the walk to Disneyland, I wish I could compare it to the Walt Disney World,  Florida, where one must use buses or cars to travel great distances between hotel and the different parks and may take days to complete a thorough visit.  But I wont.  I will only say that when measured by the physical size of a city block, we are two blocks away from the Disneyland Resort parks.  Depending on how fast one walks, or how fast a family walks, it can take from 10-20 minutes but that also counts the time wating for the traffic signals to ensure safe crossing at the intersections.  Using the ART shuttle will greatly reduce the walk to the Disneyland Resort, and may take about the amount of time to arrive at the park.  Granted, for the return to the hotel late at night, and after a busy day of fun and walking, a shuttle is nice to ride even if your hotel is just across the street (for which there are but only a handful).  So, keeping the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim , California in perspective, the Cortona Inn & Suites is extremely close to the Disneyland Resort parks and just minutes away.    I dont know exactly what is meant about thin doors, as the doors used at the Cortona Inn & Suites are doors typical of any other hotel.  Metal doors are used for strength and security and durability and are insulated to reduce the pentration of noise into guest rooms.    As for our breakfast room, it is capable of accommodating about 40 people seated at one time.  The breakfast room at Cortona Inn & Suites is actually, by comparison, much larger than the rooms used by many of our competitors.  I have mentioned this before in previous comments about our breakfast room, but we serve breakfast from 630AM to 930AM each morning to allow enough time for everyone to enjoy a complimentary breakfast.  We would like to think that all guests would be considerate of others so that everyone can be accommodated in a timely manner.  Thanks again for your review and comments and trust that we will see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Don't Let the Bed Bugs Bite
Summary: 1. Checked in. Notified that on Wednesday the power would be out for 6 hours.  No electricity whatsoever.  All the food in our fridge...no ability to go in and use the room with electricity for those hours and most importantly, NOT DISCLOSED BEFORE I BOOKED!!!!!  2. The sheets were not clean.  I am pretty sure I saw boogers on the sheets. Nasty!  3. There was a silverfish in the bed.  4. Hotel pictures did not describe the exterior well.  5. Hotel parking is limited. You cannot view the car from the room.  6. Hotel staff were not very helpful. When complained they never acknowledged it. They simply listened.  7. Breakfast: Poor quality foods. Enriched bread products only. Some people got eggs, not everyone did. They ran out quickly. All food is served on styrofoam plates. You
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Honestly, somewhat mispresenting our Inn and that is simply not very fair.  Your headline of Dont Let the Bed Bugs bite can be miscontrued to imply something that just is not the case here.  You mentioned you saw one Silverfish.    2.  The City of Anaheim notified us of the shut off of electricity to perfom repairs to natural gas lines.  Electricity to several hotels and other business in our sector was turne off as a prevenative measure to avoid a more serious event should an electrical spark ignite gas under pressure.  We posted signs all throughout the hotel of this six hour shut off in every public area, elevator, breakfast room as well as voice mail messages on each occupied guest room phone.  When the city imposes something of this nature on a business, it is always difficult but the work must be completed and all we ask is for understanding.  You may want to contact the City of Anaheim to express your discontent with the city and let them know of the negative effects it may have caused you.  3.  Silverfish in bed.  At least in California, at times some of natures creatures may find themselve inside our homes, cars, boats, even hotels and restaurants.  Every reputable business will employ a pest control program to elimiate or greatly reduce the incidences of unwanted pests in or around a business.  Although highly effective, it may not always be 100% in any situation.  4.  Hotel exterior pictures of the Cortona Inn & Suites are similar to pictures found of other hotels.  Unless one likes to study the paint and stucco, we tend to focus on the attributes of the hotel that guests may find pleasing...pool pictures, room pictures, breakfast, gift shop,  lobby, etc.  The focus is on interior pictures which can allow a guest to view the rooms that they would be staying in, with different pictures of the different room types.   5.  Hotel parking is limited to registered guests of the hotel only.  Because of our great proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center as you noted, we must restrict parking to guests only to ensure that each guest has parking for their vehicle.  Parking permits are issued and those vehicles not displaying proper credentials may be towed at owners expense.  This is fully disclosed to guests at time of registration.  As for the ability to view your vehicle from your guest room is unavoidable.  I am thinking about hotels such as the Anaheim Marriott, Anaheim Hilton, Clarion, Courtyard, Sheraton, Travelodge, Candy Cane Inn and countless others that having parking that may not be visible from every guest room.  My point is, is that we offer free parking...other hotels may charge for parking.  Viewing a parked vehicle from a parking garage or parking lot may not always be possible.  6.  Hotel staff not very helpful... Could be a matter of opinion and/or the perception based on the discussion.  Our staff is always trying to do their best to ensure that each guest is comfortable and has an enjoyable stay.  There may be challenges to a clerk that are presented once in a while, but part of good training is that the clerk listen to the guest so that they can then take the appropriate measures to rectify whatever the situation.  Breakfast.  The food served is restaurant quality purchased from the nations largest purveyor food products for restaurants, insitutions and other uses.  Breakfast hours are from 630am to 930am.  The breakfast room also serves as a meeting room available from 12noon.  In order to ensure that the meeting room is ready for occupancy, the breakfast service is discontinued timely each morning at 930am.  Although guests may continue to remain and enjoy their breakfast, food items are removed from the serving area as part of the cleaning process.    Hotel is not worth normal price of $229...our prices are monitored regularly to ensure that we offer the most competative pricing in our area.  Not sure if that is actually the price you paid, and if you did it would be for a suite.  Keep in mind that we do not charge for parking, breakfast, internet or local phone calls.  9.  Hotels.com rewards.  I cant comment on this because it has nothiing to do with the Cortona Inn or the decisions made to secure your accommodations.  10.  Wasted time for ARTS... if you were not satisfied with the ARTS service I would suggest you direct your comments to them as they provide shuttle service for most hotels in the Anaheim Resort.  Room smelled...not sure what you are referring to unless it is the newness of the fabrics that were part of our most recent room renovation.    12  Breakfast stinks...keep in mind it is a Continental Breakfast that we serve that we have kicked up a few notches...and it is complimentary.  Hard boiled eggs are served some days while scrambled eggs are served other days.  We vary the menu to keep it different and still provide food items that are satisfying.  On a personal note, never select a hotel because they serve hard boiled eggs.  Thanks and I hope that I have provided some clarification and satisfactory response to your comments.

Summary: This Hotel is a 2 star rating at best. Their # 1 problem is the Beds. These were most unconfortable in our 2 queen room. I feel If I have to go all day to an amusement park, I NEED SLEEP !! Well we didn't get any here. We stayed 2 nights & I will not repeat. As for other ammenities for this FAIR review, the rooms were very clean, fridge, coffee maker,microwave were all in good condition & working fine. TV was fine as well. Lastly, I can't say the staff was over the top except for one tall gentlemen with glasses at the front desk (he was nice). Continental Breakfast was minimal. if you dont mind less choices for breakfast. For the &89 I spent a night, I would much rather spend more & have a great nights sleep for my active Vacation.
Manager Response: Dear lablvr, Thank you for your review.  And thanks for sharing your comments about the beds.  This is one area for any hotel that is the most difficult.  How do you find a happy medium for those guests that pefer a hard bed and those that prefer a soft bed.  Well, you try to have beds made that are not too hard and not too soft.  And quite frankly, sometimes we get good comments and sometimes we dont.    As for your comments about our clean rooms and amenities, we do place an emphasis on providing clean rooms and value for your dollar.  For example, our refrigerators are not tiny...they are decent size and can accommodate quite a bit.  Our Deluxe Continental Breakfast, as described by AAA, includes the following: - choice of cold cereal - Oatmeal - Danish - Waffles or pancakes - Donuts - Toast (white and wheat) - Eggs (varies between hard boiled and scrambled) - Biscuits and Gravy - Fresh Fruit (Apples, Oranges, Bananas) - Milk - Orange and Apple Juice - Coffee (regular and decaf) / Tea  Breakfast is served from 630am to 930am.  Food service is discontined at 930am although the seating area remains open for those to continue enjoying their breakast.  If at 930 am you should arrive and find less than the items listed above, it is because the service has ended and the cleanup process has begun.  It does not necessarly mean that we dont offer a great selection of breakfast items.  However, should you arrive prior to 930am and find a depleted supply of one of the items listed above, simply ask the server who would gladly replensih the supply.  Thanks again for your comments.

Summary: From the reviews I read on this site before we went, I wasn't expecting the rooms to be as clean as they were or the breakfasts to be that great, but I was pleased with the accomodation once we arrived.    The breakfast was fairly good, especially when considering it's included/free.  There were fruit (apples, oranges, sometimes bananas), waffle makers, porridge, cereal, and eggs.  I would recommened arriving early since the breakfast area is heavily used.  It's hard to find a seat if you go for a later breakfast. Also, the coffee provided in your room was better than what was served in the breakfast area.  We stayed in a room with two queen beds.  The room was clean and the comforter was big and soft.  We were staying right by the stairs, so it was a bit noisy.  Also, as

Summary Heading: Good value near Disney & Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: If you're not too picky, the Cortona Inn & Suites is a pretty good place to stay and a great value if you're going to Disneyland or a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. It's an 8 minute walk from your room to the doors of the Anaheim Convention Center and about a 22 minute walk from the Disneyland entrance plaza. I've stayed here a few times with and without my family and it's fairly comfy. Most rooms have 2 queen beds and they've upgraded the linens with those plush bedcoverings like you get at Sheratons, Hiltons or Doubletrees, with lots of pillows. Rooms have a minifridge & microwave, coffeemaker,safe. Free hardwired internet in the rooms and free wifi iin the lobby. Free parking. They have daily breakfast with fresh made waffles, english muffins, eggs(hardboiled or
Manager Response: Dear Fongerini, Thank you for your very nice review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased that you found our hotel to your liking and that our services and amenities were equally pleasing.  We do offer a great product and like to emphasize the value for your dollar.  Amenities such as free Deluxe Continental Breakfast, free parking and now free High Speed Internet Access in guest rooms as well as free Wi-Fi in our public access areas.  Also pleased that you took notice of our wonderful new room decor with new bedding, carpeting, drapery and accent wall covering.  We did splurge a bit on the duvet for the bed as well as upgrade the sheets to a more luxurous higher thread count.  The addition of more pillows on the bed is a nice touch also.  And as you mentioned, it is quite similar to bedding found at full service hotels that usually charge more than we do.  So, thanks for the nice comments about our beds and glad you enjoyed them.  We do monitor rates on a regular basis so we can ensure that we remain competative in our market.  There are many hotels in Anaheim to select from but we know we offer so much more that is included in our rate.  Free parking, free continental breakfast, free internet access, free local phone calls, walking distance to the park, fridge and microwave in the room, free coffee in rooms...it all adds up to make a difference when shopping for hotels.   Thanks again for your review.

Summary Heading: Oustanding value if attending conference at Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Aanheim Convention center. The rooms were quiet, comfortable and clean. It is not a 5 star hotel, but it is less than half the price of the big hotels right next to the convention center.   The bad is that the towels are not very plush, the free continental breakfast is unispired and the rooms do not have free internet access (although it is available for free in the lobby).  I will try and stay here everytime I attend a meeting at the convention center. It is also very close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Remickd, Thanks for your review.  Please to know that your stay was enjoyable.  And you are right...we are extremely close the Anaheim Convention Center.  We host many guests that attend the differnt conventions and conferences at the Convention Center and most find our location to be quite handy.   And since your stay, we no longer charge for in-room internet access.  It is now a free amenity as well as our Wi-Fi internet.  As for towels, I will have our housekeeping supervisor look into the plushness factor to see what can be done about that.  We will also look into ensuring that our breakfast is always inspiring.  Thanks again for your review and please let us know if we can be of service again on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: Served the purpose- was an OK place
Summary: I reserved the large 2 room suite for 4 nights on line. We arrived in the evening, met staff that was efficient and accomodating. Our room and Disneyland tickets were ready. The room was large- 2 queens in bedroom and couch in other room with refrige, microwave, coffee maker. The bathroom was very clean. Towels could have been newer, larger and softer. The decor and carpet in the room was new and very tasteful- no cheesy nylon bedspread, but a nice fluffy ones. Tons of pillows if you like that. BE AWARE : the hotel is 1 MILE from Disney entrance- not 2 blocks as stated on line, BUT the bus stops just near the hotel and even if hotel was closer your feet will hurt so much after a day a D-land you will want to take the bus anyway. The hotel sells bus passes- so no need to find a

We had reserved a Kids Suite and queen room; upon arrival we were informed that the Kids  Suite was not available so we were upgraded to a Family Suite.  It was HUGE.  One room had bunk beds (which the boys loved) and 2 queens; the adjoining room had 2 queens.  My daughter-in-law stayed with the boys and I had the adjoining room.  The beds were very comfortable.  The room had a microwave which came in handy.  Each room had a tv.  The hotel sits off the street so it is quiet after 10:00 when kids get out of the pool.  Because of the size of the room, there was plenty of air circulation so we didn't have to use the air conditioner.    The breakfast is o.k. but don't expect a good cup of coffee.    The hotel is 3 blocks from Disneyland.  We finally discovered we could get a bus

When we arrived after a 10hr drive it was nice to settle into a clean room! I tend to turn into a bit of a germaphobe when staying in hotel rooms so I was happy to find how clean it was. My husband and I were to stay on the couch bed (which was not comfortable at all for the 2 of us. Would be fine for just one though). When we pulled it out it already had sheets on it. They looked clean but again the germaphobe took over so I went to the front desk to ask for new ones. The man at the desk looked suprised and worried that I had found something wrong so I guess this doesnt happen very often. He told me that the only  housekeeping was on break for 1/2 hour so he would bring some over then. Which he did. The complimentary breakfast looked a little sparse. We never actually got to

Summary Heading: Close to the Convention Center; Disneyland, not so much
Summary: This place is a stone throw away from the Anaheim Convention Center, NOT the Disneyland Resort.   The rates I found for this place online were too hard to pass up. The walk to the Anaheim Convention Center takes about five minutes but I did jump over a few fences to make my route more direct (so probably about a 10 minute walk).  The front desk staff is very friendly and willing to help out in any way. The main building has a Spanish Revival look on the cheap. The front desk, dining room (for the complimentary breakfast), and pool access are in this building.  I requested a non-smoking room but the first room we checked into definitely smelled like someone was smoking in there. So make sure to check your room before you unpack.  The rooms are pretty basic, nothing to write home
Manager Response: Dear Criticme23, Thank you for your review.  Just to make sure that its clear, we are a 100% non smoking hotel whcih means that guests are made aware that smoking is not permitted in guest rooms.  We trust that signage and acknowledgement of non smoking policy upon check-in/registration is respected and adhered to.  Our location in the Anaheim Resort is convenient to the Disneyland Resort parks and the Anaheim Convention Center.  There are many other hotels in Anaheim and neighboring cities that promote proximity to the Disneyland Resort however the Cortona Inn & Suites is actually located withing the Anaheim Resort zone and about two blocks from Disneyland Resort parks.  An easy walk to the Convention Center is about a 6-8 minute walk.   Our Deluxe and Complimentary Continental Breakfast is reviewed quite frequently to ensure that our guests are served items that are popular with most families.  For example, hot items that we serve include:  make your own waffles, biscuts and gravy, scrambled eggs, toast, oatmeal.  In addition, we also offer donuts, danish, fresh frut, cold cereal choices, milk, tea, orange juice, apple juice and coffee.  Hard boiled eggs are served periodically or when egg items are rotated to ensure variety.  We do appreciate guest comments and like to respond to make sure that useful information is supplied in our response.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary Heading: BEWARE OF BOOKING IN ADVANCE ,YOU WILL BE CHARGED AND THEY WON'T HAVE A ROOM FOR YOU
Summary: Beware of booking in advance You will be charged in adavance and they will not have a room for you when you arrive. We booked several nights . Our travel was delayed by a death in the family. Cortona Inn & Suites  was emailed  three days before arrival of our delay. We arrive after driving 12+ hours ( all day) and there personnel were very confused . We showed them all our emails and confirmation .  They simply had no room for us . We had already paid and they refused to refund anything.  This hotel is a scam and legal action is pending.
Manager Response: Dear famfunUsa, First let me reassure you that we are not operating a scam.  What I can tell you is that we do offer Non-Refundable rate offers for those travelers that have definate plans to travel and understand that once the reseration has been booked and paid for, there will not be any refunds. This information is provided up front and for one to decide.  We have other rate offers that have a more traditional 48 hour cancel policy that does not require prepayment.  We only make the more discounted offer available for those who want to save more but understand the risk for failing to arrive as reserved.  Our check-in time is 3PM.  Guests arriving earlier than 3PM may not check into a room that has not been vacated by the previous guest nor cleaned by our housekeeping staff.  Of course, if a clean and vacant room or the room type reserved is availble prior to 3PM, we most always accommodate our guests with an early check in. I invite you to contact our General Manager to discuss your unique situation by calling 714-971-5000. Thanks again for your review.

Summary Heading: Good price, not the best staff.
Summary: In my 20s and went with friends to Disneyland. About a half mile away, not bad walking distance.  Breakfast ends at 9, which is early if you are staying at park until 12 am.  Wifi is not free and only available in the lobby.  Staff was un informative, but the rooms were decent for the price.  Fridge, small coffee pot and microwave.  Shower pressure however was non existant.  Great for the price, but nothing spectaular.  Stayed on the 3rd floor and could hear people in their rooms, especially when children were noisy.
Manager Response: Dear Shortytinabel, Thanks for your review of our hotel.  From the comments you include, it sounds like we need to emphasize to all our guests the hours of our complimentary Continental Breakfast.    Breakfast is served from 6:30am to 9:30am every day.  Guests that arrive after 9:30 may find fewer food items remaining as the breakfast staff is tasked with closing down breakfast service and preparing room for meeting or other functions that begin at 12:00pm.    Our Internet service is included in the Resort Fee.  Currently, Wi-Fi is only intended for use in our lobby, pool area and breakfast room.  The Wi-Fi signal may be seen in guest rooms, however we cannot guarantee the service to be adequate since at this time it is only intended for use in the areas mentioned above.  In-Room High Speed Internet Access is hard wired in guest rooms and again is included in the Resort Fee.  If this information was not shared with you, please accept our apologies.  We will have refresher staff training to ensure that all guests are aware of the services and amenities we offer.  Shower pressure should be adequate to bathe comfortably in all guest rooms.  The State of California does mandate for hotels and commercial businesses the use of flow restrictors in all showers, and sink faucets to conserve water.  Guests arriving from other areas of the nation or international locations that do not practice water conservation may find this to be different from what they are accustomed to.    Thanks again for your review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.

Summary: Rented 2 adjoining rooms , each with 2 queen beds, on a Monday and Tuesday for 6 adults and 2 children (ages 5 and 3).  Rooms were very clean, parking was easy, and every employee encountered was pleasant.  Clean showers with good water pressure (a plus in my book) and decent beds made our stay enjoyable.  A microwave and refrigerator in each room made snacks very convenient.  Free wireless internet would have been nice.  Instead you have the option to pay approximately $10.00 per day for access.  Otherwise, we enjoyed it very much.
Manager Response: Dear mike67vw, Thank you for your review.  Sounds like you had a very enjoyable visit to the Anaheim and Disneyland Resort's.  Very sorry to hear that you were not informed of our Internet Service and fees (or no fees).  As part of our on-going effort to continue to offer more value for your dollar, we now include the Internet service (wireless and hard wired) in our Resort Fee as well as unlimted local phone calls.    We do thank you for your informative review of the Cortona Inn & Suites and trust that we may have the opportunity to serve you again soon.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive, nice and close to Disneyland
Summary: This is a place to stay when you need to keep the budget low, want good value for your money and stay at a place that cares about what the guests think. They don't have it all for nothing, but there is all the basics you need for a good trip.  Breakfast will exceed your expectations for the price. The only thing that would make it better is for a little meat, but the self-help waffles, scrambled eggs, toast, donuts, 4 cereals plus hot cereal, juices, milk, coffee there is not much more you could want. The person who said it was a joke must have been blind; who want's cold hard boiled eggs when scrambled is available?

I spent many hourse reading reviews for various Anaheim hotels.  I wanted something with either a kitchenette so we could do some cooking or a good continental breakfast so it would cut some costs.  I had it narrowed down but couldn't decide.  Then I found this sale on the Cortona Inn for $66 Cdn a night.  I checked into the reviews and it came highly recommended.  The room was regular well over $100 per night.  I was hoping when we got there it would be nice.  It met my expectations and more.  Nice comfortable room especially with 4 people.  The pool was a nice size and very warm.  The breakfast exceded my expections for a continental breakfast.  I would definitely recommend this hotel especially if you get it for the price we paid.
Manager Response: Dear MichelleM7, Thank you for your kind review.  Its pleasing to know that you were satisfied with the Cortona Inn &  Suites.  We to work hard to ensure that everyone can have an enjoyable stay and at the same time find great value for their dollar.  We do offer many value added features such as free parking, free continental breakfast and now free internet access, all of which you found to be quite nice as well. Thanks again for your kind review.  Perhaps we will see you again soon on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort!

Summary Heading: NICE ROOMS AND POOL BUT BREAKFAST WAS A JOKE
Summary: rooms were very very clean and nice ..i liked the micrwave and fridge in room and free parking ..it is a little far walk to the park but not 2 bad ...the breakfast did not have any hard boiled eggs and the biscuits and gravy were a JOKE ..everything else was ok ...the pool and hot tub were clean and nice ...overall good place but probably wont go there again UNLESS they fix the breakfast menu and the breakfast area was to small  !!! i will look for a place with a better breakfast like real eggs and real biscuits and gravy !!!
Manager Response: Dear whatever2010, Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We area pleased to know that you were satisifed with your accommodations and the services we provide.  With respect to breakfast, we welcome comments and suggestions especially during your stay,  We monitor guest input on a routine basis and have found that hard boiled eggs placed in the microwave oven have a tendancy to exlode on a regular basis so we have changed to scrambled eggs.  Biscuits and gravy seem to be quite popular with the majority of our guests so if you would like to clarify your thoughts with us that would be appreciated. The Cortona Inn & Suites takes pride in serving a deluxe Continental Breakfast that is complimentary each morning from 630am to 930am.  Our breakfast room has a capacity of 55 seated guests at one time.  Just as with many popular restaurants, we are not immune to crowds and do our best to accmmodate everyone.  A great tip is that the early hours are not as busy as the later hours.  We currently serve:  Biscuits and Gravy, Scrambled Eggs, Make your own waffels, Donuts, Toast, cold cereal choices, oatmeal, danish, fresh fruit, milk, orange juice, apple juice, coffee and tea.  For those that prefer a tradtional breakst, we are happy to offer suggestions for restaurants in the area offering breakfast, lunch and dinner. Thanks again and perhaps we will see you in Anaheim again soon.

Summary Heading: Overall Nice Hotel, But There Are Some Considerations
Summary: In general, Id say it was a good stay and fit our needs with a very fair rate  The good - its proximity to Disneyland, continental breakfast, friendly staff, pool and hottub, fridge and microwave in room  The considerations - we were on the ground floor and starting at around 6:30 am, we had to listen to every inconsiderate fool staying at  the hotel loudly talk and yell up and down the walkway. Also the walls are thin and we also listened to the people above us running around also. There is nothing the hotel can really do about this but just be aware. Recommendation - stay on the top floor. There is an elevator.    I didnt like the fact that there is a charge to use  the computer in the lobby and if you want to use the landline in the room, there is a charge ($10 a day). There
Manager Response: Dear ogold72, Thank your for your review.  We are pleased that overall your stay was enjoyable.  As for your comments about noise, I am in agreement with you and appreciate it when a guest can express their comments to other guests about noise and how a little bit of noise abatement practices would really help.    As for your comments about Fox News, the Cortona Inn & Suites does not express political views in any form.  Fox News is promoted as a fair and balanced news organization and can be found on the in-room television channel line-up for viewing in guest rooms as can other nationaly recognized news programs.  As for the internet issue you also mention, please know that we do not filter nor prevent any site from being accessed and that the Internet service we offer is maintained by a qualified and reputable  vendor of in-room internet access.  It is not our intention or purpose to filter internet content nor do we have any control over any site that a guest may visit or wish to view.   Thanks again for your review and we look forward to the opportunity of seeing you again soon.

Summary: We went to Disneyland and didn't book a hotel beforehand. I had seen this one online and was surprised to find it so close to Disney but maybe not close enough to walk with little ones.  We were given a junior suite which had 2 queen beds & bunk beds, plus a trundle under the bottom bunk. 5 beds is a plus!We were 2 adults, 1 teen and 3 small children. We fit perfectly and it was very clean! The restroom was small but we were only there for 1 night so it really didn't matter to us. The only down side was that the first key card didn't work so I had to go back to the desk for another but the lady walked back with me to make sure it worked. Breakfast was typical but my kids are easily please with a pastry & juice.
Manager Response: Dear weluvtrvln, Thank you for your nice comments and review.  And thank you for letting TripAdvisor know that you found the Cortona Inn & Suites to be accommodating and enjoyable.  Next time you visit us, be sure to take advantage of the other wonderful breakfast favortires that we serve with our Continental Breakfast.   See you soon!

Summary Heading: Fabulous stay at the Cortona Inn
Summary: We stayed December 29- January 5  Location: Although it is not one of the closest hotels to Disneyland it has an Anaheim Resort Transit stop just outside and is definately walkable if you choose (we were happy to buy an ART pass!)  We really liked how this hotel was set down back off the road so nice and quiet (although the Disneyland Resort Express bus dropped us off at the road with our luggage which was a bit unexpected, it went to the door of other hotels - not sure if there is room for large buses inside the grounds?)  Hotel amenities/services: We thought the lobby was very nice and loved the bronze mickey statue!  ATM and internet in lobby, plus a useful giftshop that stocks drinks and some essentials as well.  Lots of brochures and info in lobby. We were thrilled with the
Manager Response: Dear omalleycat_9, Thank you for such a wonderful and detailed review of your stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Your review is certain to help future travelers decide on where to find great value for their dollar, clean, comfortable and inviting accommodations and excellent customer service.  We have made some wonderful changes in the past few months most important our room remodel in Sept., 09.  We also monitor breakfast comments so we can make adjustments to selections so that most everyone can enjoy a nice, free, continental breaktst.  We are pleased to know you were quite satisfied with our breakfast service and selection.  Thanks again and perhaps we will have the opportunity of seeing you on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland!  Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful!
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Cortona Anaheim Inn.  We felt that the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly in assisting our family for our one night stay.  Specifically, Michelle and Judy were especially helpful when we checked in on Sunday January 11.  They took the time to get us situated in a nice room, gave us directions to Disneyland, and recommended some places to eat in the area.  Being our first time to Disneyland with two small children, and arriving late in the evening after a long four hour drive through LA rush hour traffic, it was nice to have such a nice and helpful reception at upon arrival.  Also, Grant and Taylor were very helpful in the morning (not to leave anyone out here...).  We certainly will recommend this Inn to others, and shall return the next

Summary Heading: Couldn't ask for a better stay
Summary: We stayed for 7 nights in December and based all our Los Angeles sightseeing from there. We could not have chosen better, location excellent with Disneyland walking distance, restaurants a short walk or drive, easy access to freeways and easy parking in front of the room. Breakfast was okay although our Aussie tastes are a little different. The reception service and room cleaning could not be faulted so the stay was just what we required, booked on the internet site without any knowledge of the motel, Trip advisor reviews were our only information. thanks for starting our holiday off on a good note. we have already recomended.
Manager Response: Dear qldr54, Thank you very much for your review.  We are pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable and to your satisfaction.  And thank you for your recommendations as well!!  Happy New Year!

Summary: We stayed at the Cortona for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland, it was a great hotel, clean, very friendly employees, fantastic breakfast especially the waffles you make yourself, would love to have the recipe!!!  We are looking forward to staying again next year if we can get the same great rate.  We recommend Cortona to anyone visiting Southern Calif.

Summary Heading: Rude young man front desk.Stinky room with stains.not room we booked
Summary: We booked through bookit.com who will gladly take your money but not stand up for you when there is a problem. We made the mistake of booking bookits Mystery room. The price was decent so we took a chance....Big Mistake...we booked a kingsize bed...when we arrived we were greated by a young male desk clerk who was rude and made us feel and that we were mistaken....told us there were no kingsize bed rooms available. He never said please or thank you I thought wow how did this young rude man become Cortona's front desk employee welcoming new guests to there hotel. Anyways the room had stains on the chair and on the floor and stunk a bit although we called to change the room there was nothing he could do for us....Do not Book a mystery room through Bookit. you are taking a huge
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and comments.  We are sorry that you were not satisfied with the accommodations you selected on the website you visited.  Our staff did make attempts to accommodate you as best as possible but were unsuccessful at meeting your requests.  Although the room you occupied was inspected subsequent to your previous contact with the Online Travel Agency, we did not find the room to be as described.  However, our renovation of all guest rooms was completed the end of September 2009. Thanks again

Summary: We stayed here for the first time on our recent trip to Disneyland.  We were very happy with our stay.  Rooms were very clean.  The front desk clerks were friendly and the free daily breakfast was wonderful.   The excellent rate was a bonus!  We will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Clean hotel, close to Disney if you don't mind the walk
Summary: Only was in Disney for a day (22 November). Rooms were clean. Staff was friendly. Close to Disney if you don't mind the walk (about 1/2 a mile). Only problem that we had (in both rooms)  was there was no water pressure and I advised the staff and they said "They are working on it". To make a long story short I'm glad we left that day so I could get clean since we never got any pressure that morning.  I'm assuming this was a flukey thing. but otherwise the hotel was nice.

Summary Heading: Good enough, if you aren't picky
Summary: This hotel has it's pros and cons. The cons are mostly small, and while they aren't awful, they do reduce your enthusiasm. For instance, there are no towel racks in the bathroom--  the handicapped railing next to the toilet doubles as where the hotel hangs your hand towels. The hotel soap smells like incense (which gets kind of gross quick). Also, while there's a breakfast, it's also a little gross if you're staying for any longer than a day. Aside from the stack of boiled eggs and waffles, everything else tastes like it was bought at a gas station. In addition, the internet connection is only in the lobby area, which is in a totally separate building from your room. It's free, but when you boot up, it also pops up a screen describing "charges" that never get assessed. Finally,

We stayed here for a trip to Disneyland.  The hotel staff was very nice.  The location was great I found it a long but easy walk to Disneyland.  The room was large and clean.   Breakfast consists of pastries, fruit, Coffee, Cereal, Milk, hard boiled eggs, juice, toast, gravy    and they have a waffle iron for you guessed it waffles.    My only problem was the pull out bed in the couch was bent in an uncomfortable lump.   But overall I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear mmarrs, Thank you for your review.  I am pleased to read that your stay was enjoyable.  We continue to gain a reputation in Anaheim as one of the few hotels that offer a great deluxe Continental that has a variety of breakfast favorites.  Its especially helpfull to those that are planning their vacation and looking for ways to economize as much as possible.  When you get ready to plan your next visit, be sure to call us and mention that you are a valued previous customer.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE WILL STAY HERE AGAIN
Summary: I started planning my trip months in advance.. This hotel offers internet rates where you can prepay and get an amazing discount.. I was not able to take advantage of this offer but my aunt and family were..  So when i went to book.. the rate was slightly higher but thats ok.. I booked a single KING deluxe room.. . I had payment questions and talked with ALMA at the hotel.. she is amazing.. not only did she help me get payment set up so that I was able to prepay all my charges. She was pleasant and helpful every time i had a request she went out of her way to help me. I arrived at the hotel at 11am and Alma offered to keep my bags till I got back that night, When I got back to the hotel, my room      was clean and nice.. bed was comfortable and tons of pillows I had 5 bed
Manager Response: Dear chrisinseattle, Thanks so much for your very detailed review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  I am pleased to know that your stay was enjoyable.  Its also nice to read that you took advantage of our wonderful Continental Breakfast and found our new remodeled rooms to your liking.  I will be sure to pass on your kind comments to Alma.  Thank you so much for recognizing her as she is one of our key employees who beleives in delivering excellent customer service.  When you start to plan your next visit, please be sure to give us a call.  And mention that you are one of our previous guests.  Thanks again!

Summary: Over all we were very happy with the Cortona, we were treated very well by the staff, our room was always clean. The pool was also clean, our kids would have lived in it if we had let them. We were very happy staying there, and not only will we recomment it, we will be Going back.  Cons: the only cons I can think of is that the breakfast room is really small and it is common to not get a table, people were standing around eating. The only solution to this problem would be to close the gift shop and open up that wall .I don't even know if this is possible.  Also, No free wifi? even the cheapest of cheapest of motels give you free wifi. Yes it is free in the lobby, but after a long day at Disneyland, do you really want to go to the lobby to get done what you need done? The

Summary Heading: Fantastic.........no other words to describe it
Summary: Me and my partner planned a three week holiday in the USA from Australia and had to choose between the Cortona Inn & Suites & the Holiday Inn on South Manchester Ave. After reading the reviews on this website, we decided to go with Cortona as their reviews were much the same as the Holiday Inn, but Cortona was closer to Disneyland. All i can say, about my ten day stay here, is FABULOUS!! Everything was fantastic, they let us check in early, after a 12 hour flight that was much appreciated, they changed our room when i realised our window opened onto a brick wall letting no natural light in, and changed me again three days later when the internet wasn't working in our room!! The breakfast was fine, it is Continental but does that job! The room was well equipped with bar fridge,

Summary Heading: Wish we could have spent our whole trip at this one hotel.
Summary: I traveled with my 2 younger children, my parents, my sister, her husband, and their 3 children; That 10 of us!  My parents and I shared a kids suite which was just perfect for us.  There was a King size bed in the front room and the back room with a seperate closet and TV had a pull out full size sofa bed and bunk beds.  My parents stayed in the front room and the kids and I had our privacy in the back room.  We requested my sister be close to us and we were able to be on the same floor, just a few doors down. The staff was so nice from the minute we got there and made checking in comfortable and easy. The cleaning staff were very friendly and accomadated us with our extra towel request.  And that was all we had to ask for.  The breakfast was pretty sufficient for being the
Manager Response: Dear Mel2B, Thank you so much for your guest review of our hotel.  I am pleased to know that you found our hotel to be to your satisfaction.  Your experience and comments are shared by hundreds of others that stay every week.  Its most rewarding to read comments such as your and to share them with our entire staff, as each one of them works hard to ensure that guests are greeted warmly upon arrival, that rooms are cleaned promptly and thouroughly and that our amenities are pleasing and appreciated.  We just finished a very nice refreshening of our rooms, continue to offer a very nice deluxe Continental Breakfast each morning and offer free guest parking as well.  Cortona Inn & Suites is very committed to offering guests value for their dollar without compromise. Again, thanks for your review and for staying with Cortona Inn & Suites.

Summary: I have stayed at just about every Hotel/ Motel around Disneyland and decided to stay at the Cortona Inn for the first time. We arrive at the hotel mid afternoon after calling the hotel earlier that morning to inform them of our early arrival, I remember speaking to a cheerful lady who kept calling me "darling and sweetie" and inform me it was okay to check in early. As we arrive I was being helped by a lady named Alma, she was friendly at first but started to get annoyed while she was finding my reservation. I told Alma, I just called in the morning and spoke with another lady who set aside the room for us and she said it was okay to check in anytime. She told me that that room type wasn't ready and that I have to either wait until 3PM (which it was just around noon) to check in
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review of our hotel.  Your comments are unique in the sense that we did try to accommodate your request for early check in.  It is possible that the guest that you let pass ahead of you had a different room type than yours that was ready and therefore was able to gain immediate occupancy.  If your room type was NOT available at that same instant, we would have informed you of such.  Although our check in time is 3PM, it seems as though we are being faulted for not providing your room earlier than guaranteed.  Typically, requests for early check in are based on availabilty of the room type upon your arrival, not necessarily at the time of a phone call.  In any event, we accommodate the majority of our guests with early check in as a standard procedure, knowing that it is often appreciated.  No doubt, your circumstances were out of the ordinary even though our clerks did try to find you an available room.  As for the phone call you received at night, there was a rash of prank callers that were calling different hotels suggesting many things to guests.  I honestly dont believe that any of our staff would be calling a guest room at the time of day you indicated suggesting the nees to change rooms or even use the term downgrade.  When a guest has booked and paid for a suite we would have no reason to suggest that they be relocated to any other room type that is not a suite, let alone asking this during late evening.    I have sent two messages to your Trip Advisor Account asking you to contact us so that we may discuss your experience in more detail and to offer our apologies for any inconvenience or misunderstanding there may have been, however as of  28 Oct. 2009 we have not heard from you.  In all fairness, it would have been nice to hear from you prior to your departure as we may have been able to address your concerns a bit more promptly.  In any event, we apprecaite your comments and trust that you will be in touch soon.

Summary: Rooms and cleanliness were average.  The front desk personnel were not helpful when we tried to book shuttles, etc. and often acted as if they couldn't understand English.  The breakfast was nothing exceptional, and there was never adequate seating....300 guests and a place to seat 30.  Parking was the biggest problem.  On four nights, we had to park in an adjacent hotel parking lot because there are 100 spaces to accomodate 200 rooms.  Their claim to be 1 1/2 blocks from Disney is misleading, the walk is more like a mile in distance.

Summary Heading: Not Much of a Hotel, Let Alone a Business Hotel
Summary: The lovely grounds and hard working desk staff offer a misleading introduction to this perfectly mediocre hotel.  I booked rooms directly and through a convention and had a bunch of headaches which furthered my reputation as one of the worst corporate hotel bookers in the world.  First,  there was no functioning internet in the rooms for any of my colleagues.  Like pirates we sought to log on the unsecured wireless network of the Clarion next door, with only sporadic success at 2 in the morning.  For two days one colleague had no hot water, and when that was fixed the valves were reversed.  Ouch.  Despite a several months old prepaid reservation, confirmed that morning by phone, a colleague's room was given away and an alternative 5 miles away was offered.  In the rooms
Manager Response: Dear ChicagoFamilyGuy, Thank you for your review of our hotel.  Comments such as yours are very important to us and will be reviewed for follow-up to ensure that the issues you experienced will be remedied at once.  As for your collegue being relocated, we regret that we were not able to accommodate them.  We did do our best  though to find them alternate accommodations and trust that it is understood that this is not a common occurance at the Cortona Inn.  Thanks again for your review.

Summary: Front desk and entry are clean and uncluttered. Front desk is very cheerful and helpfully friendly. The room is large and clean. There is an armoir with a TV and drawers. A refrigerator, microwave and coffe maker with coffee and creamer and sugar. The cups are styrofoam and the drinking glasses ar plastic. There is also a ironing board and iron. Closet is a bit lacking. Only a low bar for hanging clothes and a pedestal mounted safe occupies a bit of space. Night stands with wall mounted lamps on each side of the bed have one drawer and storage space. A table and two chairs provide seating. A floor lamp stands next to one chair.The bed mattress could be updated; they may be in the process of updating since there appears to be work going on in other rooms. AC was cold but very
Manager Response: Dear Ralphs, Thank you very much for your review.  We are pleased to know that your visit to Anaheim and your stay at the Cortona Inn was enjoyable.  We have just completed our room remodel and would like to thank you for your patience and understanding and apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: The Cortona Inn, where the customer is always wrong!!!
Summary: I stayed here with my husband and our two kids... 3 and 6.  We thought upon booking it that it was a good value and cute with the bunk bed suite.  The space in the room was pretty decent... not the cleanest we've stayed at, but for the amount of time we were going to be in the room, we weren't complaining.  Anyways... the two biggest things that stood out were (1) the couch dirt and (2) lack of concern for guests.  So here's the story... my son spilled a little bit of ketchup on the arm of the couch when he was eating chicken nuggets one night as a snack.  We got a washcloth and some soap and cleaned it off, but not only did the ketchup come out... the napkin was black!!! It was our last night there so we didn't worry about it... just told ourselves we wouldn't stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your review.  I understand your frustration with your lost article and would love to share years of experience in dealing with the recovery efforts on both sides.  If you visit our cortonainn.com web site, you will see near the bottom we do provide a link that allows a guest to communicate with us and establish a written request for assistance to help locate missing/lost/forgotten items.  We have taken this proactive measure because of the amount of items that are left behind.  Of great help to the hotel is when a guest will provide us with their address, phone number and email address.  So many times, one may be hesitate to provide this information, even for such purposes as to notify or contact a guest in situations similar to yours.  Your comment about why there are so many articles in our lost and found clearly demonstrates the amount of items collected by any hotel (including ours) on a regular basis.  The fact that we were not able to locate your battery charger is unfortunate, but certainly does not mean that we didnt care about you or did not want to help you.  Often, items reported as lost or missing have been known to reappear without explanation or question on our part.  If your item should be  subsequently turned in to our lost and found, we will tag it, place it in a locked safe and return it to you upon your instruction.    Thanks again for your comments.

Summary: i had booked a stay for 3 nights at the Inn, and due to a emergency we had to cancel last minute. I was treated with respect by staff and management. i was refunded the full amount, and i"m sure that no other place woulc have done the same, and was touched by the sincere caring of managers.  We will be booking a stay in the future, and more than likely be going with more family. i will also mention the Inn to other parents as well Thank you again Cortona Inn, be seeing you soon.
Manager Response: Dear chavez707, Thank you for taking the time to post your comments on this site.  We appreciate the time you have taken and hope that everything worked out well.  If we can be of assistance in the future please let us know.

Summary: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for a great rate and having read the reviews on tripadviser. After reading  the manager's responses to the reviews  I felt I knew exactly what I was getting and I was right.  Three years ago we paid five times as much to stay at the Holiday Inn (which is miles away) and I felt we got much better value here. After I made the Hotwire booking (first time using Hotwire) I emailed John to confirm it was al ok as I was worried that I had sent my money off to cyberspace. He emailed me back immediately and confirmed that I wanted 2 double beds - a great start to my Cortona Inn experience.  The hotel is true to what it aims to provide and makes no promises to be anything else. The room on the ground floor was clean and with room to move around (travelled
Manager Response: Dear jodi06, Thank you for your very nice review of our hotel.  I am pleased to know that you were satisfied with your accommodations and the amenities we offer.  Your "from the heart" review is spot on and I could have not said it better myself.  Thank you for sharing your experience as a guest of our hotel and perhaps we will have the chance of seeing you on another visit soon. Thanks again!!

Summary: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. It was booked at the last minute for a quick trip to Disneyland that I made with some friends from Australia. It is a bit of a distance from Disneyland, but we were able to catch the Anaheim Transit Bus both ways.The free breakfast was 'okay.' Some bonuses were the nice man that was on the front desk at about 1:00 am when we returned from Disneyland. We needed to book a hotel room for a stay near Hollywood and he allowed us to take our laptop into the breakfast area to use the wireless internet so that we wouldn't have to pay to have it in the room for just a few hours.  Also I inadvertantly left a pair of earings in a rather odd place in the room (under some sheets on the pullout couch). I filled out the hotel's lost a
Manager Response: Dear Arizona_8, Thank you for taking the time to post your review of our hotel.  Very pleased to know that not only was yout stay enjoyable, but that our service extended beyond your departure.  I will be sure to pass on your  "Thanks" to our Housekeeping staff and the gentleman that assisted you late at night.  And thank you for selecting the Cortona Inn & Suites for your lodging needs.

Summary: My husband & I stayed in Anaheim for a few days - mainly so we could go to Disneyland. The staff at the Cortona were very helpful with directions & things to do. We got the bus to Disneyland the first day & then realised that it was only a short walk from the hotel. The rooms were clean & the breakfast was more than enough. Shops with food & souveniers are close by. They have a pool, hot tub & WIFI (at a cost, if you want to use it in your room) available. All in all it was a good place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Joeljade, Thank you for your review.  Very pleased to read that you were satisfied with our facilities and services.  With respect to your Disneyland experience, most of our guests share the same opinion and find our hotel to be conveniently located in the Anaheim Resort.  We shall look forward to seeing you on a future visit.  Thanks again.

Summary: I would like to add to my review "harassed in Disneyland".  At the time of writing - our experience was particularly bad.  But in fairness; as Mr. Rozatti suggests - there is more to the story...  It would have been nice to have been given the opportunity to add to this without his comments but so it goes...  Larry - the general manager - at the Cortona Inn has been very gracious and diplomatic in his handling or our very unusual circumstances at the Cortona Inn.  His kindness throughout and since our stay has turned what had been a very negative experience into a more positive one.    As Mr. Rozatti alluded to - the Inn did give us $40 dollars to buy lunch and Larry was very apologetic.  As to the front counter staff - breakfast staff - housekeeping staff - they were very

Summary: Upon arrival the front clerk stated to me that my credit card would be charged then,, which I thought odd but being as though it had been booked through a military travel agency but agreed thought it might even make check out go a lil smoother,  so check in was fine got room keys, location of room was ok. Openning the door was an experience  I was struck with a wave of must like I had just walked into the Chargers 90 degree locker room had to try airing it out immediatly . Our bathroom light had to be played with to come on. The pullout couch which is where my husband and I slept for two pain filled nights of trying not to roll onto eachother because the bed is caving in the center..... the distance is further from the park than stated on the website and my 8 yr daughter in
Manager Response: Dear Coledizzles, Thank you for your review.  And thank you for returning my call.  I felt that your circumstances were more of a procedural nature that required more information to determine exactly what transpired with the billing of your stay.  Again, I appreciate the opportunity of speaking with you today.  And if your plans call for another visit soon, we shall look forward to the opportunity of serving you and your complete satisfaction.  Thanks again!!

Summary Heading: Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous Staff, Fabulous Holiday ......
Summary: One of the main reasons i picked this hotel was in my mind if a staff member/management takes the time out to read on trip advisor about their hotel then it must be some good, also to respond as they do. For that reason i was very much looking forward to meeting John Rozatti.  My husband and i arrived at the Cortona and had a funny encounter straight away meeting the reception staff (Michelle and Sammy) whom have the same name as me and hubby. We had a great laugh which was welcoming after an 11.5 hour flight!  We were allocated a king suite with a separate lounge, great to have this and wasn't expecting it, so a lovely surprise after a long flight. There were two TV's, one in lounge and one in the bedroom. There was a 'certain smell' in the room, but i knew from experience

We stayed in the family suite which accommodated  3 adults and 3 children comfortably.  The room has a microwave and small fridge so we were able to stock the fridge with water to take to Disneyland.  The room was clean and I have to hand it to the cleaning staff because our room was always clean when we returned at night, which was not an easy job to do with 6 people to clean up after.  They have a free continental breakfast that  saved us a lot of money.  It was a short walk to catch the transit to Disneyland.  For the price it was a great place to stay and we will definetly stay there again.  They also have free parking and the staff was very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear grammyweb, Thank you for your nice review.  I am pleased to know that our hotel met with your satisfaction.  I know I have said many times here on this site that we try hard to make everyone stay as comfortable as possible...and your review is proof that we do try hard.  It also helps other future travelers to know of your opinion and experience...for example, that our rooms have microwave oven and a good sized refrigerator. It does help one to cut down on costs by stocking up on water, sodas and snacks.  That being said, our deluxe Continental Breakfast is another cost saver that can easily save a family of four around $30 day in breakfast meals alone.  So, glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and will look forward to your future visit.

Summary: Came to Disneyland with my boyfriend, parents and grandparents, we had 3 rooms in total.  I had just finished up working at week long conference in Palm Springs and wanted to relax and go to Disneyland.   PROS ~CLEAN rooms! I must say everything was very clean ~Nice selection at breakfast (however the poor girl working worked her butt of to keep things stocked and clean) ~Fridge & microwave in the room ~They have the ART stop now (at the end of the driveway) ~ Staff was friendly  CONS ~Beds were awful, like sleeping on springs in some spots ~ We had a handicap room (not sure why) and the bar in the shower came out of the wall...good thing I am not handicap and rely on that ~ The hot tub was COLD when we tried to use it and it took about 30 mins to heat up ~towels were TINY
Manager Response: Dear jschwan, Thanks also for your  pro and con review.  I can tell you that we have mostly favorable reviews with only a fraction appearing on this site.  But, we are looking into most of the items you mentioned such as towell,s beds, etc.  The Hot Tub is heated by natural gas and not sure how long it should normally take to heat, but have heard that some guests may turn it on, then jump in the  pool and swim around a bit, then hop into the jacuzzi.  Hey, why didnt I think of that??  Also, although  I cant reveal too much more now, but most of the other items you have mentioned are being addressed as we speak.  Thanks again and hope to see you here again soon.

Summary: After reading all the good ratings regarding this hotel, I am so disappointed after our four nights stay. The room is clean and spacious but you can feel the spring from your bed. The hotel is old and needs some renovations job to keep it look better.  Breakfast area is small and crowded. For the first three mornings, there was only one "poor" staff to take care all the cleaning and food/ drink refilling. (Previously we stayed in San Diego Comfort inn, there were at least 3 staffs to serve)  Poor girl had to run around and tried to keep all the hungry guests happy. However, not much she could do by herself, the tables were dirty, floor was a mess and sticky.     The pool is small but clean. Microwave and fridge are good features. Parking is free but you have to pay extra hotel
Manager Response: Dear Texas_1234, Thank you for your review.  I want to emphasize that we take your comments very serious and will look into the condition you found our breakfast room.  Although food items have a natural tendancy to find the floor, it is our job to ensure that the room remains tidy and orderly so that all guests can enjoy breakfast.  Regarding the spring in the bed, if it was not reported to our hotel staff during your stay, the mattress must be inspected to determine the remedy if in fact a spring is broken or damaged.  Of course, hotel bedding like bedding for your home should be comfortable.  We will have this checked immediately.  I should mention a room upgrade that will be completed shortly and will enhace the overall appearance of our hotel. Thank you again for your review and for brining this to our attention. And since we do not know the room which you occupied during your stay, if you could kindly email me john@cortonainn.com or call me 714-971-5000 with the room number or your first and last name so I can look up your guest record to find your room number.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel while we went to Disneyland.  We had a great time. Pros:  - Continental breakfast (biscuits/gravy, waffles, cereal, oatmeal, toast, fruit) - free  - Free & ample parking  - Nice room (well sized, clean, comfortable)  - The staff was very nice  - Walking distance to Disneyland (~15-20 min)  - Great deal overall Cons:  - Swimming pool rather small (we didn't use it, stayed at disney late though so it didn't matter)  - 15-20 min walk to Disney is a long walk when it's late and you're tired
Manager Response: Dear 25SunnyCalifornia, Thank you for your review.  Quick, to the point and positive.  As for the distance to the Disneyland Resort the new ART stop at our hotel entrance will make the short distance to and from the park much more managble. Thanks again for your complimentary review.

Summary Heading: What an awesome staff! Lodging was what we paid for and more!
Summary: Good Day to you. Our stay here was a real treat. We arrived (April 18-22) to find that the travel agent made an error, the wonderful staff set to task post haste to correct it in our favor. Alma (?spelling) took the call and note was made before we left for the trip. Manager Adrian (?spelling) was so kind. He just went over the top to rectify the situation. He fixed a issue of two kids one stuffed toy leaving a personal thoughtful note. (we had purchased a package deal through our travel agent) When we arrived in the room WOW! Two stuffed toys and popcorn and a very sweet personal note. They MADE IT RIGHT! Even allowing for internet access so we could work on getting the issues with the car accident resolved. Judy (at the desk was so sweet) We had been in a car accident on our
Manager Response: Dear JAALU, Thanks for your wonderful review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Very please to read that your stay was comfortable and fun for everyone.   Your review hit on a couple of points that I really like to hear.  1.)  Our deluxe Continental Breakfast that you found not only very satisfying, but the fact that it saved you s o much money every day.  That can really add up and truly represents a huge savings.  2.)  Our location.  It is true that we are thoughtully set back off Harbor Blvd just enough so that our guest rooms do not pick up the noise from traffic passing by the boulevard.  3.)  Maid Service.  Our maids take their job very serious and do strive to ensure that every guest receives a clean and comfortable room.  I guess I could add in a fourth point and that would be value for the dollar.   We know that the current trend is for those seeking the best value for their money.  That is why we remain extremely competitive...without sacrificing on comfort, amenities and little extras.  Thanks again for your review and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: DON'T STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET LOCKED OUT AND LIED TO
Summary: I stayed at the Cortona Inn April15-18, 2009 and at first enjoyed my experience but by the last night I decieded that I was never going to stay there again. I was traveling with my husband, elderly mother and my 15 and 12 year old nieces to enjoy the Disneyland Theme park. Upon arrival at check in I asked the front desk if I could pay with cash since I did not have the $500 + dollars on my credit card to pay for the three nights stay. The check in person told me not to worry about it and that I could pay when I checked out. Well before the third night after walking back from disneyland, which by the way is quite along walk, my husbands key would not work to get into the room, he went to the front desk and the woman at the front desk told him that he must of demagnitized his card
Manager Response: Dear TeeCee_111, Without having all the details about how your accommodations were being settled, I want to share with you a common hotel practice that is indicative of most hotels in the US as well as those in other countries.  When checking in to a hotel, even for cash paying customers, it is quite commen that a credit is also requested to cover any additional charges that may be incurred during the course of ones stay.  Although room charges may be paid in advance in cash upon arrival, additional charges are billed to your room account and settled at the time of check out using whatever payment method you choose, whether cash or credit card.  As I stated above, this is common in our industry.  Second, if the gentleman that came in to the lobby asked for a key to your room and was not recognized by the clerk on duty and was not able to verify his identity, the clerk is trained to refuse the guest access to the room.  Please understand that this is for your protection.  No hotel can issue a key to a guest that is not identified as being the occupant of the room nor to one who is unable to verify his/her identity.  Clerks are trained in guest safety and security and there are many tactics that must be employed to ensure that only guests that should have access to a guest room are in fact a registered guest in that room.
