BUT, I can guarantee you that at NO time would our clerks have suspected that you or anyone else in your party as being criminal like for waiting outside our lobby or sitting in our lobby nor do we think of any guest as being a common criminal.

Summary: Front desk staff were friendly and helpful.  Continental breakfast was above average and offered plenty of options including fresh fruit.  It's an older hotel so  it's not in perfect shape, but it's extremely clean.  Housekeeping does a great job.  The rooms are spacious.  It was nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room.  You can see the Disney fireworks from the 3rd floor balcony.  A bit of a walk to the parks- but no longer than the walk from most hotels in the area.  Just a short drive (or a 45 min walk) to Angel stadium if you want to see a baseball game.
Manager Response: Dear diatwo, Thank you for your comments and kind review.  Although there are many hotels in the Anaheim Resort that have been here longer than we have, it proves once again that you cannot judge a book by its cover.  What the Cortona Inn & Suites is proud of is the fact that we maintain our facilities to ensure a pleasant guest experience and demand of our housekeeping department high standards so that our guests can enjoy clean and comfortable accommodations.  With nice amenities that you have mentioned such as fridge (and not one of those teeny-weeny ones), microwave oven, fresh brew coffee maker, iron/ironing board it does help to make ones stay convenient and comfortable.  Plus, our cpmplimentary Deluxe Continental Breakfast is full of many great morning favorites for everyone to enjoy.  This alone can save a family anywhere from $10-30 per day just in breakfast costs alone.  As for the walk to Angel Stadium, I would reccommend hopping on the OCTA public transit bus (route 50) and get there in about 5-8 minutes for just a couple of dollars.  So, thanks again for your nice review and perhaps we will have the opportunity to see you again on your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!
Summary: Got a good deal for the 3 nights we stayed there. But would not stay there again. Pros: It was clean Breakfast was included Hot tub Easy Parking  Cons: Reserved the room months in advance and requested rooms next to family members.  Had, previous to booking, called to make sure that this was possible. Was told that this was not a problem if we all got single rooms. Booked single rooms. Called again a week prior about the rooms was told to call the night before to make sure that we had rooms next to each other. Called the night before and was told  to call the morning of our check in. The morning of was told that we had rooms close but not next to each other. Huuuh? How hard is it to book 3 rooms together? How hard is it to accommodate a blind vets request  for easy assistance
Manager Response: Well, I could take up a lot of space with this comment to explain why it is not always easy to arrange three rooms together as this guest asks.  If all of our rooms were the same type, that would be very easy.  But we have Suites, rooms with one King bed and some with two Queen beds and family suites.  For example, if room 101 had 1 King bed, room 102 had two Queen beds and room 103 is a suite, in this hypothetical scenario, it would be a challenge to get two rooms in a row that had two queen beds if these were the last three rooms available in the hotel.  So, without taking up any more space, I will simply say that we try to accommodate requests to the best of our ability.  As for the comments about guest noise around the room, I can only comment that most guests are considerate of others when it comes to communicating with others in their family.  And although it is true that there are many choices for hotels in the Anaheim Resort we do offer not only the clean, comfortable and convenioent accommodations that you experienced, but also exceptional value for the dollar.  Thanks again and I do appreciate your comments.

Summary: We booked our suite on the phone a month prior to our stay and called two days prior to confirm. When we arrived, check in was easy and the front desk was very efficent. However, when we went up stairs, we found that we had a single room with two double beds only. With 8 people in our party, needless to say the room was too small. We were told that suites were available "first come, first serve basis" and there were no more available. I was disappointed that there was no offer of an extra room. The front desk did offer roll out beds, though did not bring them up until 9pm( we checked in at 2pm) The next morning we did get our suite after being told that we would have to pay for the roll out beds from the night before.   If traveling with young children, be ready to purchase the
Manager Response: Dear Seelove00, Thank you for your review and comments.  First, my apologies that the room type that you reserved was not available.  On rare occasions this may happen for different reasons, and at times beyond the control of the hotel.  Unforseen emergencies that require guests to extend their stay in the room type that was being held for you is one example.  Its not something we like to see happen and certainly understand your point of view.  I would, however, like to mention that we dont have double size beds at the Cortona Inn.  All rooms have Queen Size beds except for our single bedded King Rooms which have a King bed.  As for the rollaway beds, if you would contact me directly I would be happy to make any appropriate adjustment for you.  If we made an attempt to accommodate you by placing rollaway beds in the room, there should not have been any additonal charge.  As for our Continental Breakfast, it does get quite busy, especially when the hotel is full.  Your visit during spring break is not only a popular time of the year when schools are out, but it does increase the amount of traffic one may encounter, whether it be parks, restaurants, hotels, etc.  I can tell you that breakfast earlier in the morning is usually less crowded.  So, set the alarm for 6am and be there at 630 to enjoy a great Continental Breakfast.    As for your guest rooms, thanks for recognizing the hard work of our wonderful housekeeping staff.  They truely do work hard to make sure that every guest enjoyes a clean and fresh room from the moment of check-in and througout their stay.  Thanks again and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We stayed 5 nights and had three rooms. The rooms were spotless,  and the hotel staff was very friendly and most accommodating. We wanted all three rooms close together. Done. We needed some extra towels one day. Done. The breakfast was great!  They had an employee working nonstop to keep the items stocked.  Get there early though if you want a table. Diabetics, bring your own sugar free syrup if you want a waffle.  I needed to send a fax and asked them where a kinkos was. They offered to send it for me. I even forgot to turn in a room safe key, and they told me I could mail it to them. This was a nice hotel staffed with nice people! The kids enjoyed the pool.  We would definitely stay there again, and remember the key!
Manager Response: Dear DisneylandJunky, Wow!!  Five nights and three rooms...I bet everyone had a wonderful time.  Very nice to read that we met your expectations in all categories.  We have made many improvements over these past  twelve months with customer service a top priority.  We have implemented a variety of small changes internally that may not be visiable to our guests, but do have a positive impact on their overall stay.  I am pleased to know that guests leave our hotel satisfied and appreciative of our services and amenities.  Thanks for your honest and humble review.

Summary Heading: The Happiest Place to stay when visiting The Happiest Place on Earth.
Summary: When we arrived our room was not ready. That was ok though, we just went got some lunch. When we came back it was ready. I opened the door and it was fresh smelling and very clean. The person that we had the pleasure of checking us in was Leslie. She is one of the nicest people I think I have ever met. Thank you for all your hard work. I trully hope that you had a Happy Birthday.  The Breakfast was good to get the morning started. I thought that the hotel did a wonderful job the kept the breakfast fully stocked and always with a smile on the employees faces. This location does not have a shuttle to Disneyland but you can ride the ART bus/Tram from the front of the Clarion Hotel for 2 adults it only cost us $28.oo which is way better than parking at the parks or even walking. i
Manager Response: Dear Kimmiko, Thank you for a very candid and wonderful review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  You know, this happens frequently that rooms may not always be available when arriving prior to check in time.  This is true for any hotel.  Mainly, check out time is 11AM and once the guest departs, the housekeeping staff goes in and prepares the room for the next guest.  Often, we can accommodate early check-ins, but there are times when it just simply isnt available.  However, your decision to have lunch was perfect as you were able to enjoy unwind after the journey to Anaheim, have a nice lunch and the whole time your room was being prepared for you.  I would have done the same thing.  So, great idea.  But, I do have good news...as I promise in these responses, we have made a change to the ART stop.  Now, instead of making your way to the other side of the other hotel, the new stop will be at the Bus Stop just next to our entrance on Harbor Blvd.  We will now have our own dedicated ART shuttle stop.  It just couldnt get any better, right??  As for the nominal fee, your right.  Since parking is not free at the Disneyland Resort, its a bargain considering you are picked up in front of our hotel and dropped inside the Disneyland Resort.  This change will take effect within a matter of days.   Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the Disneyland Resort!!

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here this last week.  The rooms were very clean.  It was nice after a long day to come back to a clean room.  the only thing that I had a problem with is the breakfast-it was supposed to be from 6:30-9 and we went about 7:30 two of our 4 days and the had no more biscuts and gravy one day and no more make your own waffles the next.  A little frustrating that you didn't keep everything the whole time and we had to settle for donuts and cold cereal.  But other than that we had a nice stay.  I would recomend it to anyone.  The staff was helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear disneylover, Thank you for your kind review and comments.  First, I would like to apologize that you were not able to enjoy our Continental Breakfast to the fullest.  Since our breakfast is served from 6:30 to 9:30 each morning, I do not know why there were items missing during the time of your visit.  But, I will bring your comments to the attention of our General Manager so we can address this issue.  I would like to suggest to anyone who may be reading these comments that should you ever experience a similar situation at any hotel, please make an attempt to notify the manager on duty or restaurant staff.  But again, please accept our apologies.  And I am pleased to know that you found our staff to be courteous and attentive to your needs.  Comments such as yours are very helpful to guests that are planning a visit to Anaheim and I thank you for bringing your comments to this site.  Thanks!

Summary Heading: Great place, Incredible Breakfast, little far from Disneyland
Summary: Wow, I really like this place. The hotel was nice. I saw other reviews and would agree, this is really more like a motel, where you drive up and park your car right outside your room, rather than a hotel where the parking is separate. But this place was very nice, clean, and safe feeling. It is walkable from Disneyland, but its quite a walk, about 15 minutes at a leisurely pace. There is a shuttle that goes back and forth that picks up at the Clarion hotel next door every 15 minutes. (the shuttle takes an hour break between noon and 1PM) but you are the last stop for the bus before going to Disney and the 3rd stop when leaving the park. (All 3 stops are right next to each other on the same street) The room was clean, and the bed fine, nothing special, but bring your own pillows.
Manager Response: Dear Craig, I would like to thank you for your review and comments about the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Your comments are very, very helpful to guests especially since you have provided some very good information that is positive and beneficial to those shopping for a hotel in the Anaheim Resort.  Not to boast, but we don’t cut costs on our Biscuits and Gravy and the Belgium Waffles are the tastiest.  You may have left out some of the breakfast items we offer, but the fact that you were pleased with our breakfast says it all.  One can visit our site to get a current list of the items we serve for our Continental Breakfast. With respect to your comments about room access and parking, it’s ironic that I responded to another guest who felt as though that where you park your car determines if it’s a hotel or motel.  Exterior entrances provide quick and easy access to guest’s rooms and in an emergency is inherently safer.  At the Cortona Inn, another cost savings is that we do not charge for parking.  There are several hotels in the resort that do have parking fees and require you to park father away from your room.   Thanks again Craig for providing a valuable review of the Cortona Inn & Suites to those travelers who are looking for clean and comfortable accommodations that are affordable and offers great amenities and value added features.

Summary: My whole family liked this hotel. It had everything that we were looking for- continental breakfast, pool, spa, close to disney, clean, separate room for the kids without them being in a different room altogether (suite). The arcade was not really an arcade, but who really needs one on vacation? The rooms had a microwave, fridge, desk, tv in each room and was clean! Our four boys loved having a room like home -bunkbeds, queen bed, tv, closet and lots of space. We were very pleased, the access to the rooms was nice (outside without feeling like a motel) and you didn't have to track water all over the halls after swimming. Towels at the pool too. Also, with a family of six, the laundry room was great with a Target store and many othes right up the street. We traveled with another
Manager Response: Dear hiroshijg, Thank you for pleasant review and comments of the Cortona Inn.  We appreciate these comments as they truly represent what we offer.  And that is clean, comfortable, convenient accommodations with room types that are suited for just about any family.  The suite you have described (1 Bedroom Toscana Kids Suite) is our most popular because of the Bunk Beds.  Your comment is so true, because we here often that the kids just love it.  As for our breakfast, we are gaining notoriety for a wonderful breakfast that offers much more than most.  The fact that it can save the average family about $30.00 a day in food cost is a great bonus that we offer complimentary each morning to all registered guests.  It is nice to hear also that you did take advantage of our other facilities and services and as a result, your vacation was pleasant, memorable and fun.  And that, after all, is truly what it is all about...  Thanks again for your comments and review of our hotel.

Summary Heading: Couldn't get out of here fast enough
Summary: Let me begin by saying my husband and I are not picky when it comes to hotel rooms.  We travel several times a year and have had to book low-end 2 star motels if nothing else was available and have been pleased as long as it was clean and comfortable. The Cortona Inn is NOT a three star hotel.  Although the website shows a nice lobby, the lobby building is very separate from the rooms.  The facility is a motel; entered by ramps on the outside; NOT a hotel.  The room was very noisy, as we could hear traffic and people outside all night long.  We got very little sleep.  I called management one morning at 3:30 A.M. and requested they ask guests outside to be quiet and nothing was done.  Management was not helpful.  I've had better rooms.  Room was small and okay as far as
Manager Response: Dear TravelingPrincss, Thank you for taking the time to express your opinions about our hotel.  The Cortona Inn & Suites is rated by AAA and has been awarded three diamonds.  Close to 50% of the hotels in the Anaheim Resort have exterior corridors that allows guests quick and easy access to their rooms.  It is unfortunate that your stay was interrupted by other guests that may not have been as courteous as others.  Our staff is trained to respond to guest issues that are reported to our Guest Services and can assure you that attempts were made to identify the source of the noise you experienced and resolve the issue.    With respect to our pool,  the last few days of Feb. 2009 we had new safety drains installed in our pool to comply with new county safety standards.  At the same time we had the pool interior and Jazuzzi interior resurfaced to provide our guests with a nice clean and sparkling pool with the latest safety features.  During the process, pool chemicals were reintroduced into the pool and it took a couple of days to balance the chemicals and stabilize the water filtration process.  The pool is sparkling clean and currently being enjoyed by our hotel guests.  Your experience is unfortunate but by no means is representative of our pool.    Again, I thank you for your comments.

Summary Heading: New Year's Eve at the Cortona
Summary: I'm a frequent visitor to Disneyland. Usually 4-5 times a year from about 9 hours away. I've stayed at many hotels around the Disneyland area. So when I check out a new hotel, I'm always looking for a great deal to compensate for not being across the street at my favorite hotel, Best Western Park Place Inn.   We stayed at Cortona over New Years Eve. We got such an awesome deal on Expedia, (under $65 a night with tax) we decided to give it a try.   The positives are, very friendly, although frazzled with long lines front desk. I've had some doozy front desk clerks before (the WORST being at Park Vue & Desert Inn) but I felt the Cortona were friendly, helpful & genuinely concerned about me & my stay.  I loved the microwave & refrig in my room.  I thought the sink area was ample &
Manager Response: Dear wendebird, Thank you for your comments about your stay at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We appreciate comments such as yours.  I am pleased to inform you that the discrepancies mentioned are a very easy fix and is not something deemed to be of a permanent nature.  I wish I had been informed of your pillows as this is easy to remedy.  But, please know that I have contacted housekeeping and have asked them to remove any pillow that looks as though it has lost if fluffiness.  I will also remind our housekeepers that they should slow down some with their carts in the earlier hours of the morning so that it doesnt cause the noise you may have heard.  As for TV buttons being broken, it may have been done intentionally as a deterrent to prevent settings being changed that should not be attempted by anyone other than our maintenance staff.  It has to do with the premium pay system.  In fact, the buttons may appear broken but it is for a reason.  All TV settings are made with remote controls.  In any event, I want you to know that I have looked into your concerns and have found that most can be easily resolved.  So, once again, thanks for your review and perhaps the next time you visit Anaheim, we can change your mind about where to stay and allow us another opportunity of meeting your expectations.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay Near Disneyland
Summary: My stay at Cortona Inn and Suites was great.  After reading some negative reviews, I was leery.  This property is nothing like "Motel 6"!  The reception staff was very welcoming. The room was large, very clean, had plush towels, microwave, and refrigerator.  Breakfast was a deluxe continental with many options: make your own waffles, fresh fruit, cereal, danishes (with microwave to heat them), biscuits and gravy, hard boiled eggs, juices, coffee, etc. I felt very safe walking around the neighborhood in the evening.  Disneyland was just two blocks away within walking distance.  The room rate was excellent. This is not a four star hotel but I highly recommend this hotel for a good, clean, decent room with some very nice extras!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for posting your comments regarding your experience as a guest at the Cortona Inn & Suites.  What matters most about your experience is the fact that you were satisfied with your choice of hotel for your visit to Anaheim.  Your mention of many of our fine amenities that you found pleasing not only helped you enjoy your stay just that much more, but it also provided you with the value you were looking for.  Every employee at the Cortona Inn & Suites is interested in a positive and pleasant guest stay.  And we are pleased again to know that your experience was appreciated.

Summary: We stayed at Cortona last March, we had a great stay with  a clean comfortable room and pleasent staff, the kids loved the pool and the disney films being on whilst they had breakfast, we are returning again at the end March, we look forward to another pleasent stay. Hi Mr Rozatti,      Do you still want that Guinness?
Manager Response: Hello again finchey3... Thanks for your review.  Of course, I am pleased to read that you are returning for another visit to Anaheim.  I shall mark your arrival in my calendar and make a point to say hello.  With the latest news about La Nina, I can almost assure you of a beautiful stay for March.  And thanks again for your candid and brief review of our hotel.  We do try hard to offer great rates, clean and comfortable rooms with nice amenities and services.  I know you will be satisfied once again and am looking forward to your arrival.  Safe traveling!

Summary: I'm a Southern California resident with a Disney season pass.  My friends and I like to find a fairly cheap hotel to stay in when going to the Disney parks because we like to get there right when it opens so we can do what we want and either go to Downtown Disney for drinks and dinner or head out.  Getting to the parks when they open in the morning would require us to begin the 50 mile journey at around 500am, which isn't going to happen.  Southern California traffic is the best!!! So we found this hotel for about $60 a night and with 3 of us it was about $20/person (right up our alley).  I don't expect much from hotels, but this one was decent (at least for our purposes).  I would assume that most people who go to Anaheim are going to only use the room as a place to shower and
Manager Response: Thanks YeahYo for your review.  Happy to read that you and your friends accommplished your goal which was to come to Anaheim find a nice place and have some fun.

Summary: First, I want to preface this review by saying that we are not difficult people to please when it comes to accommodations. We take 2-3 vacations a year and have stayed in many hotels over that time. I would say that 95% of the rooms we have stayed in have met or exceeded our expectations. I cannot say the same about the Cortona. I made my reservation directly with the hotel and reserved a King Suite, which, according to the hotel's website, "feature[s]…a King Bed, while a separate living room includes a sofa-sleeper." I also reconfirmed with the hotel two days before we arrived and were told again that we had a King Suite reserved. However, when we arrived the room we were given was one large room with a queen bed and a bunk bed. I called immediately and told them it was the
Manager Response: Dear Gabriel B's Mom... First allow me to apologize for the confusion with your reservation.  It would be a lenghty and perhaps unappealing story to explain to you how rooms seem to appear, but it has to do with future reservations that are still scheduled to arrive.  Beyond that, please accept our apologies that the suite you reserved was not available.  We did try to accommodate you in a one bedroom Kids Suite which is larger, although not what you wanted.  We did also deliver a token care package to your room just to show that we were concerned enough about your disappointmenet to try to make some type of restitution.  No hotel is immune to criticism, but in this case, and in all honesty, we did try to accommodate you in the best way possible.  Thank you for your comments.

Summary: It wasn't horrid, and the beds were rather hard, but I'm glad we only spent $65 a night based on a "dare" on bookit.com.  We decided next time we'll spend the extra few dollars and stay in a name brand hotel.  The hotel staff was very nice, but no thanks, not again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to submit your review of our hotel.  I recently stayed in a brand name hotel in Rancho Cordova, CA where at the hotel I paid $141.00 for my room,  $9.95 for a turkey sandwich and $9.00 for a green salad.  I walked out of there grateful for a clean place to stay, but not again.  As a hotelier, I am confident that our hotel compares equally to many brand name hotels in our category and often at more favorable pricing.  I do know that we work very hard to ensure our guests have an enjoyable experience and wish that we could have met your expectations.  Thanks again for your comments.  Have a Happy New Year!

Summary: My girlfriend and I wanted a romantic getaway for a few days to come see Disneyland covered in snow. Usually I stay at the Paradise Pier or the Fairfield Marriot but as first quoted by my AAA travel agent they were a little pricey and after all we decided all we were going to do is sleep in the room. So after looking around the net in the 60-80 dollar range we decided on the Cortona based on the website's nice portrayal of the property's exterior landscaping and the infrequent bad reviews I had seen on a website similar to this one.            After our 6+ hour drive we arrived to the property at around 11am and was allowed to have an early check in which is the only thing good you will read about this hotel here. We were beat and needed some rest so we unpacked and headed into
Manager Response: Thanks for your information.  Although this is not representative of our hotel, I did not read where you contacted anyone in managment to discuss your concerns.  As for the picketeers, they are not only in front of our hotel, they are also picketing in front of about five other establisments.  If you read their cause, it has nothing to do with the facility or management of the Cortona Inn & Suites.   Thanks again.

Summary: First the positive things: The hotel grounds are very nice, clean and kempt. The housekeeping staff is stealth. Hardly  heard them, barely saw them but knew they were there...because  we like to sleep later than usual when on vacation, we chose to put the Do Not Disturb sign in the lock. When we needed fresh towels they were more than happy to give them to us. The room was clean, the bathroom looked recently renovated. All the info we needed for getting around or eating was there in the room info binder.  Plenty of free parking, close to IHOP, Denny's and Baker's Square.(mention the ad from the hotel and get either free meals for kids or 10% off) .but for a GREAT breakfast get in the car or ART and drive down to Mimi's!!!  Awesome Breakfast!!!  It was very quiet in the evenings.
Manager Response: Wow!  I have to say, this is one heck of a review.  Thanks for being so thorough with a fine review of our hotel and other establishements that helped to make your stay enjoyable.  The detail you provided is what really helps folks when they are looking for a nice place to stay and still remain within their budget AND get the amenities and service they expect.  Sorry that the pool was out of commission...new safety requirements required a modification of the pool drain.  Work performed in the pool area requires that the entire area be closed, which includes the Jacuzzi as well.  The pool has since re-opened.  As for other guests with little noisemakateers, their excitment does overwhelm them and at times, others as well.  I would imagine that as people read these online forums, it may help to serve as a subtle reminder that the comfort and respect of other guests is appreciated by everyone.   Thanks again for taking the time to provide everyone with your review.

Summary: We stayed at the Cortona between 22nd and 26th October 2008 and found it to be superior.  Nestled between apparently grander neighbours, this motel style establishment scores high on service, location and friendliness. I went there with my children and we opted for a single 2 queens/TV/shower room, which was perfectly adequate. Maid service was impeccable, and the reception staff as good as any I’ve seen in bigger hotels. Judy, I hope you get to read this, my kids loved you and your help on the numerous occasions I asked for it, was readily given and always appreciated. I have to say that everyone in reception was great, but you really stood out.  Reception itself, is in a separate block, which also houses the breakfast room and the pool. The rooms are in a three sided block
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your wonderful review.  And yes, we have informed Judy of your kind words.  As a matter of fact, she is now headed to Hollywood, where she hopes to find her name on the infamous Hollywood Walk of Fame.  Course, we did have to reel her in a bit.  All kidding aside, she is one of our "Stars" that always shines so bright for our guests.  We are glad to know that you found her demeanor and service exceptional.  Thats just Judy!!  As for the rest of your comments...what can we say?  You summed it all up and now everyone knows of what a wonderful stay you had.  And the cat...well, lets just say that every good restaurants or hotel should have one on loan. But if I have a spare scrap or morsel, I'll throw it his/her way for you.  Thanks again and I will be sure that Judy reads your review for sure!  See you next time.

Summary: We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable.  The hotel is set back from the road which we liked.  It was an easy 20 minute walk for our party to the Disney parks.  The breakfast buffet had enough variety to please everyone in our party.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We are most pleased that you found our hotel to be accommodating and convenient for your Disneyland visit.  And thanks once again for taking the time to post your thoughts.

Summary: After researching hotels near Disneyland, I found Cortona to be a wonderful deal when comparing distance and price, so I booked 2 rooms for 5 nights.  Our rooms were large, clean and comfortable.  The refrigerator was about twice the size usually in mmotel rooms.  The breakfast provided included self-made waffles, biscuits and gravy, breads, bagels, and several varieties of danish and donuts.  We were on the ground floor and never heard anyone above us or beside us even though the place was pretty full.  We parked right in front of our door.  The walk to DL was a little over half a mile, plenty close for four grown men to walk.  We saw several groups with kids walking that far or further, some with strollers.   When I go back, if I can get close th the same price, this will
Manager Response: Dear Donald...is that your real name?  Anyway, thank your for a very candid review of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  We are pleased to know that you did your research and were more than satisified with your choice.  What helps make our hotel an excellent choice, and more so now than ever, is the value for the dollar that we offer.  When you take into consideration all the points you mention such as distance, amenities, a free breakfast and clean rooms, large fridge, it really helps make a difference in the pocket book.  And we are glad to know that we can offer our service at a very competitive price.  We look forward to your return and ask that you contact us directly to assist you once again.  Thank you!

Summary: When we made our reservations we were given a total and when we went to check out the total was different.  They did not  let us know that there was a resort fee added to everynight and could not waive the fee.  They should let you know all fees that would be applied cause I did not think to ask is there any other fees  that i should know about that might get added.   The rooms were descent but the beds were harder than rocks and the bathroom floor was dirty.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  From what I read, you were satisfied with your stay with one minor issue but had a concern about your bill.  Sorry to hear that the beds were not as comfortable as you would have preferred.  Bedding is an area that just seems to vary from person to person.  Those who like firm and those who like soft.  From reviewing other comments and speaking with guests, our beds seems to be pleasing to our guests a majority of the time.  As for the Resort Fee, it is not a hidden fee as we do disclose this when booking online on our own web site as well as other well known and popular travel web sites.  For voice reservations, our agents are trained to quote the rate with a total stay amount that also includes taxes and fees.  If this information was not shared with you please accept our apologies...as a rule, it is mentioned when we quote rates and total stay cost.  Your comment about the bathroom floor has been discussed with our housekeeping department and maintenance staff and has been resolved.  Perhaps it was an oversight, but generally speaking flooring is cleaned as part of the cleaning process.

Summary: We went to Disneyland for 3 days and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. For us, me and my gf are 24 and 25 years old, it was no problem at all to walk from here to the main entrance.  First of all this hotel had a very relaxed atmosphere, from the minute we arrived here we felt very welcome. The front desk staff, 2 girls, were professional and friendly. We booked a deluxe room because it was only a few dollars extra, this was definetly the best room we stayed in on our 3 week trip through California. It was very large, clean and to our suprise it had large private jacuzzi. The outside pool was nice also, clean, not crowded and it had a nice large jacuzzi. We swam here every night.  Also we bought our 3 day Park-Hopper pass at the hotel for a nice discount.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  We are pleased to hear that your stay was enjoyable and relaxing.  From the looks of the pictures you snapped, you also enjoyed perfect pool weather!  Just what California is known for. Thanks again and hurry back soon!

Summary Heading: Perfect addition to a holiday of a lifetime!
Summary: I had to write a review after reading the terrible comments some people have been making, as I want future travellers to know the true representation of this wonderful hotel.  My Mum and I stayed here in September 2007 for the first time and it certainly won't be the last.   We booked through hotels.com as we loved the look of the hotel. Even though we looked at others we kept comparing them to this, but after we booked we were really worried as we kept reading bad reviews. Well we didn't have a thing to worry about as this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at.  We arrived at about 9pm and the check-in staff couldn't have been nicer, asking us about our trip and where we had travelled from etc. We were in our room 5 minutes later, really quick and friendly service.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your very nice review and comments of our hotel.  It is nice to know that our efforts to provide great value, wonderful amenities and comfortable accommodations are appreciated.  We do work hard at making sure that we remain competative in our market with respect to the  services and amenities we feature as well as comfortable guest rooms and great customer service.  Of course, having a great location in the Anaheim Resort is a definate plus.  Thanks again and nice to hear that your stay was enjoyable.  We hope you hurry back soon!

Summary: I really thought this hotel was a great one for our family vacation. We had two rooms because my husband, kids and myself stayed in one and my parents and brother in another room. I am truly wondering if these people who complain so much would have complained about any hotel they stayed at. Since we were on a multi generational family vacation, we knew we couldn't afford the Hilton, so we had to go medium budget and The Cortona fit the bill. My parents/brother's room was great, our room was clean and great, the breakfast was an expanded continental (just as described), the pool was clean and fun, the parking was fine, the hotel clerks were very friendly and helpful because I didn't want a room next to my parents and they complied, etc. We were staying there when they had the
Manager Response: Well said!  Thank you so much for your honest and heartfelt comments.  The experience you have described is a truer representation of our hotel and the service we provide.  Trip Advisor is a great forum where people can read comments whether good or bad and then filter out comments on their own that are either helpful or not.  I am also happy to know that you appreciated our Deluxe Continental Breakfast for what it is rather than being disappointed for what it is not.  Thanks again and please visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Would not stay even if I was paid to do so
Summary: We booked our hotel through a travel agent whom said the Cortona was a good hotel to stay at.. I suppose if you are a very flexible person it would be great. Everytime we had a question for the staff or needed something they were useless. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights left for a cruise and came back for a additional4 nights. Both times our hotel room was given away so we were given 2 doubles instead of the request king. The second time we asked for early check-in. When we got there the staff said not everyone knows how it works so he could not check us in. he took our bags so we coulde go to the park and told us our King room would be ready for us when we got back. (confirmed a couple times that it was ok and it would still be there at midnight when we got back) we were
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments.  Please know we take these comments very seriously.  Your experience is not typical and is not representative of level of service we provide.  We will be reviewing the conversations that took place at our front desk to see if we can determine the cause or reason that you received less than satisfactory service.  Thanks again!

Summary: I stayed at the Cortona Inn with my family from the United Kingdom (Wife, 6 yr old Son, & father in law) for 6 nights, we left and went to vegas for 3 nights, then returned to Cortona Inn for another 4 before leaving the USA. We booked a deluxe double queen room, and found the room comfortable, and included TV, Fridge, Coffee maker with a daily supply of coffee and cups, Iron and board, hairdryer, and a safe.  The staff were very friendly especially the girls at reception, who were great, and very helpful, and ok to have a joke with. The pool was small, but always had clean towels available for the guests, and if there were none there, you only had to walk a few yards to the reception where they supplied you with some.  The breakfast was plentiful as described in another review,
Manager Response: Thank you for your very fair and informative review of our hotel.  Comments such as your are refreshing in the sense that they represent a helpful  opinon of ones experience.  As for our Continental Breakfast, we try to strike a balance for all of our guests.  Where one would like to have bagles, another would like to have crosissants or scones.  We are adding more items soon that should be pleasing to everyone.  But I must emphasize that it is a complimentary "Contiental Breakfast" which, according to definition, does not usually consist of meats or cheese.  That would be more of an "English" breakfast, as my Google search revealed.  Our 24 hour Business Center does have a per minute fee of 49 cents.  However airline boarding passes can be accessed and printed at no cost.  Thank you again for proving input that is informative and helpful.

Summary Heading: Good rooms, nice staff, terrible breakfast
Summary: With a large family, we were looking to take a budget minded Disneyland vacation. Booked the Cortona and were happy with everything but the continental breakfast (looking for a place that included it to save some money as there were 5 of us). The breakfast consisted of sugar covered doughnuts and danishes, cold boiled eggs, cereals (no- name) ,toast, coffee, and beverages. If you are diabetic, do not go here.   I find it ironic that the hotel tries to promote recycling yet serves everything in styrofoam. My family refused to eat there after the second attempt......  As previously mentioned, the rooms were good, the pool was clean and the staff  were hard-working.....
Manager Response: OK, so I was reading along and liking what the guest was saying and then I got to the part about our breakfast.  So, being an avid Food Network viewer, I turned to them for the definition of Continental Breakfast.  Here it is:   CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST   Definition: A light breakfast that usually consists of a breadstuff (such as toast, croissants, pastries, etc.) and coffee, tea or other liquid. The continental breakfast is the antithesis of the hearty english breakfast.   What we offer consists of the following:  - Choice of 3 cold cereals (Kellogs, for those that are brand concious) - Oatmeal - Assorted Danish - Donuts - Toast (White and Wheat bread) - Waffles - Hard Boiled Eggs (Health Department requires they be refrigerated...can be heated gently in microwave oven) - Fresh Fruit (Apples, Oranges) - Milk (2% low fat) - Coffee - Decaf and regular - Two Fruit Juices (Orange and Apple) - Tea  Compared to the definition of Continental Breakfast, we do exceed the basics and still plan to add more.  We are in the process of adding more hot items as well as freshly made waffles.  Usually, a Continental Breakfast is a "grab and go" thing...a quick bite in morning to get you started.    Not sure about the diabetes issue, but I did find what a diabetic can have for breakfast:   1 slice of whole wheat bread which you toast to your own particular liking. Then on to this spread 1 teaspoon of margarine. Then on to the toast you can either place 1/4 cup of egg substitute or cottage cheese. However if you want something a little more warm and substantial in the morning replace the cottage cheese/egg substitute with 1/2 cup of oatmeal mixed with 1/2 cup of skimmed milk. Plus you are also allowed 1/2 of a small banana.  For most guests, our Continental Breakfast offers not only great value, but also a great selection of most breakfast favorites.    Thanks for your review and I am glad that despite the fact the our breakfast did not meet with your approval, the rest of your stay was pleasant.

Summary Heading: Remember this is Not the Hilton....We Loved this Hotel!
Summary: I cannot Beleive how many awful reviews this hotel has! We stayed at the cortona With two small childeren for 4 nights, and had a wonderful time! The people at the front desk were very helpful, and freindly. We were pleased with the size of the room (we had the kids suite with bunkbeds). Every day  we returned to our room to have it completely cleaned, even our kids blankets we had brought from home neatly folded! What a luxury for a busy family on vacation! The breakfast was nice, there was always a Disney movie going to keep the kids happy.The pool was nice. We had no problem with parking.  Overall we had an exeptional experience at Cortona Inn and Suites!
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest and most sincere review of our hotel.  I am happy to mention that as an independent hotel in Anaheim we are equally concerned about our guests comfort and satisfaction as a flagged hotel.  Your experience is another example of how our efforts in outstanding service make the trip just that much more pleasant.  Thanks again and hurry back soon!

Summary: We booked this hotel thorugh a travel place with out seeing any pictures or reading any reviews. After the hotel was booked I started to read the reviews and they were not good. We stayed in the hotel for 5 days. The rooms were clean and nice. The breakfast was ok nothing to rave about, we only ate the breakfast once. But other than that we had a good time. I don't think we would stay there again but it was a fine place to sleep.
Manager Response: Thanks for your honest opinon about our hotel and your stay.

Summary: When I read the reviews from this site I have to admit I was worried about going to stay at the Cortona Inn.  I was traveling with a large group, and was staying in the same room with my sister and her husband, two kids, and my daughter.  We stayed in one of the kids suites. First off the place was clean. We had a room on the top floor. When we arrived at the hotel, we couldn't check in because we were too early, but, the hotel crew were very nice and allowed us to store our luggage in a room that was locked. I was worried,  but I worried for nothing. We left for Disneyland, and ended up coming back to the hotel later that night. Everything was as we left it, safe. We then checked into the room, and from first sight the room was clean, and didn't smell like some rooms at other
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your recent stay.  I am very happy to hear that the young lady in our breakfast room was recognized for her outgoing and friendly demeanor.  With a renewed emphasis on customer service in all departments, I know our guests arriving in the future will appreciate this effort.  Thanks again and pleased to know that your visit to the Anaheim Resort was fun and comfortable.

Summary: I've always used this site heavily and while it is good to know what other customers have experienced, I generally do not take any review to be a completely accurate representation.  I made the assumption that the poor reviews were only one person's opinion.  We arrived to the hotel at 4pm, having booked it over a month in advance, only to find that the hotel had overbooked and were moving people randomly to Clarion and Comfort Inn (both lower quality hotels).  We were told that we would be moved for 1 night and would return to Cortona Inn the next morning.   When we asked for the manager or front desk supervisor, we found that they had cowardly gone home early and left their front desk receptionists on their own to tell the many people of the situation.  Rather than being
Manager Response: The Cortona Inn & Suites values the opinions of our guests and appreciates the comments regarding their stay.  As is true with most reputable hotels, our goal is always to deliver to the customer a satisfactory lodging experience.  If we failed in meeting your expectations, please accept our apology and know that we take your comments seriously.  At the same time, we always appreciate the opportunity to resolve any guest issue as soon as possible rather than after the fact.  Should your plans call for a future hotel stay and you experience any issue, always contact the guest service department as soon as possible to effect a resolve to any issue to reduce any inconvenience during your stay.

Summary: I am a travel agent myself, and after pricing out different hotels in Anaheim with suite options, I decided to try this one, as the price was so much less then some others. After booking, I came onto Tripadvisor, and was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. Upon arrival, I was pleasently surprised! The hotel sets back off the main road, so it is fairly quiet, in a pretty, spanish tile roof ,typical setting. The pool is a good size in the middle of the courtyard, and was never too crowded, with plenty of lawn chairs. We had a room on the third floor, but there were elevators, so it was not that bad. We stayed in a kids suite, which had the main bed in the front area with the mini fridge/microwave, desk and tv. The bathroom was in between this room and the kids
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay.  Please know that all comments are appreciated and shared with each department.  If we are praised for our service we want our staff to know that their efforts were successful.  Comments that may not be as favorable are handled with equal amounts of enthusiasm to reinforce in each of our staff that anything less than outstanding customer service is unacceptable.  Thank you again and we hope to see you at the Cortona Inn & Suites in the near future.

Summary: Wanting a reasonably priced family suite we booked the Cortona. I can safely say it was ok at best.   Good - extra room for kids (great for momy and daddy time) - fairly close to Disney - price  Bad - very very uncomfortable beds - about a 15 minute walk to park, not good for young children or at the end of the day when you are tired - no restaurant  If travelling with a large family and you need an affordable room with lots of sleeping room this is it. Just make sure you drink yourself to sleep if you want a full nights rest.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay.  I am happy to hear that we met some of our goals by providing you and your family with the value that you were expecting with respect to your hotel accommodations.  Quite frankly, it is difficult to find a happy medium with beds since what may be soft to one could be firm to another and vice versa.  Our beds are relatively new and while they did not provide the comfort your were expecting, it is not due to the condition of the bedding.  There are many manufactures of hotel beds as well as many different designs and levels of comfort.  Our beds are designed to provide a broad degree of comfort rather than discomfort.  Regardless, they did not appeal to your or your family and we appreciate your input.  Although we do not have a restaurant on premise, there are many restaurants within a very short walking distance in either direction.  Personally, I enjoy the Agio Risotrante for some of the best freshly prepared food in Anaheim.  For late night snack urges or hunger pains, we do have vending machines with a fresh supply of snacks, chocolates, etc as well as a beverage machine with soda, water and juice.  Several restaurants even deliver.  I admit, I love to walk but I know that after a busy day to the park, it might seem a bit far with kids in tow.  That is the beauty of the ARTS (Anaheim Resort Transit Service) bus that provides shuttle service between most hotels in the Anaheim Resort (including Cortona Inn) and the Disneyland Resort, as well as other shopping and entertainment venues in the Resort.  It even stops at the Anaheim Amtrak and Metrolink Train Station.  To help with your last comment, the new Anaheim Garden Walk will open June 14th where you will find many nice restaurants as well as some establishments that will serve adult beverages and is located just south of the hotel at Harbor Blvd and Clementine St.

Summary: I got the free night deal on a travel site and somehow they lost a day reservation and wanted to charge me $$$ for the last day. So I found this hotel on hotwire(actually had to know someone who booked it before so I knew it was Cortona). When we arrived I was upset that he wasn't very friendly. Older guy at the desk. He said I would ahve to change rooms the last night because it was a hotwire booking and put us in a KING ROOM.. eeks! I did not want to change rooms and I did not want a king suite. Luckily by the last day Romeo who was very nice managed to swing it so I could stay in the same room for my "hotwire" reservation. But I didn't like wiating until the last minute to find out. The room is smaller than it looks on pics. clean but stained comforter and furniture. The
Manager Response: Your comments have been forwarded to the appropriate department manager for review.  While your comments are disappointing to read, it is not a typical experience.  The Cortona Inn provides a service to our guests without regard to where reservations were made.  Our apologies for the inaccurate explanation that may have been conveyed to you.  I am pleased to know that Romeo was able to provide you with more suitable accommodations.  With respect to our hotel rating, please know that there are full service hotels that have a three star rating and there are limited service hotels that are rated 3 stars.  What makes the Cortona Inn a more value oriented product is that we do not charge for parking and our Continental Breakfast is free.  Free parking alone can save about $12.00 per day.  I do commend you for taking the right steps by contacting our guest service agents to resolve your issues during your stay rather than after your stay.  Thank you again for your input and please know that we will do what we can to turn around the issues you experienced so that others may not have to experience the same.

Summary: I stayed here with my boyfriend, and his two brothers. I knew we'd be coming in for a very late arrival, so I called the hotel ahead of time to let them know. The lady on the phone was really nice about it, and noted a late arrival for our reservation. When we got there at around 3AM, we had to ring a doorbell, because the doors to the lobby were locked. But we had no problem checking in, and the man at the front desk wasn't rude or anything. We had a standard 2 bedroom room. I think they were queens, I don't remember, but the room was very "roomy." I liked how the vanity was separate from the shower/toilet. It was very convenient for us. The beds were quite comfy, and the blankets and pillows were fine. We didn't watch TV, but we did make use of the microwave and the fridge,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to express your satisfaction with our hotel.  We receive far more praise than scorn and its nice to be able to reply in a public forum such as this to your comments.  The Cortona Inn & Suites is always looking for ways in which we can make a guests stay more enjoyable.  From free high speed internet in our public space, free parking, free deluxe Continental Breakfast, free local phone calls, free in room fresh brew coffee, its nice to know that our guests appreciate the efforts to bring increased lodging value to our customers.  I am pleased to read that you enjoyed your stay.  Perhaps we can look forward to your visit again soon.

Summary Heading: In this case cheap doesn't mean good value
Summary: This review is based on my family's 4 night stay.  We were in the family suite which is basically two standard 2 queen bed rooms with an interior door joining the rooms.  We stayed while visiting Disneyland.  Pros: -Looks very presentable on the outside and even at first glance inside the rooms.  -4pm late check out for only $25  -Refrigerator, microwave and a Safe for valuables  -Toilet and shower were good  -A/C worked fine,  not too noisy  -Relatively close to Disneyland although I would not call it within walking distance (not with 2 small children and temps in the upper 90's as was the case for us.)  -Pool and hot tub  -Business Center in lobby.  Charge by minute internet.  FREE web check in for your return flight home.  Cons:  -THE HOTEL IS VERY CHEAPLY BUILT.  THE PEOPLE
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  I understand your level of displeasure and would like to apologize for your experience.  It is not representative of the service of our hotel and I highly recommend that you contact the hotel to discuss the matter further should you desire.  Although nobody expects to leave articles of clothing behind, it does happen.  Its unfortunate that the garments found in your room were not recovered by our housekeeping staff.  With respect to the language issue, it is difficult to impose an English only policy since there is no legislation that requires one to speak English.  Although it is good business practice and would be appreciated by many guests including yourself, it is a challenge to react to this type of comment.  The housekeeping staff we have is hard working and relentless in their dedication to duty and reliability.  To ensure that guest rooms are cleaned and released to guests for occupancy, we tend to focus on the demands at hand for providing clean rooms in a timely manner to help comply with our 3pm check in time.  Thanks again for your comments and our most sincere apologies for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

Summary: I booked this hotel through Hotwire  for $ 73 a night- supposedly a 3 star but I would rate 2.5 at best.  Rooms were fine and clean but the "breakfast room" was substandard compared to the breakfast rooms at other nearby hotels. The Business Center consisted of a single pay as you go computer in the lobby, the pool was very small and  there was no restaurant on the premises.  If the hotel is booked as a  a 2 star, it would be fine.  The walk to Disneyland isn't bad, but if you have young children you might want to use the ART buses.  Also, there is a $7.00 resort fee but I am unclear what the fee covered as internet was extra.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  With respect to your comments about our Continental Breakfast, is it the appearance or the product?  Considering that AAA has approved the use of the term Deluxe Continental Breakfast since our breakfast includes: - 3 cold cereal choice plus Oatmeal - Toast - Assorted Danish - Donuts - Hard Boiled Eggs - Two Fresh Fruit Choices - Waffles - Coffee - Milk - Orange Juice - Apple Juice  Again, these items, are abundant in supply and offered free.  Our service is from 6:30 to 9:30 every morning.  If you are referring to the room where the breakfast is served, please be more specific so that we can consider any suggestions you may have.  Our business center is a fully self contained set-up which allows one to perform most tasks that one would care to do while vacationing.  One is able to check email, make online purchases, shop, print boarding passes, print documents, online banking, etc.  The service is fee based, and is very reasonable and inline with many internet services that are offered for a fee.  In addition to our fee based in room high speed internet access, we do offer a complimentary wireless high speed internet access service in our public spaces such as lobby, breakfast room, pool area.  For those without a laptop computer, the business center is a very handy option.  Some hotels combine fees in the rate and are not listed as a line item.  We have elected to list the fee separately so that one can distinguish the rate by itself.  This helps to find the best rate when shopping for the best rate.  Keep in mind that we do not charge for parking, local phone calls, toll free access, in room coffee, free wireless in lobby or continental breakfast.  Being a limited service hotel, we do not have a restaurant or advertise that we do.  Of course, there are several within a very short walking distance of the hotel.  I hope that this helps clear up any queries with regard to fees and or services offered by the Cortona Inn & Suites.    Thanks for your comments.

Summary: We went to Anaheim for a convention and booked here because others we were going with had booked here.  I paid $121 a night and it wasn't even close to being worth it.  The place seems old, our light above the vanity area never worked.  I didn't like how the door goes to the outside.  It's very noisy.  The employees were rude.  Originally, they wouldn't give us rooms by each other.  I told her I requested that when we placed our reservations and she said you can't do that. They told us they weren't available.  Another person from our group checked in later and got one in the area where a couple of us wanted to stay.  I was there with my 10 year old daughter and she thought it was scary!  We walked to the convention center, that was convenient.  We also walked to Disneyland, it
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments.  With respect to your request for rooms near another, it is at times difficult to honor such requests due to the different room types that the hotel has in inventory.  Not all rooms types in a row are of the same configuration.  We receive requests of this nature on a regular basis and are more than happy to accommodate guests so that they may be close to one another.  It sounds as if this was not possible perhaps due to availability of rooms during your stay.  As for feeling of safety and security, I can only say that hotels in the Anaheim Resort as a whole experience one of the lowest incidences of any type of rift raft in the nation.  We have a very very active police department that does a wonderful job of keeping the Anaheim Resort one of the safest areas in California, if not the nation.    With respect to your comments about our breakfast, we do have a staff member on duty during breakfast hours with duties that include re-stocking of breakfast items as well as cleaning up after our guests.  You didn't mention in your comments if the breakfast area was busy or if there were a lot of guests enjoying breakfast when you were there.  Admittedly, it does require due diligence on our part to ensure that items that fall to the floor and are left behind are cleaned up by our staff as quickly as possible.    Please know that we appreciate your comments and apologize for the less than perfect conditions you experienced.

Summary: Would stay again IF I could find price on Hotwire again as good as it was ($56 a night).  Found the hotel in good condition.  Looks good from outside, set back from road, good family atmosphere (looked like mostly disneyland visitors) Clean pool which my kids really enjoyed. Rooms were clean, good linens, comfy beds.  Nice to have micro and fridge in room, good size TV too.  Breakfast was OK, apples, oranges, donuts, pastries, oatmeal, cold cereals, toast, toaster waffles, coffee, milk, juice- none of it was high quality, but filled you up and got the job done!  Staff was interesting.... I booked on Hotwire where you cannot specify 2 beds- in the past after I book on Hotwire I call the hotel to make sure they can give me 2 beds- never been a problem before until Cortona.  I
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  Our apologies for the less than easy task of ensuring your room had two beds.  Although Hotwire sells rooms that will accommodate at least two people, its does not guarantee the room type.  You did the right thing by contacting the hotel although your experience was not exactly the way it should have been handled according to what you describe.  Please know that it is not indicative of our hotel.  Not having all the specifics about personal items in guest rooms, hotels generally frown on staff from moving items for the purpose of cleaning.  Generally, staff are trained to clean "around" items on dressers and etc. out of respect for  valuable items.  If your item was disturbed by an over zealous housekeeper, please accept our apologies for the occurrence.  We are proud of our housekeeping staff for their efforts and honesty and most of all their desire to keep our guests rooms clean and tidy during their stay.  As a follow-up to your comments, we have reminded our staff to never move or disturb articles left in guest rooms under any circumstances.  Thank you again for your comments and we look look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I booked this hotel because my two daughters-who are approaching  the teen years wanted the privacy of their own room. Booked the two room Kid's suite which consists of a Queen bed in the front room and a separate  room with a bunk bed and a pull out sofa bed. The rooms were spacious and clean and could probably accommodate   six (with small children). Nice continental breakfast and eating area  near the pool area. The only problem and it is the quality/age of the mattresses in the rooms-very cheap and old and no support. Woke up every morning with a sore back. The poor mattresses are not limited to the adults as my daughters each complained of the mattreses on each of their bed. All in all a very nice hotel but until they replace the mattreses I probably would stay elsewere.
Manager Response: Bedding comfort is always a challenge for hotels because some like beds that are firm or firmer and some like beds that are soft or softer.  Our beds are in the middle...not too soft and not too hard.  Even with high quality beds we use, its difficult to please everyone one-hundred percent of the time.  Although for most guests, our beds provide a comfortable nights rest.   We do appreciate your comments.

Summary: We were in Anaheim for a convention and booked this room through the convention website.  I later read some very scary reviews and was extremely nervous.  But there was no need to be.  As a matter of fact we are going to stay there again next year.  The rooms were spacious, clean,  and comfertable- no odors.  The refridgerator and microwave were great for leftovers.  The walk to the convention center was fast and convient.  This hotel is very close to many good restaurants.  The staff was helpfull and friendly.  The breakfast was nice and they did have internet in the lobby.   Air conditioner worked well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  We are glad to know that our hotel met with your expectations and that you were able to sort out the various comments you may have read and determined that sometimes opinions vary.  Reputable hotels, such as the Cortona Inn & Suites work very hard to ensure that our hotel maintains the highest level of service to ensure guest satisfaction.  No hotel is perfect and there may be instances where we fail to deliver, at times through no fault of the hotel.  But when we do, and when we are given the chance, we do everything we can to correct a situation and make it right.  Thanks again and glad that your stay was enjoyable.

Summary Heading: great value place to stay , walking distance to disneyland
Summary: My husband & I  stayed here for 3 nights from 6th - 9th Oct 07. It was a great location for the theme parks , only a few minutes walk away. Staff were friendly and helpful and we also bought our park tickets from reception too. Rooms are what you would expect for the reasonable rates and there is a  small pool and plenty of  parking. The breakfast was ok, very busy though so not much seating . Fine if you just want a quick coffee and cake to grab before going out . Just a short walk across the street is a great Dennys which we used . I would recommend this as a good hotel for families
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  We are happy to know that your stay was enjoyable.  Please be sure to visit us again the next time you are in Anaheim.

Summary: I had a pretty good stay at the Inn. The hotel has a good look in the lobby and at the entrance but the rooms have a look of a regular budget motel. The breakfast is decent, they have boiled eggs, toast etc and the regular fare of danish, coffee, juice etc. Rooms are okay, carpet is old and the room had a distinct smell..the kind of smell you have when you let a room stay closed for a long time with no fresh air. Other than that good location, close to Disney.

I booked through a third party website. I booked this room after reading about it here and seeing that there was more postive then negative. Well let me tell you that this was the wrost room I have ever been in. We went to Disneyland for my sons 8th birthday. I didn't want to spen an arm and a leg but I wanted a clean room to relax in at the end of the day. I called the hotel on the day we were due to arrive telling them that we would be a late check in around 2am so someone would be ready for us. After a long drive we arrived a 1:40am. It took about 10 minutes for someone to open the lobby doors. When he finally came he was very rude. I didn't pay it any attention, since all I wanted to do was get some sleep. When we got up to the room it looked okay at first but after two
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Very sorry to hear that your room was not up to our standards let alone yours.  I will remind you that what you describe is not the "standard" that our company tolerates for rentable rooms.  FYI that all sofa sleeper mattresses have been replaced with more comfortable mattresses.  Since sofa bed mattresses must fold, they do tend to be on the thinner side.  As for blankets and bedspreads, they are professionally laundered to ensure their cleanliness or replaced in the case of holes or stubborn stains.  I would imagine that these items are no longer in service if they were as you described.   As for comparing the other hotel you stayed at for subsequent nights, I would like to remind you that all hotels are subject to the same scrutiny by guests and once in a while may find discrepancies with even the finest hotels.  Again I thank you for your opinion.

Summary: I stayed at the Cortona several days while visiting Disneyland in Anaheim.  This property was once a Days Inn and retains the basic configuration (doors open to the outside a la motel), but the rooms have been updated and the foyer/main desk area has been redesigned.  Still, this remains a very basic accomodation with no restaurant on site, a dated exterior, and staff which are not overly helpful.  It should be rated at 2 1/2 stars in my opinon, but some travel sites have rated it a 3 (which is how I ended up there). Nevertheless, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the heating unit worked, and it was nice to have both a fridge and microwave in the room.  It is a bit of a haul to walk to Disney, but the Anaheim resort transit (ART) picks up at the Clarion next door,
Manager Response: Thanks for your review of our hotel.  We like to think that we offer a bit more than just the basic services but recognize that we cannot be everything to everyone.  What we do offer is a safe and comfortable hotel with a choice of deluxe rooms and 1 bedroom suites.  As a value added feature, we offer a Deluxe Continenteal Breakfast.  Since it is truly complimentary, we would like to think that the items served are appreciated for what they are.  We offer quality products for a great start in the morning.  Since it is a Continental Breakfast we do not offer meat items or potatos but we do now have fresh waffles you make on your own and much more.  To see all that is served visit our web site. As for Resort Fees, many hotels charge them (and not just in Anaheim).  Some sites may include them in the rate and some dont.  All things considered when you look at what you pay for a Hotwire reservation compared to what you would pay elsewhere, even with the Resort Fee added on, your still enjoying a substantial savings.  That being said, you can always visit our cortona web site for best deals and promotional offers.  Currently we offer a Stay 4 Pay 3 promo as well as a Welcome Weekend promo.  Also, if you purchase your Disneyland Park Hopper tickets, you can choose our Theme Park and Stay promo that gives you a 1 bedroom suite at the price of a deluxe room.   Thanks again for your comments.

Summary: We booked a two night stay for a Disneyland vacation.  We had three children with us, so the kids suite worked wonderfully!  There is a set of bunk beds and a fold out bed, the kids loved getting their own TV.  (And there is a door to separate the rooms) There is only a few channels (basic), but when you have a hotel you are rarely there anyway!  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The first night we were there, I tried to take a shower and the nozzle would not work.  The bath worked fine, but I like my showers :-)  Well, they apologized and offered to change our room since there was no maintenance guy available(in all fairness, it was almost midnight), so we decided to stay in the room since the kids were already asleep, and they said they would fix it the following
Manager Response: Thank you for your very fair review of our hotel.  I really feel as though you appreciated our hotel as a clean and comfortable place to stay, reasonably priced, nice amenities and close proximity to the Disneyland Resort.  That is what we offer to all of our guests.  Now of course, we do try to make everyones stay as special as possible by offering more than just the basics, but its pleasing to read that your stay was satisfactory.  And your right, as for guests making loud noise, its an issue any hotels must contend with.  And breakfast...well, we have made some very nice upgrades since you were here but I agree that Continental Breakfast is NOT a full American Breakfast and the word complimentary should always be taken into consideration.  Perhaps on your next visit to the Disneyland Resort, we will see you again.  Be sure to call if you do.  Thanks again!

Summary: Cortona came as part of our Virgin holidays package from the UK to USA. I was a bit worried when I read some of the reviews, but as before, got the the hotel to find theres nothing wrong with it. We had a standard room, with 2 large beds, fridge, microwave and coffee maker. It was very clean, the staff cleaning it every day and doing a good job too.   The breakfast is maybe a little minimal compared to what we usually get in the UK, but it still suited us fine. There were corn flakes, cheerios, toast with butter/jelly, Orange, raspberry lemonade and milk to drink, tea and coffee, tasty pastries, apples and oranges. There was enough to start us off for that day.  There are a lot of restaurants in the local area, including a Denny's 2 minutes walk down the street, and a 24 hour

Our travel agent gave us the Cortona as the best option as it was the only one that had a microwave, fridge and continental breakfast. We stayed 4 nights and went to Disney. We upgraded for $20 /night to a suite when we got there to a king size bed & separate room, or we could have got a jacuzzi in the room for same price.Eating is very expensive in Disney, so we were able to get food and water from local stores ( Target is 2 blocks away, and AM/PM and 7-11) and take it with us. There are also many retaurants close by- walking or shuttle.We walked to Disney there and back a couple times, maybe took 15 min. The rest of the time there is a shuttle that runs every 20 min. The shuttle ticket cost $6 for 2 days unlimited riding( but we used it for 3 as they didn't even punch it the

Booked a six night stay in July on Expedia. We have a large family, so we booked a Kid's Suite. (Two rooms, one with a King, TV, Microwave Desk and Fridge. The other with bunk beds, a queen sleeper sofa, and TV, and plenty of room for a crib.) This worked out great for us.  Arrived before check in time, but our room was ready. Check in was fast and efficient. We really didn't have much interaction with staff, because we really didn't need it. Called front desk because we had forgotten to request a crib, and it was delivered promptly. Housekeeping does start a little early every day, but they do a good job. Never had to ask for more towels as we have at other places.  After reading some of the other reviews on this site about this property, I really wonder what some people

Summary Heading: We knew we were in trouble shortly after driving up...
Summary: My wife booked our stay through AAA originally for a 5 night stay.  We ended up changing our plans a few weeks before we left and ended up in Anaheim only 3 nights.  She called the hotel and changed the reservation directly because she didn't trust the central reservation system to get the change right.  Well, I'm sure you can see where this is going.    We arrived on our revised arrival date and surprise, they didn't have our reservation, and "had no rooms left".  To make matters worse, there was supposed to be a convention in town during the height of the Disney summer vacation season.  To their credit the front desk staff started calling around and did their best to find a mini-suite for us (we had 5 people).  Romeo found a room at the Carousel Inn and Suites down the street,

Summary Heading: They treated me badly and the room stunk
Summary: I had a reservation for the next and tried to check in on the wrong date.  They told me that i did not have a reservation.  I asked if they could allow me to use the internet or if they could look up [--]so i can call them, and the manager rudely said, "We do not have the internet."  Then the manager rudely told me to try asking the Marriot hotel next door to see if they will allow me to use the internet.  He then said that it would cost me 10 dollars to use the internet there to check on my reservation.  THIS WAS THE WORSE EXPERIENCE I HAV EVER HAD.  DON'T RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.
Manager Response: Not sure about the tone of the manager or the actual conversation that took place, but the manager was correct in informing you that the hotel did not have public internet access or a business center when you stayed.  Since then, we have added a Business Center where guests can perform a multitude of tasks as well as High Speed Internet Access in our guest rooms.  In fact, we even added complimentary wireless High Speed Internet Access in our Lobby, Breakfast Room and Pool area as a result of guest comments indicating a desire for this service.    The referral to the Marriott may have been either a suggestion as to the nearest location with public internet access and was certainly not intended to offend you.  If the referral came across this way, please accept our apologies.

Summary Heading: Only good if you're never in the room...
Summary: We stayed at Cortona Inn in April for our trip to Disney.  They claim they are "a block and a half" from Disney.  However, the main entrance to Disney for pedestrians is a lot farther than that...7/10 of a mile.  Plus, we had to cross three busy intersections.  I don't know how they consider that a block and a half.  It's a doable walk, but I don't reccomend it if you have kids or have to carry anything.  The motel itself is definitely two stars at best.  We had a room with two queen sized beds.  We didn't dare use one of the beds because of a large black stain in the center of the comforter.  The room smelled old and stuffy, and housekeeping kept knocking on the door at 8 in the morning even after telling them to come back...repeatedly.  I think they had continental breakfast,
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  Not exactly the kind of comments we expect to hear from our guests, but certainly one that involves an easy correction.  May can see warm humid days and if a room is closed tight for a day or so may become stuffy with lack of air movement.  This is easily remedied with air exchanged either via windows or A/C units.  If you found the bedspread to have been stained, we certainly want to know about it immediatly so it can be replaced with a fresh clean one or new spread.
