If the housekeeper disturbed you before you desired service time, we do provide Do Not Disturb Signs in every room for this purpose.  Although you were not pleased with the performence of the housekeeper, it does demonstrate their desire to keep guest rooms tidy.  Breakfast hours are from 6:30am to 9:30am.  This is a three hour period leading up to the opening of Disneyland Park and early enough for most guests who may have an early departure.  The breakfast room is located off our main lobby and offers a Continental Breakfast which includes pastry, coffee, juice, toast, cereal and fresh fruit.  Items are added to satify guest requests on a regular basis as well as items removed if not popular.  The breakfast is free and available during the posted hours on your registration key card packet.

Summary: Wow, where do I start.  First it is dated, smelly and the breakfast was a big joke.  We were suppose to stay 5 nights, checked out early, because a big fight broke out about 4 rooms down from us.  I was watching TV with my 5 year old grandson around 8:30 pm when I heard horrible screaming and class breaking.  Opened the door looked out and saw a very intoxicated Hispanic who had just broke the window of a room, yelling he was going to [--] kill someone.  Finally, seven, yes seven, police cars came flying up,  cops running with guns drawn, banging on the door with their flashlights, come out now.  They got him, arrested him, with him screaming he was going to kill whoever he was fighting with (I assume his wife or girlfriend).  We checked out the next day and told them why, they
Manager Response: Not a normal occurrance and anyone who suggests this is a yearly occurance would be grossly misinformed.  I can guarantee that this does not happen often, if at all other than the incidence you describe.  Most of our guests are convention attendees and business clients attending business at the  Convention Center, or families that have purchased their vacations months in advance.  Anaheim is one of the safest areas in the nation and the Anaheim Resort boasts one of the safest areas around.  No hotel is immune to the actions of those who will misbehave, and it should not be construed that this incidence is at all typical of our area.

Summary: Seriously, I laugh when I ge to the hotels and realize Ihad nothing to worry about especially after some of the reviews I read about it prior to the trip. Okay, it’s NOT luxury but it’s clean, spacious and safe. We didn’t go on vacation to hang out in our hotel room, so what do we care if it was nice to look at or not? What I did care about is that it was cleaned and well maintained, which it was. The hot tub and pool were great, beds relatively comfy, large rooms, fridge and microwave are super useful and it was really well-located. We walked to Disneyland and found the trek fine, but we have no kids so maybe that would change if we did. And yes, the complimentary breakfast was very, very minimal, so I suggest hititng Denny’s or the Ihop, both across the street. Unless you can
Manager Response: An honest review is always appreciated.  I would like post an update to our breakfast.  We have added many new items to our breakfast and it is now a Deluxe Continental Breakfast.  Our breakfast includes the following: - 3 Cold Cereal Choices - Oatmeal - Waffles - Danish - Toast - Donuts - Muffins - Hard Boiled Eggs - Two Fresh Fruit Choices (Apples, Oranges) - Coffee (regular and decaf) - Milk - Two Fruit Juices (Apple and Orange)  As you can see from the list above, it is more than toast with apple jelly.  Plus, we monitor selections on a regular basis and make every effort to keep up with the demand for popular items requested by guests.

Summary Heading: It's equivalent to the cost, but spend a bit more!
Summary: I was truly petrified about checking in after reading the reviews here, but honestly, expect what you are paying for.  It was clean, it was functional, and it even had a microwave, coffee maker and mini-fridge.  However, if you are going to be walking around Disneyland all day, your body will ache, and these are not the beds you want to come back to.  Again, I repeat, they are clean, just not very comfortable.  It is a motel, not a hotel, so the noice outside the rooms can be annoying, request top floor, away from the elevators.  The continental breakfast is just that: juice, coffee, pastries, toast, and cheapy cereal.  As long as you are fine with these things, it is fine. Next time I plan to find more comfortable beds so that I actually wake up feeling rested, and hopefully

Well how do I start to say how rude the front desk staff is.  When we first checked in they looked at us weird because we were paying cash, like people don't do that anymore.  They were getting mad at the staff right in front of us, which is very rude and unprofessional.  We kept on getting phone calls which nobody was on the other line okay I can understand that what can they really do, but the people next door to us were having a party and was carrying a conversation outside that was so loud that I could hear every word.  We called to complain but did that help no all they did was move the party indoor.  When we complained again all they did was look at us with a stupid look and say  yeah people can be rude.  That makes a person mad when the own staff doesn't do anything about

Travelled from New Zealand  on holiday and spent 3 nights here. Very pleasant rooms, clean and tidy, plenty of space in them. Hotel is set back from road and no street noise. Staff very pleasant and went out of their way to be helpful. Enjoyed our complimentary continental breakfasts, not a lot of variety but plenty and dining room clean.

I felt sick to my stomach after reading reviews on this hotel 2 days before we were due to arrive. After arriving at the hotel I just don't understand previous reviews. We found it to be perfect.   We spent 5 nights at the Cortona. We had a mini suite which was fantastic. It consisted of a lounge room with lounge, tv, bar fridge, microwave, tv, coffee table and a desk. There was a small but comfortable bathroom and a really large bedroom with plenty of wardrobe space and two very comfortable queen beds. Our room was clean and neat and there were no nasty odours.    We experienced no problems with the staff who went out of their way to be friendly and polite and extremely helpful. The breakfast was plentiful. I have read on this site people complaining of the quality of the
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  We take comments very seriously and always appreciate feedback.  But sometimes...well, sometimes one really has to wonder what is fact and what is, well, not factual.    On a percentage basis, most comments we receive in the form of our guest response cards are very favorable, such as yours.  And admittedly, when a legitmate complaint is lodged with the hotel we act on it quickly.  The most difficult issue to try and resolve from a guest is the one we never receive until its posted somewhereand after the fact.  We would always like to have the chance to make something right if given the chance.  In your case, we did well.  And that is our intent.  If we fail, tell us...while your still here.  Give us the chance to make it right.  Any business should be given that opportunity.  Its what good customer service is all about.    Your comments are appreciated.  And we are glad your stay was enjoyable.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We booked a mini-suite online. The hotel had our reservation documented as a family suite. They changed it, but gave no eye contact and were not very customer-friendly with the correction. The room had a very strong wet-carpet smell, like mildew. It just about knocked me over. We turned on the fan and unloaded the car. The bathroom smelled like old urine. We turned on the bathroom fan, but it didn't seem to be operational. I was so disappointed (this cost $149 plus tax). The bedspreads had stains on the backsides when we turned them back. The sofa bed was so thin and springy and only had one old blanket.  When the smell didn't clear, we went to the front desk and explained that the smell was intolerable. The people were now very professional and helpful. They knew exactly what
Manager Response: Well, this guest had their opinion but I do not agree with torching any business or building.  That being said, I am not sure if this scenario has been exagerrated, but I can at least say that in two years we certainly could not have continued to operate a hotel with rooms like the guest describes.  I dont mean to sound like a broken record, but we are a legitimate business and experienced hoteliers that take pride in the service we deliver.  We strive for 100% all the time but recognize that sometimes we may not meet a guests 100% approval.  But we continue to make every effort to ensure a comfortable, affordable and memorable stay.

Summary: From the internet photos until the time you drive up, you get the impression that this is nice place for the money. I am the firs to say, be cautioned of what is behind door #.... The staff was not friendly. We arrived there in hopes to check it and no rooms were available. After a long drive (7 hours) we were hoping to shower and relax. Funny how early the maids knock on the door  to tidy up the room while you are staying there but at 3 o'clock in the afternoon there are  no clean rooms. In addition, we found the housekeeping was horrible. They had taken our dirty towels, not replaced them and then to top it off they did not make up our beds. The rooms were sub-marginal. They were very humid and did have a strong mildew odor (especially when the air conditioning unit was turned

Summary Heading: Don't leave anything valuable in room!!!
Summary: I booked this hotel for a trip to Disneyland.  We had several people in our group, traveling from Colorado and needed a suite.  Thought it would be close to Disneyland, not close enough when you are tired from walking around Disneyland all day, so ended up driving and paying $10 to park in Disneyland parking lot.  Drove in from Colorado, arrived at hotel 30 minutes before check in time, went in thinking maybe we could check in, not so, and they treated me like I was crazy..Came back at 3:10 pm and room still not ready, finally got in and no pillowcases, towels and bathroom smelled like mold, had to ask for them to take care of it, they didn't care about the mold.  Breakfast was terrible, the worst, cheap and sad excuse for a continental breakfast ever.  On the 3rd day our keys

First problem was the smell of the room. It had a strong milldew smell. We wanted to switch rooms but they were sold out. The next day when we went down for the continental breakfast there was a cock roach crawling in the cereal. When i told the attendent she proceeded to  take the roach out. Thats it! It wasnt until I told the person at the front desk anything more was done. Who knows how many people ate that cereal seeing as I went down right before it was over. I will never stay there again.

Just returned from a trip to Disneyland with my husband and our three teenagers.  I booked the Cortona Inn on another travel website and although the pics looked good I was apprehensive - booking a hotel sight unseen is always a little nerve-wracking to me.    The two room suite wasn't available for our stay so we booked two double queen rooms.  When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised - the rooms were spacious,clean and the mini-fridge (actually kept things cold, not cool!) and microwave came in very handy. I  liked that the property is situated away from the street, and found it easier to sleep without the noise of traffic from Harbor Blvd.  We stayed on the first floor (there are three) and the hotel seemed to booked each night we were there, but I heard very little noise

we arrived at the hotel and the outside was beautiful,  the rooms were not ready even though we had a reservation stating what day we would be there. we had to wait a few hours for the room to be ready they were short on housekeeping that day, as if that mattered to us considering we had driven 4 hours and wanted to relax enjoy the pool and shower, the room was an average room, we had the kids suite. the bathroom was not as clean as i would have liked it considering there was hair floating in the bathtub when i went to give my 6 year old a bath. overall the staff was unable to help with anything but an apology and not even a heartfelt one at that. This was not my idea of a great hotel.

I recently spent a week at the Cortona Suites in Anahime (which is a converted Day's Inn) while on vacation to Disneyland with my grand-children.  Prior o going I called (which was difficult to get the number in the first palce) to check on a few things, One of those was internet access, I am a REALTOR and havto keep in contact with clients and beable to check my e-mail even wehen I'm away, I was told that there was high speed internet acces by cable in all the rtooms. (I assumed it was free as most hotels that offer internet in the rooms are free through my experience,) at any rate there was nothing in the documntation, the desk clerk did not mention and nothing on th website other than there was interenet service. Much to my surprise when I went to use it the first night there

Summary Heading: The Good, the Bad, & the Ugly
Summary: Actually, we found this property to be Okay! Being that there were six of us,we rented a family suite for two nights. We found our units to be clean, comfortable and spacious. The Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. They good naturedly put up with our goofy bantering and answered all of our questions.  The distance to Disneyland was acceptable to us, although the the Hotel advertises it is one block away. We used the trip meter on our vehicle and found the distance from the hotel lobby to the Disney entrance was exactly a half mile! Quite a difference for those planning to walk!  The Continental breakfast was all carbohydrates and sugar (bread, sweet rolls, cereal, and oranges).  Not good for those trying to eat a bit more healthy! Suggest some hard boiled eggs thrown

Looks like they've renovated but unfortunately there's a lot of wear and tear on all the furniture.  Carpet was soaked and when I reported it, staff said they couldn't do anything until the next day.  1 pillow case and sheet had holes in it.  You can hear everyone talking and can also hear cars pulling in to park.  After hearing they'd fixed it up and looking at the photos, I really thought it would be a good value.  It has the exterior of a 3-4 star hotel but the interior of our room was comparable to that of a 2 star hotel.  Wouldn't stay again.  There are several across from Disneyland that are similar in price and have good reviews from guests.  Staff wasn't helpful and very quick at check in.

Summary Heading: Pretty good, but needs some child updating.
Summary: The suite was a nice size.  The inside and outside were clean and neat.  The rooms weren't perfect (some stains on the carpet), but were overall neat and tidy.  The breakfast was plentiful in amount, but really unimaginative (all they had was muffins, cherios, flake cereal, and toast).  The location was really great.  It was close by to everything (Disneyland and the Convention Center)and felt quite safe.    My main concern was child safety.  The rooms had no covers on the outlets, wires hanging around all over the place, and NO HIGH CHAIRS for the infants for breakfast.   So, if you are bringing a young child, make sure that you bring a portable high chair and some child proofing equipment.

Summary Heading: Room was ok but service had a bit to answer for......
Summary: Checked in on 14th Aug 2005 and checked out on 17th Aug 2005. The room was of a decent size, 2 Double beds, decent TV, microwave etc.  However a few things..... I had a problem with one of the lights where it kept going out and when maintenance came it miraculously worked (Murphy's law) and he treated me like i was an idiot and left. Staff at the front desk weren't overly friendly and when i asked about a transfer Qantas Holidays had organised for me he gave me the wrong info and needless to say i nearly missed a flight to New York  The Pool and Jacuzzi were small but nice enough  It was a 15 min walk to Disneyland etc but i'd say if you can afford to stay somewhere a bit more upmarket do so!

Even though completely full for some of our weeks stay we had no problems and would use this hotel again.   Given some of the reviews you may be concerned if you are considering a visit(I was) but don't be!  Everything was clean (efficient & effective daily maid service etc) & comfortable... Staff were helpful... a requested repair (toilet flush problem) completed with 30mins.  OK, maybe not a place to stay if you hate kids (2 blocks from Disney) or want a more exciting breakfast but for location and value you can't go wrong.

Maybe the Cortona Inn and Suites is improving because of past reviews, I don't know, but our experience was definitely better than previous reviews.  We had also just spent one night down the street at the Super 8 which was disgusting ( to say the least) so the Cortona was very pleasant for us.  We called the hotel direct to reserve a kid's suite.  I was able to get them to lower their price to $80.00 a night with AAA membership... a very good deal!  When we arrived they did tell us that they had overbooked the kid's suite and tried to offer me a mini suite, which I told them was too small, they then gave me two adjoining rooms each with two queen beds.    Our rooms were immaculately clean, granite countertops, travertine tile floors, and corian showers.  The beds were

Just checked out of the Cortona Inn & Suites.  Very good location only about 1 block from the Convention Center and about a 5 minute walk to Disneyland.  The hotel is clean and the bathrooms were newly renovated.  We rented the Kids suite for the 3 of us.  There was 2 TV's, a King bed, a pull out queen and bunk beds. It was a little noisy, but it did have a refrig, microwave and coffee pot.  The "free" continental breakfast consisted of juice, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, tea.  It was OK for free.  Management was very nice and helpful.  I'd stay there again.  As I say it wasn't luxury but it was clean and adequate for the price.

My husband and I are planning an elaborate trip out of the counrty, so when talk of our hooneymoon came up in conversation, we did not know what to do.  We wanted to go to a place that would leave us with great memories, but not break our savings for our other trip. We are from Texas so we had decided to drive down to San Antonio and stay there for a week, but he wanted to do something more special than that, because you only get one honeymoon after all. So the morning we were to drive to San Antonio, My husband called Expedia and made reservations for us to go to Disneyland! We asked the representative from expedia right away what we wanted. We specified a two star hotel. Our trip was not about spending time in an over-rated,over elaborate, and overpriced facility.   When you

We booked this hotel through Getawaytoday.  We had reservation papers and confo number.  upon checking in, we were told that our room was cancelled.  After driving 300+ miles, you don NOT want to hear this.  I asked who cancelled, the idiot of a staff member claimed that getway cancelled and when I asked what I do, because I had already paid over $800 for the vacation package, he said ' i guess you call getaway.  It was a sunday, and we reached getaways emergency hotline number.  While waiting for them to call back, my husband confronted the hotel staff.  The guy we talked to was very uncaring, basically saying it wasnt his problem, and we need to figure it out on our own.  His co-worker, another moron, went about dusting his computer....yes..dusting!!  He had a look like it was

After reading all the differing opinions, just has we did when we went to Mazatlan last winter, knew how to read between the lines. This is a better than average hotel in this area, some are better looking, some look like dumps, but we found our Kids Suite a great deal. The layout is terrific for a little privacy at the end of the day, the room was clean, the layout of the hotel away from the main road, (Harbor Blvd is definitley where you want to stay for easy walking to DL) kept most noise out, sure you can hear people out at the pool, but it gets quiet at 10 sharp seemed. And in the morning you can hear some people leaving for DL, but we were getting to go too, it`s what we were all there for anyway seeingly. Don`t count on a big breakfast, danishes, muffins, corn

I heeded the advice of the positive reviews on this site and booked this property for a recent weekend to celebrate my daughter's 17th birthday.  Granted, this was a holiday (Veteran's Day) weekend so attendance in this Disneyland area was higher than usual, however the problems we encounted seemed more systemic than volume related.  The facility is mediocre at best (our first room's carpet was damp, no bath mat), staff seems untrained in basic customer service skills, and their systems are not connected with the online booking companies (they receive faxes from companies such as Expedia, Hotels etc. rather than electronic transmission).  They do not take the room type selected and paid for online seriously - you get whatever they have available, regardless.  I booked and paid

Summary Heading: wish I had read these reviews before we went
Summary: We Stayed four nights at the Days Inn. I was expecting a little more from the "deluxe" continental breakfast. We picked this hotel because we thought we could save money by not having to buy breakfast. Several of the men in our group headed over to Carl's Jr. in the morning bacause stale Danish and muffins just didn't satisfy. There was no milk which was hard for the kids. Ended up buying some at the convience store down the street and having cereal in our room. We have stayed accross the street from the park before, which was much more convienient. Sometimes the ART shuttles were full (in october!) and we didn't get on.

Just got back from taking my 10 yr old son to Disneyland.  Was on a budget and didn't want to spend alot of money a room you are never in.  This hotel is in walking distance to the entrance to Disneyland park.  The room had a refrigerator and a microwave.  The pool and hot-tub were great. We enjoyed our stay and would stay at this hotel again

Perfectly nice rooms and good swimming pool. However the breakfast room had not been cleaned since the previous day- tables were filthy -  and breakfast was put out late (pretty crucial when you're desperate to get to Disneyland at opening time.) Actually the breakfast was so minimal we decided not to bother. It was our first stay at a Days Inn,so maybe we were just expecting too much(compared to Quality Inn, Comfort Inn or Best Westerns where we had stayed earlier in the trip.) On the plus side, only 20 minutes to walk to the park so saved on car parking!

We stayed here in April and got a great deal through expedia. We paid $350.00cad for a five night stay including tax which could not be found anywhere else! It was absolutely fine for the price and we had a great stay. The continental breakfast did wear a little thin after five mornings as it never changed and my hungry teenage boys were still very hungry when we arrived at the parks. Unfortunately the car rental company is no longer based at the motel as we had hoped to rent our car right on the premises but there are many places to rent close by.

Normally we stay at the Portofino Inn and Suites. However, this hotel was new and had an attractive rate ($89.95/night for a kids suite) so we decided to give it a try. We had reserved our room over three months in advance.  We checked in at 1:00 PM (after an 8 hour drive with cranky and tired children), but our room (a kid's suite) was not clean yet. Staff took our credit card info and told us to come back after 3:00 PM to get the keys. We went to Downtown Disney for lunch, and when we returned at around 3:30 PM we attempted to get the keys to our room. We were told that the room we reserved was not available (why didn't they tell us that at 1:00?) and they had upgraded us to a family suite (actually two adjoining standard king rooms). When we entered the rooms, there was

Summary Heading: Nice, clean room. Just as expected (Thanks TripAdvisor!)
Summary: We just got back from a 4 night stay (6/3-6/7/2005) at the Days Inn on 2029 S. Harbor Blvd (there are several Days Inns in the area and this is the newest one). I had booked the room back in mid-April thru the Days Inn site and got a room rate of 89/nite for Fri & Sat and 79/nite for Sun & Mon, with tax and all it ended up at 386 total.   I had read all the reviews on here before booking so I knew what to expect. We had a regular two double bed room on the third floor. The room was clean but the shower smelled sour like if the curtain needs washing. The rest of the room was clean and nicely decorated for the price. The beds are hard but we're used to a pillow top. There is a safe in the room which really comes in handy. There is a nice size fridge, coffee maker, and microwave. I

This hotel was great for us and our three kids-we got the mini suite.  The housekeeping staff was friendly and did an excellent job.  The walk to Disneyland was not too terrible, and we were able to walk to restaurants for dinner each night.  The only complaints we had were that the room had a mildewy-odor (probably from people dumping wet swimsuits and towels on the carpet?), and the breakfast was minimal (danishes, oranges, apples, orange juice,coffee, and raspberry lemonade--that's it.).  We were glad to have brought some bagels along.  However, I was pleased with the experience and would stay again.

Summary Heading: No conplaints,  just want we wanted
Summary: We just got back from our stay  (Sunday to Friday).  we went to d-land, cali adventure and universal studios and the beach.   Our rooms were fine we 6 of us stayed in a kids suite, (king bed, bunk and sofa bed)  Our first day to d-land we drove there and parked in the parking lot.  This took about 15 - 20 minutes to get to the gates of d-land.  So the next 2 days we just walked.  it is a 15 - 20 minute walk.  Our 7 year old didn't complain.  There are alot of little stores along the way that have alot of d-land t-shirts and stuff (much cheaper than in the park) so we bought some stuff there but also bought stuff in the park as well.. Mikey ears are hard to find anywhere else and the kids must have those.   The pool is smaller than it looks but it is heated and was fine.  We swam

While we were staying at the hotel, our son became very ill.  We had to ask for new sheets and towels several times during the night.  They were very accomodating and also offered to contact a doctor the next morning.  Since he was ill, we needed to extend our stay another day.  They were about to have a large group come in and the rate was much higher, but they gave us the room at the same rate we were paying!  They worked with us during a difficult situation and were very understanding.  I plan on going back next year to the Anaheim area and I will be staying there again (hopefully my son will have a better time too.)

Summary Heading: Good room at a great price!  $59+ tax AAA rate April 2005
Summary: If you are heading to Disneyland and looking for a bargain, this is it. My teenage son and I stayed at the Days Inn & Suites at the Anaheim Resort/Convention Center (not to be confused with about four other Days Inns in the area) and were very happy with our accomodations. The room wasn't perfect, but I gave it an "above average" rating because it was great for the price.  It has the typical color television, hair dryer and phone. There's also DSL Internet access if you are willing to pay the $10 a day charge. (I wasn't)  One of the things that sold us on this motel was the refrigerator and microwave that are perfect for keeping sodas ice cold or cooking up a bag of popcorn.
